original: Sampaṭicchane-evaṃ hotu dī. ni. 2.419.
analyzed: sampaṭicchane evam hotu
translated: In consenting: ‘So be it.’

original: Akkose-muddhā te phalatu sattadhā jā. 1.16.295, corā taṃ khaṇḍākhaṇḍikaṃ chindantu ma. ni. aṭṭha. 1.
analyzed: te phalatu sattadhā jā corā tam khaṇḍākhaṇḍikam chindantu mā ni aṭṭha
translated: In cursing: ‘Let his head split in seven!’ ‘Let thieves cut him limb from limb!’

original: Sapathe-etena saccavajjena, putto uppajjataṃ ise jā. 1.14.104, musā me bhaṇamānāya, muddhā phalatu sattadhā jā. 1.14.104.
analyzed: sapathe etena sacca vajjena puttaḥ ise jā  musā me bhaṇamānāya muddhā phalatu sattadhā jā
translated: In swearing: ‘By this truth, by this pledge, by this vow, by this utterance of truth, let a son be born to me!’ ‘If I lie, let my head split in seven!’

original: Āmantane-etu vessantaro rājā jā. 2.22.2341, “ehi bhikkhu cara brahmacariyaṃ mahāva. 28, etha bhikkhave sīlavā hotha” iccādīsupi ehi, ethasaddā āmantane tiṭṭhanti.
analyzed: āmantane etu vessantaraḥ rājā jā  ehi bhikkhu cara brahmacariyam mahāva etha bhikkhave sīlavā hotha iccādīsu pi ehi etha saddāḥ āmantane tiṭṭhanti
translated: In summoning: ‘Come, King Vessantara!’ ‘Come, bhikkhu, lead the holy life!’ ‘Come, bhikkhus, be virtuous!’

original: Nimantane-adhivāsetu me bhante bhagavā svātanāya bhattaṃ pārā. 77.
analyzed: me bhante bhagavā svātanāya bhattam
translated: In inviting: ‘May the Blessed One accept my meal tomorrow together with the Sangha of bhikkhus.’

original: Pavedane-vedayatīti maṃ saṅgho dhāretu cūḷava. aṭṭha. 102, upāsakaṃ maṃ bhavaṃ gotamo dhāretu dī. ni. 1.299, punārāyu ca me laddho, evaṃ jānāhi mārisa dī. ni. 2.369.
analyzed: mam saṅghaḥ dhāretu upāsakam mam bhavam gotamaḥ dhāretu  /
translated: In informing: ‘May the Sangha remember me as one who has informed.’ ‘May Master Gotama remember me as a lay follower who has gone to him for refuge.’ ‘I have gained a second life, good sir.’

original: Pattakāle-parinibbātu bhante bhagavā, parinibbātu sugato, parinibbānakālo bhante
analyzed: patta kāle parinibbātu bhante bhagavā parinibbātu sugataḥ parinibbāna kālaḥ bhante
translated: At the time of the request: ‘May the Blessed One attain final Nibbana, may the Happy One attain final Nibbana!’ ‘It is time, Blessed One, for the final Nibbana of the Blessed One!’

original: bhagavato dī. ni. 2.168, kālo kho te mahāvīra, uppajja mātukucchiyaṃ bu. vaṃ. 1.67,
analyzed: bhagavataḥ kālaḥ khalu te mahāvīra uppajja mātukucchiyam
translated: The Blessed One’s “The time has come for you, Great Hero, to be conceived in the womb” .

original: byākarohi aggivessana na dāni te tuṇhībhāvassa kālo ma. ni. 1.357.
analyzed: byākarohi aggivessana na dāni te tuṇhībhāvassa kālaḥ
translated: “You must explain, Aggivessana, it is not the time for you to be silent” .

original: Anubhotu, anubhontu, anubhohi, anubhotha, anubhomi, anubhoma, bhavatu, bhavantu, ‘himimesvassā’ti hi, mi, mesu assa dīgho, tvaṃ paṇḍito bhavāhi.
analyzed: anubhotu anubhontu anubhohi anubhotha anubhomi anubhoma bhavatu bhavantu hi mi me su assa ati hi mi me su assa dīghaḥ tvam paṇḍitaḥ bhavāhi
translated: “May he experience, may they experience, may you experience, may you all experience, may I experience, may we experience, may it be, may they be, ‘Himimesvassā’ti hi, mi, mesu assa dīgho, you be wise.

analyzed: hiḥ sataḥ lopaḥ ka rū nī cam pā
translated: . Hissato lopo ka. ; rū. ; nī. ; caṃ. ..; pā. ...

original: Akārato parassa hissa lopo hoti.
analyzed: akārataḥ parassa hissa lopaḥ hoti
translated: After akāra, hissa is dropped.

original: Atoti kiṃ? Brūhi, dehi, hohi.
analyzed: kim brūhi dehi hohi
translated: What is the purpose of the word ‘ato’? Say, give, be.

original: Iminā ato hissa lopo, tvaṃ paṇḍito bhava.
analyzed: iminā a taḥ lopaḥ tvam paṇḍitaḥ bhava
translated: By this ‘ato hissa is dropped’, you be wise.

original: Tumhe paṇḍitā bhavatha, bhavāmi, bhavāma.
analyzed: tumhe paṇḍitāḥ bhavatha bhavāmi bhavāma
translated: You all be wise, I am, we are.

original: Parachakke-so bhavataṃ, te bhavantaṃ, tvaṃ bhavassu, tumhe bhavavho, ahaṃ bhave, mayaṃ bhavāmase, imāni suddhakatturūpāni.
analyzed: bhavatam te bhavantam tvam bhavassu tumhe bhavavhaḥ aham bhave mayam bhavāmase imāni suddha kattu rūpāni
translated: In the other section: so bhavataṃ, te bhavantaṃ, tvaṃ bhavassu, tumhe bhavavho, ahaṃ bhave, mayaṃ bhavāmase, these are pure forms in the four-fold base.

original: Anubhūyatu, anubhūyantu, anubhuyyatu, anubhuyyantu iccādi suddhakammarūpaṃ.
analyzed: anubhūyatu anubhūyantu anubhuyyatu anubhuyyantu iccādi suddha kamma rūpam
translated: Anubhūyatu, anubhūyantu, anubhuyyatu, anubhuyyantu etc. are pure forms in the three-fold base.🔽.

original: Bhāvetu, bhāventu, bhāvayatu, bhāvayantu iccādi hetukatturūpaṃ.
analyzed: bhāvetu bhāventu bhāvayatu bhāvayantu iccādi hetu kattu rūpam
translated: Bhāvetu, bhāventu, bhāvayatu, bhāvayantu, etc., are the forms of the causal-agent noun.

original: Bhāvīyatu, bhāvīyantu. Rassatte-bhāviyatu, bhāviyantu. Dvitte-bhāviyyatu, bhāviyyantu. Tathā bhāvayīyatu, bhāvayīyantuiccādi hetukammarūpaṃ.
analyzed: bhāvīyatu bhāvīyantu dvitte bhāviyyatu bhāviyyantu tathā bhāvayīyatu bhāvayīyantu iccādi hetu kamma rūpam
translated: Bhāvīyatu, bhāvīyantu, rassatte-bhāvīyatu, bhāvīyantu, dvitte-bhāviyyatu, bhāviyyantu, tathā bhāvayīyatu, bhāvayīyantu, etc., are the forms of the causal-action noun.

original: ‘Eyyāthasse’iccādisuttena thassa vho, tumhe bhavavho, bhavatha vā.
analyzed: eyyā thassa iicca ādi suttena thassa vho tumhe bhavavhaḥ bhavatha vā
translated: ‘Eyyāthassa’ and so on. Thassa vho, tumhe bhavavho, bhavatha vā.

original: Iti tvādi.
analyzed: iti tva ādi
translated: Iti tvādi.

original: Eyyādi
analyzed: eyi ādi
translated: Eyyādi

original: Atha eyyādi vuccate.
analyzed: atha eyyādi vuccate
translated: Now the eyyādi is stated.

original: 577. Hetuphalesveyya eyyuṃ eyyāsi eyyātha eyyāmi eyyāma etha eraṃ etho eyyāvho eyyavho (moggallānādīsu) eyyaṃ eyyāmhe vā ka. 416; rū. 454; nī. 880; caṃ. 1.3.120; pā. 3.3.156.
analyzed: hetu phalesu eyya eyyum eyyāsi eyyātha eyyāma etha eram etho eyyāvho eyyavho moggallāna ādīsu eyyam eyyāmhe vā ka rū nī caṃ pā
translated: In the causal and resultant, eyy, eyyum, eyyasi, eyyatha, eyyāmi, eyyāma, etha, eraṃ, etho, eyyāvho, eyyavho (in Moggallāna, etc.), eyyam, eyyāmhe or ka. ; rū. ; nī. ; caṃ. ..; pā. ...

original: Aññamaññasambandhiniyā hetukriyāyañca phalakriyāyañca kriyatthā eyyādayo honti vā.
analyzed: aññamañña sambandhiniyā hetu kriyāyat ca phala kriyāyat ca kriyatthāḥ eyyādayaḥ honti vā
translated: The eyyādi words are used in the sense of action in the causal action and in the resultant action which are related to each other.

original: Hetuphalesupi kadāci aññavibhattuppattidīpanattho vāsaddo, sace so yānaṃ labhissati,
analyzed: hetu phalesu pi kadāci sace saḥ yānam labhissati
translated: In the causal and resultant, sometimes the word vā is used to show the origination of another case ending, if he gets the vehicle,

original: gamissati, sace na labhissati, na gamissati iccādi.
analyzed: gamissati sace na labhissati na gamissati iccādi
translated: he will go, if he does not get it, he will not go, and so on.

original: Sace saṅkhāro nicco bhaveyya, sukho nāma bhaveyya, sace so paṇḍito bhaveyya, sukhito bhaveyya.
analyzed: sace saṅkhāraḥ niccaḥ bhaveyya sukhaḥ nāma bhaveyya sace saḥ paṇḍitaḥ bhaveyya sukhitaḥ bhaveyya
translated: If a formation were permanent, it would be called “happiness,” and if it were wise, it would be happy.

original: 578. Pañhapatthanāvidhīsu caṃ. 1.3.121; pā. 3.3.161.
analyzed: pañha patthanā vidhīsu cam pā
translated: In questions, wishes, and injunctions.

original: Etesu eyyādayo honti.
analyzed: etesu eyyā ādayaḥ honti
translated: In these eyyādayo honti.

original: Pañhe-kinnu kho tvaṃ vinayaṃ vā adhiyyeyyāsi dhammaṃ vā.
analyzed: pañhe kinnu kho tvam vinayam vā adhiyyeyyāsi dhammam vā
translated: In a question: “What will you study, the Vinaya or the Dhamma?”

original: Patthanāyaṃ-bhaveyyaṃ jātijātiyaṃ.🔽Vidhimhi-pāṇaṃ na haneyya, adinnaṃ na ādiyeyya, dānaṃ dadeyya, sīlaṃ rakkheyya.
analyzed: patthanāyaṃbhaveyyam jāti jātiyam  na haneyya adinnam naḥ ādiyeyya dānam dadeyya sīlam rakkheyya
translated: In a wish: “I would be in rebirth-linking.”🔽In an injunction: “One should not kill breathing things, one should not take what is not given, one should give gifts, one should observe virtue.”

original: 579. Sattārahesveyyādī ka. 416; rū. 454; nī. 881-4; caṃ. 1.3.128; pā. 3.3.169-172; satyarahesveyyādī (bahūsu).🔽Sattiyaṃ arahatthe ca eyyādayo honti.
analyzed: sattiyam arahatthe ca eyya ādayaḥ honti
translated: In injunctions to kill and in injunctions to be revered, eyyādayo honti.

original: Bhavaṃ rajjaṃ kareyya, bhavaṃ rajjaṃ kātuṃ sakko, kātuṃ arahoti attho.
analyzed: bhavam rajjam kareyya bhavam rajjam kātum sakko kātum arahā iti attho
translated: In the sense of “he should rule the kingdom,” “he is able to rule the kingdom,” “he is worthy to rule the kingdom.”

original: So imaṃ vijaṭaye jaṭaṃ saṃ. ni. 1.23.🔽580. Sambhāvane vā ka. 416; rū. 854; nī. 881, 883-4; caṃ. 1.3.118-9; pā. 3.3.154-5.
analyzed: saḥ u imam vijaṭaye jaṭam sam ni  sambhāvane vā ka rū nī  cam pā
translated: He will disentangle this tangle.

original: Sambhāvanepi eyyādayo honti vā.
analyzed: sambhāvane pi eyyādayaḥ honti vā
translated: In wishes, too, eyyādayo honti.🔽In wishes, too, eyyādayo honti.

original: Pabbatamapi sirasā bhindeyya, bhaveyya, bhaveyyuṃ, bhaveyyāsi, bhaveyyātha, bhaveyyāmi, bhaveyyāma.
analyzed: pabbatam api sirasā bhindeyya bhaveyya bhaveyyum bhaveyyāsi bhaveyyāsi bhaveyyāmi bhaveyyāma
translated: He would be, they would be, you would be, you all would be, I would be, we would be.

original: Parachakke-so bhavetha, te bhaveraṃ, tvaṃ bhavetho, tumhe bhaveyyāvho, ahaṃ bhaveyyaṃ, mayaṃ bhaveyyāmhe, iti suddhakatturūpāni.
analyzed: bhavetha te bhaveram tvam bhavetho tumhe aham bhaveyyam mayam bhaveyya amhe iti suddha kattu rūpāni
translated: In the other tense: He would have been, they would have been, you would have been, you all would have been, I would have been, we would have been. Thus the four forms in the present tense are pure.

original: Anubhūyeyya, anubhūyeyyuṃ. Dvitte rassattaṃ, anubhuyyeyya, anubhuyyeyyuṃ iccādi suddhakammarūpaṃ.
analyzed: anubhūyeyya anubhūyeyyum dvitte rassattam anubhuyyeyya anubhuyyeyyum iccādi suddha kamma rūpam
translated: He would have experienced, they would have experienced. In the reduplicated form: He would have been experiencing, they would have been experiencing. Thus the forms in the past tense are pure.

original: Bhāveyya, bhāveyyuṃ, bhāvayeyya, bhāvayeyyuṃ iccādi hetukatturūpaṃ.
analyzed: bhāveyya bhāveyyum bhāvayeyya bhāvayeyyum iccādi hetu kattu rūpam
translated: He would develop, they would develop. He would have developed, they would have developed. Thus the four forms in the present tense are causal.

original: Bhāvīyeyya, bhāvīyeyyuṃ. Rassatte-bhāvayiyeyya, bhāvayiyeyyuṃ. Dvitte-bhāviyyeyya, bhāviyyeyyuṃ. Tathā bhāvayīyeyya, bhāvayīyeyyuṃ iccādi hetukammarūpaṃ.🔽581. Eyyeyyāseyyaṃnaṃ ṭe ka. 517; rū. 488; nī. 1105.
analyzed: bhāvīyeyya bhāvīyeyyum dvitte bhāviyyeyya bhāviyyeyyum tathā bhāvayīyeyya bhāvayīyyum iccādi hetu kamma rūpam  ṭe ka rū nī
translated: He would have developed, they would have developed. In the reduplicated form: He would have been developing, they would have been developing. In the other tense: He would have been developing, they would have been developing. Thus the forms in the past tense are causal and verbal.

original: Eyya, eyyāsi, eyyamiccetesaṃ ṭe hoti vā.
analyzed: eyya eyyā asi eyyam iti etesam te vā
translated: Eyya, eyyāsi, eyyamiccetesaṃ ṭe hoti vā.

original: Atrimā pāḷī-caje mattā sukhaṃ dhīro, passe ce vipulaṃ sukhaṃ dha. pa. 290. Kiṃ tvaṃ
analyzed: sukham dhīro sukham dhīro passe ce vipulam sukham kim tvam
translated: The wise man, having cast off the burden, is happy, if he sees the wide happiness of Nibbana.

original: sutasomā’nutappe jā. 2.21.399, dhīraṃ passe suṇe dhīraṃ, dhīrena saha saṃvase jā. 1.13.94 iccādi.
analyzed: suta soma anutappe jā dhīram passe suṇe dhīram dhīrena saha saṃvase jā iccādi
translated: What are you sorry for, O Suta Soma? The wise man should see the wise man, the wise man should hear the wise man, the wise man should live together with the wise man.

original: So bhave, bhaveyya, tvaṃ bhave, bhaveyyāsi, ahaṃ bhave, bhaveyyaṃ.
analyzed: saḥ bhave bhaveyya tvam bhave bhaveyya asi aham bhave bhaveyyam
translated: He would be, he would be, you would be, you would be, I would be, I would be.

original: 582. Eyyuṃssuṃ ka. 517; rū. 488; nī. 1105.
analyzed: eyyuṃssum ka rū nī
translated: Eyyumsu, ka, ru, ni.

original: Eyyuṃssa uṃ hoti vā.
analyzed: eyyuṃssaḥ um hoti vā
translated: Eyyumssa, u is optionally added.

original: Atrimā pāḷī-vajjuṃ vā te na vā vajjuṃ, natthi nāsāya rūhanā jā. 1.3.33, upayānāni me dajjuṃ, rājaputta tayī gateti jā. 2.22.26.🔽583. Eyyāmassemu ca ka. 517; rū. 488; nī. 1105.
analyzed: pāḷīvajjum vā te na vā vajjum natthi nāsāya rūhanā jā upayānāni me rāja putta tayī gatā iti jā  eyyāmas semu ca ka rū nī
translated: The burden is not heavy for you, whether it is heavy or not, there is no obstruction to the nose, the means of approach are given to me, O prince, when you have gone.🔽Eyyāmassemu, ka, ru, ni.

original: Eyyāmassa emu ca hoti, antassa u ca.
analyzed: eyyāmassa emu ca hoti antassa u ca
translated: Eyyāmassa, emu is optionally added, and u is added to the final.

original: Atrimā pāḷī-kathaṃ jānemu taṃ mayaṃ dī. ni. 2.318, muñcemu naṃ uragaṃ bandhanasmā
analyzed: atrimā pāḷīkatham jānemu tam mayam ni muñcemu naṃ uragam bandhanasmā
translated: The burden is not heavy for you, how shall we know that? We will release the snake from the noose,

original: jā. 1.15.252, dakkhemu te nāga nivesanāni jā. 1.15.254, gantvāna taṃ paṭikaremu accayaṃ,
analyzed: dakkhemu te nāga nivesanāni jā  gantvāna tam paṭikaremu accayam
translated: we will see your abodes, O snake, we will go and make amends for the offence,

original: appeva naṃ putta labhemu jīvitaṃ jā. 1.15.13, dajjemu kho pañcasatāni bhoto jā. 2.22.1302,
analyzed: appā iva nam putta labhemu jīvitam jā  dajjemu kho pañca satāni bhotaḥ jā
translated: perhaps we may obtain life for our son. 1.15.13, we will give you five hundred, good sir. 2.22.1302,

original: pañhaṃ pucchemu mārisa dī. ni. 2.354, viharemu averino dī. ni. 2.357, tayājja guttā
analyzed: pañham mārisa dī ni  viharemu guttā
translated: we will ask a question, good sir. dī. ni. ., we will dwell without hatred dī. ni. ., today we will dwell

original: viharemu rattinti jā. 1.2.18. Bhaveyyāmu, bhaveyyāma.
analyzed: viharemu jā
translated: protected. jā. ... We would be, we would be.

original: Mahāvuttinā kvaci majjhe yyā-kārassa lopo, atthaṃ dhammañca pucchesi jā. 1.16.150,
analyzed: mahāvuttinā kvaci majjhe yyākārassa lopaḥ attham dhammam ca pucchesi jā
translated: In the Mahāvuttinā, sometimes the syllable yyā is omitted, you ask about the meaning and the Dhamma. jā. ..,

original: uregaṇḍāyo bujjhesi, tāyo bujjhesi māṇava jā. 2.17.132-133, yathā gatiṃ me abhisambhavetha
analyzed: uregaṇḍāyaḥ bujjhesi tāyaḥ bujjhesi māṇava jā yathā gatim me abhisambhavetha
translated: you awaken to the shoulder-blades, you awaken to them, young man. jā. ..-, as you may understand my condition

original: jā. 2.17.87-89, yathā gatiṃ te abhisambhavema jā. 2.17.87-89, okāsaṃ sampajānātha,
analyzed: jāḥ yathā gatim te abhisambhavema jāḥ okāsam sampajānātha
translated: jā. ..-, as we may understand your condition. jā. ..-, you should make room,

original: vane yattha vasemaseti jā. 2.22.1885 ‘vasāmase’.
analyzed: vane yattha vasemasa iti jāḥ vasāmase
translated: in the forest where we dwell. jā. .. ‘we dwell’.

original: ‘Eyyāthasse’iccādisuttena eyyāthassa o ca, tumhe bhaveyyātho, bhaveyyātha vā.
analyzed: eyyāthassa iiccādi suttena eyyāthassa o ca tumhe bhaveyyāthaḥ bhaveyyātha vā
translated: ‘Eyyāthassa’ and so on, by the sutta, of eyyāthassa o, you would be, you would be.

original: Ettha ca pubbe vuttā pañha, patthanā, vidhippabhedā idhapi yathāpayogaṃ veditabbā. Pañhasaddena paripañha, paripucchā, parivitakka, parivīmaṃsādayo saṅgayhanti.
analyzed: ettha ca pubbe vuttā pañha patthanā vidhi ppabhedā idha api yathā apayogam veditabbā pañha saddena paripañha paripucchā parivitakka parivīmaṃsa ādayo saṅgayhanti
translated: And here the question, the aspiration, and the division of the rules of procedure mentioned above should be understood as they are appropriate here. The word question includes the discussion, the interrogation, the reflection, the investigation, etc.

original: Paripañhe-dhammaṃ vā paṭhamaṃ saṅgāyeyyāma vinayaṃ vā.
analyzed: paripañhedhammam vā paṭhamam vinayam vā
translated: In the discussion: “Let us first recite the True Idea or the Discipline.”

original: Paripucchāyaṃ-vadetha bhante kimahaṃ kareyyaṃ, ko imassa attho, kathañcassa atthaṃ ahaṃ jāneyyaṃ.🔽Parivitakke-kassāhaṃ paṭhamaṃ dhammaṃ deseyyaṃ dī. ni. 2.72, yaṃnūnāhaṃ dhammañca vinayañca saṅgāyeyyaṃ pārā. aṭṭha. 1.paṭhamamahāsaṅgītikathā.🔽Parivīmaṃsāyaṃ-gaccheyyaṃ vā ahaṃ uposathaṃ, na vāgaccheyyaṃ mahāva. 137.
analyzed: bhante kim aham kareyyam kaḥ imassa atthaḥ kathañca assa attham aham jāneyyam  parivitakkekassa aham paṭhamam dhammam deseyyam ni yaṃ nūna aham dhammañca vinayañca saṅgāyeyyam pārā aṭṭha paṭhama mahā saṅgīti kathā  parivīmaṃsāyaṃgaccheyyam vai aham uposatham na vā āgaccheyyam
translated: In the interrogation: “Tell me, venerable sir, what should I do, what is the meaning of this, how should I know the meaning of this?”

original: Patthanāyaṃ-evaṃrūpo siyaṃ ahaṃ anāgatamaddhānaṃ ma. ni. 3.274, ummādantyā ramitvāna, sivirājā tato siyaṃ jā. 2.18.70, passeyya taṃ vassasataṃ arogaṃ jā. 2.21.453.
analyzed: siyam aham sivi rājā tatas siyam jā passeyya tam vassa satam arogam jā
translated: In the reflection: “To whom should I first teach the True Idea? … the one who is wise … who is capable of understanding … who will be a good vessel … who will be slow to forget … who will be a good helper … who will be a good supporter … who will be a good guide … who will be a good teacher … who will be a good speaker … who will be a good preacher … who will be a good expounder … who will be a good expounder of the True Idea … who will be a good expounder of the True Idea and the Discipline … who will be a good expounder of the True Idea and the Discipline in detail … who will be a good expounder of the True Idea and the Discipline in detail and in brief … who will be a good expounder of the True Idea and the Discipline in detail and in brief and in due order … who will be a good expounder of the True Idea and the Discipline in detail and in brief and in due order and in due sequence … who will be a good expounder of the True Idea and the Discipline in detail and in brief and in due order and in due sequence and in due connection … who will be a good expounder of the True Idea and the Discipline in detail and in brief and in due order and in due sequence and in due connection and in due manner … who will be a good expounder of the True Idea and the Discipline in detail and in brief and in due order and in due sequence and in due connection and in due manner and in due form … who will be a good expounder of the True Idea and the Discipline in detail and in brief and in due order and in due sequence and in due connection and in due manner and in due form and in due connection with the True Idea … who will be a good expounder of the True Idea and the Discipline in detail and in brief and in due order and in due sequence and in due connection and in due manner and in due form and in due connection with the True Idea and in due connection with

original: Āyācane-labheyyāhaṃ bhante bhagavato santike pabbajjaṃ, labheyyaṃ upasampadaṃ mahāva. 28; saṃ. ni. 2.17.
analyzed: āyācanā ilabheyya aham bhante bhagavato santike pabbajjam labheyyam upasampadam sam ni
translated: In the Āyācana: “May I receive the going-forth, Lord, in the presence of the Lord, may I receive the full ordination.”

original: Vidhimhi-careyya dhammaṃ jā. 1.14.63.
analyzed: dhammam
translated: In the Vidhi: “One should practice the Dhamma.”

original: Niyojane-careyyādittasīsova, natthi maccussa nā gamo saṃ. ni. 1.145.
analyzed: natthi maccussa nā gamaḥ sam ni
translated: In the Niyujana: “One should practice as if one’s head were on fire, there is no going for one who is dead.”

original: Ajjhesane-yassa siyā āpatti, so āvikareyya mahāva. 132, yassa nakkhamati, so bhāseyya mahāva. 70.
analyzed: ajjhesaneyassa siyā āpatti so āvikareyya mahāva  yassa na khamati saḥ bhāseyya mahāva
translated: In the Ajjhesana: “He who has an offence should reveal it,” “He who is agreed upon should speak.”

original: Pavāraṇāyaṃ-vadeyyātha bhante yenattho pārā. 290.
analyzed: bhante
translated: In the Pavāraṇā: “May you speak, Lord, of what you have need of.”

original: Anumatiyaṃ-taṃ jano hareyya vā daheyya vā yathāpaccayaṃ vā kareyya ma. ni. 1.247.
analyzed: anumatiyantam janaḥ hareyya vā daheyya vā yathāpaccayam vā kareyya
translated: In the Anumati: “People would carry it off or burn it or do what they want with it.”

original: Anuññāyaṃ-ākaṅkhamāno saṅgho kammaṃ kareyya cūḷava. 6.
analyzed: anuññāyaṃ ākaṅkhamānaḥ saṅghaḥ kammam kareyya cūḷava
translated: In the Anuññā: “If the Order wishes, it should do the transaction.”

original: Āmantane-yadā te pahiṇeyyāmi, tadā eyyāsi khattiya jā. 2.22.635.
analyzed: āmantaneyadā te pahiṇeyyāmi tadā eyyāsi khattiya jā
translated: In the Āmantana: “When I send you, then come, noble.”

original: Nimantane-idha bhavaṃ nisīdeyya.
analyzed: nimantaneidha bhavam nisīdeyya
translated: In the Nimantana: “Here, Sir, you should sit down.”

original: Pattakāle-saṅgho uposathaṃ kareyya, pātimokkhaṃ uddiseyya mahāva. 167.
analyzed: patta kāle saṅghaḥ uposatham kareyya pātimokkham uddiseyya
translated: In the Pattakāla: “The Order should do the Uposatha, should recite the Pāṭimokkha.”

original: ‘Sambhāvane vā’ti vāsaddo avuttavikappanattho, tena parikappa, kriyātipannādayo saṅgayhanti.
analyzed: sambhāvane vā ti vā saddaḥ a vutta vikappana atthaḥ tena kriyā atipanna ādayaḥ saṅgayhanti
translated: ‘Or in supposition’—the word ‘or’ has the sense of ‘and also’; thus supposition, verbal roots, verbal nouns, etc., are included.

original: Tattha parikappo duvidho bhūtā’bhūtavasena.
analyzed: tattha parikappaḥ duvidhaḥ bhūta abhūta vasena
translated: Herein, supposition is twofold, as true and false.

original: Tattha bhūtaparikappe-yo bālaṃ seveyya, sopi bālo bhaveyya.
analyzed: tattha bhūta parikappeyaḥ bālam seveyya saḥ api bālaḥ bhaveyya
translated: Herein, in true supposition: ‘If he were to serve the fool, he too would become a fool.’

original: Abhūtaparikappe-yadā kacchapalomānaṃ, pāvāro tividho siyā jā. 1.8.78. Yadā sasavisāṇānaṃ, nisseṇī sukatā siyā jā. 1.8.79.
analyzed: kacchapa lomānam pāvāro tividhaḥ siyā jā  yadā nisseṇī su katā siyā jā
translated: In false supposition: ‘When the tortoise’s hair, the hare’s horn, would be made into a three-spoked wheel … When the rabbit’s horns were well made into a three-spoked wheel …’

original: Kriyātipanne-sace so agāraṃ ajjhāvaseyya, rājā assa cakkavattī dī. ni. 3.136.
analyzed: kriyā atipannā isace saḥ agāram ajjhāvaseyya rājā assa cakkavattī
translated: In verbal nouns: ‘If he were to live in a house, he would be a universal monarch …’🔽‘If he were to go forth …’

original: Iti eyyādi.
analyzed: iti eyyādi
translated: and so on.

original: Hiyyattanī
analyzed: hiyyattanī
translated: Hiyyattanī

original: Atha hiyyattanī vuccate.🔽584. Anajjattane ā ū o ttha a mhā ttha tthuṃ se vhaṃ iṃ mhase ka. 418; rū. 456; nī. 886; caṃ. 1.2.77; pā. 3.2.111.🔽Ajjato aññasmiṃ bhūte kāle kriyatthā paraṃ āiccādayo honti.🔽585. Ā ī ssādīsvaña vā ka. 519; rū. 457; nī. 1032.
analyzed: atha hiyyattanī vuccate  ā ū o ttha a mhā ttha tthuṃ se vhaṃ iṃ mhase ka rū nī caṃ pā  ajjataḥ aññasmin bhūte kāle param āicca ādayaḥ honti  ā ī s s ā dīsvaña vā ka rū nī
translated: Now, what is called hiyyattanī is stated.🔽In the future time, which is other than the present, the verbal-noun forms paraṃ āiccādayo are used.🔽In the future time, which is other than the present, the verbal-noun forms īiccādayo are used.

original: Āiccādīsu īiccādīsu ssādīsu ca tesaṃ ādimhi aña hoti vā.
analyzed: ā i cc ādīsu ī i cc ādīsu ssa ādīsu ca tesam ādimhi aña hoti vā
translated: In the future time, which is other than the present, the verbal-noun forms ssādayo are used.

original: So abhavā, bhavā, te abhavū, bhavū, tvaṃ abhavo, bhavo, tumhe abhavattha, bhavattha, ahaṃ abhava, bhava, mayaṃ abhavamhā, bhavamhā.
analyzed: saḥ abhavā bhavā te abhavū bhavū tvam abhavaḥ bhavo tumhe abhavattha bhavattha aham abhava bhava mayam abhavamhā bhavamhā
translated: He was, they were, you were, you were, you were, you were, you were, you were, we were, we were.

original: Parachakke-abhavattha, bhavattha, abhavatthuṃ, bhavatthuṃ, abhavase, bhavase, abhavavhaṃ, bhavavhaṃ, abhaviṃ, bhaviṃ, abhavamhase, bhavamhase.
analyzed: parachakke abhavattha bhavattha abhavatthum bhavatthum abhavase bhavase abhavavham bhavavham abhavim bhavim abhavamhase bhavamhase
translated: In the other set: You were, you were, you were, you were, you were, you were, you were, you were, I was, I was, we were, we were.

original: 586. Ā ī ū mhā ssā ssāmhānaṃ vā ka. 517; rū. 488; nī. 1105.
analyzed: vā ka
translated: . Ā ī ū mhā ssā ssāmhānaṃ vā ka. ; rū. ; nī. .

original: Etesaṃ rasso hoti vā.
analyzed: etesam rassaḥ hoti vā
translated: The vowel of these is lengthened or not.

original: So abhava, te abhavu, mayaṃ abhavamha.
analyzed: saḥ abhava te abhavu mayam abhavamha
translated: He was, they were, we were.

original: ‘Eyyāthasse’iccādinā āssa tthattaṃ, assa ca aṃ, so abhavattha, bhavattha, abhavā, bhavā vā, ahaṃ abhavaṃ, bhavaṃ, abhava, bhava vā, imāni suddhakatturūpāni.
analyzed: ā ssa ttha ttam assa ca aṃ saḥ abhavattha bhavattha abhavā bhavā vā aham abhavam bhavam abhava bhava vā imāni suddha kattu rūpāni
translated: ‘Eyyāthassa’ and so on: āssa tthattaṃ, and aṃ, he was, you were, you were, you were, you were, I was, I was, I was, we were, these are the pure four forms.

original: Ettha ca mahāvuttinā ā-vibhattiyā thādeso bahulaṃ dissati, medanī sampakampatha jā.
analyzed: ettha ca mahāvuttinā āvibhattiyā tha ādesaḥ bahulam dissati medanī sampakampatha jā
translated: And here the locative of the ā-declension is often seen with the Great Vowels, as in ‘Medanī sampakampatha jā.’🔽.

original: 2.22.1672, visaññī samapajjatha jā. 2.22.328, imā gāthā abhāsatha jā. 2.22.328, tuccho
analyzed: visaññī samapajjatha jā imāḥ gāthāḥ abhāsatha jā tucchaḥ
translated: 2.22.1672, enter into unconsciousness, jā. 2.22.328, he spoke these verses, jā. 2.22.328, the empty

original: kāyo adissatha theragā. 172, nibbidā samatiṭṭhatha theragā. 273, eko rahasi jhāyatha
analyzed: kāyaḥ adissatha theragāḥ nibbidā samatiṭṭhatha theragāḥ ekaḥ rahasi jhāyatha
translated: body is not seen, elder monks. , you should stand in dispassion, elder monks. , you should meditate alone in seclusion,

original: jā. 1.15.286 iccādi. Tathā o-vibhattiyā ca, dubbheyyaṃ maṃ amaññatha iccādi.
analyzed: jā iti cādi tathā o vibhattiyā ca dubbheyyam mama amaññatha iti cādi
translated: jā. .. and so on. Likewise, with the o-case ending, they thought me untrustworthy, and so on.

original: Iti hiyyattanī.
analyzed: iti hiyyattanī
translated: Thus, the objective case.

original: Ajjattanī
analyzed: ajjattanī
translated: The subjective case

original: Atha ajjattanī vuccate.
analyzed: atha ajjattanī vuccate
translated: Now, the subjective case is said.

original: 587. Bhūte ī uṃ o ttha iṃ mhā ā ū se vhaṃ aṃ mhe ka. 419; rū. 469; nī. 887.
analyzed: bhūte ī uṃ o ttha iṃ mhā ā ū se vhaṃ aṃ mhe ka
translated: . Beings ī uṃ o ttha iṃ mhā ā ū se vhaṃ aṃ mhe ka. ; rū. ; nī. .

original: Abhavīti bhūto, atītoti attho, bhūte kāle kriyatthā paraṃ īiccādayo honti.
analyzed: abhavīti bhūtaḥ atītaḥ iti atthaḥ bhūte kāle param honti
translated: The past, means the past time, the forms ī and so on are used for the past time.

original: 588. A ī ssā ssatyādīnaṃ byañjanassiu ka. 516; rū. 466; nī. 1030; caṃ. 1.2.76; pā. 3.2.110 aīssaādīnaṃ byañjanassiu (bahūsu).
analyzed: a ī ssā ssatya ādīnam byañjana ssiu ka rū nī caṃ pā a ī ssa ādīnam byañjana ssiu bahūsu
translated: . A ī ssā ssati and so on, the initial letter of the case ending is changed to iu. ; rū. ; nī. ; caṃ. ..; pā. .. aīssa and so on, the initial letter of the case ending is changed to iu (in the plural).

original: Aādissa īādissa ssāādissa ssatiādissa ca byañjanassa ādimhi iu hoti. ‘Byañjanassā’ti etena aādimhi pañca, īādimhi sattāti dvādasa suddhasaravibhattiyo paṭikkhipati.
analyzed: a ādissa ī ādissa ssa ādissa ssati ādissa ca byañjanassa ādimhi iu hoti byañjanassa ati etena a ādimhi pañca ī ādimhi satta ati dvādasa suddha sara vibhattiyaḥ paṭikkhipati
translated: After a, after ī, after ssā, after ssati, the initial letter is changed to iu. 'Byañjanassā' means he excludes the twelve case endings, five beginning with a and seven beginning with ī, by this.

original: ‘Āīssādīsvaña vā’iti suttena vikappena dhātvādimhi akāro.
analyzed: ā īs sa ādi svaña vā iti suttena vikappena dhātu ādimhi akāraḥ
translated: ‘Āīssādīsvaña vā’ means the vowel a in the base etc. by the substitution of the vowel a by the rule ‘Āīssādīsvaña vā’.

original: So abhavī, bhavī, te abhavuṃ, bhavuṃ, tvaṃ abhavo, bhavo, tumhe abhavittha, bhavittha,
analyzed: saḥ abhavī bhavī te abhavum bhavum tvam abhavaḥ bhavo tumhe abhavittha bhavittha
translated: He was, he will be, they were, they will be, you were, you will be, you all were, you all will be,

original: ahaṃ abhaviṃ, bhaviṃ, mayaṃ abhavimhā, bhavimhā, so abhavā, bhavā, te abhavū, bhavū,
analyzed: aham abhavim bhavim mayam abhavimhā bhavimhā saḥ abhavā bhavā te abhavū bhavū
translated: I was, I will be, we were, we will be, he was, he will be, they were, they will be,

original: tvaṃ abhavise, bhavise, tumhe abhavivhaṃ, bhavivhaṃ, ahaṃ abhavaṃ, bhavaṃ, mayaṃ🔽abhavimhe, bhavimhe.
analyzed: tvam abhavise bhavise tumhe abhavivham bhavivham aham abhavam bhavam mayam  abhavimhe bhavimhe
translated: you were, you will be, you all were, you all will be, I was, I will be, we were, we will be.

original: ‘Āīū’iccādinā ī, mhā, ā, ūnaṃ rassatte-so abhavi, bhavi, mayaṃ abhavimha, bhavimha, so abhava, bhava, te abhavu, bhavu.🔽589. Eyyāthasseaāīthānaṃ o a aṃ ttha ttho vho vā ka. 517; rū. 488; nī. 1105; ‘…vhoka’ (bahūsu).
analyzed: ī mhā ā ūnam abhavi bhavi mayam abhavimha bhavimha saḥ abhava bhava te abhavu bhavu  o a aṃ ttha tthaḥ vhaḥ vā ka rū nī vhaḥ ka bahūsu
translated: ‘Āīū’ etc. means the vowels ī, ṝ, ḷ, ū, ḷ, ṝ, ī, ā, ū, in the long state – he was, he will be, we were, we will be, he was, he will be, they were, they will be.

original: Eyyāthādīnaṃ yathākkamaṃ oādayo honti vā.
analyzed: yathākkamam o ādayaḥ honti vā
translated: Eyyāthādīnaṃ o a aṃ ttha ttho vho vā ka means the vowels o, a, aṃ, ttha, ttho, vho, vā, ka, are optionally added to eyyātha etc. respectively.

original: Tumhe gaccheyyātho, gaccheyyātha vā, tvaṃ agacchissa, agacchisse vā, ahaṃ agamaṃ,
analyzed: tumhe gaccheyya atho gaccheyya atha vā tvam agacchissa agacchisse vā aham agamam
translated: You all should go, you all should go, you should go, you should go, I went, I went,

original: gamaṃ, agama, gama vā, so agamittha, gamittha, agamā, gamā vā, so agamittho, gamittho,
analyzed: gamam agama gama vā saḥ agamittha gamittha agamā gamā vā saḥ agamitthaḥ gamitthaḥ
translated: He went, he did not go, he went or he did not go, he went there, he went there, he went or he went there, he went there, he went there,

original: agamī, gamī vā, tumhe gacchavho, gacchatha vāti.
analyzed: agamī gamī vā tumhe gacchavhaḥ gacchatha vā ati
translated: he went, he went or he went there, you two go, you all go.

original: Iminā ī, ā, avacanānaṃ ttho, ttha, aṃādesā honti, so abhavittho, bhavittho, so abhavittha, bhavittha, ahaṃ abhavaṃ, bhavaṃ.🔽Atrimā pāḷī – īmhi-paṅko ca mā visiyittho jā. 1.13.44, sañjagghittho mayā saha jā.
analyzed: iminā ī ā a vacanānam tthaḥ ttha aṃ ādesāḥ honti saḥ abhavitthaḥ bhavitthaḥ saḥ abhavittha bhavittha aham abhavam bhavam  atrimā pāḷī ca mā visiyitthaḥ jā  sañjagghitthaḥ mayā saha jā
translated: By this the forms ttho, ttha, aṃ, ā, are substituted for ī, ā, avacana, he did not become, he became, he did not become, he became, I did not become, I became.🔽The following is the text: “The mud here let not stick to me, let not the dust stick to me.”

original: 1.16.241. Āmhi-anumodittha vāsavo jā. 2.22.1667, nimantayittha vāsavo jā. 2.22.1667,
analyzed: vāsavaḥ jā
translated: “I am approved by Vāsava, I am invited by Vāsava.”

original: khubbhittha nagaraṃ tadā jā. 2.22.1673, subhūtitthero gāthaṃ abhāsittha theragā.
analyzed: nagaram tadā jā subhūti theraḥ gātham thera gā
translated: “The city was crowded then,” said the Elder Subhūti.

original: 1. Amhi-idhāhaṃ mallikaṃ deviṃ etadavocaṃ saṃ. ni. 1.119, ajānamevaṃ āvuso avacaṃ🔽jānāmīti pārā. 195, ahaṃ kāmānaṃ vasamanvagaṃ jā. 2.19.45, ajjhagaṃ amataṃ santiṃ iccādi.
analyzed: amhi idha aham mallikam devim etat avocam sam ni ajānam evam āvuso avacam  jānāmi iti pārā aham kāmānam vasam anvagam jā ajjhagam amatam santim iti ādi
translated: “Here I said this to Queen Mallikā: ‘I do not know, venerable sir, I said I know.’🔽‘I am under the sway of sensual pleasures,’ I said. ‘I have entered the deathless peace.’

analyzed: uṃs siṃsu aṃsu ka rū nī
translated: ‘You should cut off, you should cut off, you should cut off.’ ‘Form, feeling, perception, volitional formations, consciousness.’ ‘The eye, forms, eye-consciousness, eye-contact.’

original: Umiccassa iṃsu, aṃsu honti.
analyzed: um iccassa iṃsu aṃsu honti
translated: The u of uṃ becomes iṃ, and the a of iṃ becomes aṃ.

original: Agamiṃsu, agamaṃsu, agamuṃ. Iminā uṃssa iṃsu, abhaviṃsu, bhaviṃsu.
analyzed: agamiṃsu agamaṃsu agamum iminā iṃsu abhaviṃsu bhaviṃsu
translated: They came, they went, they went away. By this (rule) they would have been iṃsu, abhaviṃsu, bhaviṃsu.

original: 591. Ossa a i ttha ttho ka. 517; rū. 488; nī. 1105.
analyzed: ossa a i ttha tthaḥ ka rū nī
translated: Ossa a i ttha ttho ka. ; rū. ; nī. .

original: Ossa aiccādayo honti.
analyzed: os saḥ ai c ca ādayaḥ honti
translated: Ossa, aiccādayo honti.

original: Tvaṃ abhava, tvaṃ abhavi, tvaṃ abhavittha, tvaṃ abhavittho.
analyzed: tvam abhava tvam abhavi tvam abhavittha tvam
translated: You were, you were not, you were not so, you were not thus.

original: Atrimā pāḷī-ossa atte-mā hevaṃ ānanda avaca dī. ni. 2.95, tvameva dāni’makara, yaṃ
analyzed: attā imā hevam ānanda tvam eva dānim akara yam
translated: In the text, in the case of ossa, in the case of atte, say thus: “Ānanda, speak thus”, dī. ni. ., “You alone now, Aṅkura”, yaṃ

original: kāmo byagamā tayi jā. 1.2.167. Itte-mā tvaṃ bhāyi mahārāja, mā tvaṃ bhāyi rathesabha
analyzed: kāmaḥ byagamā tayi jāḥ ittā imā tvam bhāyi mahā rāja mā tvam bhāyi rathesabha
translated: “Having abandoned sense desires”, jā. ... In the case of atte, “You should not fear, great king, you should not fear, chariot-warrior”,

original: jā. 2.22.684, mā cintesi mā tvaṃ soci, yācāmi luddakaṃ ahaṃ gavesitabbaṃ. Tthattemāssu
analyzed: jā mā cintesi mā tvam yācāmi luddakam aham gavesitabbam
translated: jā. .., “Do not be anxious, do not grieve”, “I beg the hunter”, gavesitabbaṃ. In the case of tthattemāssu

original: tiṇṇo amaññittha jā. 2.22.255, mā kilittha mayā vinā jā. 2.22.1713, māssu kujjhittha
analyzed: tiṇṇaḥ amaññittha jā  mā kilittha mayā vinā jā  mā assu kujjhittha
translated: “Having crossed, he thought”, jā. .., “Do not be distressed in my absence”, jā. .., “Do not be angry”, māssu kujjhittha

original: nāvika jā. 1.6.5. Tthotte-mā purāṇe amaññittho theragā. 280, mā dayhittho punappunaṃ
analyzed: nāvika jā purāṇe amaññitthaḥ theragā mā dayhitthaḥ punappunam
translated: “O boatman”, jā. ... In the case of tthotte-mā, “Having remembered the ancient (teachers)”, theragā. , “Do not be heated again and again”,

original: saṃ. ni. 1.212, tiṇamatte asajjittho jā. 1.1.89, mā tvaṃ brahmuno vacanaṃ upātivattittho
analyzed: sam ni tiṇamatte asajjitthaḥ jā mā tvam brahmunaḥ vacanam upātivattitthaḥ
translated: saṃ. ni. ., “Having not prepared even a blade of grass”, jā. .., “Do not transgress the word of Brahmā”,

original: ma. ni. 1.502, mā tvaṃ maññittho na maṃ jānātī ma. ni. 1.502 ti.
analyzed: ma ni mā tvam maññitthaḥ na mama ti
translated: ‘Do not think that I do not know you’ (Dhp 1.502).

original: Tattha ‘mā dayhittho’iccādīni parokkhāvacanenapi sijjhanti.
analyzed: tattha mā parokkhā vacanena api sijjhanti
translated: Herein, ‘Do not burn up’, etc., are established by the indirect expression.

original: Suttavibhattena tthassa ttho hoti, taṃ vo vadāmi bhaddante, yāvantettha samāgatā apa. thera 1.1.367, massu mittānaṃ dubbhittho. Mittadubbho hi pāpakoti jā. 1.16.222.🔽Mahāvuttinā ossa kvaci lopo, puna dānaṃ adā tuvaṃ jā. 2.22.1786, mā no tvaṃ tāta
analyzed: sutta vibhattena tthassa tthaḥ hoti tam vaḥ vadāmi bhaddante yāvantaḥ ittha samāgatāḥ apa thera mittānam mitta dubbhaḥ hi pāpakaḥ iti jā  mahāvuttinā kvaci lopaḥ punar dānam adā tuvam jā mā no tvam tāta
translated: The locative case-ending has the locative case-meaning, ‘I tell you this, good sirs, all of you assembled here’ (Dhp 1.1), ‘Do not despise your friends’ (Dhp 1.1), ‘For he who despises his friends is evil’ (Dhp 1.2).

original: adadā jā. 2.22.2126, mā bhoti kupitā ahu jā. 2.22.1931, māhu pacchānutāpinī saṃ.🔽ni. 1.162; therīgā. 57.
analyzed: adadā jā mā kupitā ahu jā mā āhu saṃ  ni therīgā
translated: By the Great Tenses, o is sometimes elided, ‘Again you must give a gift’ (Dhp 1.3), ‘Do not give us, dear father’ (Dhp 1.4), ‘Do not be angry, lady’ (Dhp 1.5), ‘Do not be remorseful afterwards’ (Dhp 1.6).

original: 592. Si ka. 517; rū. 488; nī. 1105.🔽Ossa si hoti vā.🔽Tvaṃ abhavasi, bhavasi, tvaṃ anubhosi.🔽593. Mhātthānamuu ka. 517; rū. 488; nī. 1105.🔽Mhā, tthānaṃ ādimhi uña hoti.🔽Assosumhā, ahesumhā, avocumhā, avocuttha iccādīni dissanti.
analyzed: si ka rū nī 🔽oḥ saḥ si hoti vā 🔽tvam abhavasi bhavasi tvam anubhosi 🔽mha attha ana muu ka rū nī 🔽mhā tthānam ādimhi uña hoti 🔽avocumhā avocuttha icca ādīni dissanti
translated: (Therīgāthā 1.1), (Theragāthā 1.1), (Suttanipāta 1.1), (Suttanipāta 1.2), (Suttanipāta 1.3), (Suttanipāta 1.4), (Suttanipāta 1.5), (Suttanipāta 1.6), (Suttanipāta 1.7), (Suttanipāta 1.8), (Suttanipāta 1.9), (Suttanipāta 1.10), (Suttanipāta 1.11), (Suttanipāta 1.12), (Suttanipāta 1.13), (Suttanipāta 1.14), (Suttanipāta 1.15), (Suttanipāta 1.16), (Suttanipāta 1.17), (Suttanipāta 1.18), (Suttanipāta 1.19), (Suttanipāta 1.20), (Suttanipāta 1.21), (Suttanipāta 1.22), (Suttanipāta 1.23), (Suttanipāta 1.24), (Suttanipāta 1.25), (Suttanipāta

original: Tumhe abhavuttha, bhavuttha, abhavittha, bhavittha vā, mayaṃ abhavumhā, bhavumhā, abhavimhā, bhavimhā vā.
analyzed: tumhe abhavuttha bhavuttha abhavittha bhavittha vā mayam abhavumhā bhavumhā abhavimhā bhavimhā vā
translated: You were, you were not, you were not, you were, we were, we were not, we were not, we were.

original: 594. Iṃssa ca suu ka. 517; rū. 488; nī. 1105; “…siu” (bahūsu).
analyzed: iṃssa ca suu ka rū nī siu bahūsu
translated: . Iṃssa ca suu ka. ; rū. ; nī. ; “…siu” (in many).

original: Imiccassa mhā, tthānañca ādimhi suu hoti, sāgamo hotīti attho. Casaddena īādīnampi
analyzed: im iccassa mha ā tthānam ca ādimhi su u hoti sa āgamaḥ hoti iti atthaḥ ca saddena ī ādīnam pi
translated: The suu is for the iṃ of the mha, and the sāgama is for the beginning, the meaning is: the sāgama is for the beginning. By the word ca, the sāgama is for the beginning of ī and so on.

original: ādimhi sāgamo hoti, sāgame ca sati byañjanaṃ hoti, tassa ādimhi iāgamo labbhati.
analyzed: ādimhi sa āgamaḥ hoti sa āgame ca sati byañjanam hoti tassa ādimhi i āgamaḥ labbhati
translated: And when there is the sāgama, the byañjana is, and for that the iāgama is allowable at the beginning.

original: Tena “imā gāthā abhāsisuṃ gavesitabbaṃ, te me asse ayācisuṃ, yathābhūtaṃ vipassisuṃ”
analyzed: tena imāḥ gāthāḥ abhāsisum gavesitabbam te me asse ayācisum yathābhūtam vipassisum
translated: Therefore “imā gāthā abhāsisuṃ gavesitabbaṃ, te me asse ayācisuṃ, yathābhūtaṃ vipassisuṃ”

original: jā. 2.22.1863 iccādīni dī. ni. 3.277 sijjhanti.
analyzed: i cca ādīni dī ni sijjhanti
translated: jā. .. iccādīni dī. ni. . sijjhanti.

original: So bhogaṃ anubhosi, anubhavi vā, tumhe anubhosittha, anubhavittha vā, ahaṃ anubhosi, anubhaviṃ vā. Mayaṃ anubhosimhā anubhavimhā vā.
analyzed: saḥ bhogam anubhosi anubhavi vā tumhe anubhosittha anubhavittha vā aham anubhosi anubhavim vā mayam anubhosimhā anubhavimhā vā
translated: He enjoyed wealth, or he enjoyed, you enjoyed, you enjoyed, I enjoyed, I enjoyed, we enjoyed, we enjoyed.

original: 595. Eontā suṃ ka. 517; rū. 488; nī. 1105; ‘eottā suṃ” (bahūsu).
analyzed: e o ntā sum ka rū nī e o ttā sum bahūsu
translated: . Eontā suṃ ka. ; rū. ; nī. ; ‘eottā suṃ” (in many).

original: Edantato odantato ca parassa uṃvacanassa suṃ hoti vā.
analyzed: e t antataḥ o t antataḥ ca parassa uṃ vacanassa sum hoti vā
translated: The suṃ is for the uṃ of the other, from the ed and the od.🔽.

original: Ānesuṃ, sāyesuṃ, cintesuṃ, paccanubhosuṃ, paribhosuṃ, adhibhosuṃ, abhibhosuṃ.
analyzed: ānesum sāyesum cintesum paccanubhosum paribhosum adhibhosum abhibhosum
translated: They brought, they brought together, they thought, they experienced, they enjoyed, they overcame, they overmastered.

original: Suttavibhattena ādantatopi ca, vihāsuṃ viharanti ca saṃ. ni. 1.173, te anubhosuṃ, imāni suddhakatturūpāni.
analyzed: ca vihāsum viharanti ca sam ni te anubhosum imāni suddha kattu rūpāni
translated: With the Sutta-division, and also with the root ād, they dwelt, they dwelt together, they dwelt in, they experienced, these are pure forms of the root.

original: Tena bhogo anvabhūyī, anubhūyī.🔽Rassatte-anvabhūyi, anubhūyi.
analyzed: tena bhogaḥ anvabhūyī anubhūyī  rassatte anvabhūyi anubhūyi
translated: By him wealth was enjoyed, was experienced.🔽By you two wealth was enjoyed, was experienced.

original: Dvitte-anvabhuyyi, anubhuyyi.
analyzed: dvitte anvabhuyyi anubhuyyi
translated: By you two wealth was enjoyed, was experienced.

original: Tena bhogā anvabhūyuṃ, anubhūyuṃ, anvabhūyiṃsu, anubhūyiṃsu iccādi suddhakammarūpaṃ.
analyzed: tena bhogāḥ anvabhūyum anubhūyum anvabhūyiṃsu anubhūyiṃsu iccādi suddha kamma rūpam
translated: By him wealth was enjoyed, was experienced, he enjoyed, he experienced, they enjoyed, they experienced, and so on, are pure forms of the root.

original: So maggaṃ abhāvi, bhāvi, abhāvesi, bhāvesi, abhāvayi, bhāvayi, te maggaṃ abhāviṃsu, bhāviṃsu.🔽‘Eontāsu’nti edantamhā suṃ. Te maggaṃ abhāvesuṃ, bhāvesuṃ, abhāvayiṃsu, bhāvayiṃsu,
analyzed: so maggam abhāvi bhāvi abhāvesi bhāvesi abhāvayi bhāvayi te maggam abhāviṃsu bhāviṃsu  e o nta asunti e t antamhā sum te maggam abhāvesum bhāvesum abhāvayiṃsu bhāvayiṃsu
translated: He developed the path, he developed, he developed you, he developed, he developed them, they developed, they developed.🔽‘In the endings’ means in the endings beginning with suṃ. They developed, they developed, they developed, they developed,

original: tvaṃ maggaṃ abhāvaya, bhāvaya, abhāvayi, bhāvayi, tvaṃ maggaṃ abhāvittha, bhāvittha,
analyzed: tvam maggam abhāvaya bhāvaya abhāvayi bhāvayi tvam maggam abhāvittha bhāvittha
translated: you develop, you develop, you developed, you developed, you developed, you developed, you developed, you developed,

original: abhāvayittha, bhāvayittha, tvaṃ maggaṃ abhāvayittho, bhāvayittho, tvaṃ maggaṃ abhāvesi,🔽bhāvesi, tumhe maggaṃ abhāvittha, bhāvittha, abhāvayittha, bhāvayittha, ahaṃ maggaṃ🔽abhāviṃ, bhāviṃ, abhāvesiṃ, bhāvesiṃ, abhāvayiṃ, bhāvayiṃ, mayaṃ maggaṃ abhāvimhā,
analyzed: abhāvayittha bhāvayittha tvam maggam abhāvayitthaḥ bhāvayitthaḥ tvam maggam abhāvesi  bhāvesi tumhe maggam abhāvittha bhāvittha abhāvayittha bhāvayittha aham maggam  abhāvim bhāvim abhāvesim bhāvesim abhāvayim bhāvayim mayam maggam abhāvimhā
translated: You have developed, you are developing, you have developed the path, you are developing the path, you are developing the path,

original: bhāvimhā, abhāvimha, bhāvimha, abhāvayimhā, bhāvayimhā, abhāvayimha, bhāvayimha.🔽So maggaṃ abhāvā, bhāvā, abhāvittha, bhāvittha, abhāvayittha, bhāvayittha iccādi hetukatturūpaṃ.
analyzed: bhāvimhāḥ a bhāvimha bhāvimha a bhāvayimhāḥ bhāvayimhāḥ a bhāvayimha bhāvayimha  saḥ maggam abhāvā bhāvā abhāvittha bhāvittha abhāvayittha bhāvayittha iccādi hetu kattu rūpam
translated: you have developed the path, you are developing the path, we have developed the path, we are developing the path, I have developed the path, I am developing the path, I have developed the path, I am developing the path, we have developed the path, we are developing the path, we have developed the path, we are developing the path, we have developed the path, we are developing the path.

original: Tena maggo abhāviyi, bhāviyi, tena maggā abhāviyiṃsu, bhāviyiṃsu iccādi hetukammarūpaṃ.🔽Iti ajjattanī.🔽Parokkhā
analyzed: tena maggaḥ bhāviyi bhāviyi tena maggāḥ iccādi hetu kamma rūpam  iti ajjattanī  parokkhā
translated: He has developed the path, he is developing the path, he has developed the path, he is developing the path, he has developed the path, he is developing the path, he has developed the path, he is developing the path, we have developed the path, we are developing the path, we have developed the path, we are developing the path, we have developed the path, we are developing the path, we have developed the path, we are developing the path.

original: Atha parokkhā vuccate.🔽596. Parokkhe a u e tha aṃ mha ttha re ttho vho iṃ mhe ka. 417; rū. 460; nī. 887; caṃ. 1.2.81; pā. 3.2.115.
analyzed: atha parokkhā vuccate 🔽parokkhe a u e tha aṃ mha ttha re ttho vho iṃ mhe ka rū nī caṃ pā
translated: By that the path was developed, was developed, was developed, was developed, was developed, was developed, was developed, was developed, was developed, was developed, was developed, was developed, was developed, was developed, was developed, was developed, was developed, was developed, was developed, was developed, was developed, was developed, was developed, was developed, was developed, was developed, was developed, was developed, was developed, was developed, was developed, was developed, was developed, was developed, was developed, was developed, was developed, was developed, was developed, was developed, was developed, was developed, was developed, was developed, was developed, was developed, was developed, was developed, was developed, was developed, was developed, was developed, was developed, was developed, was developed, was developed, was developed, was developed, was developed, was developed, was developed, was developed, was developed, was developed, was developed, was developed, was developed, was developed, was developed, was developed, was developed, was developed, was developed, was developed, was developed, was developed, was developed, was developed, was developed, was developed, was developed, was developed, was developed, was developed, was developed, was developed, was developed, was developed, was developed, was developed, was developed, was developed, was developed, was developed, was developed, was developed, was developed, was developed, was developed, was developed

original: Akkhānaṃ indriyānaṃ paraṃ parokkhaṃ, apaccakkhanti attho. Bhūte kāle attano parokkhakriyāya vattabbāya kriyatthā aādayo honti.🔽Mahāvuttinā gassa dīgho vā, so kira jagāma, te kira jagāmu, tvaṃ kira jagāme, tumhe kira jagāmittha, ahaṃ kira jagāmaṃ, mayaṃ kira jagāmimha iccādi.
analyzed: akkhānam indriyānam param parokkham a paccakkhanti atthaḥ bhūte kāle attano parokkha kriyāya vattabbāya kriya tthāḥ a ādayaḥ honti  mahāvuttinā gassa dīghaḥ vā saḥ kira jagāma te kira jagāmu tvam kira jagāme tumhe kira jagāmittha aham kira jagāmam mayam kira jagāmimha iccādi
translated: The past participle is used in the sense of ‘not seen’ with the words in the sense of ‘not seen’ by oneself at the time of speaking.

original: Ettha ca ‘so kira jagāma’ iccādīni anussavaparokkhāni nāma.
analyzed: ettha ca saḥ kira jagāma iccādīni anussava parokkhāni nāma
translated: ‘So kira jagāma’, etc., are called ‘hearsay not seen’.

original: ‘Ahaṃ kira jagāmaṃ, mayaṃ kira jagāmimhā’ti idaṃ attanā gantvāpi gamanaṃ pamuṭṭhassa vā asampaṭicchitukāmassa vā paṭivacanaparokkhaṃ nāma.
analyzed: aham kira jagāmam mayam kira jagāmimha ati idam attanā gantvā api gamanam pamuṭṭhassa vā a sampaṭicchitu kāmassa vā paṭivacana parokkham nāma
translated: ‘Ahaṃ kira jagāmaṃ, mayaṃ kira jagāmimhā’ is called ‘not seen by oneself’ when one has gone but has forgotten or does not wish to admit it.

original: 597. Parokkhāyañca ka. 458; rū. 461; nī. 939; caṃ. 5.1.3; pā. 6.1.2.
analyzed: parokkha ayam ca ka rū nī cam pā
translated: . In the not seen, ka. ; rū. ; nī. ; caṃ. ..; pā. ...

original: Parokkhamhi pubbakkharaṃ ekassaraṃ dverūpaṃ hoti, casaddena aññasmimpi dvedverūpaṃ sijjhati.
analyzed: parokkhamhi pubba kkharam ekassaram dvi rūpam hoti ca saddena aññasmim pi dve dve rūpam sijjhati
translated: In the not seen, the first syllable is single, the second is double, and there is a vowel interchange. By the word ‘ca’ the second is also double in another.

original: Caṅkamati, daddallati, dadāti, jahāti, juhoti, lolupo, momūho.
analyzed: caṅkamati daddallati dadāti jahāti juhoti lolupaḥ momūhaḥ
translated: Caṅkamati, daddallati, dadāti, jahāti, juhoti, lolupo, momūho.

original: 598. Dutiyacatutthānaṃ paṭhamatatiyā ka. 461; rū. 464; nī. 942.
analyzed: dutiya catutthānam paṭhama tatiyā ka rū nī
translated: The first and third of the second and fourth.

original: Dvitte pubbesaṃ dutiya, catutthānaṃ kamena paṭhama, tatiyā honti.
analyzed: pubbesam dutiya catutthānam kamena paṭhama tatiyā honti
translated: In the second, the second of the first; in the fourth, the first of the third.

analyzed: pubbassa a ka rū nī cam pā
translated: The first of the first, the first of the first.

original: Dvitte pubbassa bhūssa anto a hoti.🔽600. Bhūssa vuka ka. 475; rū. 465; nī. 956; caṃ. 5.3.92; pā. 6.4.88.
analyzed: dvitte pubbassa bhūssa antaḥ a hoti  bhūssa vuka ka rū nī cam pā
translated: In the second, a comes after the first of the first.🔽In the second, vuka comes after the first of the first.

original: Dvitte bhūdhātussa ante vuka hoti, vāgamo hotīti attho.
analyzed: bhū dhātussa ante hoti vā āgamaḥ hoti iti attho
translated: The meaning is that the augment vā comes.

original: “Tatthappanādo tumulo babhūvā”ti jā. 2.22.1437 pāḷi.
analyzed: tattha appanādaḥ tumulaḥ babhūva ati
translated: “There was a great uproar there” .

original: So kira rājā babhūva, te kira rājāno babhūvu, tvaṃ babhūve.
analyzed: saḥ kira rājā babhūva te kira rājānaḥ babhūvu tvam babhūve
translated: It seems that he was a king, they were kings, you were.

original: ‘A ī ssā ssatyādīnaṃ byañjanassiu’ iti suttena byañjanādimhi iāgamo, tumhe babhūvittha,🔽ahaṃ babhūvaṃ, mayaṃ babhūvimha, so babhūvittha, te babhūvire, tvaṃ babhūvittho,
analyzed: a ī ssā s satya ādīnam iti suttena byañjana ādimhi i āgamaḥ tumhe babhūvittha  aham babhūvam mayam babhūvimha saḥ babhūvittha te babhūvire tvam
translated: By the rule “a ī ssā ssatyādīnaṃ byañjanassiu” , iā comes after the first syllable, you were,🔽I was, we were, he was, they were, you were,

original: tumhe babhūvivho, ahaṃ babhūviṃ, mayaṃ babhūvimhe, imāni suddhakatturūpāni.
analyzed: tumhe aham babhūvim mayam babhūvimhe imāni suddha kattu rūpāni
translated: you all were, I was, we were, these are the pure four forms.

original: ‘Kyo bhāvakammesvaparokkhesū’ti paṭisiddhattā parokkhamhi bhāvakammesu yapaccayo na hoti, ‘tena kira bhogo anubabhūvittha, tena bhogo anubabhūvire’tiādinā yojetabbaṃ.
analyzed: kyaḥ bhāva kammesu aparokkhesu iti paṭisiddha ttā parokkhamhi bhāva kammesu ya paccayaḥ na hoti tena kira bhogaḥ anubabhūvittha tena bhogaḥ anubabhūvire iti ādinā yojetabbam
translated: Since the form ‘bhāvakammesu parokkhhesu’ is rejected, the y-connective is not used in the past tense for bhāvakammas in the remote past; it should be construed thus: ‘Ten kira bhogo anubabhūvi, tena bhogo anubabhūvire’.

original: Iti parokkhā.
analyzed: iti parokkhā
translated: So much for the remote past.

original: Ssatyādi
analyzed: s satya ādi
translated: The future tense and so on

original: Atha ssatyādi vuccate.
analyzed: atha ssatya ādi vuccate
translated: Now the future tense and so on are described.

original: 601. Bhavissati ssati ssanti ssasi ssatha ssāmi ssāma ssate ssante ssase ssavhe ssaṃ ssāmhe ka. 421; rū. 473; nī. 892; caṃ. 1.3.2; pā. 3.3.13.
analyzed: bhavissati ssati ssanti ssasi ssatha ssāmi ssāma ssate ssante ssase ssavhe ssam ssāmhe ka rū nī caṃ pā
translated: Bhavissati ssati ssanti ssasi ssatha ssāmi ssāma ssate ssante ssase ssavhe ssaṃ ssāmhe ka. ; rū. ; nī. ; caṃ. ..; pā. ...

original: Bhavissatīti bhavissanto, anāgatakālo, tasmiṃ bhavissati kāle kriyatthassa tyādayo honti.
analyzed: bhavissati iti bhavissantaḥ anāgata kālo tasmin bhavissati kāle kriyatthassa tya ādayaḥ honti
translated: Bhavissati = bhavissanto, the future time; in that future time the future-tense endings ty-ādayo are used for the meaning of action.

original: 602. Nāme garahāvimhayesu ka. 421; rū. 473; nī. 893; caṃ. 1.3.109, 115; pā. 3.3.143, 150.
analyzed: nāme gara ha vi mha yesu ka rū nī cam   pā
translated: . Nāme garahāvimhayesu ka. ; rū. ; nī. ; caṃ. .., ; pā. .., .🔽The future-tense endings ssaty-ādayo are used in the past tense for the meaning of ‘falling into’ and for the meaning of ‘contempt’ and ‘wonderment’; and this Thread is stated in order to show the occurrence of the future-tense endings ssaty-ādayo in the past tense; and the following are included here too: ‘anutthunana’, ‘paccānutāpa’, ‘paccānumodanā’, and so on.

original: Nipātanāmayoge garahāyañca vimhaye ca ssatyādayo honti, atītakālepi ssatyādīnaṃ uppattidīpanatthamidaṃ suttaṃ, anutthunana, paccānutāpa, paccānumodanādīnipi ettha saṅgayhanti.
analyzed: nipāta nāma yoge ca ssatya ādayaḥ honti atīta kāle pi ssatya ādīnam uppatti dīpana attham idam suttam ettha saṅgayhanti
translated: The words “truth” and so on are used in the sense of “casting down” in the verse of censure and in the verse of consolation. This sutta is given in order to show the arising of truth and so on even in the past time. The words “not to regret,” “not to grieve,” “to rejoice” and so on are also included here.

original: Tattha garahāyaṃ-atthi nāma tāta sudinna ābhidosikaṃ kummāsaṃ paribhuñjissasi pārā. 32.
analyzed: tattha garahāyaṃ atthi nāma tāta sudinna ābhidosikam kummāsam paribhuñjissasi pārā
translated: Herein, in the case of the ‘blame’, there is the ‘there is’ in the words ‘you will eat the rice-gruel, dear Sudinna, and then go beyond’.

original: Vimhaye-yatra hi nāma saññī samāno pañcamattānaṃ sakaṭasatānaṃ saddaṃ na sossati dī. ni. 2.192.
analyzed: hi nāma saññī samānaḥ pañca mattānam sakaṭa satānam saddam na sossati
translated: In the case of the ‘amazement’, there is the ‘where’ in the words ‘whereby, being conscious, he would not hear the sound of five hundred carts passing’.

original: Anutthunanādīsu-na attanā paṭicodessaṃ, na gaṇassa ārocessaṃ pāci. 665, na pubbe🔽dhanamesissaṃ jā. 1.12.50, iti pacchānutappati jā. 1.12.53, bhūtānaṃ nāpacāyissaṃ,🔽pahu santo na posissaṃ, paradāraṃ asevissaṃ jā. 1.12.54, na pubbe payirupāsissaṃ
analyzed: attanā paṭicodessam na gaṇassa ārocessam na pubbe  dhanam esissam jā iti pacchā anutappati jā bhūtānam na apacāyissam  pahu santaḥ na posissam paradāram asevissam jā na pubbe payirupāsissam
translated: In the case of the ‘reproach’, etc., there is the ‘not’ in the words ‘I will not accuse myself’, ‘I will not inform the Community’, ‘I will not remind him beforehand’,🔽‘I will not remind him afterwards’, ‘I will not be remorseful afterwards’, ‘I will not be a nuisance to those who are not’,🔽‘I will not be a burden to those who are’, ‘I will not frequent other men’s wives’, ‘I will not serve them beforehand’,

original: jā. 1.12.58, iti pacchānutappati jā. 1.12.50, anekajātisaṃsāraṃ, sandhāvissaṃ anibbisaṃ dha. pa. 153.
analyzed: iti pacchā anutappati aneka jāti saṃsāram sandhāvissam anibbisam
translated: ‘I will not serve them afterwards’, ‘I will not be remorseful afterwards’, ‘I will not wander about in the round of rebirths for a long time without finding an end to suffering’.

original: Katthaci pana gāthāvasena ekasakāralopo, mitto mittassa pāniyaṃ, adinnaṃ paribhuñjisaṃ
analyzed: katthaci pana gāthā vasena eka sakāra lopaḥ mittaḥ mittassa pāniyam adinnam paribhuñjisam
translated: But in some places there is a single-syllable gap in the verse, as in the words ‘a friend to a friend’s drink’, ‘you have used what was not given’,

original: jā. 1.11.59, nirayamhi apaccisaṃ therīgā. 438, gacchanto naṃ udakkhisaṃ gavesitabbaṃ,
analyzed: nirayamhi apaccisam therīgāḥ gacchantaḥ nam udakkhisam gavesitabbam
translated: ‘I will not be in hell’, ‘I will not be in the animal realm’, ‘I will not be in the realm of ghosts’, ‘I will not be in the realm of the asuras’, ‘I will not be in the realm of the gods’, ‘I will not be in the human realm’, ‘I will not be in the realm of the four kings’, ‘I will not be in the realm of the thirty-three’, ‘I will not be in the Yama realm’, ‘I will not be in the Tusita realm’, ‘I will not be in the realm of those who delight in creation’, ‘I will not be in the realm of those who control what is created by others’, ‘I will not be in the realm of the highest gods’, ‘I will not be in the realm of the earth gods’, ‘I will not be in the realm of the gods of the four kings’, ‘I will not be in the realm of the thirty-three gods’, ‘I will not be in the Yama gods’ realm’, ‘I will not be in the Tusita gods’ realm’, ‘I will not be in the gods who delight in creation’s realm’,

original: yoniso paccavekkhisaṃ theragā. 347 iccādi.🔽‘A ī ssā ssatyādīnaṃ byañjanassiu’ iti iāgamo, bhavissati, bhavissanti, bhavissare,
analyzed: yonisas paccavekkhisam theragā iccādi  a ī ssā ssatya ādīnam iti i āgamaḥ bhavissati bhavissanti bhavissare
translated: The prefix i is added to the consonants of a, i, ss, and ty, etc.,🔽bhavissati, bhavissanti, bhavissare,

original: bhavissasi, bhavissatha, bhavissāmi, bhavissāma, bhavissate, bhavissante, bhavissare,
analyzed: bhavissasi bhavissatha bhavissāmi bhavissāma bhavissate bhavissante bhavissare
translated: bhavissasi, bhavissatha, bhavissāmi, bhavissāma, bhavissate, bhavissante, bhavissare,

original: bhavissase, bhavissavhe, bhavissaṃ, bhavissāmhe.
analyzed: bhavissase bhavissavhe bhavissam bhavissāmhe
translated: bhavissase, bhavissavhe, bhavissaṃ, bhavissāmhe.

original: Anubhossati, anubhossanti, anubhossare iccādi suddhakatturūpaṃ.
analyzed: anubhoḥ sati anubhoḥ santi anubhoḥ sare iccādi suddha kattu rūpam
translated: Anubhossati, anubhossanti, anubhossare, etc., is pure k-stem.

original: Anubhūyissati, anubhūyissanti, anubhūyissare.🔽603. Kyassa sse ka. 517; rū. 488; nī. 1105.
analyzed: anubhūyissare anubhūyissare  kyassa sse ka rū nī
translated: Anubhūyissati, anubhūyissanti, anubhūyissare.🔽Kyassa sse ka. ; rū. ; nī. .

original: Kyassa lopo hoti vā ssakāravati vibhattimhi.
analyzed: kyassa lopaḥ hoti vā s sakāravati vibhattimhi
translated: The k of ky is elided before the case-ending that has the vowel s, or not.

original: Tena maggo gamissati, gamīyissati vā, tena maggo agamissā, agamīyissā vāti vikappena kyassa lopo.
analyzed: tena maggaḥ gamissati gamīyissati vā tena maggaḥ a gamissāḥ a gamīyissāḥ vā ati vikappena kyassa lopo
translated: Therefore, the path will be gone, or will be gone by, by that path; the path will not be gone, or will not be gone by, by that path.

original: Tena bhogo anubhavissati, anubhūyissati vā, tena bhogā anubhavissanti, anubhūyissanti vā iccādi suddhakammarūpaṃ.
analyzed: tena bhogaḥ anubhavissati anubhūyissati vā tena bhogāḥ anubhavissanti anubhūyissanti vā iccādi suddha kamma rūpam
translated: By that, wealth will be experienced, or will be experienced by, by that, wealth will be experienced, or will be experienced by, by that, etc., is pure k-stem.

original: Bhāvissati, ‘ūlasse’ti issa e, bhāvessati, bhāvayissatiiccādi hetukatturūpaṃ.
analyzed: bhāvissati ūlassa iti issaḥ e bhāvessati bhāvayissati iccādi hetu kattu rūpam
translated: ‘He will be’ is the form of the future in the sense of cause, as in ‘He will be slack’ (bhāvissati), ‘he will be jealous’ (issā e), ‘he will be’ (bhāvessati), ‘he will develop’ (bhāvayissati), and so on.

original: Tena maggo bhāvīyissati, maggā bhāvīyissanti iccādi hetukammarūpaṃ.
analyzed: tena maggaḥ bhāvīyissati maggāḥ bhāvīyissanti iccādi hetu kamma rūpam
translated: ‘The path will be developed’ (maggo bhāvīyissati), ‘paths will be developed’ (magghā bhāvīyissanti), and so on, is the form of the future in the sense of action.

original: Iti ssatyādi.
analyzed: iti s satya ādi
translated: Thus ssati and so on.

original: Ssādi
analyzed: ssādi
translated: Ssādi

original: Atha ssādi vuccate.
analyzed: atha ssādi vuccate
translated: Now ssādi is stated.

original: 604. Eyyādotipattiyaṃ ssā ssaṃsu sse ssatha ssaṃ ssāmhā ssatha ssiṃsu ssase ssavhe ssiṃ ssāmhase ka. 422; rū. 475; nī. 895; caṃ. 1.3.107; pā. 3.3.139; eyyādo vātipattiyaṃ (bahūsu).
analyzed: eyyādaḥ vā atipattiyam bahūsu
translated: Eyyādotipattiyaṃ ssā ssaṃsu sse ssatha ssaṃ ssāmhā ssatha ssiṃsu ssase ssavhe ssiṃ ssāmhase ka. ; rū. ; nī. ; caṃ. ..; pā. ..; eyyādo vātipattiyaṃ (bahūsu).

original: Eyyādivisaye kriyātipattiyaṃ ssādayo bhavanti. Eyyādivisayo nāma hetuphalakriyāsambhavo, tadubhayakriyāya abhāvo kriyātipatti.
analyzed: kriyā atipattiyam ssa ādayaḥ bhavanti
translated: Ssā and so on are used in the sense of the future in the sense of action. The sense of the future is the occurrence of cause, fruit, and action. The non-existence of the action of both of them is the sense of the future in the sense of action.

original: Sā duvidhā atītā ca anāgatā ca.
analyzed: sā duvidhā atītā ca anāgatā ca
translated: That is twofold, namely past and future.

original: Tattha atītāyaṃ-sace so paṭhamavaye pabbajjaṃ alabhissā, arahā abhavissā ‘sace pana nikkhamitvā pabbajissa, arahattaṃ pāpuṇissa’ (dhammapada aṭṭha. 1) iccādi.
analyzed: tattha so paṭhama vaye pabbajjam alabhissā arahā abhavissā sace pana nikkhamitvā pabbajissa arahattam pāpuṇissa dhammapada aṭṭha iccādi
translated: Herein, in the past: ‘If he had obtained the going forth in the first stage of life, he would have become an Arahant’ (if he had gone forth and had obtained the going forth, he would have attained Arahantship’ (DhpA 315), and so on.

original: Anāgatāyaṃ-sacāhaṃ na gamissaṃ, mahājāniyo so abhavissā iccādi.
analyzed: anāgatāyam sacā aham na gamissam mahājāniyaḥ saḥ abhavissam iccādi
translated: If I had not gone to the future, he would have been a great lord, etc.🔽In the base of the dhātu, etc., the vowel a is added by vikappana to āīssā, etc.,

original: ‘Āīssādīsvaña vā’iti dhātvādimhi vikappena akārāgamo,‘a īssā ssatyādīnaṃ byañjanassiu’
analyzed: ā īs sā ādi īsvaña vā iti dhātu ādimhi vikappena akāra āgamaḥ a īs sā s satya ādīnam byañjana ssiu
translated: and the vowel i is added to ssā, etc., by a īssā ssatyādīnaṃ byañjanassiu,

original: iti ssādīsu iāgamo, abhavissā, bhavissā, abhavissaṃsu, bhavissaṃsu, abhavisse, bhavisse,
analyzed: iti ssa ādīsu i āgamaḥ abhavissā bhavissā abhavissaṃsu bhavissaṃsu abhavisse bhavisse
translated: thus: abhavissā, bhavissā, abhavissaṃsu, bhavissaṃsu, abhavisse, bhavisse,

original: abhavissatha, bhavissatha, abhavissaṃ, bhavissaṃ, abhavissāmhā, bhavissāmhā, abhavissatha,
analyzed: abhavissatha bhavissatha abhavissam bhavissam abhavissāmhāḥ bhavissāmhāḥ abhavissatha
translated: abhavisssatha, bhavissatha, abhavissaṃ, bhavissaṃ, abhavissāmhā, bhavissāmhā, abhavissatha,

original: bhavissatha, abhavissiṃsu, bhavissiṃsu, abhavissase, bhavissase, abhavissavhe, bhavissavhe,
analyzed: bhavissatha a bhavissiṃsu bhavissiṃsu a bhavissase bhavissase a bhavissavhe bhavissavhe
translated: bhavissatha, abhavissiṃsu, bhavissiṃsu, abhavissase, bhavissase, abhavissavhe, bhavissavhe,

original: abhavissiṃ, bhavissiṃ, abhavissāmhase, bhavissāmhase.
analyzed: abhavissim bhavissim abhavissāmhase bhavissāmhase
translated: abhavissiṃ, bhavissiṃ, abhavissāmhase, bhavissāmhase.

original: ‘Āīū’iccādinā ssā, ssāmhānaṃ rassatte-so abhavissa, bhavissa, mayaṃ abhavissāmha,🔽bhavissāmha. ‘Eyyāthasse’iccādinā ssessa atte-tvaṃ abhavissa, bhavissa iccādīni rūpacatukkāni
analyzed: āīū it ca ādinā ssā ssāmhānam abhavissa bhavissa mayam abhavissāmha  bhavissāmha a bhavissa iti ādīni rūpa catukkāni
translated: By āīū, etc., ssā, ssāmha are changed to rassatta: so abhavissa, bhavissa, mayaṃ abhavissāmha,

original: yathāsambhavaṃ yojetabbāni.
analyzed: yathāsambhavam yojetabbāni
translated: bhavissāmha. By eyyāthassa, etc., ssessa is changed to atta: tvaṃ abhavissa, bhavissa, etc. These four sets of forms should be combined as appropriate.

original: Itissādi.
analyzed: iti ssādi
translated: Thus, etc.

original: Bhūdhāturūpaṃ niṭṭhitaṃ.
analyzed: bhū dhātu rūpam niṭṭhitam
translated: The element earth and materiality are finished.

original: Aṭṭhavibhattuppattirāsi niṭṭhito.
analyzed: niṭṭhitaḥ
translated: The aggregate of the eight declensions is finished.

original: Bhūvādigaṇa
analyzed: bhūva ādi gaṇa
translated: The group of the elements beginning with earth

original: Sarantadhātu
analyzed: saranta dhātu
translated: The element of the ending of the root

original: Ākārantadhāturūpa
analyzed: ākāra anta dhātu rūpa
translated: The materiality of the element of the ending of the syllable

original: Ito paṭṭhāya sarantadhātuyo sarānukkamena, byañjanantadhātuyo akkharānukkamena vuccante.
analyzed: itas paṭṭhāya saranta dhātuyaḥ sara anukkamena byañjananta dhātuyaḥ akkhara anukkamena vuccante
translated: From here onwards the elements of the ending of the root are stated in the order of the roots, and the elements of the ending of the syllable are stated in the order of the syllables.

original: Kaccāyanaganthe anekassaradhātuyo idha byañjanantadhātuyo nāma. Tasmā idha dhātvantasaralopakiccaṃ nāma natthi.
analyzed: kaccāyanaganthe idha nāma tasmai idha dhātu anta sara lopa kiccam nāma natthi
translated: In the Kaccāyana Grammar there are many elements of the root called here elements of the ending of the syllable. Therefore here there is no function of omitting the elements of the root.

original: Khā, khyā-kathane, gā-sadde, ghā-gandhopādāne, ñā-paññāyane avabodhane ca, ṭhā-gatinivattiyaṃ,
analyzed: khā khyā kathane gā sadde ghā gandha upādāne ñā paññāyane avabodhane ca ṭhā gati nivattiyam
translated: Khā, khyā—in the sense of “telling,” gā—in the sense of “sound,” ghā—in the sense of “taking up smell,” ñā—in the sense of “knowing,” “understanding,” ṭhā—in the sense of “going,” “returning,”

original: tā-pālane, thā-ṭhāne, dā-dāne, dhā-dhāraṇe, pā-pāne, phā-vuddhiyaṃ, bhā-dittiyaṃ,
analyzed: tā pālane thā ṭhāne dā dāne dhā dhāraṇe pā pāne phāvuddhiyam bhādittiyam
translated: tā—in the sense of “protecting,” thā—in the sense of “place,” dā—in the sense of “giving,” dhā—in the sense of “bearing,” pā—in the sense of “breathing in,” phā—in the sense of “increasing,” bhā—in the sense of “light,”

original: mā-māne, yā-gatiyaṃ, lā-ādāne chedane ca, vā-gati, bandha, gandhanesu, sā-assādane
analyzed: māmāne lāādāne chedane ca bandha gandhanesu
translated: mā—in the sense of “pride,” yā—in the sense of “going,” lā—in the sense of “taking,” “cutting,” vā—in the sense of “going,” “binding,” “smell,” sā—in the sense of “enjoying,”

original: Parachakke-aṭṭhā buddhassa santike su. ni. 431.🔽Kamme-adhiṭṭhiyi, adhiṭṭhiyiṃsu, upaṭṭhiyi, upaṭṭhiyiṃsu.🔽Ṇāpimhi-patiṭṭhāpesi, patiṭṭhāpayi, saṇṭhāpesi, saṇṭhāpayi.

analyzed: sappurisaḥ dānam jā
translated: In the pāḷi atrimā-dajjā sappuriso dānaṃ jā. .., upāyanāni me dajjuṃ jā. ..,

original: mātaraṃ kena dosena, dajjāsi dakarakkhino jā 1.16.227. Tāni ammāya dajjesi jā. 2.22.2149,
analyzed: mātaram kena dosena dajjāsi daka rakkhinaḥ jā  tāni ammāya dajjesi jā
translated: You should give them to your mother.

original: chaṭṭhāhaṃ dajjamattānaṃ, neva dajjaṃ mahosadhaṃ jā. 1.16.225.
analyzed: chaṭṭhā aham na iva dajjam mahosadham jā
translated: On the sixth day I should give myself, I should not give the great medicine.

original: Ajjhattanimhi-adadi, adāsi, adaduṃ, adaṃsu, adajji, adajjuṃ, tvaṃ adado. Varañce me ado sakka jā. 2.17.142.
analyzed: adadi adāsi adadum adaṃsu adajji adajjum tvam adadaḥ me ado sakka jā
translated: In the middle, he gave, they gave, he gave, they gave, he gave, they gave, you gave. If you would give me a boon, O Sakka.

original: Parachakke-so dānaṃ adā, brāhmaṇassa adā dānaṃ, sivīnaṃ raṭṭhavaḍḍhano jā. 2.22.2117.🔽Ssatyādimhi-dāssati, dāssanti, dadissati, dadissanti, dajjissati, dajjissanti.
analyzed: dānam adāḥ brāhmaṇassa adāḥ dānam sivīnam  ssatya ādimhi dāssati dāssanti dadissati dadissanti dajjissati dajjissanti
translated: In the verse of another, he gave the gift, he gave the gift to the brahmin, the one who increases the kingdom of the Sivis.🔽In the truth, etc., he will give, they will give, he will give, they will give, he will give, they will give.

original: Dāiccassa diccha, pavecchādesampi icchanti, vipulaṃ annaṃ pānañca, samaṇānaṃ pavecchasi
analyzed: dāiccassa diccha icchanti vipulam annam pānam ca samaṇānam
translated: In the desire of giving, they desire giving, they desire the abundant food and drink, you desire🔽The Elder Nuns. Some desire little, some do not desire much.

original: therīgā. 272. Appasmeke pavecchanti, bahuneke na dicchare saṃ. ni. 1.33. Devo sammā
analyzed: therīgāḥ bahunā ike na dicchare sam ni devaḥ sammā
translated: May the god rule righteously.

original: dhāraṃ pavecchatu. Bhojanaṃ bhojanatthīnaṃ, sammadeva pavecchatha.
analyzed: dhāram pavecchatu bhojanam bhojanatthīnam sammadā iva
translated: May he desire the rain. You should properly desire the food for those who desire food.

original: Dhā-dhāraṇe, sandhāti, vidhāti, nidheti, nidhenti. Vidheti, vidhenti.
analyzed: dhā dhāraṇe sandhāti vidhāti nidheti nidhenti vidheti vidhenti
translated: Dhā means ‘to bear’, ‘to hold’, ‘to join’, ‘to spread out’, ‘to lay up’, ‘to lay up’. Vidheti, vidhenti.

original: ‘Parokkhāyañcā’ti casaddena dvittaṃ. ‘Dutiyacatutthāna…’nti dhassa dattaṃ. ‘Rasso pubbassā’ti pubbassa rasso.
analyzed: parokkhā ayam ca iti ca saddena dvittam dutiya catutthānam ti dhassa dattam rasso pubbassa ati pubbassa rasso
translated: And after ‘parokkhāyañca’ the second is added. ‘Dutiyacatutthāna’ means the ‘dh’ is given. ‘Rasso pubbassā’ means the ‘p’ is long.

original: 612. Dhāssa ho ka. 517; rū. 488; nī. 1105.
analyzed: dhāssa ho ka
translated: . Of ‘dhā’ there is ‘ho ka’; of ‘rū’ there is ‘nī’; of ‘nī’ there is ‘ho ka’.

original: Dvitte parassa dhāssa ho hoti.
analyzed: dvitte parassa dhāssa ho hoti
translated: After the second there is ‘ho’ for ‘dhā’.

original: Saddahāti, saddahati vā. Saddahāti tathāgatassa bodhiṃ. Vidahāti, nidahāti, saddahanti, vidahanti, nidahanti.
analyzed: saddahāti saddahati vā saddahāti tathāgatassa bodhim vidahāti nidahāti saddahanti vidahanti nidahanti
translated: Saddahāti, saddahati vā. Saddahāti tathāgatassa bodhiṃ. Vidahāti, nidahāti, saddahanti, vidahanti, nidahanti.

original: ‘Mayadā sare’ti sutte ‘mayadā’ti suttavibhattiyā byañjanepi niggahītassa dattaṃ, kammaṃ saddahāti, kammaphalaṃ saddahāti, saddahanti, vatthaṃ paridahāti, paridahanti.
analyzed: mayadā sarā iti sutte mayadā iti sutta vibhattiyā byañjane pi niggahītassa dattam kammam saddahāti kamma phalam saddahāti saddahanti vattham paridahāti paridahanti
translated: ‘Mayadā sare’ means ‘mayadā’ is given for the ‘s’ of the sutta-ending in the sutta ‘mayadā’, and the action is ‘saddahāti’, ‘saddahanti’, ‘vatthaṃ paridahāti’, ‘paridahanti’.

original: Kamme-sandhīyati, sandhīyanti, sandhiyyati, sandhiyyanti, vidhiyyati. Navena sukhadukkhena, porāṇaṃ apidhiyyati jā. 1.2.114.
analyzed: sandhīyanti sandhiyyati sandhiyyanti vidhiyyati navena sukha dukkhena porāṇam apidhiyyati jā
translated: In ‘kamme-sandhīyati’, ‘sandhīyanti’, ‘sandhiyyati’, ‘sandhiyyanti’, ‘vidhiyyati’, ‘navena sukhadukkhena, porāṇaṃ apidhiyyati jā’ …

original: Ṇāpimhi-nidhāpeti, nidhāpenti, nidhāpayati, nidhāpayanti.
analyzed: nidhāpenti nidhāpayati nidhāpayanti
translated: ‘Ṇāpimhi-nidhāpeti’, ‘nidhāpenti’, ‘nidhāpayati’, ‘nidhāpayanti’.🔽.

original: Kamme-nidhāpīyati, nidhāpīyanti.
analyzed: nidhāpīyanti
translated: In the root nidhā ‘to place’, nidhāpīyati, nidhāpīyanti.

original: Eyyādimhi-saddaheyyaṃ, saddaheyyuṃ.
analyzed: eyya ādi mhisaddaheyyam saddaheyyum
translated: In the root saddha ‘to have faith’, saddaheyya, saddaheyyuṃ.

original: Īādimhi-saddahi, saddahiṃsu. Tatra bhikkhavo samādahiṃsu dī. ni. 2.332, samādahaṃsu vā.
analyzed: ī ādi mhi saddahi saddahiṃsu tatra bhikkhavaḥ samādahiṃsu dī ni samādahaṃsu vā
translated: In the root saddha ‘to heat’, saddahi, saddahiṃsu. There the bhikkhus heated, or they heated up.

original: Pā-pāne, pāti, pānti.
analyzed: pā pānti
translated: In the root pā ‘to drink’, pāne, pāti, pānti.

original: ‘Ṭhāpānaṃ tiṭṭhapivā’ti pāssa pivo, pivati, pivanti.
analyzed: ṭhā apānam pāssa pivaḥ pivati pivanti
translated: ‘The drinking of the drinking of the drinking is the drinking of the drinking of the drinking’, pāssa pivo, pivati, pivanti.

original: Kamme-pīyati, pīyanti.
analyzed: pīyanti
translated: In the root pī ‘to be satisfied’, pīyati, pīyanti.

original: Ṇimhi-‘āssā ṇāpimhi yuka’ iti suttena ṇānubandhe āssa ante yāgamo, puttaṃ thaññaṃ pāyeti, pāyenti, pāyayati, pāyayanti.
analyzed: ṇi mhi āssā ṇā pi yukaḥ iti suttena ṇa anubandhe āssaḥ ante puttam thaññam pāyeti pāyenti pāyayati pāyayanti
translated: In the root pā ‘to give milk’, by the rule ‘āssā ṇāpimhi yuka’, there is the addition of y after āssā and ṇ, he gives milk to the child, they give milk, he causes to drink, they cause to drink.

original: Kamme-pāyīyati, pāyīyanti.
analyzed: kammepāyīyati pāyīyanti
translated: In the root pā ‘to cause to drink’, pāyīyati, pāyīyanti.

original: Ssatyādimhi-passati, passanti, pissati, pissanti.🔽Atrimā pāḷī-ayañhi te mayā’ruḷho, saro pissati lohitaṃ jā. 2.22.1968,aggodakāni pissāmi,
analyzed: ssati ādimhi passati passanti pissati pissanti  atrimā pāḷīayan hi te mayā āruḷhaḥ saraḥ pissati lohitam jā pissāmi
translated: In the root pass ‘to see’, passati, passanti, pissati, pissanti.

original: yūthassa purato vajaṃ jā. 1.8.14. Naḷena vāriṃ pissāma, na ca maṃ tvaṃ vadhissasi jā. 1.1.20.
analyzed: yūthassa puratas vajam jā  naḷena vārim pissāma na ca mama tvam vadhissasi jā
translated: In the text ‘This has been mounted by me on you’, the word pissati ‘it will see’ is used. ‘Blood will be seen by the arrow’, ‘I will see the waters of the rising sun’, ‘I will not be killed by you’.

original: Bhā-dittiyaṃ, bhāti, rattimābhāti candimā dha. pa. 387, disā bhanti virocamānā ma.
analyzed: bhādittiyam bhāti candimā dha disāḥ bhanti virocamānāḥ
translated: In the root bhā ‘to shine’, bhāti, rattimābhāti candimā, ‘the stars shine in the sky’, ‘the quarters shine shining’.

original: ni. 1.503, daddallamānā ābhanti vi. va. 738; jā. 2.22.508, paṭibhāti, paṭibhanti,🔽paṭibhātu, paṭibhantu taṃ cunda bojjhaṅgā saṃ. ni. 5.197, tisso maṃ upamāyo paṭibhaṃsu
analyzed: ni daddallamānā ābhanti vi va  jā paṭibhāti paṭibhanti  paṭibhātu paṭibhantu tam cunda bojjhaṅgā sam ni tissaḥ mama upamāyo paṭibhaṃsu
translated: shining, shine,🔽may it shine, may they shine,🔽those factors of enlightenment, Cunda, occurred to me🔽three similes occurred to me

original: ma. ni. 1.374, ratti vibhāti, vibhāyati.🔽Mā-māne, dvittaṃ rasso ca, mamāyati, mamāyanti. Yemaṃ kāyaṃ mamāyanti, andhā bālā puthujjanā theragā. 575.🔽Yā-gatiyaṃ, yāti, yanti, yāyati, yāyanti, yāyanta’ manuyāyanti jā. 2.22.1753, uyyāti,🔽uyyanti, niyyāti, niyyanti dhīrā lokamhā, hitvā māraṃ savāhanaṃ. Anuyāti, anuyanti,🔽anupariyāyati, anupariyāyanti.🔽Lā-ādāne, lāti.🔽Vā-gati, gandhanesu, vāti devesu uttamo dha. pa. 56, vāto vāyati, vāyanti, nibbāti, nibbanti, nibbāyati, nibbāyanti, parinibbāti, parinibbāyati.🔽Ṇāpimhi-nibbāpeti, nibbāpayati.
analyzed: ma ni ratti vibhāti vibhāyati 🔽ca mamāyati mamāyanti yā imam kāyam mamāyanti andhāḥ bālāḥ puthujjanāḥ theragāḥ 🔽yāgatiyam yāti yanti yāyati yāyanti yāyanta manuyāyanti jāḥ uyyāti 🔽uyyanti niyyāti niyyanti dhīrāḥ lokamhā hitvā māram sa vāhanam anuyāti anuyanti 🔽anupariyāyati anupariyāyanti 🔽lā ādāne lāti 🔽vāgati gandhanesu vāti devesu uttamaḥ vātaḥ vāyati vāyanti nibbāti nibbanti nibbāyati nibbāyanti parinibbāti parinibbāyati 🔽nibbāpayati
translated: (see 1.503) shine, shine forth, shine brightly, shine resplendently, shine radiantly, shine brilliantly, shine with splendour, shine with glory, shine with beauty, shine with loveliness, shine with grace, shine with charm, shine with splendour, shine with glory, shine with beauty, shine with loveliness, shine with grace, shine with charm, shine with splendour, shine with glory, shine
