splendour, shine with glory, shine with beauty, shine with loveliness, shine with grace, shine with charm, shine with splendour

original: Īādimhi-parinibbāyi, parinibbāyiṃsu.
analyzed: ī ādi parinibbāyi parinibbāyiṃsu
translated: In the sense of ‘having attained Nibbāna’ (he) attained Nibbāna, (they) attained Nibbāna.

original: Ssatyādimhi-parinibbissati, parinibbissanti, parinibbāyissati, parinibbāyissanti.🔽Sā-assādana, tanukaraṇa, antakriyāsu, sāti, sāyati, sāyanti, pariyosāyanti.
analyzed: ssatya ādimhi parinibbissati parinibbissanti parinibbāyissati parinibbāyissanti  tanu karaṇa anta kriyāsu sāti sāyati sāyanti pariyosāyanti
translated: In the sense of ‘will attain Nibbāna’ (he) will attain Nibbāna, (they) will attain Nibbāna, (he) will attain Nibbāna, (they) will attain Nibbāna.🔽In the sense of ‘satisfying’, ‘making thin’, ‘making an end’, (he) satisfies, (they) satisfy, (they) come to an end.

original: Ṇāpimhi-osāpeti, pariyosāpeti, osāpayati, pariyosāpayati.
analyzed: pariyosāpeti osāpayati pariyosāpayati
translated: In the sense of ‘having attained’ (he) attains, (he) comes to an end, (he) causes to attain, (he) causes to come to an end.

original: Kamme-osāpīyati, pariyosāpīyati.
analyzed: kammeosāpīyati pariyosāpīyati
translated: In the sense of ‘action’ (it) is attained, (it) is brought to an end.

original: Hā-cāge, pahāti, pahāyati, pahāyanti.
analyzed: ha ācāge pahāti pahāyati pahāyanti
translated: In the sense of ‘giving up’, ‘giving away’, (he) gives up, (he) is given up, (they) are given up.

original: Kattu, kammani kyo, īñaāgamo, hiyyoti hiyyati poso jā. 1.15.348, nihiyyati tassa yaso a. ni. 4.17; jā. 1.10.60, tvaṃ eko avahiyyasi, dvittaṃ rasso ca.
analyzed: kattu kammani kyaḥ īña āgamaḥ hiyyoti hiyyati posaḥ jā nihiyyati tassa yasaḥ a ni jā  tvam ekaḥ avahiyyasi ca
translated: In the sense of ‘doing’, ‘action’, ‘having come’, ‘having gone’, ‘a person is destroyed’, ‘his fame is destroyed’, ‘(he) is destroyed’, ‘you are destroyed’, ‘the second is weak’.

original: 613. Kavaggahānaṃ cavaggajā ka. 462-4; rū. 467-504; nī. 943-5; caṃ. 6.2.116; pā. 7.4.62.
analyzed: ka vagga hānam ca vagga jā ka rū nī cam pā
translated: In the sense of ‘having the same base as the first’, ‘having a different base’, ‘having the same base’, ‘having a different base’, ‘having the same base’, ‘having a different base’, ‘having the same base’.

original: Dvitte pubbesaṃ kavagga, hānaṃ cavagga, jā honti.
analyzed: dvitte pubbesam kavagga hānam cavagga jā honti
translated: In the second (case) the first has the same base, the giving up has a different base, (they) are.

original: Jahāti, pajahāti, jahanti, pajahanti.
analyzed: jahāti pajahāti jahanti pajahanti
translated: (He) gives up, (he) gives up completely, (they) give up, (they) give up completely.

original: Kamme-pahīyati, pahīyanti.
analyzed: pahīyanti
translated: In the sense of ‘action’ (it) is given up, (they) are given up.

original: Rassatte-pahiyati, pahiyanti.
analyzed: rassatte pahiyati pahiyanti
translated: In the sense of ‘weakness’ (it) is given up, (they) are given up.

original: Dvitte-pahiyyati, pahiyyanti, pajahīyati, pajahīyanti.
analyzed: dvitte pahiyyati pahiyyanti pajahīyati pajahīyanti
translated: Pahiyyati, pahiyyanti, pajahīyati, pajahīyanti.

original: Ṇāpimhi-hāpeti, hāpenti, hāpayati, hāpayanti, jahāpeti, jahāpenti, jahāpayati, jahāpayanti.
analyzed: hāpenti hāpayati hāpayanti jahāpeti jahāpenti jahāpayati jahāpayanti
translated: Hāpeti, hāpenti, hāpayati, hāpayanti, jahāpeti, jahāpenti, jahāpayati, jahāpayanti.

original: Kamme-hāpīyati, jahāpīyati.
analyzed: jahāpīyati
translated: In the kammadhāraya compound: hāpīyati, jahāpīyati.

original: Īādimhi-pahāsi, pahāsuṃ, pajahi, pajahiṃsu.🔽614. Hāto ha ka. 480; rū. 490; nī. 961.
analyzed: ī ādim hi pahāsi pahāsum pajahi pajahiṃsu  ha a taḥ ha ka rū nī
translated: In the ādi class: pahāsi, pahāsuṃ, pajahi, pajahiṃsu.🔽Hāto ha ka; rū; nī.

original: Hāto parassa ssa-kārassa ha hoti vā.
analyzed: ha ā taḥ parassa ssakārassa ha hoti vā
translated: After parassa, hāto ha is the substitute for the ssa-kāra, optionally.

original: “Hāhisi tvaṃ jīvaloka”nti jā. 1.5.36 pāḷi, hāhiti, hāhinti, hāhati, hāhanti, jahissati, hissati, aññamaññaṃ vadhitvāna, khippaṃ hissāma jīvitaṃ jā. 2.22.673.
analyzed: tvam jīva lokanti jā  hāhiti hāhinti hāhati hāhanti jahissati hissati aññam aññam vadhitvāna khippam hissāma jīvitam
translated: “Hāhisi tvaṃ jīvaloka” (Jā. i. 142), hāhiti, hāhinti, hāhati, hāhanti, jahissati, hissati, aññamaññaṃ vadhitvāna, khippaṃ hissāma jīvitaṃ (Jā. i. 142),

original: Nhā-soceyye, nhāti, nhāyati, nhāyanti.
analyzed: nhāsoceyye nhāti nhāyati nhāyanti
translated: Nhā—in soceyya (purification), nhāti, nhāyati, nhāyanti.

original: Mahāvuttinā byañjanavaḍḍhane, nahāti, nahāyati, nahāyanti.🔽Iti bhūvādigaṇe ākārantadhāturūpaṃ.
analyzed: mahāvuttinā byañjana vaḍḍhane nahāti nahāyati nahāyanti  iti bhū ādi gaṇe ākāra anta dhātu rūpam
translated: In the Mahā-vutti, in the augmenting of the vowel, nahāti, nahāyati, nahāyanti.

original: Ivaṇṇantadhāturūpa
analyzed: i va ṇ ṇ anta dhātu rūpa
translated: Thus in the bhūvādi class the form of the verbal base is in the ākāraṇat form.🔽The form of the verbal base in the i-aṇ form

original: I-gatiyaṃ ajjhāyane ca, khi-khaye pakāsane ca, cicaye, ji-jaye, ḍī-vehāsagatiyaṃ, nī-naye, bhī-bhaye, lī-laye, sī-saye, mhi-hāse.
analyzed: i gatiyam ajjhāyane ca khikhaye pakāsane ca cicaye jijaye ḍīvehāsagatiyam nīnaye bhībhaye līlaye sīsaye mhihāse
translated: In the case of the direction i, in the case of the study of the Vedas, in the case of the destruction of k, in the case of the manifestation of k, in the case of the accumulation of c, in the case of the victory of j, in the case of the direction of d, in the case of the direction of n, in the case of fear of b, in the case of the sport of l, in the case of the lying down of s, in the case of the laughter of m.

original: Tyādyuppatti, kattari lo, eti, enti, esi, etha, emi, ema, veti, venti, sameti, samenti,
analyzed: kattari laḥ eti enti esi etha emi ema veti venti sameti samenti
translated: In the case of the origin of tyā, in the case of the agent lo, goes, they go, you go, come, I go, we go, he goes, they go, he comes, they come,

original: abbheti, abbhenti, abhisameti, abhisamenti, aveti, aventi, samaveti, samaventi, apeti,🔽apenti, upeti, upenti, anveti, anventi, acceti, accenti, pacceti, paccenti, ajjheti,
analyzed: abbheti abbhenti abhisameti abhisamenti aveti aventi samaveti samaventi apeti  apenti upeti upenti anveti anventi acceti accenti pacceti paccenti ajjheti
translated: he approaches, they approach, he comes together, they come together, he goes, they go, he comes together, they come together, he goes away, they go away, he comes together, they come together, he sends,🔽they send, he goes, they go, he follows, they follow, he accepts, they accept, he returns, they return, he approaches,

original: ajjhenti, udeti, udenti, samudeti, samudenti, pariyeti, pariyenti, upayati, upayanti,
analyzed: udeti udenti samudeti samudenti pariyeti pariyenti upayati upayanti
translated: they approach, he rises, they rise, he rises together, they rise together, he goes around, they go around, he goes near, they go near,

original: accayati, accayanti, udayati, samudayati.
analyzed: accayati accayanti udayati samudayati
translated: he goes away, they go away, he rises, he rises together.

original: Etu, sametu, entu, samentu, ehi, samehi, etha, sametha, etha byagghā nivattavho, paccupetha mahāvanaṃ jā. 1.3.66.
analyzed: etu sametu entu samentu ehi samehi etha sametha etha byagghā nivattavhaḥ paccupetha mahā vanam
translated: Let him come, let him come together, let them come, let them come together, come, come together, come, come together, come, tigers, turn back, come near, great forest. ...🔽...

original: Mahāvuttinā idhātumhā eyyādīnaṃ ekārassa lopo, na ca apatvā dukkhassantaṃ saṃ. ni. 1.107, vissāsaṃ eyya paṇḍito, yadā te pahiṇeyyāmi, tadā eyyāsi khattiya jā. 2.22.635.
analyzed: mahāvuttinā eyya ādīnam ekārassa lopaḥ na ca a patvā dukkhassa antam sam ni vissāsam eyya paṇḍitaḥ yadā te pahiṇeyyāmi tadā eyyā asi khattiya jā
translated: In the word mahāvutti, the e of eyyā is elided by the rule ‘mahāvuttinā idhātumhā eyyādīnaṃ ekārassa lopo’, but not by the rule ‘na ca apatvā dukkhassantaṃ saṃ. ni. 1.107’. The wise man should not go out without confidence. When I send you, then you may go, O prince.

original: Īādimhi ‘paro kvacī’ti vibhattisaralopo, dhammaṃ abhisami, abhisamiṃsu.
analyzed: ī ādimhi paraḥ kvaci iti vibhatti sara lopaḥ dhammam abhisami abhisamiṃsu
translated: In the word īādimhi, the vibhatti and the saravaṇa are elided by the rule ‘paro kvacī’. He has penetrated the Dhamma. They have penetrated.

original: ‘Eontā su’nti uṃssa suṃ, abhisamesuṃ, abhisamayuṃ, abhisamayiṃsu.
analyzed: e o ntā sunti sum abhisamesum abhisamayum abhisamayiṃsu
translated: By the rule ‘eontā su’, the u becomes suṃ. They have penetrated. They have penetrated to. They have penetrated to.

original: Ssatyādimhi –
analyzed: s satya ādimhi
translated: In the word ssatyādimhi,

analyzed: etismā ka rū nī
translated: . Etismā ka. ; rū. ; nī. .

original: ‘Etī’ti dhātuniddeso tisaddo, idhātumhā parassa ssakārassa hi hoti vā.
analyzed: e ti iti dhātu niddesaḥ ti saddaḥ i dhātumhā parassa ssakārassa hi hoti vā
translated: The word etī is a verbal noun. Here the ss of the other is either h or o.

original: Ehiti, essati. Bodhirukkhamupehiti bu. vaṃ. 2.63, nerañjaramupehiti bu. vaṃ. 2.63,
analyzed: ehiti bodhi rukkham upehiti bu vaṃ
translated: He goes. He will go. He approaches the Bodhi tree. He approaches the river Nerañjarā.

original: upessati, tadā ehinti me vasaṃ jā. 1.1.33, tato nibbānamehisi cūḷava. 382 tassuddānaṃ,
analyzed: upessati tadā ehinti me vasam jā tatas nibbānam ehisi cūḷava tassa uddānam
translated: He will approach. Then you may come to me. Then you will attain Nibbāna. The summary:

original: na punaṃ jātijaraṃ upehisi dha. pa. 238. Suttavibhattena aññadhātūhipi, kathaṃ jīvihisi
analyzed: na punar jāti jaram upehisi dha pa  sutta vibhattena añña dhātūhi pi katham jīvihisi
translated: You will not come again to birth and old age. How will you live?

original: Ssādimhi “sace puttaṃ siṅgālānaṃ, kukkurānaṃ adāhisī”ti gavesitabbaṃ pāḷi, ‘adāhisī’ti ca adadissasetyattho.
analyzed: ssa ādimhi sace puttam siṅgālānam kukkurānam adāhisi iti gavesitabbam pāḷi adāhisi iti ca
translated: In the present tense, if the text reads “If you would give your son to jackals and dogs,” it should be searched for. The meaning of “would give” is “would not give.”

analyzed: khi khaye a vaṇṇa pakāsane ca khayati khayanti
translated: In the sense of destruction and in the sense of revealing dispraise, khayati, khayanti.

analyzed: khitaḥ yāgamaḥ vikappena yassa dvittam kappo khīyetha vaṇṇaḥ na khīyetha tathāgatassa

translated: Dī. ni. aṭṭha. , they are disgusted, they are destroyed, they are defeated. The meaning is that they reveal dispraise. Khayati,

analyzed: ī ādimhi ajesi ajesum vijesi vijesum ajayi ajayum ajayiṃsu vijayi vijayum vijayiṃsu jessati vijessati parājessati jayissati vijayissati parājayissati

original: Ḍī-vehāsagatiyaṃ, sakuṇo ḍeti, ḍenti dī. ni. 1.215; a. ni. 4.198. Pāsaṃ oḍḍeti, oḍḍenti.
analyzed: sakuṇaḥ ḍeti ḍenti pāsam oḍḍeti oḍḍenti
translated: In the 1st periphrastic: ḍeti, ḍenti, dī, ni, oḍḍeti, oḍḍenti.

original: Nī-naye, neti, nenti, vineti, vinenti, nayati, nayanti, vinayati, vinayanti.
analyzed: nīnaye na iti nenti vinā iti vinenti nayati nayanti vinayati vinayanti
translated: In the 1st present: neti, nenti, vineti, vinenti, nayati, nayanti, vinayati, vinayanti.

original: Kamme-nīyati, nīyanti.
analyzed: nīyanti
translated: In the 1st passive: nīyati, nīyanti.

original: Dvitte-niyyati, niyyanti, niyyare.
analyzed: niyyanti niyyare
translated: In the 1st causative: niyyati, niyyanti, niyyare.

original: Ṇāpimhi āyādesassa rasso, nayāpeti, nayāpenti, nayāpayati, nayāpayanti.
analyzed: ṇāpimhi āya ādesassa rassaḥ nayāpeti nayāpenti nayāpayati nayāpayanti
translated: In the 1st future: nayāpeti, nayāpenti, nayāpayati, nayāpayanti.

original: Kamme-nayāpīyati, nayāpīyanti.
analyzed: nayā api iyanti
translated: In the 1st passive: nayāpīyati, nayāpīyanti.

original: Īādimhi-nesi, nesuṃ, vinesi, vinesuṃ, ānesi, ānesuṃ, anayi, nayi, anayiṃsu, nayiṃsu, ānayi, ānayiṃsu, vinayi, vinayiṃsu.
analyzed: ī ādimhi nesum vinesum vinesum ānesum ānesum anayi nayi anayiṃsu nayiṃsu ānayi ānayiṃsu vinayi vinayiṃsu
translated: In the 1st perfect: nesī, nesuṃ, vinesī, vinesuṃ, ānesi, ānesuṃ, anayi, nayi, anayiṃsu, nayiṃsu, ānayi, ānayiṃsu, vinayi, vinayiṃsu.

original: Ssatyādimhi-nessati, nessanti, nayissati, nayissanti.
analyzed: nessanti nayissanti
translated: In the 1st conditional: nessati, nessanti, nayissati, nayissanti.

original: Bhī-bhaye, bheti. Mā bhetha kiṃ socatha modathavho jā. 1.12.27, vibhemi etaṃ asādhuṃ, uggatejo hi brāhmaṇo jā. 2.17.103. Bhāyati, bhāyanti.
analyzed: bhī bhaye bheti mā bhetha kim socatha modathavhaḥ jā vibhemi etam asādhum ugga tejaḥ hi brāhmaṇaḥ jā bhāyati bhāyanti
translated: Bhī- in the sense of fear, as in bheti. Mā bhetha kiṃ socatha modathavho jā. 1.12.27, vibhemi etaṃ asādhuṃ, uggatejo hi brāhmaṇo jā. 2.17.103. Bhāyati, bhāyanti.

original: Kārite mahāvuttinā sāgamo vā, bhīseti, bhīsayati, bhīsāpeti, bhīsāpayati. Bhikkhuṃ bhīseyya vā bhīsāpeyya vā pāci. 346-347.
analyzed: kārite mahāvuttinā sa āgamaḥ vā bhīseti bhīsayati bhīsāpeti bhīsāpayati bhikkhum bhīseyya vā bhīsāpeyya vā
translated: Kārite mahāvuttinā sāgamo vā, bhīseti, bhīsayati, bhīsāpeti, bhīsāpayati. Bhikkhuṃ bhīseyya vā bhīsāpeyya vā pāci. -.

original: Sī-saye, seti, senti, atiseti, atisenti, sayati, sayanti.
analyzed: sīsaye seti senti atiseti atisenti sayati sayanti
translated: Sī- in the sense of lying down, as in seti, senti, atiseti, atisenti, sayati, sayanti.

original: Kamme-atisīyati, atisīyanti.
analyzed: atisīyanti
translated: In the kammadhāraya compound, as in atisīyati, atisīyanti.

original: Ṇāpimhi rasso, sayāpeti, sayāpayati.
analyzed: ṇāpimhi rassaḥ sayāpeti sayāpayati
translated: In the passive, as in rasso, sayāpeti, sayāpayati.

original: Ṇimhi-sāyeti, sāyayati, sāyesuṃ dīnamānasā apa. thera 2.54.48.
analyzed: dīna mānasāḥ
translated: In the causative, as in sāyeti, sāyayati, sāyesuṃ dīnamānasā apa. thera ...

original: Mhi-hāse, umheti, umhayati, vimheti, vimhayati, na naṃ umhayate disvā, na ca naṃ paṭinandati jā. 1.2.93.
analyzed: umhā iti umhayati vimhā iti vimhayati na nam umhayate disvā na ca nam paṭinandati jā
translated: In the kammadhāraya compound, as in hāse, umheti, umhayati, vimheti, vimhayati, na naṃ umhayate disvā, na ca naṃ paṭinandati jā. ...

original: Kamme-umhīyati, vimhīyati.
analyzed: kammeumhīyati vimhīyati
translated: In the kammadhāraya compound, as in umhīyati, vimhīyati.

original: Kārite pubbassaralopo, sace maṃ nāganāsūrū, umhāyeyya pabhāvatī. Sace maṃ nāganāsūrū, pamhāyeyya pabhāvatī jā. 2.20.17.
analyzed: kārite pubbassara lopaḥ sace mama nāga nāsūrū umhāyeyya pabhāvatī sace mama nāga nāsūrū pamhāyeyya pabhāvatī jā
translated: In the causative, with the elision of the first syllable, as in sace maṃ nāganāsūrū, umhāyeyya pabhāvatī. Sace maṃ nāganāsūrū, pamhāyeyya pabhāvatī jā. ...

original: Iti bhūvādigaṇe ivaṇṇantadhārūpaṃ.
analyzed: iti bhū ādi gaṇe i va ṇ ṇ anta dhā rūpam
translated: So the matter-as-visible-form is like the group of words beginning with bhū.

original: Uvaṇṇantadhāturūpa
analyzed: u a c anta dhātu rūpa
translated: The matter-element as the visible

analyzed: hudāne bhakkhane sattiyañca
translated: hu-dāne bhakkhane pūjāyaṃ sattiyañca, hū-sattāyaṃ.

original: Tyādyuppatti, ‘kattari lo’ti lapaccayo, uvaṇṇassa avādeso, ‘dīgho sarassā’ti sakammikadhātūnaṃ kyamhi dīgho.
analyzed: tya ādi uppatti kattari laḥ ti la paccayaḥ u vaṇṇassa a v ādesaḥ dīghaḥ sarassa ati sa kammika dhātūnam kyamhi dīghaḥ
translated: The origin of these is ‘in the verb lo’ , the affix lap, the vowel a is elided, ‘the long of the roots’ , so the long is in the kyamhi.

original: Cu-cavane, cavati, cavanti.
analyzed: cucavane cavati cavanti
translated: Cu-cavane, cavati, cavanti.

original: Ju-sīghagamane, javati, javanti.
analyzed: ju sī gha gamane javati javanti

analyzed: bahulanti adhika tattā kyamhi kvaci vuddhi a v ādesaḥ abhitthavīyati abhitthavīyanti abhitthaviyyati abhitthaviyyanti

original: Du-upatāpe, upaddavati, upaddavanti.
analyzed: duupatāpe upaddavati upaddavanti

original: Yu-gatiyaṃ, yavati.
analyzed: yugatiyam yavati

analyzed: rusadde ravati ravanti viravati viravanti

analyzed: bravīti
translated: Bravīti.

analyzed: yuva ṇ āna miya ṅauvaṅa sare ka rū nī miya vuvaṅa bahūsu

translated: Ivaṇṇu’vaṇṇantānaṃ dhātūnaṃ kvaci iyaṅa, uvaṅa honti sare.

original: Bruvanti, brunti vā. “Ajānantā no pabruntī”ti pāḷi. Brūsi, brūtha, brūmi, brūma.
analyzed: bruvanti brunti vai a jānantā na u pabrunti iti brūsi brūtha brūmi brūma

translated: Ti, antīsu brūssa āha hoti, tesañca ṭa, ṭū honti.

original: So āha, te āhu.
analyzed: saḥ āha te āhu
translated: So āha, te āhu.

original: Atrimā pāḷī-nibbānaṃ bhagavā āha, sabbaganthapamocanaṃ, āha tesañca yo nirodho mahāva.
analyzed: pāḷī nibbānam bhagavā āha sabba gantha pamocanam āha tesam ca yaḥ nirodhaḥ
translated: Atrimā pāḷī-nibbānaṃ bhagavā āha, sabbaganthapamocanaṃ, āha tesañca yo nirodho mahāva.

original: 60, yaṃ pare sukhato āhu, tadariyā āhu dukkhato. Yaṃ pare dukkhato āhu, tadariyā
analyzed: yam pare sukhatas āhu tad ariyāḥ āhu dukkhatas yam pare dukkhatas āhu tad ariyāḥ

original: sukhato vidū su. ni. 767. Tattha ‘āhā’ti katheti. ‘Āhū’ti kathenti.
analyzed: sukhataḥ vidū su ni tattha āha ati kathā iti āhū iti kathenti
translated: Herein, ‘āhu’ means ‘they say’. ‘Āhu’ means ‘they say’.

original: Brūtu, brūvantu, brūhi maṅgalamuttamaṃ khu. pā. 5.2, brūtha, brūmi, brūma.🔽Eyyādimhi-brūssa uvaṅa hoti, bruveyya, bruveyyuṃ.
analyzed: brūtu brūvantu brūhi maṅgalam uttamam brūtha brūmi brūma  hoti bruveyya bruveyyum
translated: Brūtu, brūvantu, brūhi maṅgalamuttamaṃ khu. pā. ., brūtha, brūmi, brūma.🔽In eyya, etc., uvaṅa is substituted for brūssa: bruveyya, bruveyyuṃ.

original: Īādimhi sare pare brūssa ottaṃ, ossa ca avādeso, abravi, abravuṃ, abraviṃsu.
analyzed: ī ādimhi sare pare brūssaḥ ottam ossaḥ ca a v ādesaḥ abravi abravum abraviṃsu
translated: In ātīta, etc., otta is substituted for brūssa, and ossa is not elided: abravi, abravuṃ, abraviṃsu.

original: Uvādese-abruvi, abruvuṃ, abruviṃsu.
analyzed: abruvum abruviṃsu
translated: In uvacana, abruvi, abruvuṃ, abruviṃsu.

original: Parokkhamhi –🔽622. Aādīsvāho brūssa ka. 475; rū. 465; nī. 956.
analyzed: parokkhamhi  brūssa ka rū nī
translated: In parokkha,🔽. Aādīsvāho brūssa ka. ; rū. ; nī. .

original: Aādīsu brūssa āha bhavati.
analyzed: a ādīsu brūssaḥ āha bhavati
translated: In aādīsu, āha is substituted for brūssa: bhavati.

original: So āha, te āhu.
analyzed: saḥ āha te āhu
translated: So āha, te āhu.

original: 623. Ussaṃsvāhā vā nī. 1036.
analyzed: ussaṃsvāhā vā nī
translated: . Ussaṃsvāhā vā nī. .

original: Āhādesamhā parassa uvacanassa aṃsu hoti vā.
analyzed: āha ādesamhā parassa u vacanassa aṃsu hoti vā
translated: In āhādesamhā parassa uvacanassa aṃsu is substituted for āha, optionally.

original: Te āhaṃsu, saccaṃ kirevamāhaṃsu, narā ekacciyā idha jā. 1.13.123.
analyzed: te āhaṃsu saccam narāḥ
translated: Te āhaṃsu, saccaṃ kirevamāhaṃsu, narā ekacciyā idha jā. ...

original: Su-sandane, nadī savati, savanti, ābhavaggā savanti.
analyzed: susandane nadī savati savanti ābhavaggā savanti
translated: Su-sandane, nadī savati, savanti, ābhavaggā savanti.

original: Sū-pasavane, puññaṃ pasavati cūḷava. 354, pasavanti.
analyzed: su upasavane puññam pasavati cūḍava pasavanti
translated: In the sense of ‘making grow’ (pasavati) he makes merit in the Sūpa-offering, in the Cūḷava-offering, they make (merit).

original: Hu-pūjāyaṃ, ‘parokkhāyañcā’ti dvittaṃ, ‘kavaggahānaṃ cavaggajā’ti hassa jo, juhoti, juhonti.
analyzed: parokkha ayam ca ati dvittam kavagga hānam cavagga jāti hassa jaḥ juhoti juhonti
translated: In the sense of ‘worshipping’ (hu-pūjāyaṃ) the second (dvittaṃ) is ‘parokkhāyañcā’ (in the sense of ‘offering to the gods’), the third (tattaṃ) is ‘kavaggahānaṃ cavaggajā’ (in the sense of ‘the group of the first three vowels’), he offers, they offer.

original: Kamme-tena aggi hūyate.🔽Ṇimhi-juhāveti, juhāvayati.
analyzed: kammetena aggi hūyate  juhāvayati
translated: In the sense of ‘action’ (kamme-tena) the fire is offered.🔽In the sense of ‘offering’ (nimhi) he offers, he causes to offer.

original: Ṇāpimhi-juhāpeti, juhāpayati.🔽Hu-sattiyaṃ, pahoti, sampahoti, pahonti, sampahonti.
analyzed: juhāpayati  husattiyam pahoti sampahoti pahonti sampahonti
translated: In the sense of ‘causing to offer’ (ṇāpimhi) he causes to offer, he causes to be offered.🔽In the sense of ‘ability’ (hu-sattiyaṃ) he is able, he is able together, they are able, they are able together.

original: Hū-sattāyaṃ, hoti, honti, hotu, hontu.
analyzed: hūsattā ayam hoti honti hotu hontu
translated: In the sense of ‘existence’ (hū-sattāyaṃ) he is, they are, let him be, let them be.

original: Eyyādimhi- ‘yuvaṇṇānamiyaṅauvaṅa sare’ti dhātvantassa uvādeso, huveyya, huveyyuṃ.🔽Āādimhi-so ahuvā. Vaṇṇagandhaphalūpeto, amboyaṃ ahuvā pure jā. 1.2.71. Ahuvā te pure
analyzed: eyya ādimhi sara iti dhātu antassa u vā ādesaḥ huveyya huveyyum  vaṇṇa gandha phalūpetaḥ amboyam ahuvā pure jā ahuvā te pure
translated: In the sense of ‘imperative’ (eyyādimhi) ‘yuvaṇṇānamiyaṅauvaṅa sare’ (in the sense of ‘the first three vowels’) there is a substitution of the final vowel, he would offer, they would offer.

original: sakhā saṃ. ni. 1.50, te ahuvū, tvaṃ ahuvo, tumhe ahuvattha ma. ni. 1.215, jhāyatha🔽bhikkhave mā pamādāttha, mā pacchā vippaṭisārino ahuvattha, ahuva, ahuvaṃ vā, ahuvamhā.
analyzed: sakhā sam ni te ahuvū tvam ahuvaḥ tumhe ahuvattha ma ni jhāyatha 🔽bhikkhave mā pamādāttha mā pacchā vippaṭisārinaḥ ahuvattha ahuva ahuvam vā
translated: In the sense of ‘past’ (āādimhi) he was, endowed with beauty, fragrance and fruit, this mango was in the past, in the past they were your friends, you were, you all were, you were, you were all, you were, you were all, we were.

original: “Akaramhasa te kiccaṃ, yaṃ balaṃ ahuvamhase jā. 1.4.29. Ahuvamheva mayaṃ pubbe, na
analyzed: akaramhasa te kiccam yam balam ahuvamhase jāḥ ahuvamha iva mayam pubbe na
translated: “We have done your bidding, in that we have strength.”🔽“We were, in the past, not non-existent.”

original: nāhuvamhā”ti ma. ni. 1.180 pāḷiyo.🔽Īādimhi sāgamo, ahosi, pāturahosi.
analyzed: na ahuvamha ati ma ni  ī ādimhi sa āgamaḥ ahosi pātuḥ ahosi
translated: In the beginning, there was a coming-into-existence, there was a manifestation.

original: Mahāvuttinā īlopo rasso ca. Ahudeva bhayaṃ ahu chambhitattaṃ. Ahudeva kukkuccaṃ, ahu vippaṭisāro pārā. 38. Ādīnavo pāturahu theragā. 269, dibbo ratho pāturahu.
analyzed: mahāvuttinā ī lopaḥ rasso ca ahu deva bhayam ahu chambhitattam ahu deva kukkuccam ahu vippaṭisāro pārā ādīnavaḥ pāturahu theragā dibbaḥ ratho pāturahu
translated: By the Great-Extension (Mhv. 1.1), there was the elision of ī and the shortening (of the preceding syllable). There was fear, there was terror. There was anxiety, there was remorse. The danger manifested itself to the Elders. The divine chariot manifested itself.

original: 624. Hūto resuṃ ka. 517; rū. 488; nī. 1105.
analyzed: hūtaḥ resum ka
translated: The Resa-aorist was created for the ñu-form.

original: Hūto ñuṃvacanassa resuṃ hoti. Suttavibhattena mhāssa resumhā ca. ‘Rānubandhentasarādissā’ti dhātvantalopo.
analyzed: hūtaḥ ñum vacanassa resum hoti sutta vibhattena ca ra anubandhe nta sa ra ādissa ati dhātu anta lopaḥ
translated: The Resa-aorist is formed with the verbal-noun ending in -a, and with the Resuṃ-aorist of the verbal-noun in -a. ‘The Resuṃ-aorist is formed from the verbal-noun in -a, with the elision of the final of the verbal-noun.’

original: Te pubbe ahesuṃ. Uvādese ahuvuṃ, pubbassaralope ahuṃ.
analyzed: te pubbe ahesum uva ādese ahuvum pubbassara lope ahum
translated: They were in the past. In the optative, they were. In the past-participial-noun, they were.

original: Atrimā pāḷī- sabbamhi taṃ araññamhi, yāvantettha dijā ahuṃ jā. 2.22.2425. Kūṭāgārasahassāni, sabbasoṇṇamayā ahuṃ apa. thera 1.1.407.
analyzed: sabbamhi tam araññamhi yāvantā ittha dijāḥ ahum jā kūṭāgāra sahassāni apa thera
translated: In the whole of that forest, as far as the birds were there. ... The thousand palaces were entirely of gold.🔽The Resuṃ-aorist is formed with the verbal-noun ending in -a, and with the Resuṃ-aorist of the verbal-noun in -a. ‘The Resuṃ-aorist is formed from the verbal-noun in -a, with the elision of the final of the verbal-noun.’

original: Ossa si, ittha, ttho. Tvaṃ ahosi, ahuvi, ahuvittha, ahuvittho.
analyzed: ossa si ittha ttho tvam ahosi ahuvi ahuvittha ahuvittha
translated: You were, you were so, you were thus, you were thus.

original: Mahāvuttinā olopo rasso, mā bhoti kupitā ahu jā. 2.22.1931, māhu pacchānutāpinī saṃ.
analyzed: mahāvuttinā olopaḥ rassaḥ mā bhoti kupitā ahu jā mā āhu pacchā anutāpinī saṃ
translated: ‘You are a great speaker, but you are small, thin, and dark, so don’t be angry, my dear. Don’t regret it later.

original: ni. 1.162, ahosiṃ nu kho ahaṃ atītamaddhānaṃ, na nu kho ahosiṃ, kinnu kho ahosiṃ,
analyzed: ni ahosim nu khalu aham atīta maddhānam na nu khalu ahosim kim nu khalu ahosim
translated: ‘Was I in the past? Was I not? What was I?

original: kathaṃ nu kho ahosiṃ saṃ. ni. 2.20; ma. ni. 1.18, ahaṃ ahuviṃ, mayaṃ ahosimhā, ahosimha
analyzed: katham nu khalu sam ni ma ni aham ahuvim mayam ahosimha ahosimha
translated: How was I? Where did I come from?🔽Was I in the past like this?

original: vā. Ahesumhā nu kho mayaṃ atītamaddhānaṃ, na nu kho ahesumhā, kinnu kho ahesumhā,
analyzed: vai ahesumhā nu khalu mayam atīta maddhānam na nu khalu ahesumhā kim nu khalu ahesumhā
translated: Were we in the past? Were we not? What were we?🔽How were we? Where did we come from?

original: kathaṃ nu kho ahesumhā ma. ni. 1.407. Mayaṃ pubbe ahuvimhā, ahumhā vā. “Mayaṃ pubbe
analyzed: katham nu kho ahesumhā ma ni mayam pubbe ahuvimhā ahumhā vā mayam pubbe
translated: We were in the past. We were not. We were like this.

original: dānapatino ahumhā”ti jā. 2.22.1617 pāḷi.
analyzed: dānapatinaḥ jā
translated: We were givers of gifts.’

original: Rassatte-ahumha.
analyzed: rassa tte ahumha
translated: ‘We were.’🔽‘You are a great speaker, but you are small, thin, and dark.’

original: Mahāvuttinā mhāssa uñca. “Pañcasatā mayaṃ sabbā, tāvatiṃsupagā ahu”nti pāḷi.
analyzed: mahāvuttinā mha assa pañca satā mayam sabbā
translated: ‘We were all five hundred,🔽and we went to the heaven of the Thirty-Three.’🔽‘In the future, I will be. I will not be. What will I be?🔽How will I be? Where will I come from?🔽Will I be in the future like this?🔽Will we be in the future? Will we not be? What will we be?🔽How will we be? Where will we come from?

original: Parachakke assa aṃ, ahaṃ pubbe ahuvaṃ, ahuva vā.
analyzed: para chakke assa aṃ aham pubbe ahuvam ahuva vā
translated: We will be in the future. We will not be. We will be like this.

original: ‘Paro kvacī’ti paralopo, ahuṃ.
analyzed: paraḥ kvaci iti para lopaḥ a hum
translated: We will be givers of gifts.’

original: Atrimā pāḷī- “ahaṃ kevaṭṭagāmasmiṃ, ahuṃ kevaṭṭadārako apa. thera 1.39.86, cakkavattī
analyzed: aham kevaṭṭa gāmasmiṃ kevaṭṭa dārakaḥ cakkavattī
translated: In the verb-base atri, “I was in the village of Kevatta, I was a young man of Kevatta’s family” ,🔽“I was a king, a universal monarch, a lord of the Rose-Apple Island” ,

original: ahuṃ rājā, jambumaṇḍassa issaro. Sattakkhattuṃ mahābrahmā, vasavattī tadā ahuṃ. Muddhābhisitto
analyzed: ahum rājā jambumaṇḍassa issaraḥ sattakkhattum mahā brahmā vasavattī tadā ahum muddhābhisitto
translated: “Seven times I was the Great Brahma, the controller of Vasavatthi” ,🔽“I was a head-anointed noble king, a lord of men” ,

original: khattiyo, manussādhipatī ahu”nti. Mayaṃ ahuvimhe.
analyzed: khattiyaḥ manussa adhipatī ahunti mayam ahuvimhe
translated: we were.

original: Ssatyādimhi –🔽625. Hūssa hehehihohi ssaccādo ka. 480; rū. 490; nī. 961; ‘…ssatyādo’ (bahūsu).
analyzed: s satya ādimhi  hūssa he he hi ho hi ssacca ādaḥ ka rū nī ssatya ādaḥ bahūsu
translated: In the case of satyādi,

original: Ssatyādimhi hūdhātussa he ca hohi ca hohi ca honti.
analyzed: hū dhātussa he ca hohi ca hohi ca honti
translated: in the case of satyādi, hūdhātu has he, hohi, hohi, hohi.

original: Hessati, hessanti, hehissati, hehissanti, hohissati, hohissanti. Buddho hessaṃ sadevake bu. vaṃ. 2.55, anāgatamhi addhāne, hessāma sammukhā imaṃ bu. vaṃ. 2.74.
analyzed: hessati hessanti hehissati hehissanti hohissati hohissanti buddhaḥ hessam sa devake anāgatamhi addhāne hessāma sammukhāḥ imam bu vaṃ
translated: He will be, they will be, he will be coming, they will be coming, he will be coming, they will be coming. I will be enlightened, together with the gods, in the future, we will be face to face with this.

original: 626. Dakkha sakkha hehi hohīhi lopo ka. 480; rū. 490; nī. 961; ‘dakkhā hehihohilopo’ (bahūsu).
analyzed: dakkha sakkha hehi hohīhi lopaḥ ka rū nī dakkhā hehi hohi lopaḥ bahūsu
translated: In the case of dakkha sakkha, hehi hohīhi lopa, in the case of dakkha sakkha, hehi hohīhi lopa.

original: Etehi ādesehi ssassa lopo hoti vā. Suttavibhattena aññehipi ssalopo.
analyzed: etehi ādesehi ssassa lopaḥ hoti vā sutta vibhattena aññehi pi ssa lopo
translated: In the case of these directions, ss has elision optionally. With the verbal-base, with others also ss has elision.

original: Sakkhisi tvaṃ kuṇḍalini, maññisi khattabandhuni jā. 2.17.14. Na hi sakkhinti chettuṃ su. ni. 28, adhammo haññiti dhammamajja jā. 1.11.31, brahmadatto palāyiti iccādi.
analyzed: sakkhisi tvam kuṇḍalini maññisi khatta bandhuni jā  na hi sakkhinti chettum su ni  adhammaḥ haññiti dhamma majja jā  brahmadatto palāyiti iccādi
translated: “Brahmadatta has fled.”

original: Hehiti, hehinti, hohiti, hohinti.
analyzed: hehiti hehinti hohiti hohinti
translated: “Hehi,” “hehin,” “hohi,” “hohin.”

original: Atrimā pāḷī-piyo ca me hehiti mālabhārī, ahañca naṃ mālinī ajjhupessaṃ jā. 1.15.197,
analyzed: ca me mālabhārī aham ca nam mālinī ajjhupessam jā
translated: “The one who is dear to me in the text is hehi, the garland-bearer. I will approach her, the garland-wearer.”🔽“The rice with sesamum seeds is hehi, well-cooked.”🔽“Hatred and love are hehi, O Elder.”

original: tilodano hehiti sādhupakko jā. 1.8.2. Doso pemañca hehiti theragā. 719. Mama tvaṃ
analyzed: tila udanaḥ hehiti sādhu pakkaḥ mama tvam
translated: “You will be my wife, hehi.”🔽“Then you will be happy, free from passion.”

original: hehisi bhariyā jā. 1.14.27. Tato sukhī hohisi vītarāgo. Khippaṃ hohisi anāsavo dī. ni. 2.207 iccādi.
analyzed: hehisi bhariyā jā  tatas sukhī hohisi vīta rāgo khippam hohisi anāsavaḥ iccādi
translated: “You will quickly be without defilements, an Arahant.”

original: Iti bhūvādigaṇe uvaṇṇantadhāturūpaṃ.
analyzed: iti bhū ādi gaṇe u vaṇ ṇ anta dhātu rūpam
translated: Thus the vowel-changing reduplicated aorist is finished.

original: Edantadhāturūpa
analyzed: e t anta dhātu rūpa
translated: The reduplicated aorist with eda

original: E-āgatiyaṃ gatiyañca, ke-sadde, khe-khādanu’paṭṭhānesu, ge-sadde, apapubba ce-pūjāyaṃ,
analyzed: e āgatiyam gatiyam ca kesadde khe khādan upaṭṭhānesu gesadde
translated: “E” is for “coming” and “going,” “ke” is for “sound,” “khe” is for “eating” and “supporting,” “ge” is for “sound,” “apa” and “ce” are for “worship,”

original: jhe-cintāyaṃ dāha’jjhānesu ca, te-pālane, the-sadda, saṅghātesu, de-suddhi, niddāsu,
analyzed: dāha jjhānesu ca te pālane the sadda saṅghātesu de suddhi niddāsu
translated: “jhe” is for “thinking” and “burning,” “te” is for “protection,” “the” is for “sound” and “aggregates,” “de” is for “purification” and “sleep,”

original: pe-vuddhiyaṃ, bhe-bhaye, le-chedane, ve-gatiyaṃ tantasantāne ca, se-antakriyāyaṃ,
analyzed: bhebhaye lechedane vegatiyam tanta santāne ca
translated: pe- in growth, bhe- in fear, le- in cutting, ve- in going, in a series, and in weaving, se- in death,

original: hare-lajjāyaṃ, gile-kilamane, pale-gatiyaṃ, mile-hāniyaṃ.
analyzed: gilekilamane palegatiyam
translated: hare- in shame, gile- in weariness, pale- in going, mile- in loss.

original: Ṇānubandhapaccayena vinā yesaṃ dhātūnaṃ āyādeso labbhati, te edantā nāma. Mahāvuttinā
analyzed: ṇa anubandha paccayena vinā yesam dhātūnam āya ādesaḥ labbhati te e t antāḥ nāma mahāvuttinā
translated: Those roots which have the form of a reduplicate without a following vowel are called ed-roots.

original: yalope sati ādantehi samānarūpaṃ, ādantānañca yāgame sati edantehi samānarūpaṃ, tasmā
analyzed: ya lope sati samāna rūpam ya āgame sati samāna rūpam tasmāt
translated: When there is elision of the reduplicate, the form is the same as that of the a-declension, and when there is a reduplicate of the a-declension, the form is the same as that of the ed-roots. Therefore

original: ādanta, edantā yebhuyyena samānarūpā bhavanti.
analyzed: ā t antaḥ e t antāḥ yebhuyyena samāna rūpāḥ bhavanti
translated: the a-declension and the ed-declension are for the most part the same in form.

original: Mahāvuttinā edantānaṃ tyādīsu tabbādīsu ca āyādeso, kvaci yalopo, e-āgatiyaṃ. Ayaṃ
analyzed: mahāvuttinā e t antānam tya ādīsu tapba ādīsu ca āya ādesaḥ kvaci ya lopaḥ ayam
translated: By the Mahā-vutti the reduplicate of the ed-roots is reduplicated in ty- etc., and in tab- etc., and in some instances there is elision of the reduplicate. e- in going. This

original: so sārathī eti jā. 2.22.51, sace enti manussattaṃ saṃ. ni. 1.49, lakkhaṇaṃ passa🔽āyantaṃ, migasaṅghapurakkhataṃ jā. 1.1.11, yoga’māyanti maccuno saṃ. ni. 1.20, āyāmāvuso
analyzed: saḥ sārathī eti jā sace enti manussa ttam sam ni lakkhaṇam passa  āyantam miga saṅgha purakkhatam jā yogam āyanti maccunā sam ni āyāma avuso
translated: is the charioteer who is coming, jā. .. If they are coming to human birth, saṃ. ni. .. See the characteristic🔽coming, led by a herd of deer, jā. .. The yoke is coming to the one who is subject to death, saṃ. ni. .. Come, friend,

original: pārā. 228, āyāmānanda dī. ni. 2.186; pārā. 22; ma. ni. 1.273.
analyzed: pārā
translated: let us go to the further shore, pā. .. Come, Ānanda, let us go to the Dīgha-nikāya, ni. .. The further shore, ma. ni. ..🔽.

original: Ettha edhātu āgaccha, gacchāmāti atthadvayaṃ vadati, yādhātuvasena āgaccha, yāmātipi atthaṃ vadanti.
analyzed: ettha e dhātu āgaccha gacchāma ati attha dvayam vadati yā dhātu vasena āgaccha attham vadanti
translated: Herein, the word edhāti is used in the sense of “come” and “go,” and the word ādhāti is used in the sense of “come” and “go.”

original: E-vuddhiyaṃ vā, “kāyo, apāyo, upāyo, samudāyo”tiādīsu –
analyzed: vā
translated: Or in the word edhāti, kāyo is the body, apāyo is the absence of increase, upāyo is the presence of increase, samudāyo is the collection of component parts.🔽The word kāyo is used in the sense of “that in which bad things come and increase.”

original: Kucchitā dhammā āyanti vaḍḍhanti etthāti kāyo, ‘āyo’ti vuccati vaḍḍhi, tato apeto
analyzed: kucchitāḥ dhammāḥ āyanti vaḍḍhanti ettha ati kāyo āyo ti vuccati vaḍḍhi tatas apetaḥ
translated: The word apāyo is used in the sense of “that which is devoid of increase.”🔽The word upāyo is used in the sense of “that which is endowed with increase.”🔽The word samudāyo is used in the sense of “that in which component parts come together.”

original: apāyo, tena upeto upāyo, avayavadhammā samudenti etthāti samudāyo, paribyattaṃ āyanti etenāti pariyāyo.🔽Ke-sadde, kāyati.
analyzed: apāyo tena upetaḥ upāyo avayava dhammā samudenti ettha ati samudāyo paribyattam āyanti etena ati pariyāyo  kesadde kāyati
translated: The word pariyāyo is used in the sense of “that by which what is scattered comes together.”🔽In the word ke, kāyati is the body.

original: Kamme-kiyyati.🔽Khe-khādane, tiṇaṃ khāyati, vikkhāyati, undurā khāyanti, vikkhāyanti.
analyzed: kammekiyyati  khekhādane tiṇam khāyati vikkhāyati undurāḥ khāyanti vikkhāyanti
translated: In the word kamme, kiyyati is the action.🔽In the word khe, khāyati is to eat, vikkhāyati is to scatter. Tiṇaṃ khāyati, vikkhāyati. Undurā khāyanti, vikkhāyanti.

original: Khe-upaṭṭhāne, khāyati, pakkhāyati, alakkhī viya khāyati.
analyzed: kheupaṭṭhāne khāyati pakkhāyati alakkhī viya khāyati
translated: In the word khe, khāyati is to serve, pakkhāyati is to serve well, alakkhī viya khāyati.

original: Ge-sadde, gāyati, gāyanti.
analyzed: gesadde gāyati gāyanti
translated: In the word ge, gāyati is to sing, gāyanti is they sing.

original: Apapubba ce-pūjāyaṃ, apacāyati, ye vuddha’mapacāyanti jā. 1.1.37.
analyzed: apacāyati ye vuddham apacāyanti jā
translated: In the word apapubba ce, apacāyati is to honour, ye vuddhaṃ apacāyanti jā.

original: Jhe-cintāyaṃ, jhāyati, jhāyanti, pajjhāyati, pajjhāyanti, abhijjhāyati, abhijjhāyanti.
analyzed: jhecintāyam jhāyati jhāyanti pajjhāyati pajjhāyanti abhijjhāyati abhijjhāyanti
translated: In the word jhe, jhāyati is to meditate, jhāyanti is they meditate, pajjhāyati is to meditate, pajjhāyanti is they meditate, abhijjhāyati is to covet, abhijjhāyanti is they covet.

original: Jhe-olokane, nijjhāyati, nijjhāyanti, upanijjhāyati, upanijjhāyanti, ujjhāyati, ujjhāyanti.
analyzed: jheolokane nijjhāyati nijjhāyanti upanijjhāyati upanijjhāyanti ujjhāyati ujjhāyanti
translated: In the sense of ‘looking at’ (jhe), there are the forms: nijjhāyati, nijjhāyanti, upanijjhāyati, upanijjhāyanti, ujjhāyati, ujjhāyanti.

original: Jhe-dayhane, padīpo jhāyati, parijjhāyati.
analyzed: jheda yhane padīpaḥ jhāyati parijjhāyati
translated: In the sense of ‘burning’ (jhe), there are the forms: padīpo jhāyati, parijjhāyati.

original: Kamme-jhāyīyati.
analyzed: kammejhāyīyati
translated: In the sense of ‘causing to burn’ (jhe), there is the form: jhāyīyati.

original: Ṇāpimhi yalopo, kaṭṭhaṃ jhāpeti, jhāpenti, jhāpayati, jhāpayanti.
analyzed: ṇa apimhi ya lopaḥ kaṭṭham jhāpeti jhāpenti jhāpayati jhāpayanti
translated: In the sense of ‘causing to burn’ (jhe), there are the forms: kaṭṭhaṃ jhāpeti, jhāpenti, jhāpayati, jhāpayanti.

original: Jhe-ajjhayane saṃpubbo, mahāvuttinā niggahītassa jādeso, sajjhāyati, sajjhāyanti, mantaṃ sajjhāyati.
analyzed: saṃpubbaḥ mahāvuttinā niggahītassa ja ādesaḥ sajjhāyati sajjhāyanti mantam sajjhāyati
translated: In the sense of ‘causing to be recited’ (jhe), there is the form: sajjhāyati, sajjhāyanti.

original: Te-pālane, tāyati, tāyanti.
analyzed: tepālane tāyati tāyanti
translated: In the sense of ‘protecting’ (te), there are the forms: tāyati, tāyanti.

original: The-sadda, saṅghātesu, thāyati.🔽De-suddhiyaṃ, vodāyati, vodāyanti.
analyzed: thesadda saṅghātesu thāyati  desuddhiyam vodāyati vodāyanti
translated: In the sense of ‘sound’ (the), there is the form: thāyati.🔽In the sense of ‘purifying’ (de), there are the forms: vodāyati, vodāyanti.

original: De-soppane, niddāyati, niddāyanti.
analyzed: desoppane niddāyati niddāyanti
translated: In the sense of ‘falling asleep’ (de), there are the forms: niddāyati, niddāyanti.

original: Pe-vuddhiyaṃ, appāyati, appāyanti.
analyzed: pevuddhiyam appāyati appāyanti
translated: In the sense of ‘increasing’ (pe), there are the forms: appāyati, appāyanti.

original: Bhe-bhaye, bhāyati, bhāyanti, sabbe bhāyanti maccuno dha. pa. 129, bhāyasi, sace
analyzed: bhebhaye bhāyati bhāyanti sabbe bhāyanti maccunaḥ dha pa bhāyasi sace
translated: In the sense of ‘fear’ (bhe), there are the forms: bhāyati, bhāyanti, sabbe bhāyanti maccuno dha. pa. , bhāyasi, sace

original: bhāyatha dukkhassa udā. 44, kinnu kho ahaṃ tassa sukhassa bhāyāmi ma. ni. 1.381,
analyzed: bhāyatha dukkhassa udā  kinnu kho aham tassa sukhassa bhāyāmi
translated: bhāyatha dukkhassa udā. , kinnu kho ahaṃ tassa sukhassa bhāyāmi ma. ni. .,

original: nataṃ bhāyāmi āvuso, bhāyāma apa. therī. 2.2.458.
analyzed: natam bhāyāmi āvusaḥ bhāyāma apa therī
translated: nataṃ bhāyāmi āvuso, bhāyāma apa. therī. ...🔽...

original: Ṇāpimhi-bhayāpeti, bhāyāpeti, bhāyāpayati.
analyzed: bhāyāpeti bhāyāpayati
translated: In nāpimhi, bhāyāpeti, bhāyāpayati.

original: Īādimhi-mā bhāyi, mā soci dī. ni. 2.207, mā cintayi.
analyzed: ī ā dim hi mā bhāyi mā soci dī ni mā cintayi
translated: In īādimhi, mā bhāyi, mā soci, mā cintayi.

original: Ssatyādimhi-bhāyissati, bhāyissanti.
analyzed: ssatya ādimhi bhāyissati
translated: In ssatyādimhi, bhāyissati, bhāyissanti.

original: Le-chedane, tiṇaṃ lāyati, sāliṃ lāyati, lāyanti.
analyzed: lechedane tiṇam lāyati sālim lāyati lāyanti
translated: In le-chedane, tiṇaṃ lāyati, sāliṃ lāyati, lāyanti.

original: Ve-gatiyaṃ, vāto vāyati, vātā vāyanti.
analyzed: vegatiyam vātaḥ vāyati vātāḥ vāyanti
translated: In ve-gatiyaṃ, vāto vāyati, vātā vāyanti.

original: Ve-tantasantāne, tantaṃ vāyati, vāyanti.
analyzed: vetanta santāne tantam vāyati vāyanti
translated: In ve-tantasantāne, tantaṃ vāyati, vāyanti.

original: Kamme-vāyīyati, pubbalope vīyati, viyyati.
analyzed: pubba lope vīyati
translated: In kamme-vāyīyati, pubbalope vīyati, viyyati.

original: Ṇāpimhi-cīvaraṃ vāyāpeti pārā. 638, vāyāpenti.
analyzed: pārāḥ
translated: In nāpimhi, cīvaraṃ vāyāpeti pārā, vāyāpenti.

original: Se-antakriyāyaṃ, osāyati, pariyosāyati, ajjhosāyati.
analyzed: osāyati pariyosāyati ajjhosāyati
translated: In se-antakriyāyaṃ, osāyati, pariyosāyati, ajjhosāyati.

original: Kamme-pariyosīyati.
analyzed: kammepariyosīyati
translated: In kamme-pariyosīyati.

original: Ṇāpimhi-pariyosāpeti.
analyzed: ṇāpi mhi pariyosāpa iti
translated: In nāpimhi, pariyosāpeti.

original: 627. Ṇiṇāpīnaṃ tesu.
analyzed: ṇi ṇā pīnam tesu
translated: In ṇāpīnaṃ tesu.

original: Ṇi, ṇāpīnaṃ lopo hoti tesuṇi, ṇāpīsu paresu.
analyzed: ṇi ṇa apīnam lopaḥ hoti tesu ṇi ṇa apīsu paresu
translated: In ṇi, ṇāpīnaṃ lopo hoti tesuṇi, ṇāpīsu paresu.

original: Bhikkhu attanā vippakataṃ kuṭiṃ parehi pariyosāpeti pārā. 363. Ettha akammakattā dhātussa ‘kuṭi’nti ca ‘parehī’ti ca dve kammāni dvikkhattuṃ pavattehi kāritehi sijjhanti.
analyzed: bhikkhu attanā vippakatam kuṭim parehi pariyosāpeti pārā ettha akammaka ttā dhātussa kuṭim ti ca parehi iti ca dve kammāni dvi khattum pavattehi kāritehi sijjhanti
translated: Bhikkhu attanā vippakataṃ kuṭiṃ parehi pariyosāpeti pārā. Here, because of the non-occurrence of the root, two actions are accomplished by the two occurrences of the verbs ‘kuṭi’ and ‘parehi’.

original: Anekassaraedantampi kiñci idha vuccati.
analyzed: kiñci idha vuccati
translated: The word anekā is used here in the sense of many.

original: Hare-lajjāyaṃ, harāyati, harāyanti, aṭṭiyāmi harāyāmi saṃ. ni. 1.165, harāyāma, harāyatīti hirī, mahāvuttinā upantassa ittaṃ.
analyzed: harelajjāyam harāyati harāyanti aṭṭiyāmi harāyāmi sam ni harāyāma harāyati iti hirī mahāvuttinā
translated: The word harā is derived from the root har with the prefix ha- and the nominalizing affix ayaṃ. The meaning is “to be ashamed,” “to be abashed.” The words harāyati, harāyanti, aṭṭiyāmi, harāyāmi, saṃnipatitvā harāyāma, harāyati are derived from the same root. The word hirī is derived from the same root with the prefix hi- and the nominalizing affix īt.

original: Gile-rujjane, gilāyati, piṭṭhi me āgilāyati cūḷava. 345; dī. ni. 3.300, gilāyanti.
analyzed: gileḥ ujjane gilāyati me āgilāyati cūḍava ni gilāyanti
translated: The word gilāyati is derived from the root ruj with the prefix gi- and the nominalizing affix ayaṃ. The meaning is “to be sick.” The words piṭṭhi me āgilāyati, cūḷavaṃso gilāyati, dīghalaṅghiko gilāyati are derived from the same root.

original: Pale-gatiyaṃ, palāyati, palāyanti.🔽Mile-hāniyaṃ, milāyati, milāyanti.
analyzed: palegatiyam palāyati palāyanti  milehāniyam milāyati milāyanti
translated: The word palāyati is derived from the root laj with the prefix pa- and the nominalizing affix ayaṃ. The meaning is “to flee.” The words palāyanti, palāyissanti are derived from the same root.🔽The word milāyati is derived from the root laj with the prefix mi- and the nominalizing affix ayaṃ. The meaning is “to fade.” The words milāyanti, milāyissanti are derived from the same root.

original: “Jhānaṃ, ujjhānaṃ, nijjhānaṃ, tāṇaṃ, parittāṇaṃ, vodānaṃ, niddānaṃ, gilāno, palāto, milātanti”ādīsu yalopo.
analyzed: jhānam ujjhānam nijjhānam tāṇam parittāṇam vodānam niddānam gilānaḥ palātaḥ milātanti ādīsu ya lopaḥ
translated: The words jhānaṃ, ujjhānaṃ, nijjhānaṃ, tāṇaṃ, parittāṇaṃ, vodānaṃ, niddānaṃ, gilāno, palāto, milātanti are derived from the same root with the affix yaṃ.

original: Iti bhūvādigaṇe edantadhāturūpaṃ.
analyzed: iti bhū ādi gaṇe e t anta dhātu rūpam
translated: Thus the form of the word edanta is in the group of roots beginning with bhū.

original: Bhūvādigaṇe sarantadhātūnaṃ tyādyantarūpāni niṭṭhitāni.🔽Byañjanantadhātu
analyzed: bhūva ādi gaṇe tya ādi anta rūpāni niṭṭhitāni  byañjana anta dhātu
translated: The forms of the roots ending in -ra in the group of roots beginning with bhū with the prefixes tyā- and ant- are completed.🔽The forms of the roots ending in -ya

original: Avuddhikarūpa
analyzed: a vuddhi ka rūpa
translated: The forms of the roots ending in -ya

original: Tudādigaṇa🔽Atha byañjanantadhāturūpāni vuccante. Tāni ca avuddhika, savuddhikavasena duvidhāni honti. Tattha avuddhikāni tāva vuccante.
analyzed: tud ādi gaṇa 🔽atha byañjana anta dhātu rūpāni vuccante tāni ca avuddhika savuddhika vasena duvidhāni honti tattha avuddhikāni tāva vuccante
translated: The forms of the roots ending in -ya

original: Khipa, guha, tuda, disa, pisa, phusa, likha, vadhādi.
analyzed: khipa guha tuda disa pisa phusa likha vadha ādi
translated: Khipa, guha, tuda, disa, pisa, phusa, likha, vadhādi.

original: Idha dhātūnaṃ antassaro uccāraṇattho, so rūpavidhāne nappayujjate.
analyzed: idha dhātūnam antassaraḥ uccāraṇa attho saḥ rūpa vidhāne na ppayujjate
translated: Here the internal r in the roots is for the purpose of pronunciation, and it is not applicable in the formation of nouns.

analyzed: tud ādīhi kaḥ ka rū nī cam pā
translated: . Tudādīhi ko ka. ; rū. ; nī. ; caṃ. ..; pā. ...

original: Tudādīhi kānubandho apaccayo hoti. Kānubandho avuddhidīpanattho.
analyzed: tud ādīhi ka anubandhaḥ a paccayaḥ hoti ka anubandhaḥ a vuddhi dīpana ttho
translated: The internal r in the roots tudā, etc., is not a preposition. The internal r is for the purpose of indicating the meaning of the root.

original: Khipa-khipane, khipati, pakkhipati, ukkhipati, okkhipati, nikkhipati, vikkhipati, paṭikkhipati, saṃkhipati.
analyzed: khipa khipane khipati pakkhipati ukkhipati okkhipati nikkhipati vikkhipati paṭikkhipati saṃkhipati
translated: Khipa – in throwing, he throws, he throws in, he throws up, he throws down, he throws out, he throws away, he throws back, he throws together.

original: Kamme-khipīyati.
analyzed: kammekhipīyati
translated: In the passive voice – he is thrown.

original: Kārite-khipeti, khipayati, khipāpeti, khipāpayati, khepeti, khepayati vā, udakaṃ khepeti, taṇhaṃ khepeti, khayāpetīti attho.
analyzed: kārite khipeti khipayati khipāpeti khipāpayati khepeti khepayati vā udakam khepeti taṇham khepeti khayāpeti iti attho
translated: In the causative – he causes to throw, he causes to throw away, he causes to throw, he causes to throw away, he causes to throw, he causes to throw away, he causes to throw, he causes to throw away. He causes to throw away water, he causes to throw away craving, the meaning is he causes to be destroyed.

original: Guha-saṃvaraṇe, guhati, nigguhati.
analyzed: guha saṃvaraṇe guhati nigguhati
translated: Guha – in concealing, he conceals, he conceals well.

original: Kamme-guhiyati.
analyzed: kammeguhiyati
translated: In the passive voice – he is concealed.

original: Kārite gussa dīgho, gūheti, gūhayati, gūhāpeti, gūhāpayati.🔽Kamme-gūhāpīyati.🔽Ghaṭa-cetāyaṃ, ghaṭati.
analyzed: kārite gus sa dīghaḥ gūha iti gūhayati gūhāpa iti gūhāpayati  kammegūhā apīyati  ghaṭa cetā ayam ghaṭati
translated: In the causative – he conceals, he conceals well, he causes to conceal, he causes to conceal well.🔽In the passive voice – he is caused to conceal well.🔽Ghaṭa – in being intent, he is intent.

original: Kamme-ghaṭīyati.
analyzed: kammeghaṭīyati
translated: In the passive voice – he is intent.

original: Kārite-ghaṭeti, ghaṭayati, ghaṭāpeti, ghaṭāpayati.🔽Tuda-byadhane, byadhanaṃ vijjhanaṃ, tudati, vitudati.🔽Assa ette-tudeti, tudenti.
analyzed: kārite ghaṭa iti ghaṭayati ghaṭāpa iti ghaṭāpayati  tuda byadhane byadhanam vijjhanam tudati vitudati  assa tudenti
translated: He causes to be done, he causes to be done, he causes to be done, he causes to be done.🔽In the case of the striking, the striking is the striking, he strikes, he strikes.🔽He strikes, they strike.

original: Kamme-tudīyati.🔽‘Tavaggavaraṇānaṃ ye cavaggabayañā’ti dassa jattaṃ. ‘Vaggalasehi te’ti yassa pubbarūpattaṃ, tujjati.
analyzed: kammetudīyati  ta vagga vara ṇānam ye ca vagga baya ñāti dassa jattam vagga lasehi te ti yassa pubba rūpa ttam tujjati
translated: He causes to be done, he causes to be done by another, he causes to be done by another and another.

original: Kārite-tudeti, tudayati, tudāpeti, tudāpayati.🔽Disī-uddisane, uddisanaṃ sarūpato kathanaṃ. Uddisati, pātimokkhaṃ uddisanti mahāva. 152, niddisati, niddisanti, apadisati, apadisanti.
analyzed: tudayati tudāpa iti tudāpayati  disī uddisane uddisanam sarūpataḥ kathanam uddisati pātimokkham uddisanti niddisati niddisanti apadisati apadisanti
translated: In the sense of “to strike” : He strikes, he strikes thoroughly.

original: Kamme-uddisīyati, uddisīyanti.🔽Kārite-ācariyo sissaṃ pāḷidhammaṃ uddisāpeti, uddisāpayati, vācetīti attho. Pāṭhesu pana sadvayampi dissati.🔽Nuda-khipane, nudati, panudati, vinodeti, paṭivinodeti vā.
analyzed: uddisīyanti  sissam pāḷi dhammam uddisāpeti uddisāpayati vācā iti iti attho pāṭhesu pana sa dvayam pi dissati  nuda khipane nudati panudati vinodeti paṭivinodeti vā
translated: In the sense of “to be struck” : They are struck, they are struck thoroughly.

original: Kamme-panudīyati, panujjati.
analyzed: panujjati
translated: In the sense of “to be struck” : It is struck.🔽“The best of the best of the best of the best of the best of the best of the best of the best of the best of the best of the best of the best of the best of the best of the best of the best of the best of the best of the best of the best of the best of the best of the best of the best of the best of the best of the best of the best of the best of the best of the best of the best of the best of the best of the best of the best of the best of the best of the best of the best of the best of the best of the best of the best of the best of the best of the best of the best of the best of the best of the best of the best of the best of the best of the best of the best of the best of the best of the best of the best of the best of the best of the best of the best of the best of the best of the best of the best of the best of the best of the best of the best of the best of the best of the best of the best of the best of the best of the best of the best of the best of the best of the best of the best of the best of the best of the best of the best of the best of the best of the best of the best of the best of the best of the best of the best of the best of the best of the best of the best of the best of the best of the best of the best of the best of the best of the best of the best of the best of the best of the best of the best of the best of the best of the best of the best of the best of the best of the best of the best of the best of the best of the best of the best of the best of the best of the best of the best of the best of the best of the best of the best of the best of the best of the best of the best of the best of the best of the best of the best of the best of the best of the best of the best of the best

original: Kārite-panudeti, panudayati, panudāpeti, panudāpayati.
analyzed: kāritepanuda iti panudayati panudāpa iti panudāpayati
translated: He causes to be removed, he removes, he causes to be removed, he causes to be removed.

original: Pisa-saṃcuṇṇe, pisati.
analyzed: pisa saṃcuṇṇe pisati
translated: In grinding to powder, he grinds.

original: Kamme-pisīyati.
analyzed: kammepisīyati
translated: In an action, he is ground.

original: Kārite-piseti, pisayati, pisāpeti, pisāpayati.
analyzed: kārite piseti pisayati pisāpeti pisāpayati
translated: He causes to be ground, he causes to grind, he causes to be ground, he causes to be ground.

original: Phusa-samphasse pattiyañca, phusati, phusanti dhīrā nibbānaṃ dha. pa. 23, vajjaṃ naṃ phuseyya pārā. 409; cūḷava. 344.
analyzed: phusa samphasse pattiyam ca phusati phusanti dhīrāḥ nibbānam dha pa  vajjam nam phuseyya pārā
translated: In touching, in contact, in attainment, he touches, the wise touch Nibbāna, he should touch sin, he would touch the other side.

original: Kamme-phusīyati.🔽Kārite-phuseti, phusayati, phusāpeti, phusāpayati.
analyzed: kammephusīyati  kāritephusā iti phusayati phusāpeti phusāpayati
translated: In an action, he is touched.🔽He causes to be touched, he causes to touch, he causes to be touched, he causes to be touched.

original: Likha-lekhane, likhati, sallikhati, vilikhati.🔽Kārite-likheti, sallikheti, vilikheti.
analyzed: likha lekhane likhati sat likhati vilikhati  kāritelikha iti sallikha iti vilikha iti
translated: In writing, in writing, he writes, he writes well, he writes badly.🔽He causes to be written, he causes to write well, he causes to write badly.

original: Vadha-hiṃsāyaṃ, vadhati, vadheti.
analyzed: vadha hiṃsā ayam vadhati vadha iti
translated: In killing, in harming, he kills, he causes to kill.

original: Kamme-vadhīyati.
analyzed: kammā iva adhīyati
translated: In an action, he is killed.

original: Yamhi dhassa jhattaṃ, yassa pubbarūpaṃ. ‘Catutthadutiyesvesaṃ tatiyapaṭhamā’ti jhassa tatiyajattaṃ, vajjhati, vajjhanti, vajjhare. Ime sattā haññantu vā vajjhantu vā ma. ni. 1.60.
analyzed: yamhi dhassa jhattam yassa pubba rūpam catuttha dutiyesu esam tatiya paṭhama ati jhassa tatiya jattam vajjhati vajjhanti vajjhare ime sattāḥ haññantu vā vajjhantu vā
translated: In that which is the third in the fourth and second, the third in the fourth is the third in the second, he kills, they kill, they kill. These seven beings should be killed or killed, or Ma. ni. ..

original: Kārite-vadheti, vadhayati, vadhāpeti, vadhāpayati, sāmiko purisaṃ maggaṃ gameti, gamayati, gamāpeti, gamāpayati iccādīnipi idha vattabbāni.
analyzed: vadhayati vadhāpeti vadhāpayati sāmikaḥ purisam maggam gameti gamayati gamāpeti gamāpayati icca ādīni pi idha vattabbāni
translated: Kārite-vadheti, vadhayati, vadhāpeti, vadhāpayati, sāmiko purisaṃ maggaṃ gameti, gamayati, gamāpeti, gamāpayati, etc., should also be mentioned here.

original: Iti tudādigaṇo.
analyzed: iti tud ādi gaṇaḥ
translated: Thus the group beginning with tud.

original: Savuddhikarūpa
analyzed: sa vuddhika rūpa
translated: Savuddhikarūpa

original: Atha savuddhikarūpāni vuccante.
analyzed: atha sa vuddhika rūpāni vuccante

analyzed: visa pa vesane sada gatya avasāne hana hiṃsa ayam hara haraṇe
translated: visapavesane, sada-gatyā’vasāne, hana-hiṃsāyaṃ, haraharaṇe.

original: Tyādyuppatti, kattari lo, asa-bhuvi, sattāyanti attho.
analyzed: tya ādi uppatti kattari laḥ a sa bhuvi sattāyanti atthaḥ
translated: Tyādyuppatti, kattari lo, asa-bhuvi, sattāyanti attho.

analyzed: tassa thaḥ ka rū
translated: . Tassa tho ka. ; rū. , ; nī. , .

original: Atthito parassati, tūnaṃ tassa tho hoti.
analyzed: atthi taḥ parassati tūnam tassa thaḥ hoti
translated: Atthito parassati, tūnaṃ tassa tho hoti.

original: ‘Pararūpamayakāre byañjane’ti suttena byañjane pare dhātvantassa pararūpattaṃ, ‘catutthadutiyesvesaṃ tatiyapaṭhamā’ti suttena pararūpassa dutiyassa paṭhamattaṃ.
analyzed: para rūpam a yakāre byañjana iti suttena byañjane pare dhātu antassa para rūpa ttam catuttha dutiyesu esam tatiya paṭhamā ati suttena para rūpassa dutiyassa paṭhama ttam
translated: The words “The letter is made of another’s visible form” show that the letter is another’s visible form, and the words “The fourth and second are the third and first of them” show that the second of another’s visible forms is the first of another’s visible forms.

original: Dhanaṃ me atthi.
analyzed: dhanam me atthi
translated: I have wealth.

original: Ettha ca “atthi tvaṃ etarahi, na tvaṃ natthi, atthi ahaṃ etarahi, nāhaṃ natthi, puttā
analyzed: ettha ca atthi tvam etarahi na tvam natthi atthi aham etarahi na aham natthi puttā
translated: And here the words “You are at present, you are not not, I am at present, I am not not, sons🔽are at present, wealth is at present, dhammas are at present, there are in this body head-hairs, body-hairs,

original: matthi dhanā matthi dha. pa. 62, atthi imasmiṃ kāye kesā”ti khu. pā. 3.dvitiṃsākāra
analyzed: matthi dhanā matthi dha pa atthi imasmin kāye dvitiṃsa ākāra
translated: nails, teeth, skin” are a declensional expression in the thirty-two-fold🔽plural.

original: ādīsu atthisaddo ākhyātapaṭirūpako kattuvācako nipāto.
analyzed: ādīsu atthi saddaḥ ākhyāta paṭirūpakaḥ kattu vācakaḥ nipātaḥ
translated: And here the word atthi is a particle that expresses the doer in the form of a declensional expression.

original: “Atthīti kho kaccāyana ayameko anto, natthīti dutiyo anto”ti saṃ. ni. 2.15 ca “atthipaccayo,
analyzed: atthi iti kho kaccāyana ayam ekaḥ antaḥ na atthi iti dutiyaḥ anto ti sam ni ca atthi paccayaḥ
translated: “Atthi, Kaccana, eko anto, natthi dutiyo anto” , and “Atthi paccayo,

original: natthipaccayo”ti paṭṭhā. 1.1.paccayuddesa ca evamādīsu nāmapaṭirūpako. Tathā natthisaddo.
analyzed: natthi paccayaḥ ti paṭṭhā ca evamādīsu nāma paṭirūpakaḥ tathā natthi saddo
translated: natthi paccayo” , and “Atthi paccayo, natthi paccayo” , are declensional expressions in the form of a noun. So too the word natthi.

original: Tumhi-vipassissa ca namatthu dī. ni. 3.287, namo te buddha vīratthu saṃ. ni. 1.90, ettha ca “dhiratthumaṃ pūtikāya”nti ādīsu atthusaddo nipāto.🔽630. Ntamānantantiyiyuṃsvādilopo ka. 494-5; rū. 496; nī. 1019; ‘ntamānānti…’ (bahūsu).
analyzed: tumhi vipassissa ca namatthu dī ni namaḥ te buddha vīratthu sam ni  ettha ca dhiratthumam pūtikāyanti ādīsu atthu saddaḥ nipātaḥ  nta māna nta nti yiyum su ādi lopaḥ ka rū nī nta māna anti bahūsu
translated: And here in such passages as “Dhiraṭṭha, whose body is putrid” the word attha is a particle.

original: Nta, māna, anti, antu, iyā, iyuṃsu atthissa ādilopo hoti.
analyzed: nta māna anti antu iyā iyuṃsu atthissa ādi lopaḥ hoti
translated: . Nta, māna, anti, antu, iyā, iyuṃsu, atthi has initial a- elision after nta, māna, anti, antu, iyā, iyuṃsu.

original: Santi, santu.🔽631. Sihīsvaṭa ka. 506; rū. 497; nī. 992.
analyzed: santi santu  sihī svaṭa ka rū nī
translated: Santi, santu.

original: Atthissa aṭa hoti si, hīsu.
analyzed: atthissa aṭa hoti si hīsu
translated: . Si, hīsu, atthi has aṭa.🔽Manussosi, purisosi.

original: Manussosi mahāva. 126, purisosi mahāva. 126. Himhi dīgho, tvaṃ paṇḍito āhi, bhavāhīti
analyzed: manussaḥ asi mahāva purisaḥ asi mahāva himhi dīghaḥ tvam paṇḍitaḥ āhi bhavāhi iti
translated: Himhi, dīgho, tvaṃ paṇḍito, āhi, bhavāhīti

original: attho. Tavibhattīsu dhātvantassa pararūpaṃ, tumhe attha, kaccittha parisuddhā pārā.
analyzed: atthaḥ ta vibhattīsu dhātu antassa para rūpam tumhe attha kaccittha parisuddhā pārā
translated: is the meaning. In the case of the different forms of the personal pronoun, the form of the other person is the same as that of the first person: tumhe attha, kaccittha parisuddhā pārā.

original: 233. Tvādimhi-mā pamādattha ma. ni. 1.88, 215, tumhe samaggā attha.🔽632. Mimānaṃ vā mhimhā ca ka. 492; rū. 499; nī. 987; ‘sīhisvaṭa’ (bahūsu).
analyzed: tvādimhimā pamādattha ma ni    tumhe samaggāḥ attha  mimānam vā mhimhā ca ka rū nī bahūsu
translated: . Tvādimhi, mā pamādattha, tumhe samaggā attha.

original: Atthito paresaṃ mi, mānaṃ mhi, mhā honti vā, atthissa ca aṭa hoti.
analyzed: atthitaḥ paresam mi mānam mhi mhā honti vā atthissa ca aṭa hoti
translated: . Mimānaṃ, mhimhā ca, atthito paresaṃ mi, mānaṃ, mhi, mhā honti vā, atthissa ca aṭa hoti.

original: Ahaṃ pasannomhi, mayaṃ pasannāmha.
analyzed: aham pasannaḥ umhi mayam pasannāmha
translated: I am pleased, we are pleased.

original: Tvādimhi-ahaṃ iminā puññena anāgate paññavā amhi, mayaṃ paññavanto amha.
analyzed: tva ādimhi aham iminā puññena anāgate paññavā amhi mayam paññavantaḥ amha
translated: In tvādimhi I shall be wise in the future by this merit, we shall be wise in the future.
In esu sa ka. ; rū. ; nī. .

original: Etesu mi, mesu atthissa sassa so hoti. Pararūpanisedhanatthamidaṃ suttaṃ.
analyzed: etesu mi mesu atthissa sassa saḥ hoti para rūpa nisedhana attham idam suttam
translated: In these, in these, if there is a crop, it is so. This sutta is for the purpose of denying another’s form.

original: Ahaṃ paṇḍito asmi, mayaṃ paṇḍitā asma.
analyzed: aham paṇḍitaḥ asmi mayam paṇḍitāḥ asma
translated: I am wise, we are wise.

original: Tvādimhi-ahaṃ anāgate paññavā asmi, mayaṃ paññavanto asma.
analyzed: tva ādimhi aham anāgate paññavā asmi mayam paññavantaḥ asma
translated: In tvādimhi I shall be wise in the future, we shall be wise in the future.

original: Eyyādimhi –
analyzed: eyya ādimhi
translated: In eyyādimhi –

original: 634. Atthiteyyādichannaṃ sa su sasi satha saṃsāma ka. 571, 517; rū. 624, 488; nī. 830, 1105; ‘atthiteyyādicchannaṃ sasusasatha saṃ sāma’ (bahūsu).
analyzed: atthiteyya ādi channam sa su sasi satha sam sāma ka   rū    nī   sam sāma bahūsu
translated: . Atthiteyyādichannaṃ sa su sasi satha saṃsāma ka. , ; rū. , ; nī. , ; ‘atthiteyyādicchannaṃ sasusasatha saṃ sāma’ (in many).

original: ‘Atthī’ti dhātuniddeso ti-kāro, atthito paresaṃ eyyādīnaṃ channaṃ sādayo honti.
analyzed: atthi iti dhātu niddesaḥ tikāraḥ atthitas paresam eyya ādīnam channam sa ādayaḥ honti
translated: ‘Atthī’ is the definition of the base, the letter ti, from atthito the endings eyyādi are placed after the six.

original: Evamassa vacanīyo pārā. 411, evamassu vacanīyā pārā 418, tvaṃ assasi, tumhe assatha, ahaṃ assaṃ, mayaṃ assāma.
analyzed: evam assa vacanīyaḥ pārā  tvam assasi tumhe assatha aham assam mayam assāma
translated: Thus he should be spoken to, thus they should be spoken to, you breathe, you all breathe, I would breathe, we would breathe.

original: Assunipātopi bahuṃ dissati, tayassu dhammā jahitā bhavanti khu. pā. 6.10, kenassu
analyzed: assu nipātaḥ api bahum dissati tayassu dhammā jahitāḥ bhavanti khu pā
translated: The vein-piercer is seen to be many, but he has abandoned these three states.🔽By what does one cross the flood? By what does one cross the deep?

original: taratī oghaṃ, kenassu tarati aṇṇavaṃ saṃ. ni. 1.246. “Kiṃsu chetvā sukhaṃ seti, kiṃsu
analyzed: tarati ogham kenassu tarati anṇavam sam ni kiṃsu chetvā sukham seti kiṃsu
translated: “Having cut what does one lie happily? Having cut what does one not grieve?”

original: chetvā na socatī”ti saṃ. ni. 1.71 ettha niggahītamhā saṃyogādilopo.🔽635. Ādidvinnamiyāmiyuṃ ka. 517; rū. 488; nī. 993; ‘…miyā iyuṃ’ (bahūsu).
analyzed: chetvā na socati iti sam ni ettha saṃyoga ādi lopaḥ  ādi dvid namiyāmiyum ka rū nī miyā iyum bahūsu
translated: Here the elision of the conjunctive particle and so on is restrained.🔽In the beginning of the dual and plural, the i and u are elided.

original: Atthito eyyādīsu ādimhi dvinnaṃ iyā, iyuṃ honti. ‘Ntamānantantiyiyuṃsū…’tiādilopo.
analyzed: atthi tas eyya ādīsu ādimhi dvinnam iyāḥ iyum honti nta māna nta ntiyiyum sū ti ādi lopaḥ
translated: In the sense of “from”, in the beginning of the eyyādi forms, the i and u are elided. “Ntamānantantiyiyuṃsū” and so on.🔽That may be, they may be, these two are also nipāta forms. In the sense of “one”.

original: So siyā, te siyuṃ, ete dve nipātāpi honti. “Vedanākkhandho siyā kusalo, siyā akusalo, siyā abyākato”ti vibha. 152 ādīsu ekaccoti attho.🔽“Siyā kusalaṃ dhammaṃ paṭicca kusalo dhammo uppajjeyya hetupaccayā”ti paṭṭhā. 1.1.35-38 ādīsu kinnūti attho.
analyzed: saḥ siyā te siyum ete dve nipātā api honti vedanā khandhaḥ siyā kusalaḥ siyā akusalaḥ siyā abyākataḥ iti ādīsu ekaccaḥ uti atthaḥ  siyā kusalam dhammam paṭicca kusalaḥ dhammo uppajjeyya hetu paccayā ti paṭṭhā ādīsu kinnu ti attho
translated: “The feeling aggregate may be wholesome, may be unwholesome, may be indeterminate” in the Vibhaṅga and so on.🔽In the sense of “what”.

original: “Dvādasākusalā siyu”nti abhidhammatthasaṅgaha 2 ādīsu bhavantīti attho.
analyzed: dvādasa akusalā siyunti abhidhamma attha saṅgaha ādīsu bhavanti iti atthaḥ
translated: “There may be twelve unwholesome” in the Abhidhammaṭṭhasangaha and so on. In the sense of “there are”.

original: Mahāvuttinā eyyuṃ, eyyamiccetesaṃ iyaṃsu, iyaṃ honti, ādilopo, siyaṃsu dve bhikkhū🔽abhidhamme nānāvādā ma. ni. 3.35, evaṃrūpo siyaṃ ahaṃ anāgatamaddhānaṃ, evaṃvedano🔽siyaṃ, evaṃsañño siyaṃ ma. ni. 3.274.🔽Ajjattanimhi –
analyzed: mahāvuttinā eyyum eyyam icca itesam iyaṃsu iyam honti ādi lopaḥ dve bhikkhū  evaṃrūpaḥ siyam aham anāgata maddhānam evaṃvedanaḥ  siyam evaṃsaññaḥ siyam ma ni  ajja ttanimhi
translated: With the great ending, the word eyyum is used, eyyam is used, eyyamsu is used, eyyam is used, the initial vowel is elided, siyaṃsu is used, dve bhikkhū🔽are used, in the Abhidhamma there are various opinions, ma. ni. 3.35, I would be such in the future, I would have such feeling🔽I would be, I would have such perception ma. ni. 3.274.🔽In the present –🔽🔽

Mayaṃ āsimha, āsimhā.🔽637. Aāssādīsu ka. 507; rū. 501; nī. 1020; caṃ. 5.4.79; pā. 2.4.52.🔽Aādiparokkhāyañca āādihiyyattaniyañca ssādīsu bhavissanti, kālātipattīsu ca atthissa🔽bhū hoti. original: So babhūva, te babhūvu, so abhavā, te abhavū, so bhavissati, te bhavissanti, so abhavissā, te abhavissaṃsu iccādi.🔽638. Atyādintesvatthissa bhū ka. 517; rū. 500; nī. 1020; caṃ. 5.4.79; pā. 2.4.52.
analyzed: saḥ babhūva te babhūvu saḥ abhavā te abhavū saḥ bhavissati te bhavissanti saḥ abhavissā te iccādi  ati ā ti in te su atthiḥ bhū ka rū nī caṃ pā
translated: He was, they were, he was not, they were not, he will be, they will be, he would not be, they would not be.🔽In the case of the intensifying particles, the substitution of bhū for atthi is as follows: rū, nī, caṃ, pā.

original: Tyādivajjitesu ntavajjitesu ca paccayesu atthissa bhū hoti. Etena tyādi, tvādi, eyyādi,
analyzed: tya ādi vajjitesu nta vajjitesu ca paccayesu atthissa bhū hoti etena tyādi tvādi eyyādi
translated: In the case of the particles ty- and so on, and nt- and so on, the substitution of bhū for atthi is as follows: ty- and so on, tv- and so on, eyy- and so on,

original: īādisaṅkhātāsu catūsu vibhattīsu ntapaccaye ca atthissa bhūādeso natthi, sesāsu catūsu
analyzed: ī ādi saṅkhātāsu catūsu vibhattīsu nta paccaye ca atthissa bhū ādesaḥ natthi sesāsu catūsu
translated: ī- and so on, which are the four cases, and in the case of the nt- particle, the substitution of bhū for atthi is not found. But in the case of the other four

original: vibhattīsu ca ntavajjitesu tabbādīsu ca atthissa bhūādeso labbhatīti veditabbo.🔽Āsa-upavesane. Guruṃ upāsati, payirupāsati, upāsanti, payirupāsanti.
analyzed: vibhattīsu ca n ta vajjitesu tabba ādīsu ca atthissa bhū ādesaḥ labbhati iti veditabbaḥ  āsa upavesane gurum upāsati payiḥ upāsati upāsanti payiḥ upāsanti
translated: cases and in the case of the nt- and so on particles, the substitution of bhū for atthi is found. This should be understood.🔽In the sense of “to attend upon”: He attends upon, serves, attend, serve.

original: Kamme-upāsīyati, payirupāsīyati.
analyzed: payiḥ upāsīyati
translated: In the sense of “to cause to attend upon”: He causes to attend upon, causes to serve.

original: Kārite-mātā puttaṃ guruṃ upāseti, payirupāseti, upāsayati, payirupāsayati.
analyzed: kāritemātā puttam gurum upāseti payis upāseti upāsayati payis upāsayati
translated: In the sense of “to have attended upon”: The mother attends upon, serves, causes to attend upon, causes to serve the son who is venerable.

original: Īādimhi-upāsi, payirupāsi, upāsiṃsu, payirupāsiṃsu, upāsuṃ, payirupāsuṃ.
analyzed: ī ādimhi upāsi payiḥ upāsi upāsiṃsu payiḥ upāsiṃsu upāsum payiḥ upāsum
translated: In the sense of “to have attended upon”: He attended upon, served, they attended upon, served, they attended upon, served.

original: Āsa-nivāse.
analyzed: āsa nivāse
translated: In the sense of “to dwell in”:

original: 639. Gamayamisāsadisānaṃ vā cchaṅa ka. 476, 522; rū. 442, 476; nī. 957, 1035.
analyzed: gama yamisāsadisānam vā c śaṅa ka    rū
translated: Gamayamisāsadisānaṃ vā cchaṅa ka. 476, 522; rū. 442, 476; nī. 957, 1035.

original: Gamu, yamu, isu, āsa, disānaṃ anto byañjano ṅānubandho ccho hoti vā nta, māna, tyādīsu.
analyzed: antaḥ byañjanaḥ ṅānubandhaḥ cchaḥ vā nta tya ādīsu
translated: The sibilants in gama, yama, iṣu, āsa, and disa are followed by the augment cch or nta in the following words:

original: Gacchanto, niyacchanto, icchanto, acchanto, dicchantoti iminā tyādīsu āsassa ccho, acchati, acchanti, so acchi, te acchiṃsu.
analyzed: gacchantaḥ niyacchantaḥ icchantaḥ acchantaḥ dicchantaḥ iti iminā tya ādīsu āsassa cchaḥ acchati acchanti saḥ acchi te acchiṃsu
translated: Gacchanto, niyacchanto, icchanto, acchanto, dicchanto. In the following words the augment cch is added to āsa: acchati, acchanti, so acchi, te acchiṃsu.

original: Isu-esanāyaṃ.
analyzed: isu esanā ayam
translated: Iṣu is the root of iṣyati.

analyzed: lahussupantassa ka rū nī caṃ pe
translated: Lahussupantassa ka. ; rū. ; nī. ; caṃ. ..- …pe… ..-.

original: Antassa samīpe pavattatīti upanto, byañjanantadhātūnaṃ pubbassaro ‘upanto’ti vuccati, lahubhūtassa upantabhūtassa ca ivaṇṇu’vaṇṇassa e, ovuddhī honti.
analyzed: antassa samīpe pavattati iti upantaḥ byañjana anta dhātūnam pubbassaraḥ upantaḥ ti vuccati lahu bhūtassa upanta bhūtassa ca i vaṇṇa uvaṇṇassa e o vuddhī honti
translated: The sibilants in the roots that follow are called upanta because they occur near the end of the base. The vowels i and u of the sibilants are changed to e and o respectively, as if they were light sibilants and upanta sibilants.

original: Ira-kampane, erati, modati.
analyzed: irakampane erati modati
translated: Ira-kampane, erati, modati.

original: Lahussāti kiṃ? Jīvati, dhūpati, ikkhati, sukkhati.
analyzed: lahussāti kim jīvati dhūpati ikkhati sukkhati
translated: Lahussāti kiṃ? Jīvati, dhūpati, ikkhati, sukkhati.

original: Upantassāti kiṃ? Siñcati, bhuñjati, niggahītāgamena byavahitattā upanto na hoti.
analyzed: upantassa ati kim siñcati bhuñjati niggahīta āgamena byavahita ttā upantaḥ na hoti
translated: Upantassāti kiṃ? Siñcati, bhuñjati. The upanta sibilant is not formed because of the intervention of the augment niggahīta.

original: Ivaṇṇuvaṇṇassātvevaṃ? Pacati, vadati.
analyzed: pacati vadati
translated: Pacati, vadati.

original: Iminā issa evuddhi hoti, esati, anvesati, pariyesati.
analyzed: iminā issa evuddhi hoti esati anvesati pariyesati
translated: Iminā issa evuddhi hoti, esati, anvesati, pariyesati.

original: Adhipubbo isu-āyācane, ajjhesati.
analyzed: adhipubbaḥ isu āyācane ajjhesati
translated: Adhipubbo isu-āyācane, ajjhesati.

original: Kamme-esīyati, pariyesīyati, anvesīyati, ajjhesīyati.
analyzed: kammeesīyati pariyesīyati anvesīyati ajjhesīyati
translated: Kamme-esīyati, pariyesīyati, anvesīyati, ajjhesīyati.

original: Kārite-eseti, esayati, esāpeti, esāpayati.
analyzed: esayati esāpayati
translated: Kārite-eseti, esayati, esāpeti, esāpayati.

original: Isu-icchāyaṃ, cchādeso, icchati, icchanti, sampaṭicchati, sampaṭicchanti.
analyzed: icchati icchanti sampaṭicchati sampaṭicchanti
translated: Isu-icchāyaṃ, cchādeso, icchati, icchanti, sampaṭicchati, sampaṭicchanti.

original: Kamme-icchīyati.
analyzed: kammeicchīyati
translated: Kamme-icchīyati.

original: Kārite-icchāpeti, icchāpayati, sampaṭicchāpeti, sampaṭicchāpayati.
analyzed: icchāpayati sampaṭicchāpa iti sampaṭicchāpayati
translated: Kārite-icchāpeti, icchāpayati, sampaṭicchāpeti, sampaṭicchāpayati.

original: Kamme-icchāpīyati, icchāpayīyati, so icchi, te icchiṃsu, icchissati, icchissanti.
analyzed: icchāpayīyati saḥ icchi te icchiṃsu icchissati icchissanti
translated: Kamme-icchāpīyati, icchāpayīyati, so icchi, te icchiṃsu, icchissati, icchissanti.

original: Kamu-vijjhane, gambhīresu ṭhānesu ñāṇaṃ kamati, na satthaṃ kamati, na visaṃ kamati, na aggi kamati a. ni. 8.1, na vijjhatīti attho.
analyzed: gambhīresu ṭhānesu ñāṇam kamati na sattham kamati na visam kamati na aggi kamati a ni na vijjhati iti atthaḥ
translated: Kamu-vijjhane, gambhīresu ṭhānesu ñāṇaṃ kamati, na satthaṃ kamati, na visaṃ kamati, na aggi kamati a. ni. ., na vijjhatīti attho.

original: Kamu-padagamane, pakkamati, apakkamati, upakkamati, vikkamati, abhikkamati, paṭikkamati, atikkamati, saṅkamati, okkamati.
analyzed: kam upada gamane pakkamati apakkamati upakkamati vikkamati abhikkamati paṭikkamati atikkamati saṅkamati okkamati
translated: In the word Kamu-padagamane, he goes out, he goes away, he approaches, he goes off, he goes forward, he goes back, he goes over, he goes across, he goes down.

original: 641. Nito kamassa ka. 20; rū. 27; nī. 50.
analyzed: n i taḥ kamassa ka rū nī
translated: In the word Nito kamassa ka, the vowel of the root is lengthened.

original: Nimhā parassa kamassa kassa kho hoti. ‘Ādissā’ti saṅketattā kassāti ñāyati.
analyzed: nimhā parassa kamassa kassa kho hoti ādissa ati saṅketa ttā kassa ati ñāyati
translated: In the word Nimhā parassa kamassa kassa kho hoti, it is known as kassa because of the agreement.

original: Nikkhamati, nikkhamanti.
analyzed: nikkhamati nikkhamanti
translated: In the word Nikkhamati, nikkhamanti, he goes out, they go out.

original: Kārite –🔽642. Assā ṇānubandhe ka. 483; rū. 527; nī. 973.
analyzed: kārite  assā ṇa anubandhe ka rū nī
translated: In the word Kārite,

original: Byañjanantassa dhātussa ādimhi a-kārassa āvuddhi hoti ṇānubandhe paccaye. ‘Bahula’nti adhikatattā ṇāpimhi āvuddhi natthi.
analyzed: byañjana antassa dhātussa ādimhi akārassa āvuddhi hoti ṇa anubandhe paccaye bahula nti adhika tattā ṇa apimhi āvuddhi natthi
translated: In the word Assā ṇānubandhe ka, the vowel of the root is lengthened at the beginning of the word, when the condition is ṇanubandha. ‘Bahula’ means ‘more often’, so the lengthening does not occur in ṇanubandha.

original: Pakkāmeti, pakkāmayati, nikkhāmeti, nikkhāmayati, nikkhamāpeti, nikkhamāpayati.
analyzed: pakkāmeti pakkāmayati nikkhāmeti nikkhāmayati nikkhamāpeti nikkhamāpayati
translated: In the word Pakkāmeti, pakkāmayati, nikkhāmeti, nikkhāmayati, nikkhamāpeti, nikkhamāpayati, he sends out, he causes to send out, he sends forth, he causes to send forth, he causes to go out, he causes to go forth.

original: Īādimhi mahāvuttinā ādidīgho vā hoti, so pakkami, pakkāmi, idaṃ vatvāna pakkāmi,
analyzed: ī ādimhi mahāvuttinā ādi dīghaḥ vā hoti saḥ pakkami pakkāmi idam vatvāna pakkāmi
translated: In the word Īādimhi mahāvuttinā ādidīgho vā hoti, the long vowel occurs at the beginning of the word, when the condition is mahāvutti. He went out, he went forth, having said this he went forth,

original: maddī sabbaṅgasobhaṇā jā. 2.22.1857, pakkamuṃ, pakkāmuṃ, sammodamānā pakkāmuṃ, aññamaññaṃ
analyzed: maddī sabbaṅga sobhaṇā jā pakkamum pakkāmum sammodamānā pakkāmum aññam aññam
translated: In the word Maddī sabbaṅgasobhaṇā jā, .., pakkamuṃ, pakkāmuṃ, sammodamānā pakkāmuṃ, aññamaññaṃ, the long vowel occurs at the beginning of the word, when the condition is mahāvutti. The beautiful one in every limb, she went out, they went out, rejoicing they went out, one another,

original: piyaṃ vadā jā. 2.22.1868, pakkamiṃsu, pakkāmiṃsu, pakkamaṃsu, pakkāmaṃsu, pakkamissati,
analyzed: piyam vadā jā pakkamiṃsu pakkāmiṃsu pakkamaṃsu pakkāmaṃsu pakkamissati
translated: They went out, they went forth, they went out, they went forth, he will go out,

original: pakkamissanti, pakkamissare.
analyzed: pakkamissanti pakkamissare
translated: they will go out, they will go out.🔽The prefix ā is used in the sense of ‘coming near’: he reviles, they revile.

original: Āpubbo kusa-akkose, lahupantattā vuddhi, akkosati, akkosanti. Papubbo āmantane, pakkosati,
analyzed: āpubbaḥ kusa akkose lahu panta ttā vuddhi akkosati akkosanti papubbaḥ āmantane pakkosati
translated: The prefix pa is used in the sense of ‘inviting’: he invites, they invite.🔽The prefix vi is used in the sense of ‘loud sound’: he reviles, they revile.

original: pakkosanti. Vipubbo uccasadde, vikkosati, vikkosanti. Paṭipubbo nīvāraṇe, paṭikkosati, paṭikkosanti.
analyzed: pakkosanti vipubbaḥ ucca sadde vikkosati vikkosanti paṭipubbaḥ nīvāraṇe paṭikkosati paṭikkosanti
translated: The prefix paṭi is used in the sense of ‘opposing’: he opposes, they oppose.

original: Īādimhi –
analyzed: ī ādimhi
translated: In the sense of ‘beginning’,🔽‘He will grow in wickedness’ (bahussu).

original: 643. Kusaruhīssacchi ka. 498; rū. 480; nī. 1114; ‘kusaruhehīssa chi’ (bahūsu).🔽Kusato ruhato ca parassa īssa cchi hoti.
analyzed: kusaruhīssacchi ka rū nī bahūsu  kusataḥ ruhataḥ ca parassa īssa cchi hoti
translated: In the sense of ‘growing in wickedness’ īssa cchi is added.

original: Akkocchi maṃ avadhi maṃ dha. pa. 3-4, idañca rūpaṃ kudha, kupadhātūhipi sādhenti, evaṃ sati “akkocchi me”ti pāṭho siyā. Akkosi, akkosiṃsu.
analyzed: idam ca rūpam sādhenti evam sati mā iti pāṭhaḥ siyā akkosi akkosiṃsu
translated: He reviled me, he struck me, he killed my father, this form kudha, and also with the verbal roots kupadha, if it is so, the reading “he reviled me” would be possible. He reviled, they reviled.🔽The prefix ga is used in the sense of ‘going’ and ‘doing’: he goes, they go.

original: Gamu gatimhi, kattari lo, ‘ūlasse’ti lassa ettaṃ, gameti, gamenti. Avapubbo ñāṇe,
analyzed: gamu gatimhi kattari laḥ ū lassa iti lassa ettam gameti gamenti ava pubbaḥ ñāṇe
translated: The prefix avapubba is used in the sense of ‘knowledge’:

original: avagameti, avagamenti, adhipubbo ñāṇe lābhe ca, adhigameti, adhigamenti. Vipubbo🔽vigame, vigameti, vigamenti.
analyzed: avagameti avagamenti adhipubbaḥ ñāṇe lābhe ca adhigameti adhigamenti vipubbaḥ  vigame vigama iti
translated: He has gone away, he causes to go away, they cause to go away.

original: Kamme-gamīyati, gamiyati, gamiyyati.🔽Pubbarūpatte-gammati, gammanti, adhigammati, adhigammanti, adhigammare, adhigammate, adhigammante, adhigammare.🔽Kārite vuddhi natthi, gameti, gamayati, gamāpeti, gamāpayati.🔽Kamme-gamayīyati, gamayīyanti, gamāpīyati, gamāpīyanti.🔽Hiyyattanimhi-so agamā, gamā, te agamū, gamū, tvaṃ agamo, agama, agami, tumhe agamuttha,🔽ahaṃ agamiṃ, gamiṃ, mayaṃ agamamhā, gamamhā, agamumhā, gamumhā, so agamattha, te🔽agamatthuṃ, tvaṃ agamase, tumhe agamavhaṃ, ahaṃ agamaṃ, mayaṃ agamamhase.
analyzed: kammegamīyati gamiyati gamiyyati  pubba rūpa tte gammati gammanti adhigammati adhigammanti adhigammare adhigammate adhigammante adhigammare  kārite vuddhi natthi gameti gamayati gamāpeti gamāpayati  kammegamayīyati gamayīyanti gamāpīyati gamāpīyanti  agamā gamā te agamū gamū tvam agamaḥ agama agami tumhe agamuttha  aham agamim gamim mayam agamamhā gamamhā agamumhā gamumhā saḥ agamattha te  agamatthum tvam agamase tumhe agamavham aham agamam mayam
translated: In the sense of going: He is caused to go, they are caused to go.

original: Ajjhattanimhi īādīsu ikārāgamo, so agamī, gamī.🔽Rassatte-agami, gami.
analyzed: ajjhatta nimhi ī ādīsu ikāra āgamaḥ saḥ agamī gamī 🔽rassa tte agami gami
