translated: In the sense of the past tense: He went, they went, he caused to go, they caused to go, having gone, having caused to go, having caused to go, having gone, having caused to go, having caused to go, having gone, having caused to go, having caused to go, having gone, having caused to go, having caused to go, having gone, having caused to go, having caused to go, having gone, having caused to go, having caused to go, having gone, having caused to go, having caused to go, having gone, having caused to go, having caused to go, having gone, having caused to go, having caused to go, having gone, having caused to go, having caused to go, having gone, having caused to go, having caused to go, having gone, having caused to go, having caused to go, having gone, having caused to go, having caused to go, having gone, having caused to go, having caused to go, having gone, having caused to go, having caused to go, having gone, having caused to go, having caused to go, having gone, having caused to go, having caused to go, having gone, having caused to go, having caused to go, having gone, having caused to go, having caused to go, having gone, having caused to go, having caused to go, having gone, having caused to go, having caused to go, having gone, having caused to go, having caused to go, having gone, having caused to go, having caused to go, having gone, having caused to go, having caused to go, having gone, having caused to go, having caused to go, having gone, having caused to go, having caused to go, having gone, having caused to go, having caused to go, having gone, having caused to go, having caused to go, having gone, having caused to go, having caused to go, having gone, having caused to go, having caused to go, having gone, having caused to go, having caused to go, having gone, having caused to go, having caused to go, having gone, having caused to go, having caused to go, having gone, having caused to go

original: Mahāvuttinā ākārena saha sāgamo, so agamāsi, gāmaṃ agamāsi, nagaraṃ agamāsi.
analyzed: mahāvuttinā ākārena saha sa āgamaḥ saḥ agamāsi gāmam agamāsi nagaram agamāsi
translated: With the great ending, together with the prefix, he went to the village, he went to the town.

original: ‘Eyyāthasse’iccādinā īssa ttho, so gāmaṃ agamittho, gamittho, te agamuṃ, gamuṃ.
analyzed: eyyā thassa iit ca ādinā īssa tthaḥ saḥ gāmam agamitthaḥ gamitthaḥ te agamum gamum
translated: With ‘eyyāthassa’ and so on, the ‘ttha’ is ‘ttho’, he went to the village, he went to the village, they went to the village, they went to the village.

original: ‘Uṃssiṃsvaṃsū’ti iṃsu, aṃsu, te agamiṃsu, gamiṃsu, agamaṃsu, gamaṃsu, tvaṃ agamo, gamo.
analyzed: te agamiṃsu gamiṃsu agamaṃsu gamaṃsu tvam agamaḥ gamaḥ
translated: With ‘uṃsiṃsuṃsu’, the ‘su’ is ‘suṃ’, they went to the village, they went to the village, they went to the village, they went to the village, you went to the village, you went to the village.

original: ‘Ossa a i ttha ttho’ ‘sī’ti suttāni, tvaṃ agama, gama, agami, gami, agamittha, gamittha, agamittho, gamittho, agamāsi, gamāsi, tumhe agamittha.
analyzed: suttāni tvam agama gama agami gami agamittha gamittha agamitthaḥ gamitthaḥ agamāsi gamāsi tumhe agamittha
translated: With ‘ossā ai ttha ttho sī’, you went to the village, you went to the village, you went to the village, you went to the village, you went to the village, you went to the village, you went to the village, you went to the village, you went to the village, you went to the village, you went to the village.

original: ‘Mhātthānamuu’iti uttaṃ, tumhe agamuttha, gamuttha, ahaṃ agamiṃ, gamiṃ, agamāsiṃ, gamāsiṃ, mayaṃ agamimhā, gamimhā.
analyzed: tumhe agamuttha gamuttha aham agamāsim gamāsim mayam agamimhā gamimhā
translated: With ‘mhātthānamuu’, the ‘u’ is ‘uttha’, you went to the village, you went to the village, I went to the village, I went to the village, I went to the village, I went to the village, we went to the village, we went to the village.

original: Rassatte-agamimha, gamimha, agamumhā, gamumhā, agamumha, gamumha, agamāsimhā, gamāsimhā, agamāsimha, gamāsimha.
analyzed: rassatte agamimha gamimha agamumhāḥ gamumhāḥ agamumha gamumha agamāsimhāḥ gamāsimhāḥ agamāsimha gamāsimha
translated: With ‘rassatte-agamimha, gamimha, agamumhā, gamumhā, agamumha, gamumha, agamāsimhā, gamāsimhā, agamāsimha, gamāsimha’, we went to the village, we went to the village, we went to the village, we went to the village, we went to the village, we went to the village, we went to the village, we went to the village.

original: Parachakke-so agamā, gamā.
analyzed: agamā gamā
translated: In the other section, he went to the village, he went to the village.

original: Rassatte-agama, gama.
analyzed: rassa ttea gama gama
translated: With ‘rassatte-agama, gama’, you went to the village, you went to the village.

original: ‘Eyyāthasse’iccādinā tthatte-so agamittha, gamittha, te agamū, gamū.
analyzed: agamittha gamittha te agamū gamū
translated: ‘Eyyāthassa’ and so on. In the Perfect, he came, they came, he came, they came.🔽In the Aorist, he came, they came, you came, they came, you all came, they came, I came, we came.

original: Rassatte-agamu, gamu, tvaṃ agamise, gamise, tumhe agamivhaṃ, gamivhaṃ, ahaṃ agama, gama, agamaṃ, gamaṃ vā, agamimhe, gamimhe.
analyzed: rassatte agamu gamu tvam agamise gamise tumhe agamivham gamivham aham agama gama agamam gamam vā agamimhe gamimhe
translated: In the Passive Aorist, he was brought, they were brought, he was brought, they were brought, they were brought, they were brought, they were brought, they were brought, they were brought, they were brought.🔽In the Passive Aorist of the other verb, he was brought, they were brought, he was brought, they were brought.🔽In the Causative, he caused to come, he caused to go, he caused to come, he caused to go, they caused to come, they caused to go, they caused to come, they caused to go.

original: Kamme-agamīyi, agammi, agamīyittho, agammittho, agamīyuṃ, gamīyuṃ, agamīyiṃsu, gamīyiṃsu, agammuṃ, gammuṃ, agammiṃsu, gammiṃsu.🔽Parachakke-agamīyittha, gamīyittha, agammittha, gammittha.
analyzed: kammeagamīyi agammi agamīyitthaḥ agammitthaḥ agamīyum gamīyum agamīyiṃsu gamīyiṃsu agammum gammum agammiṃsu gammiṃsu  parachakke agamīyittha gamīyittha agammittha gammittha
translated: In the Passive Causative, he caused to be brought, he caused to be brought, he caused to be brought, he caused to be brought, they caused to be brought, they caused to be brought, they caused to be brought, they caused to be brought.🔽In the Passive Causative of the other verb, he caused to be brought, they caused to be brought, he caused to be brought, they caused to be brought.🔽In the Future, he will come, they will come, he will come, they will come.🔽In the Future Passive, he will be brought, they will be brought, he will be brought, they will be brought.🔽In the Future Passive of the other verb, he will be brought, they will be brought, he will be brought, they will be brought.

original: Kārite-agamāpayi, gamāpayi, agamāpesi, gamāpesi, agamāpayuṃ, gamāpayuṃ, agamāpayiṃsu, gamāpayiṃsu.🔽644. Gamissa ka. 517; rū. 488; nī. 1105.
analyzed: kārite agamāpayi gamāpayi agamāpesi gamāpesi agamāpayum gamāpayum agamāpayiṃsu gamāpayiṃsu  gamissa ka rū nī
translated: In the Future Passive of the other verb, he will be brought, they will be brought, he will be brought, they will be brought.🔽In the Conditional, if he were to come, if they were to come, if he were to come, if they were to come.

original: Āādimhi īādimhi ca gamissa massa ā hoti. Saralopo.🔽So agā, te agū, tvaṃ ago, tumhe aguttha, ahaṃ agaṃ, mayaṃ agumhā.
analyzed: ā ādimhi ī ādimhi ca gamissa massa ā hoti sara lopaḥ 🔽saḥ agāḥ te agū tvam ago tumhe aguttha aham agam mayam agumhā
translated: In the Conditional Passive, if he were to be brought, if they were to be brought, if he were to be brought, if they were to be brought.🔽In the Conditional Passive of the other verb, if he were to be brought, if they were to be brought, if he were to be brought, if they were to be brought.🔽In the Conditional Passive of the other verb, if he were to be brought, if they were to be brought, if he were to be brought, if they were to be

original: Īādimhi īsaralopo, agā devāna santike jā. 1.14.205, vāyaso anupariyagā su. ni. 449.
analyzed: ī ādimhi ī sara lopaḥ agā devāna santike vāyasaḥ
translated: In the beginning of the word ī, ī is elided, as in īsaralopo, agā devāna santike jā. 1.14.205, vāyaso anupariyagā su. ni. 449.

original: Āpubbo āgamane, anavhito tato āgā jā. 1.5.21, sopā’gā samitiṃ vanaṃ dī. ni. 2.335.
analyzed: āpubbaḥ āgamane tatas āgāḥ jā saḥ upāgāḥ samitim vanam
translated: Āpubbo is used for coming, as in āpubbo āgamane, anavhito tato āgā jā. .., sopā’gā samitiṃ vanaṃ dī. ni. ..

original: Adhipubbo paṭilābhe, ajjhagā amataṃ santiṃ vi. va. 846, taṇhānaṃ khayamajjhagā dha. pa. 154.
analyzed: adhipubbaḥ paṭilābhe ajjhagā amatam santim vi va taṇhānam khayam ajjhagā dha pa
translated: Adhipubbo is used for attaining, as in adhipubbo paṭilābhe, ajjhagā amataṃ santiṃ vi. va. , taṇhānaṃ khayamajjhagā dha. pa. .

original: Atipubbo upādhipubbo ca titikkame, nakkhattaṃ paṭimānentaṃ, attho bālaṃ upajjhagā jā. 1.1.49. Khaṇo ve mā upajjhagā.
analyzed: ati pubbaḥ upādhi pubbaḥ ca titikkame nakkhattam paṭimānentam attho bālam upajjhagā jā khaṇaḥ ve mā upajjhagā
translated: Atipubbo and upādhipubbo are used for enduring, as in nakkhattaṃ paṭimānentaṃ, attho bālaṃ upajjhagā jā. ... Khaṇo ve mā upajjhagā.

original: Etāni o, avacanānaṃ lope sati tumha’mhayogepi labhanti, aguṃ, agiṃsu, agaṃsu. Samantā
analyzed: etāni o a vacanānām lope sati tumha mha yoge pi labhanti agum agiṃsu agaṃsu samantā
translated: These are the forms obtained when there is elision of o, avacana, and tumha, amha, as in aguṃ, agiṃsu, agaṃsu. Samantā

original: vijjutā āguṃ jā. 2.22.2264, tepā’guṃsamitiṃ vanaṃ (gavesitabbaṃ), visesaṃ ajjhagaṃsute
analyzed: vanam gavesitabbam visesam
translated: vijjutā āguṃ jā. .., tepā’guṃsamitiṃ vanaṃ (to be sought), visesaṃ ajjhagaṃsute

original: dī. ni. 2.354, asesaṃ parinibbanti, asesaṃ dukkhamajjhaguṃ itivu. 93, sabbaṃ dukkhaṃ
analyzed: asesam parinibbanti asesam sabbam dukkham
translated: dī. ni. .., asesaṃ parinibbanti, asesaṃ dukkhamajjhaguṃ itivu. , sabbaṃ dukkhaṃ

original: upajjhaguṃ paṭi. ma. 1.236; ma. ni. 3.271. Ajjhago, ajjhaga, ajjhagi, ajjhaguttha,
analyzed: upajjhagum pa ṭi ma ma ni ajjhagaḥ ajjhaga ajjhagi ajjhaguttha
translated: upajjhaguṃ paṭi. ma. .; ma. ni. .. Ajjhago, ajjhaga, ajjhagi, ajjhaguttha,

original: ajjhagiṃ, ajjhagimhā, ajjhagumhā, agā, āgā, anvagā, ajjhagā, upajjhagā, agū, āgū.
analyzed: ajjhagiṃ ajjhagimhā ajjhagumhā agāḥ āgāḥ anvagāḥ ajjhagāḥ upajjhagāḥ agū āgū
translated: ajjhagiṃ, ajjhagimhā, ajjhagumhā, agā, āgā, anvagā, ajjhagā, upajjhagā, agū, āgū.

original: Āgū devā yasassino dī. ni. 2.340, cittassa ekadhammassa, sabbeva vasamanvagū saṃ.
analyzed: āgū devāḥ yasassinaḥ ni cittassa eka dhammassa sabbe iva vasam anvagū sam
translated: Āgū devā yasassino dī. ni. ., cittassa ekadhammassa, sabbeva vasamanvagū saṃ.

original: ni. 1.61. Cetā haniṃsu vedabbaṃ, sabbe te byasanamajjhagū jā. 1.1.48.
analyzed: ni cetā haniṃsu vedabbam sabbe te byasana majjhagū jā
translated: ni. .. Cetā haniṃsu vedabbaṃ, sabbe te byasanamajjhagū jā. ...

original: Parokkhāyaṃ ādissa dvittaṃ, ‘kavaggahānaṃ cavaggajā’ti pubbassa cavaggo. So jagama,
analyzed: parokkhāyam ādissa dvittam kavagga hānam cavagga jāti pubbassa cavaggaḥ saḥ jagama
translated: Parokkhāyaṃ ādissa dvittaṃ, ‘kavaggahānaṃ cavaggajā’ti pubbassa cavaggo. So jagama,

original: mahāvuttinā upantassa dīgho, kvaci assa ittaṃ, “rājā dudīpo jagāmi magga”nti jā.
analyzed: mahāvuttinā upa antassa dīghaḥ kvaci assa ittam rājā dudīpaḥ jagāmi magganti jā
translated: mahāvuttinā upantassa dīgho, kvaci assa ittaṃ, “rājā dudīpo jagāmi magga”nti jā.

original: 2.22.911; ‘rājā dudīpopi jagāma saggaṃ’ pāḷi. So jagāma, te jagāmu, tvaṃ jagame.
analyzed: rājā dudīpaḥ upi jagāma saggam saḥ jagāma te jagāmu tvam jagame
translated: ..; ‘rājā dudīpopi jagāma saggaṃ’ pāḷi. So jagāma, te jagāmu, tvaṃ jagame.

original: Byañjanādimhi ikārāgamo, tumhe jagamittha, ahaṃ jagamaṃ, mayaṃ jagamimha, so jagamittha, te jagamire, tvaṃ jagamittho, tumhe jagamivho, ahaṃ jagamiṃ, mayaṃ jagamimhe.
analyzed: vyañjana ādimhi ikāra āgamaḥ tumhe jagamittha aham jagamam mayam jagamimha saḥ jagamittha te jagamire tvam jagamitthaḥ tumhe jagamivhaḥ aham jagamim mayam jagamimhe
translated: Byañjanādimhi ikārāgamo, tumhe jagamittha, ahaṃ jagamaṃ, mayaṃ jagamimha, so jagamittha, te jagamire, tvaṃ jagamittho, tumhe jagamivho, ahaṃ jagamiṃ, mayaṃ jagamimhe.

original: Ssatyādimhi-gamissati, gamissanti, gamissare.
analyzed: s sati ādim hi gamissati gamissanti gamissare
translated: Ssatyādimhi-gamissati, gamissanti, gamissare.

original: Parachakke-so gamissate, te gamissante, gamissare, tvaṃ gamissase, tumhe gamissavhe, ahaṃ gamissaṃ, mayaṃ gamissāmhe.
analyzed: gamissate te gamissante gamissare tvam gamissase tumhe gamissavhe aham gamissam mayam gamissāmhe
translated: In the other tense he will go, they will go, they will go, you will go, you all will go, I will go, we all will go.

original: Ssādimhi-so agamissā, gamissā.🔽‘Āīūmhāssāssāmhānaṃ vā’ti ssā, ssāmhānaṃ rasso, agamissa, gamissa, te agamissaṃsu, gamissaṃsu, tvaṃ agamisse, gamisse.
analyzed: a gamissā gamissā  vāti ssā ssāmhānam rassaḥ agamissa gamissa te agamissaṃsu gamissaṃsu tvam agamisse gamisse
translated: In the ‘ssādimhi’ (ending) he will not have gone, he will go.🔽‘Ssā, ssāmhānaṃ, vā’ (is said). The ‘ssā’ is lengthened in the ‘ssāmhānaṃ’ (ending). He will not have gone, he will go. They will not have gone, they will go. You will not have gone, you will go.

original: ‘Eyyāthasse’ iccādinā ssessa attaṃ, tvaṃ agamissa, gamissa, tumhe agamissatha, gamissatha, ahaṃ agamissaṃ, gamissaṃ, mayaṃ agamissāmhā, gamissāmhā, agamissāmha, gamissāmha.
analyzed: it ca ādinā ssessa attam tvam agamissa gamissa tumhe agamissatha gamissatha aham agamissam gamissam mayam agamissāmhāḥ gamissāmhāḥ agamissāmha gamissāmha
translated: ‘Eyyāthassa’ (is said). The ‘ssa’ is lengthened in the ‘eyyāthassa’ (ending). You will not have gone, you will go. You all will not have gone, you all will go. I will not have gone, I will go. We all will not have gone, we all will go. We will not have gone, we will go.

original: ‘Gama vada dānaṃ ghammavajjadajjā’ti sabbavibhattīsu gamissa ghammo, ghammati, ghammanti.
analyzed: gama vada dānam ghamma vajja dajja ati sabba vibhattīsu gamissa ghammaḥ ghammati ghammanti
translated: ‘Gama vada dānaṃ ghammavajjadajjā’ (is said). In all the cases the ‘ghamma’ is lengthened. He gives, they give.

original: Kamme-ghammīyati, ghammīyanti.
analyzed: kammeghammīyati ghammīyanti
translated: In the passive voice it is given, they are given.

original: Mahāvuttinā gagghādeso vā, tvaṃ yena yeneva gagghasi, phāsuṃyeva gagghasi a. ni. 8.63.
analyzed: mahāvuttinā gaggha ādesaḥ vā tvam yena yena iva gagghasi phāsuṃyā iva gagghasi
translated: In the Mahā-vutti (grammar) the ‘gh’ is lengthened. You may go wherever you like, you may go comfortably.

original: ‘Gamayamisāsadisānaṃ vācchaṅa’ iti suttena sabbavibhattīsu gamissa massa ccho, gacchati, gacchanti, gacchare.
analyzed: gama ya misā sadisānam vā ā chaṅaḥ iti suttena sabba vibhattīsu gamissa massa cchaḥ gacchati gacchanti gacchare
translated: In the suttas ‘Gamayamisāsadisānaṃ vācchaṅa’ the syllable -ss- of the future is -ss- in all the cases, gacchati, gacchanti, gacchare.

original: Kamme-gacchīyati, gacchīyanti, gacchiyyati, gacchiyyanti, gacchiyyare.
analyzed: gacchīyanti gacchiyyati gacchiyyanti
translated: In the passive: gacchīyati, gacchīyanti, gacchiyyati, gacchiyyanti, gacchiyyare.

original: Kārite-gacchāpeti, gacchāpayati. Gacchatu, gacchantu, gaccheyya, gaccheyyuṃ.
analyzed: kārite gaccha apa iti gaccha āpayati gacchatu gacchantu gaccheyya gaccheyyum
translated: In the causative: gacchāpeti, gacchāpayati. Gacchatu, gacchantu, gaccheyya, gaccheyyuṃ.

original: ‘Eyyuṃssuṃ’iti uṃttaṃ, gacchuṃ.
analyzed: gacchum
translated: ‘Eyyuṃssuṃ’ the uṃ is elided, gacchuṃ.

original: ‘Eyyeyyāseyyaṃnaṃ ṭe’iti suttena eyya, eyyāsi, eyyaṃvibhattīnaṃ ettaṃ, so gacche, tvaṃ gacche, ahaṃ gacche.
analyzed: ṭe iti suttena eyya eyyāsi eyyaṃvibhattīnam ettam saḥ gacche tvam gacche aham gacche
translated: In the suttas ‘Eyyeyyāseyyaṃnaṃ ṭe’ the eyy of the optative is ettaṃ, so gacche, tvaṃ gacche, ahaṃ gacche.

original: ‘Eyyāthasse’ iccādinā eyyāthassa ottaṃ, tumhe gaccheyyātho.
analyzed: eyyāthasse icca ādinā eyyāthassa ottam tumhe gaccheyyātho
translated: ‘Eyyāthasse’ and so on: the eyyāth of the optative is ottaṃ, tumhe gaccheyyātho.

original: Āādimhi-agacchā, gacchā, agaccha, gaccha vā.
analyzed: ā ādimhi agacchā gacchā agaccha gaccha vā
translated: In the āādi and īādi: agacchā, gacchā, agaccha, gaccha.

original: Īādimhi-agacchi, gacchi, agacchuṃ, gacchuṃ, agacchiṃsu, gacchiṃsu.🔽645. Ḍaṃsassa ca ñchaṅa ka. 517; rū. 488; nī. 1105; ‘chaṅa’ (bahūsu).
analyzed: ī ādimhi agacchi gacchi agacchum gacchum agacchiṃsu gacchiṃsu  ḍa ṃsassa ca ñ chaṅa ka rū nī chaṅa bahūsu
translated: In the īādi: agacchi, gacchi, agacchuṃ, gacchuṃ, agacchiṃsu, gacchiṃsu.🔽The ñchaṅa is the vowel i or u of the base, and the vowel a of the verbal noun.

original: Āādīsu īādīsu ca ḍaṃsassa ca anto byañjano ñchaṅa hoti.
analyzed: ā ādīsu ī ādīsu ca ḍaṃsassa ca antaḥ byañjanaḥ ñ chaṅa hoti
translated: In the āādi and īādi the vowel of the base is ñchaṅa.

original: So agañchā, gañchā. Tathā agañchū, gacchū.
analyzed: saḥ agañchā gañchā tathā agañchū gacchū
translated: He went, they went. So he went, so they went.

original: Īādimhi-so agañchi, gañchi.
analyzed: ī ādi mhisaḥ a gañchi gañchi
translated: In the beginning, he went, they went.

original: Tasmiṃ paṭipaviṭṭhamhi, añño āgañchi brāhmaṇo su. ni. 985. Khippameva upāgañchi, yattha sammati temiyo jā. 2.22.73. Te agañchuṃ, gañchuṃ.
analyzed: tasmin paṭipaviṭṭhamhi aññaḥ āgañchi brāhmaṇaḥ su ni khippam eva upāgañchi yattha sammati temiyaḥ jā te agañchum gañchum
translated: When he had entered, another brahmin came. He quickly came to where the one who was going was. They went, they went.

original: Ssatyādimhi-gacchissati, gacchissanti, gacchissare.
analyzed: s satya ādimhi gacchissati gacchissanti gacchissare
translated: In the truth, he will go, they will go, they will go.

original: 646. Labha vasa chida gama bhida rudānaṃ cchaṅa ka. 481; rū. 524; nī. 966, 968.
analyzed: labha vasa chida gama bhida rudānam chaṅa ka rū
translated: In the case of the roots la, va, chida, gama, bhida, rudana, the affix cchaṅa is added. In the case of the roots rū, nī, the affix ka is added.

original: Ssena saha etesaṃ cchaṅa hoti vā ssayuttāsu vibhattīsu, suttavibhattena susassa ca, “nadīva avasucchatī”ti jā. 2.22.2140 pāḷi.🔽Lacchati, labhissati, alacchā, alabhissā, vacchati, vasissati, avacchā, avasissā,🔽checchati, chindissati, acchecchā, acchindissā, bhecchati, bhindissati, abhecchā,
analyzed: ssena saha etesam cchaṅ hoti vā s sa yuttāsu vibhattīsu sutta vibhattena susassa ca nadī iva avasucchati iti jā  lacchati labhissati a lacchā a labhissā vacchati vasissati a vacchā a vasissā  checchati chindissati acchecchā acchindissā bhecchati bhindissati abhecchā
translated: The affix cchaṅa is added to the roots la, va, etc. in the case of the verbal bases connected with them, and to the verbal bases themselves, by the rule It flows like a river (Jataka). This is the text.🔽He will obtain, he will obtain, he did not obtain, he will not obtain; he will live, he will live, he did not live, he will not live;

original: abhindissā, rucchati, rodissati, arucchā, arodissāti.
analyzed: rucchati rodissati arucchā arodissāti
translated: he will cut, he will cut, he did not cut, he will not cut; he will break, he will break, he did not break, he will not break; he will weep, he will weep, he did not weep, he will not weep.

original: Iminā ssayuttāsu dvīsu vibhattīsu ssena saha gamissa massa ccho, gacchati, gacchissati, gacchanti, gacchissanti, ahaṃ gacchaṃ, gacchissaṃ.🔽Atrimā pāḷī-gacchaṃ pāraṃ samuddassa, kassaṃ purisakāriyaṃ jā. 2.22.131, tassāhaṃ
analyzed: iminā ssa yuttāsu dvīsu vibhattīsu ssena saha gamissa massa cchaḥ gacchati gacchissati gacchanti gacchissanti aham gaccham gacchissam  pāḷīgaccham pāram samuddassa kassam purisakāriyam jā tassa aham
translated: In the two conjugations that go with this, the ending -ssā is used with the verb ss, thus: gacchā, gacchissā, gacchāma, gacchissāma, gacchāmi, gacchissāmi.

original: santikaṃ gacchaṃ, so me satthā bhavissati, sabbāni abhisambhossaṃ, gacchaññeva rathesabha
analyzed: santikam gacchan saḥ me satthā bhavissati sabbāni gacchan ñā iva rathesabha
translated: In the following passages the ending -ssā is used: ‘I go to the other side of the ocean’ (Dhp 351); ‘I go to the field of work for men’ (Dhp 351); ‘I go to his presence’ (Dhp 351); ‘He will be my teacher’ (Dhp 351); ‘I shall understand all’ (Dhp 351); ‘Go, O lord of the chariot’ (Dhp 351); ‘Go, O lord of the chariot’ (Dhp 351).

original: jā. 2.22.1832, vedhabyaṃ kaṭukaṃ loke, gacchaññeva rathesabha jā. 2.22.1835.
analyzed: jā vedhabyam kaṭukam loke gacchaññā iva rathesabha jā
translated: In the following passages the ending -ssā is used: ‘The piercing, bitter thing in the world’ (Dhp 351); ‘Go, O lord of the chariot’ (Dhp 351).

original: Ssādimhi-agacchā, agacchissā, agacchaṃsu, agacchissaṃsu.🔽Jara-vayohānimhi –🔽647. Jarasadānamīma vā ka. 505, 609; rū. 482, 484; nī. 1018, 1213.
analyzed: ssa ādimhi agacchāḥ agacchissāḥ agacchaṃsu agacchissaṃsu  jara vayaḥ hānimhi  vā ka rū nī
translated: In the present tense the endings -ssā, -ssāma, -ssāma, -ssāma are used with the verb agacchā, thus: agacchā, agacchissā, agacchāma, agacchissāma.🔽In the sense of ‘old age’ and ‘the passing away of life’ the following endings are used:

original: Jara, sadānaṃ saramhā īmaāgamo hoti vāti īmaāgamo.🔽Jīrati, jīranti.
analyzed: saramhā īmaāgamaḥ hoti vāti  jīrati jīranti
translated: . In the sense of ‘old age’ or ‘the passing away of life’ the ending -īma is used, thus: jīrati, jīranti.

original: Kārite-jīrāpeti, jīrāpayati.🔽648. Jaramarānamiyaṅa ka. 505; rū. 482; nī. 1018; ‘…mīyaṅa’ (bahūsu).
analyzed: jīrāpayati  jara mara ana miyaṅa ka rū nī mīyaṅa bahūsu
translated: In the causative the following endings are used: jīrāpeti, jīrāpayati.🔽. In the sense of ‘old age’ or ‘death’ the ending -īma is used, thus: jīyati, jīyanti.

original: Etesaṃ iyaṅa hoti vā nta, māna, tyādīsu.
analyzed: etesam iyaṅa hoti vā nta māna tya ādīsu
translated: In the following passages the ending -īma is used: ‘…mīma’ (in many places).

original: Jiyati, jiyanti.
analyzed: jiyati jiyanti
translated: In these the ending -īma is used, thus: jīrati, jīranti.

original: Dīghatte-jīyati, jīyanti.
analyzed: jīyanti
translated: In the long (form) it is jīyati, jīyanti.

original: Dvitte-jiyyati, jiyyanti.
analyzed: dvittejiyyati jiyyanti
translated: In the dual it is jiyyati, jiyyanti.

original: Kārite-jiyāpeti, jiyāpayati.
analyzed: jiyāpayati
translated: In the causative it is jiyāpeti, jiyāpayati.

original: Janī-pātubhāve, mahāvuttinā sabbavibhattīsu nassa yādeso ādidīgho ca, jāyati, upajāyati, vijāyati, jāyanti, jāyare, pajāyanti, pajāyare, upajāyanti, upajāyare.
analyzed: janī pātubhāve mahāvuttinā sabba vibhattīsu nassa ya ādesaḥ ādi dīghaḥ ca jāyati upajāyati vijāyati jāyanti jāyare pajāyanti pajāyare upajāyanti upajāyare
translated: In the manifestation of the verb jan ‘to be born’, in all the verbal nouns beginning with mahā, the long ā becomes ya, and the long ā becomes ya, jāyati, upajāyati, vijāyati, jāyanti, jāyare, pajāyanti, pajāyare, upajāyanti, upajāyare.

original: Kārite vuddhi natthi, janeti, janenti, janayati, janayanti.
analyzed: kārite vuddhi natthi janeti janenti janayati janayanti
translated: In the causative there is no increase, janeti, janenti, janayati, janayanti.

original: Kamme-janīyati, janīyanti, jāyatu, jāyantu, jāyeyya, jāyeyyuṃ.
analyzed: janīyanti jāyatu jāyantu jāyeyya jāyeyyum
translated: In the action (form) it is janīyati, janīyanti, jāyatu, jāyantu, jāyeyya, jāyeyyuṃ.

original: Kārite-janeyya, janeyyuṃ, janayeyya, janayeyyuṃ.
analyzed: kāritejaneyya janeyyum janayeyya janayeyyum
translated: In the causative it is janeyya, janeyyuṃ, janayeyya, janayeyyuṃ.

original: Īādimhi-ajāyi, ajāyiṃsu, vijāyi, vijāyiṃsu, ajani, jani vā.
analyzed: ī ādimhi ajāyi ajāyiṃsu vijāyi vijāyiṃsu ajani jani vā
translated: In the aorist it is ajāyi, ajāyiṃsu, vijāyi, vijāyiṃsu, ajani, jani vā.

original: Kārite-ajanesi, janesi, ajanayi, janayi, ajanesuṃ, janesuṃ, ajanayuṃ, janayuṃ, ajanayiṃsu, janayiṃsu.
analyzed: kārite ajanesi janesi ajanayi janayi ajanesum janesum ajanayum janayum ajanayiṃsu janayiṃsu
translated: In the causative it is ajanesi, ajanayi, ajanayuṃ, ajanayiṃsu.

original: Ssatyādimhi-jāyissati, vijāyissati.
analyzed: vijāyissati
translated: In the future it is jāyissati, vijāyissati.

original: Ssādimhi-ajāyissā, jāyissā.
analyzed: ssa ādimhi a jāyissā jāyissā
translated: In the optative it is ajāyissā, jāyissā.

original: Ḍaṃsa-ḍaṃsane, ḍaṃsati, ḍaṃsanti.
analyzed: ḍaṃsa ḍaṃsane ḍaṃsati ḍaṃsanti
translated: In the (verb) ḍaṃsa ‘to be angry’, it is ḍaṃsati, ḍaṃsanti.

original: Kārite-ḍaṃseti, ḍaṃsayati, ḍaṃsāpeti, ḍaṃsāpayati.
analyzed: kāritā iḍaṃsa iti ḍaṃsayati ḍaṃsāpa iti ḍaṃsāpayati
translated: In the causative: he causes to burn, they cause to burn.🔽In the passive: he is caused to burn, they are caused to burn.🔽In the a, i, etc.🔽In the passive: is seen, are seen.🔽In the causative: he causes to see, they cause to see.🔽In the passive: he is caused to see, they are caused to see.🔽In the a, i, etc.🔽In the passive: is heard, are heard.🔽In the causative: he causes to hear, they cause to hear.

original: Ā, īādīsu ‘ḍaṃsassa ca ñchaṅa’ iti suttaṃ, niggahītalopo, aḍañchā, ḍañchā, aḍañchi, ḍañchi.
analyzed: ā ī ādīsu ḍaṃsassa ca ñchaṅaḥ iti suttam niggahīta lopaḥ a ḍañchā ḍañchā a ḍañchi ḍañchi
translated: In the passive: he is caused to hear, they are caused to hear.🔽In the a, i, etc.

original: Daha-dāhe, dahati, dahanti.
analyzed: daha dāhe dahati dahanti
translated: In the passive: is smelt, are smelt.🔽In the causative: he causes to smell, they cause to smell.

original: Kamme yamhi ‘hassa vipallāso’ti pubbāparavipallāso, agginā gāmo dayhati, dayhanti.
analyzed: kamme yamhi hassa vipallāso ti pubba apara vipallāsaḥ agginā gāmaḥ dayhati dayhanti
translated: In the passive: he is caused to smell, they are caused to smell.🔽In the a, i, etc.🔽In the passive: is tasted, are tasted.

original: Kārite-dāheti, dāhayati, dahāpeti, dahāpayati.🔽649. Dahassa dassa ḍo ka. 20; rū. 27; nī. 50; ‘…dasadadakkhā’ (bahūsu).
analyzed: kāritā idāha iti dāhayati dahāpa iti dahāpayati  dahassa dassa ḍaḥ ka rū nī dasa da da kkhāḥ bahūsu
translated: In the causative: he causes to taste, they cause to taste.

original: Dahadhātussa dassa ḍo hoti vā.🔽Ḍahati, ḍahanti.
analyzed: daha dhātussa dassa ḍaḥ hoti vā  ḍahati ḍahanti
translated: In the passive: he is caused to taste, they are caused to taste.🔽In the a, i, etc.🔽In the passive: is touched, are touched.🔽In the causative: he causes to touch, they cause to touch.

original: Disa-pekkhane, tyādyuppatti, kattari lo.
analyzed: di sapekkhane tya ādi uppatti kattari lo
translated: In the passive: he is caused to touch, they are caused to touch.🔽In the a, i, etc.🔽In the passive: is known, are known.🔽In the causative: he causes to know, they cause to know.🔽In the passive: he is caused to know, they are caused to know.🔽In the a, i, etc.🔽In the passive: is seen, are seen.🔽In the causative: he causes to see, they cause to see.🔽In the passive: he is caused to see, they are caused to see.

original: 650. Disassa passadassadasadadakkhā ka. 471; rū. 483; nī. 951.
analyzed: disassa passa dassa dasa dada kkhā ka rū nī
translated: In the a, i, etc.🔽In the passive: is heard, are heard.🔽In the causative: he causes to hear, they cause to hear.🔽In the passive: he is caused to hear, they are caused to hear.🔽In the a, i, etc.

original: Disadhātussa passa ca dassa ca dasa ca da ca dakkha cāti ete ādesā honti vā.
analyzed: disa dhātussa passa ca dassa ca dasa ca da ca dakkha ca ati ete ādesāḥ honti vā
translated: In the

original: Vipassanā, vipassī bhagavā, sudassī, piyadassī, atthadassī, dhammadassī, sudassaṃ vajjamaññesaṃ dha. pa. 252, sudassananagaraṃ, mahāsudassano nāma rājā dī. ni. 2.242.
analyzed: vipassanā vipassī bhagavā sudassī piya dassī attha dassī dhamma dassī sudassam sudassam sudassam sudassana nagaram mahāsudassanaḥ nāma rājā
translated: Insight, the Blessed One who had insight, the well-seer, the one who sees what is dear, the one who sees what is profitable, the one who sees the Dhamma, the well-seen, the one who knows the well-seen, the city of the well-seen, the king named Great-Discernment,

original: Dasādese-catusaccaddaso nātho vibha. aṭṭha. suttantabhājanīyavaṇṇanā, duddaso dhammo
analyzed: nāthaḥ aṭṭha suttanta bhājanīya vaṇṇanā duddasaḥ dhammo
translated: in the ten directions, the one who sees the four truths, the Lord, the one who is hard to see, the Dhamma,🔽the Great Chapter, the Discourse on the Requisites of a Precept-Reciter, the Dhamma is hard to see,

original: mahāva. 7; dī. ni. 2.64, attano pana duddasaṃ dha. pa. 252, so ve bhikkhu dhammadasoti
analyzed: dī ni attanaḥ pana duddasam dha pa  saḥ ve bhikkhu dhamma dasaḥ ti
translated: but a bhikkhu who sees it is called a seer of the Dhamma.

original: vuccati gavesitabbaṃ. Passa dhammaṃ durājānaṃ, sammuḷhettha aviddasū. Daṭṭhabbaṃ, daṭṭhā, daṭṭhunti.
analyzed: vuccati gavesitabbam passa dhammam du rājānam sammuḷhā ittha a viddasū daṭṭhabbam daṭṭhā daṭṭhum
translated: It should be sought. See the Dhamma hard to understand, here the ignorant are confused. It should be seen, it is seen, it should be seen.

original: Iminā suttena disassa sabbavibhattīsu yathārahaṃ passa, dassa, dakkhādesā honti,
analyzed: iminā suttena disassa sabba vibhattīsu yathāraham passa dassa dakkha ādesāḥ honti
translated: In this sutta, in all the vibhattis, the forms passa, dassa, dakkhā are used as appropriate,

original: ā, īādīsu dasa, dādesā honti, “dissati, dissantī”ti rūpāni pana yassa pubbarūpattena
analyzed: ā ī ādīsu dasa da ādesāḥ honti dissati dissanti iti rūpāni pana yassa pubba rūpa ttena
translated: in the ā, ī, etc. sections, the forms dasa, dā are used. But the forms dissati, dissantī are formed here by the previous-formed

original: idha kamme sijjhanti, divādigaṇe kattari sijjhanti. Mahāvuttinā addassa, dissādesāpi
analyzed: idha kamme sijjhanti divā ādi gaṇe kattari sijjhanti mahāvuttinā addassa dissā desā api
translated: root diss in the sense of the verb. In the Mahā-vutti, the forms addassa, dissādesā are also used.

original: honti. Atrimā pāḷī-yaṃ vāsavaṃ addassāmaṃ jā. 1.6.112; ‘addasāma’, ye mayaṃ bhagavantaṃ
analyzed: honti atrimā pāḷīyam vāsavam addassāmam jāḥ addasāma ye mayam bhagavantam
translated: ‘We saw’ is ‘addassāma’ (we saw).

original: addassāma gavesitabbaṃ, api me mātaraṃ adassatha ma. ni. 2.356, dissanti bālā abyattā
analyzed: addassāma gavesitabbam api me mātaram adassatha ma ni dissanti bālāḥ abyattā
translated: ‘Should be sought’ is ‘gavesitabbaṃ’ (should be sought). ‘Did you see my mother?’ is ‘addasatha ma. ni. ’ (did you see my mother?). ‘Fools and the incompetent are seen’ is ‘dissanti bālā abyattā’ (fools and the incompetent are seen).

original: mahāva. 82, mayi ime dhammā sandissanti, ahañca imesu dhammesu sandissāmi ma. ni.
analyzed: mahāva mayi ime dhammā sandissanti ahañca imesu dhammesu sandissāmi ma ni
translated: ‘These things are seen in me’ is ‘mayi ime dhammā sandissanti’ (these things are seen in me). ‘I am seen in these things’ is ‘ahañca imesu dhammesu sandissāmi’ (I am seen in these things).🔽‘Signs will be seen’ is ‘nimittāni padissanti’ (signs will be seen). ‘Those will be seen today’ is ‘tāni ajja padissare’ (those will be seen today).

original: 3.253, nimittāni padissanti, tāni ajja padissareti bu. vaṃ. 2.82, tasmā tyādīsupi
analyzed: nimittāni padissanti tāni ajja padissara iti bu vam tasmā tya ādī supi
translated: ‘Therefore’ and so on.

original: “adassati, adassanti, adassasi, adassatha, adassāmi, addassāmā”ti yujjanti.🔽Kārite ṇimhi dassādeso, dasseti, dassayati, nidasseti, nidassayati, sandasseti, sandassayati.🔽Kamme-dassīyati, dassīyanti, nidassīyati, nidassīyanti, sandassīyati, sandassīyanti, dakkhati, dakkhanti.
analyzed: adassati adassanti adassasi adassatha adassāmi addassāma ati yujjanti  kārite ṇimhi dassa ādesaḥ dasseti dassayati nidasseti nidassayati sandasseti sandassayati  kammedassīyati dassīyanti nidassīyati nidassīyanti sandassīyati sandassīyanti dakkhati dakkhanti
translated: ‘He sees, they see, you see, you all see, I see, we see’ is correct.🔽In the passive voice ‘is seen, are seen, is shown, are shown, is demonstrated, are demonstrated, is pointed out, are pointed out’ is correct.🔽In the causative ‘is made to see, are made to see, is made to show, are made to show, is made to demonstrate, are made to demonstrate, is made to point out, are made to point out’ is correct.

original: Kamme-dakkhīyati, dakkhīyanti.
analyzed: kammedakkhīyati dakkhīyanti
translated: In the future ‘will see, will see, will show, will show, will demonstrate, will demonstrate, will point out, will point out’ is correct.🔽In the causative ‘will be made to see, will be made to see, will be made to show, will be made to show, will be made to demonstrate, will be made to demonstrate, will be made to point out, will be made to point out’ is correct.

original: ‘Gamayamisāsadisānaṃ cchaṅa’ iti cchādese- dicchati, dicchanti iccādi.
analyzed: gama ya misa asa disānam cchaṅaḥ iti cha ādese dicchati dicchanti id ca ādi
translated: ‘I shall see my equals and betters’—thus ‘I shall see’ (passāmi) is the optative form.

original: Passati, passanti, dakkhati, dakkhanti, passīyati, passīyanti, dakkhīyati, dakkhīyanti.
analyzed: passati passanti dakkhati dakkhanti passīyati passīyanti dakkhīyati dakkhīyanti
translated: He sees, they see, he will see, they will see, he is seen, they are seen, he is seen by, they are seen by.

original: Yassa pubbarūpatte-dissati, dissanti, dissate, dissante, uddissate, uddissante, niddissate, niddissante, apadissate, apadissante.
analyzed: yassa pubba rūpa tte dissati dissanti dissate dissante uddissate uddissante niddissate niddissante apadissate apadissante
translated: In the past tense: he saw, they saw, he was seen, they were seen, he was seen by, they were seen by, he was seen by, they were seen by, he was seen by, they were seen by.

original: Kārite-passāpeti, passāpayati, dakkhāpeti, dakkhāpayati.
analyzed: kārite passāpeti passāpayati dakkhāpeti dakkhāpayati
translated: In the causative: he causes to see, he causes to see, he causes to see, he causes to see.

original: Kamme-passāpīyati, dassīyati, nidassīyati, sandassīyati, dakkhāpīyati.
analyzed: dassīyati nidassīyati sandassīyati dakkhāpīyati
translated: In the passive: he is caused to see, he is caused to see, he is caused to be seen, he is caused to be shown, he is caused to see.

original: Passatu, passantu, dakkhatu, dakkhantu, passeyya, passeyyuṃ, dakkheyya, dakkheyyuṃ.🔽Eyyāmassa emu ca antassa u ca honti. “Kattha passemu khattiyaṃ jā. 2.2.1947, dakkhemu
analyzed: passatu passantu dakkhatu dakkhantu passeyya passeyyum dakkheyya dakkheyyum  eyyāmassa emu ca antassa u ca honti kattha passemu khattiyam jā dakkhemu
translated: May he see, may they see, may he see, may they see, he might see, they might see, he might see, they might see.

original: te nivesana”nti jā. 1.15.254 (…nivesanāni) pāḷi. Passeyyāma, passeyyāmu, dakkheyyāma, dakkheyyāmu.
analyzed: te nivesananti jāḥ nivesanāni pāḷi passeyyāma passeyyāmu dakkheyyāma dakkheyyāmu
translated: The forms of the optative are made by adding -tu to the present tense forms and -ntu to the present tense forms ending in -u. ‘Where might we see a khattiya …’ ‘Where might we see them in their houses’ (Jā. i, 101). ‘We might see, we might see, we might see, we might see.’

original: Āādimhi-apassā, adakkhā.
analyzed: ā ā dimhi a passāḥ a dakkhā
translated: In the future: he will not see, he will not see.

original: Dasa, dādesesu dakārassa dvittaṃ, addasā kho bhagavā mahāva. 9; dī. ni. 2.69; saṃ. ni. 1.159, addasā kho āyasmā ānando ma. ni. 1.364.
analyzed: dasa da ādesesu dakārassa addasā kho bhagavā mahāva dī ni sam ni addasā kho āyasmai ānandaḥ
translated: In the case of the ten declensions, the second case of the letter da is da, and the Blessed One saw, mahāva. 9; dī. ni. 2.69; saṃ. ni. 1.159, the venerable Ānanda saw, ma. ni. 1.364.

original: Rassatte-tamaddasa mahābrahmā, nisinnaṃ samhi vesmani jā. 1.16.148. Te addasū. Rassatte-addasu,
analyzed: mahā brahmā nisinnam samhi vesmani jā te addasuḥ
translated: The Great Brahmā saw him, the most excellent of all beings, sitting in his abode, jā. ... They saw him, the most excellent of all beings,

original: āmantayassu vo putte, mā te mātaramaddasu jātake “āmantayassu te putte, mā te mātara maddasuṃ”.
analyzed: āmantayassu vaḥ putte mā te mātara addasu jātake āmantayassu te putte mā te mātara maddasum
translated: Call your children, lest they see their mother dead, jātake Call your children, lest they see their mother dead.

original: Dādese-so addā.
analyzed: dā desesaḥ a d dā
translated: In the case of the declensions, he saw, so addā.

original: Rassatte-adda. Yāyamāno mahārājā, addā sīdantare nage jā. 2.22.2105. Yo dukkhaṃ sukhato adda, dukkhamaddakkhi sallato dī. ni. 2.368.🔽Īādimhi-apassi, passi, apassī, passī, apassiṃsu, passiṃsu, apassi, passi, apassittha, passittha, apassiṃ, passiṃ, apassimhā, passimhā.
analyzed: yāyamānaḥ mahā rājā addā sīdantare nage jā  yaḥ dukkham sukhataḥ adda sallataḥ ni  ī ādimhi apassi passi apassī passī apassiṃsu passiṃsu apassi passi apassittha passittha apassim passim apassimhā passimhā
translated: In the case of the most excellent, he saw, addā. The Great King, while being led, saw the elephant falling between the mountains, jā. ... He who saw suffering as happiness, saw suffering as a dart, dī. ni. ..🔽In the case of the present tense, he saw, he saw, he did not see, he saw, they did not see, they saw, he did not see, he saw, they did not see, they saw, he did not see, he saw, we did not see, we saw.

original: Dassādese-addassi, addassuṃ, addassiṃsu, addassaṃsu, addassi, addassittha, addassiṃ, addassimhā.
analyzed: dassa ādese addassi addassum addassiṃsu addassaṃsu addassi addassittha addassim addassimhā
translated: In the case of the past tense, he saw, they saw, they saw, they saw, he saw, they saw, he saw, we saw.

original: Dakkhādese-adakkhi, dakkhi iccādi.
analyzed: dakkhā dese a dakkhi dakkhi icca ādi
translated: In the Dakkhinādesa (the South) the forms are adakkhi, dakkhi, etc.

original: Dasādese gāthāsu-addasi, addasuṃ, addasiṃsu, addasaṃsu.
analyzed: dasa ādese gāthāsu addasi addasum addasaṃsu
translated: In the Gāthā verses the forms are addasi, addasuṃ, addasiṃsu, addasaṃsu.

original: Parachakke-addasā, addasū, ahaṃ addasaṃ, mayaṃ addassimhe. Addasaṃ kāma te mūlaṃ, saṅkappā kāma jāyasi jā. 1.8.39.
analyzed: aham addasam mayam addassimhe addasam kāma te mūlam saṅkappā kāma jāyasi
translated: In the Paracakka (the Third Person) the forms are addasā, addasū, ahaṃ addasaṃ, mayaṃ addassimhe. Addasaṃ kāma te mūlaṃ, saṅkappā kāma jāyasi jā. ...

original: Kvaci sāgame ākārāgamo, so addasāsi, te addasāsuṃ, ahaṃ addasāsiṃ, mayaṃ adasāsimha.
analyzed: kvaci sa āgame ākāra āgamaḥ saḥ addasāsi te addasāsum aham addasāsim mayam addasāsimha
translated: Sometimes the augment ās is added, so the forms are addasāsi, addasāsuṃ, ahaṃ addasāsiṃ, mayaṃ adasāsimha.

original: Yaṃ addasāsiṃ sambuddhaṃ, desentaṃ dhammamuttamaṃ theragā. 287. Athaddasāsiṃ sambuddhaṃ,
analyzed: yam addasāsim sambuddham desentam dhammam uttamam theragāḥ athaddasāsim sambuddham
translated: Yaṃ addasāsiṃ sambuddhaṃ, desentaṃ dhammamuttamaṃ theragā. Athaddasāsiṃ sambuddhaṃ,

original: satthāramakutobhayaṃ theragā. 912.
analyzed: satthāram akutobhayam theragāḥ
translated: satthāramakutobhayaṃ theragā. ...

original: Mahāvuttinā iṃssa imhi hoti, pathe addasāsimhi bhojaputte jā. 2.17.146.
analyzed: mahāvuttinā iṃssa imhi hoti pathe bhoja putte jā
translated: In the Mahāvutti (the Second Person) the forms are iṃssa, imhi, so the forms are pathe addasāsimhi bhojaputte jā. ...

original: Ssatyādimhi-passissati, passissanti.
analyzed: ssati ādimhi passissati
translated: In the Sāti (the First Person) the forms are passissati, passissanti.

original: Dakkhādese‘dakkha sakkha hehi’iccādinā ssassalopo, dakkhati, dakkhanti, dakkhiti, dakkhinti, dakkhissati, dakkhissanti.
analyzed: dakkha ādese dakkha sakkha he hi icca ādinā ssa ssa lopaḥ dakkhati dakkhanti dakkhiti dakkhinti dakkhissati dakkhissanti
translated: In the Dakkhinādesa (the South) the forms are dakkhati, dakkhanti, dakkhiti, dakkhinti, dakkhissati, dakkhissanti, by the rule ‘Dakkha sakkha hehi’ etc.

original: Ssādimhi-apassissā, adakkhissā iccādi.
analyzed: ssa ādimhi apassissā adakkhissā icca ādi
translated: In the Sāti (the First Person) the forms are apassissā, adakkhissā, etc.

original: Mara-pāṇacāge, marati, maranti.
analyzed: mara pāṇa cāge marati maranti
translated: In the Mara-pāṇacāge (the Second Person) the forms are marati, maranti.

original: ‘Jaramarānamiyaṅa’iti iyādeso, miyati, miyanti, amhaṃ daharā na miyyare jā. 1.10.97.
analyzed: daharāḥ na
translated: ‘Jarāmaraṇam-iyam-aṅa’iti iyādeso, miyati, miyanti, amhaṃ daharā na miyyare jā.

original: Kārite ‘assā ṇānubandhe’ti āvuddhi, māreti, mārenti, mārayati, mārayanti, mārāpeti, mārāpenti, mārāpayati, mārāpayanti.
analyzed: kārite māreti mārenti mārayati mārayanti mārāpeti mārāpenti mārāpayati mārāpayanti
translated: Kārite ‘assā ṇānubandhe’ti āvuddhi, māreti, mārenti, mārayati, mārayanti, mārāpeti, mārāpenti, mārāpayati, mārāpayanti.

original: Yamu-uparame, yamati, yamanti. Pare ca na vijānanti, mayamettha yamāmase. Ettha ca ‘yamāmase’ti viramāmase, maraṇaṃ gacchāmaseti attho.
analyzed: pare ca na vijānanti mayam ettha yamāmase ettha ca yamāmase iti viramāmase maraṇam gacchāmasa iti
translated: Yamu-uparame, yamati, yamanti. Pare ca na vijānanti, mayamettha yamāmase. Ettha ca ‘yamāmase’ti viramāmase, maraṇaṃ gacchāmaseti attho.

original: Saṃpubbo saṃyame, saṃyamati, saṃyamanti.
analyzed: saṃpubbaḥ saṃyame saṃyamati saṃyamanti
translated: Saṃpubbo saṃyame, saṃyamati, saṃyamanti.

original: Niggahītassa ñādese-saññamati, saññamanti.
analyzed: niggahītassa ña ādese saññamati saññamanti
translated: Niggahītassa ñādese-saññamati, saññamanti.

original: Nipubbo niyame, niyamati, niyamanti.
analyzed: nipubbaḥ niyame niyamati niyamanti
translated: Nipubbo niyame, niyamati, niyamanti.

original: ‘Gamayamisāsadisānaṃ vā cchaṅa’iti massa cchādeso, niyacchati, niyacchanti.
analyzed: vā cchaṅ eti massa cha ādesaḥ niyacchati niyacchanti
translated: ‘Gamayamisāsadisānaṃ vā cchaṅa’iti massa cchādeso, niyacchati, niyacchanti.

original: Kamme-niyamīyati, niyamīyanti.
analyzed: niyamīyanti
translated: Kamme-niyamīyati, niyamīyanti.

original: Pubbarūpe-niyammati, niyammanti.
analyzed: pubbarūpeniyammati
translated: Pubbarūpe-niyammati, niyammanti.

original: Kārite-niyāmeti, niyāmayati.
analyzed: niyāmayati
translated: Kārite-niyāmeti, niyāmayati.

original: Ṇāpimhi na vuddhi, niyamāpeti, niyamāpayati, vavatthapetīti attho.
analyzed: na niyamāpeti niyamāpayati vavatthapeti iti attho
translated: Ṇāpimhi na vuddhi, niyamāpeti, niyamāpayati, vavatthapetīti attho.

original: Ruda-assuvimocane, rodati, rodanti.
analyzed: rodati rodanti
translated: In the sense of ‘crying and weeping’ (the forms are): rodati, rodanti.

original: Ssatyādimhi-‘labhavasachidagamabhidānaṃ cchaṅa’iti ssena saha dassa cchādeso, sā🔽nūna kapaṇā ammā, cirarattāya rucchati jā. 2.22.2136. Koñjī samuddatīreva, kapaṇā🔽nūna rucchati jā. 2.21.113. Sā nūna kapaṇā ammā, ciraṃ rucchati assame jā. 2.22.2138,
analyzed: s s s tya ādi mhi la bha vasa chida gam abhidānam cha ṅa eti s sena saha dassa cha ādesaḥ sā  nūna kapaṇā ammā cira rattāya rucchati jā koñjī samudda tīrā iva kapaṇā  nūna rucchati jā sā nūna kapaṇā ammā ciram rucchati assame jā
translated: In the sense of ‘truth, etc.’ (the forms are): ‘The word ssati is used with the words labha, vas, sacchi, āgama, abhidhāna, and chana’ (thus) ssati is used with the words labha, vas, sacchi, āgama, abhidhāna, and chana,

original: kaṃ nva’jja chātā tasitā, uparucchanti dārakā jā. 2.22.2153. Rodissati, rodissanti,
analyzed: kam nu ajja chātā tasitā uparucchanti dārakāḥ jā rodissati rodissanti
translated: ‘That poor mother of ours, will she not be hungry for a long time?’ ... ‘That poor mother of ours, will she not be hungry for a long time on the bank of the ocean?’ ... ‘That poor mother of ours, will she not be hungry for a long time in the hermitage?’ ... ‘Why are the children today crying and weeping, and are they not hungry?’ ... (The forms are): rodissati, rodissanti,

original: rucchati, rucchanti.
analyzed: rucchati rucchanti
translated: rucchati, rucchanti.

original: Ssādīsu-arucchā, arucchaṃsu, arodissā, arodissaṃsu.
analyzed: a rodissāḥ a rodissaṃsu
translated: In the sense of ‘not being hungry’ (the forms are): arucchā, arucchaṃsu, arodissā, arodissaṃsu.

original: Ruha-pāpuṇane, ruhati, ruhanti, āruhati, āruhanti, ārohati, ārohanti, abhiruhati, abhiruhanti, oruhati, oruhanti, orohati, orohanti.
analyzed: ruha pāpuṇane ruhati ruhanti āruhati āruhanti ārohati ārohanti abhiruhati abhiruhanti oruhati oruhanti orohati orohanti
translated: In the sense of ‘climbing and reaching’ (the forms are): ruhati, ruhanti, āruhati, āruhanti, ārohati, ārohanti, abhiruhati, abhiruhanti, oruhati, oruhanti, orohati, orohanti.

original: Kamme-ārohīyati.
analyzed: kammeārohīyati
translated: In the sense of ‘action’ (the forms are): ārohīyati.

original: ‘Hassa vipallāso’ti ha, yānaṃ vipariyāyo, āruyhati, oruyhati.
analyzed: vipallāsaḥ iti ha yānam vipariyāyaḥ āruyhati oruyhati
translated: ‘The word ha is used in the sense of “a reversal” (thus) āruyhati, oruyhati.

original: Īādimhi-ruhi, āruhi, oruhi.
analyzed: ī ādim hiruhi āruhi oruhi
translated: In the sense of ‘going’ (the forms are): ruhi, āruhi, oruhi.

original: ‘Kusaruhissa cchī’ti suttaṃ, abhirucchi, abhiruhi vā.
analyzed: kusaruhissa suttam abhirucchi abhiruhi vā
translated: ‘Kusaruhissa cchī’ is a sutta: abhirucchi, abhiruhi.

original: Labha-lābhe, labhati, labhanti.
analyzed: labha lābhe labhati labhanti
translated: Labha-lābhe, labhati, labhanti.

original: Yassa pubbarūpatte ‘catutthadutiyesvesaṃ tatiyapaṭhamā’ti saṃyogādissa catutthassa tatiyattaṃ, labbhati, labbhanti, labbhare.
analyzed: yassa catuttha dutiyesu esam tatiya paṭhama ati saṃyoga ādissa catutthassa tatiya ttam labbhati labbhanti labbhare
translated: Yassa pubbarūpatte ‘catutthadutiyesvesaṃ tatiyapaṭhamā’ti saṃyogādissa catutthassa tatiyattaṃ, labbhati, labbhanti, labbhare.

original: Īādimhi-alabhi, alabhiṃsu.
analyzed: ī ādi mhi alabhi alabhiṃsu
translated: Īādimhi-alabhi, alabhiṃsu.

original: 651. Labhā iṃīnaṃ thaṃthā vā ka. 497; rū. 477; nī. 1013.
translated: . Labhā iṃīnaṃ thaṃthā vā ka. ; rū. ; nī. .

original: Labhamhā paresaṃ iṃ, īnaṃ kamena thaṃ, thā honti vā, dhātvantassa pararūpattaṃ, saṃyogādissa dutiyassa paṭhamattaṃ.
analyzed: paresam iṃ īnam kamena tham thāḥ honti vā dhātu antassa para rūpa ttam saṃyoga ādissa dutiyassa paṭhama ttam
translated: Labhamhā paresaṃ iṃ, īnaṃ kamena thaṃ, thā honti vā, dhātvantassa pararūpattaṃ, saṃyogādissa dutiyassa paṭhamattaṃ.

original: Ahaṃ alatthaṃ, alabhiṃ vā, so alattha, alabhi vā.
analyzed: aham alattham alabhim vā saḥ alattha alabhi vā
translated: Ahaṃ alatthaṃ, alabhiṃ vā, so alattha, alabhi vā.

original: Mahāvuttinā uṃssa thuṃ, thaṃsu honti, mhāssa ca thamhā, thuṃmhā honti, te bhagavato
analyzed: mahāvuttinā honti mhāssa ca thamhā thuṃmhā honti te bhagavato
translated: Mahāvuttinā uṃssa thuṃ, thaṃsu honti, mhāssa ca thamhā, thuṃmhā honti, te bhagavato

original: santike pabbajjañca upasampadañca alatthuṃ dī. ni. 2.77, satiṃ paccalatthuṃ, viparītasaññaṃ
analyzed: santike pabbajjam ca upasampadam ca satim paccalatthum viparīta saññam
translated: santike pabbajjañca upasampadañca alatthuṃ dī. ni. ., satiṃ paccalatthuṃ, viparītasaññaṃ

original: paccalatthuṃ, te satiṃ paccalatthaṃsu, agamamhā kho tava gehaṃ, tattha neva dānaṃ
analyzed: paccalatthum te satim agamamhā kho tava geham tattha na iva dānam
translated: (They) remembered, they remembered, we went to your house, there we did not get

original: alatthamhā ma. ni. 2.300 (thokaṃ visadisaṃ), akkosameva alatthamhā, mayañca alatthamhā
analyzed: a latthamhā ma ni thokam visadisam akkosam eva a latthamhā mayam ca a latthamhā
translated: a gift, we did not get a gift, we got only abuse, we got only abuse,🔽we got to hear, we got to hear, the one with the elements, and the one with the elements,

original: savanāya, alatthumhā vā. Dhātvantassa ccho ca. Tadāhaṃ pāpikaṃ diṭṭhiṃ, paṭilacchiṃ
analyzed: savanāya vā cho ca tadā aham pāpikam diṭṭhim paṭilacchiṃ
translated: then I renounced the evil view,

original: ayoniso jā. 1.16.204.🔽Ssatyādimhi-‘labhavasa chida gama bhida rudānaṃ cchaṅa’iti suttena ssena saha dhātvantassa
analyzed: a yonisaḥ jā  chida gama bhida rudānam chaṅa eti su ttena ssena saha dhātu antassa
translated: not wisely ...

original: cchādeso, lacchati, labhissati, lacchanti, labhissanti, lacchasi, labhissasi, lacchatha,
analyzed: cha ādesaḥ lacchati labhissati lacchanti labhissanti lacchasi labhissasi lacchatha
translated: In the case of the one with the elements, the one with the elements, and the one with the elements, the ending is changed to 'chida', 'gama', 'bhida', 'rudana', 'changa' according to the rule. One gets, one will get, they get, they will get, you get, you will get, they get,

original: labhissatha, lacchāmi, labhissāmi, lacchāma, labhissāma. Lacchāma putte jīvantā,🔽arogā ca bhavāmase jā. 2.22.2260.
analyzed: labhissatha lacchāmi labhissāmi lacchāma labhissāma lacchāma putte jīvantā  arogā ca bhavāmase jā
translated: they will get, I get, I will get, we get, we will get. We get to live with our children,🔽and we become healthy. ...

original: Ssādimhi-alacchā, alabhissā, alacchaṃsu, alabhissaṃsu.🔽Vaca-viyattiyaṃ vācāyaṃ, vacati, vacanti.
analyzed: ssa ādimhi alacchāḥ alabhissāḥ alacchaṃsu alabhissaṃsu  vācā ayam vacati vacanti
translated: In the case of the one with the elements, one does not get, one will not get, they did not get, they will not get.🔽In the verbal root, in the word, one speaks, they speak.

original: Kamme-vacīyati, vacīyanti.
analyzed: vacīyanti
translated: In the action, one is spoken about, they are spoken about.

original: Yassa pubbarūpatte ‘assū’ti suttena ādimhi akārassa uttaṃ, vuccati, vuccanti, vuccare, vuccate, vuccante, vuccare.
analyzed: yassa suttena ādimhi akārassa uttam vuccati vuccanti vuccare vuccate vuccante vuccare
translated: In the first case, the vowel of the initial a is lengthened by the rule ‘Assu’ (P. 125), and the forms are: vuccati, vuccanti, vuccare, vuccate, vuccante, vuccare.

original: Kārite-vāceti, vācenti, vācayati, vācayanti, vācāpeti, vācāpenti, vācāpayati, vācāpayanti.
analyzed: kāritā iva vācā iti vācayati vācayanti vācāpa iti vācāpenti vācāpayati vācāpayanti
translated: Kārite-vāceti, vācenti, vācayati, vācayanti, vācāpeti, vācāpenti, vācāpayati, vācāpayanti.

original: Īādimhi-avaci, vaci.
analyzed: ī ādi mhi a vaci vaci
translated: In the first case, the forms are: avaci, vaci.

original: Mahāvuttinā ākārena saha sāgamo, avacāsi, vacāsi, avacuṃ, vacuṃ, avaciṃsu, vaciṃsu, tvaṃ avaco, avaca, avaci, avacāsi, avacittha, avacittho, tumhe avacittha.
analyzed: mahāvuttinā ākārena saha sa āgamaḥ avacā asi vacāsi avacum vacum avaciṃsu vaciṃsu tvam avacaḥ avaca avaci avacāsi avacittha avacitthaḥ tumhe avacittha
translated: In the second case, the forms are: avacāsi, vacāsi, avacuṃ, vacuṃ, avaciṃsu, vaciṃsu, tvaṃ avaco, avaca, avaci, avacāsi, avacittha, avacittho, tumhe avacittha.

original: ‘Mhāthānamuña’iti suttaṃ, tumhe avacuttha, vacuttha, ahaṃ avaciṃ, vaciṃ, avacāsiṃ, vacāsiṃ, mayaṃ avacimhā, vacimhā, avacimha, vacimha vā, mayaṃ avacumhā, vacumhā, so avacā, vacā.
analyzed: suttam tumhe avacuttha vacuttha aham avacim vacim avaca asim vaca asim mayam avacimhā vacimhā avacimha vacimha vā mayam avacumhā vacumhā saḥ avacā vacā
translated: In the third case, the forms are: avacuttha, vacuttha, ahaṃ avaciṃ, vaciṃ, avacāsiṃ, vacāsiṃ, mayaṃ avacimhā, vacimhā, avacimha, vacimha vā, mayaṃ avacumhā, vacumhā, so avacā, vacā.

original: Rassatte-avaca, avacittha, vacittha vā, ahaṃ avacaṃ, avaca, vaca vā, mayaṃ avacimhe, vacimhe.
analyzed: rassatte avaca avacittha vacittha vā aham avacam avaca vaca vā mayam avacimhe vacimhe
translated: In the fourth case, the forms are: avaca, avacittha, vacittha vā, ahaṃ avacaṃ, avaca, vaca vā, mayaṃ avacimhe, vacimhe.

original: 652. Īādo vacassoma ka. 477; rū. 479; nī. 958; caṃ. 6.2.69; pā. 7.4.20.
analyzed: ī ā daḥ vacaḥ soma ka rū nī cam pā
translated: 652. Īādo vacassoma ka. 477; rū. 479; nī. 958; caṃ. 6.2.69; pā. 7.4.20.

original: Īādīsu vacassa mānubandho o hoti.
analyzed: ī ādīsu vacassa ma anubandhaḥ o hoti
translated: 652. In the group beginning with ī, o is substituted for the final vowel of the base.

original: So avoci, te avocuṃ, avociṃsu, tvaṃ avoci, tumhe avocuttha, ahaṃ avociṃ, mayaṃ avocumhā, so avoca, rasso, bhagavā etadavoca udā. 20.
analyzed: saḥ avoci te avocum avociṃsu tvam avoci tumhe avocuttha aham avocim mayam avocumha saḥ avoca rassaḥ bhagavān etat avoca udā
translated: He said, they said, they said, you said, you said, I said, we said, he said, the Blessed One said this, UdA 1, 1.

original: Ssatyādimhi –🔽653. Vacabhujamucavisānaṃ kkhaṅa ka. 481; rū. 524; nī. 963; ‘bhuja muca vaca visānaṃ kkhaṅa (bahūsu).
analyzed: s satya ādimhi  vaca bhuja muca visānam kkhaṅa ka rū nī bhuja muca vaca visānam kkhaṅa bahūsu
translated: In the case of satya, etc.,🔽In the case of the group beginning with bhuja, kkhaṅa is substituted for the final vowel of the base.

original: Ssena saha vacādīnaṃ anto byañjano kkhaṅa hoti vā ssayuttāsu vibhattīsu.
analyzed: ssena saha vaca ādīnam antaḥ byañjanaḥ kkhaṅa hoti vā ssa yuttāsu vibhattīsu
translated: The internal vowel of bhuja, muca, vaca, visāna, and kkhaṅa is optionally kkhaṅa in the case of the case-endings that are connected with the locative.

original: Vakkhati, vacissati, vakkhanti, vakkhare, vacissanti, vacissare, vakkhasi, vakkhatha,
analyzed: vakkhati vacissati vakkhanti vakkhare vacissanti vacissare vakkhasi vakkhatha
translated: He speaks, he will speak, they speak, he speaks, they will speak, they will speak, you speak, you speak,

original: vakkhāmi, vakkhāma, vakkhate, vakkhante, vakkhase, vakkhavhe, ahaṃ vakkhaṃ, vacissaṃ,
analyzed: vakkhāmi vakkhāma vakkhate vakkhante vakkhase vakkhavhe aham vakkham vacissam
translated: I speak, we speak, they speak, they speak, you speak, you speak, I speak, I will speak,

original: mayaṃ vakkhāmhe, vacissāmhe.
analyzed: mayam vakkhāmhe vacissāmhe
translated: we speak, we will speak.

original: ‘Ssenā’ti adhikārena vinā dhātvantassa kkhādesopi labbhati, vakkhissati, vakkhissanti.
analyzed: adhikārena vinā dhātu antassa labbhati vakkhissati vakkhissanti
translated: In the sense of ‘army’ the forms with kkhā, etc., are also found without the prefix: vakkhāti, vakkhissati, vakkhissanti.

original: Ssādimhi-avakkhā, avacissā, avakkhaṃsu, avacissaṃsu.🔽Vada-viyattiyaṃ vācāyaṃ, vadati, vadanti, ovadati, ovadanti, vadasi, vadatha, vadāmi, vadāma.
analyzed: ssa ādimhi avakkhā avacissā avakkhaṃsu avacissaṃsu  vācā ayam vadati vadanti ovadati ovadanti vadasi vadatha vadāmi vadāma
translated: In the sense of ‘praise’ the forms with avakkhā, etc., are also found: avakkhā, avacissā, avakkhāsuṃ, avacissāsuṃ.🔽Vada is the verbal root for ‘speaking’ and ‘advising’: vadati, vadanti, ovadati, ovadanti; vadasi, vadatha, vadāmi, vadāma.

original: Lassa ette-vadeti, vadenti, vadesi, vadetha, vademi, vadema.
analyzed: lassa ettevadā iti vadenti vadesi vadetha vademi vadema
translated: In the subjunctive the forms with ette are: vadeti, vadenti, vadesi, vadetha, vademi, vadema.

original: Kamme-vadīyati, vadiyyati, ovadīyati, ovadiyyati.
analyzed: kammevadīyati vadiyyati ovadīyati ovadiyyati
translated: In the causative: vadiyati, vadiyyati, ovadīyati, ovadiyyati.

original: Dassa cavaggatte yassa pubbarūpattaṃ, vajjati, vajjanti, ovajjati, ovajjanti.
analyzed: dassa ca vagga tte yassa pubbarūpattam vajjati vajjanti ovajjati ovajjanti
translated: In the optative the forms with cavaggatta are: vajjati, vajjanti, ovajjati, ovajjanti.

original: Kārite-bheriṃ vādeti, vādenti, vādayati, vādayanti, guruṃ abhivādeti, abhivādenti, abhivādesi, abhivādetha, abhivādemi, abhivādema.
analyzed: kārita ibherim vādeti vādenti vādayati vādayanti gurum abhivādeti abhivādenti abhivādesi abhivādetha abhivādemi abhivādema
translated: In the passive: bheriṃ vādeti, vādenti, vādayati, vādayanti; guruṃ abhivādeti, abhivādenti; abhivādesi, abhivādetha, abhivādemi, abhivādema.

original: Mahāvuttinā assa ittaṃ, abhivādiyāmi, abhivādiyāma, abhivādayāmi, abhivādayāma vā,
analyzed: mahāvuttinā assa ittam abhivādiyāmi abhivādiyāma abhivādayāmi abhivādayāma vā
translated: In the Mahāvagga the forms with itta are: abhivādiyāmi, abhivādiyāma; abhivādayāmi, abhivādayāma vā;

original: abhivandāmi, abhivandāmāti attho. Vandanto hi “sukhī hotū”ti abhimaṅgalavacanaṃ vadāpeti
analyzed: abhivandāmi abhivandāma ati atthaḥ vandantaḥ hi sukhī hotu uti abhimaṅgala vacanam
translated: I pay homage, I pay homage, is the meaning. For one who pays homage says, “May he be happy,” and so he causes the auspicious words to be spoken.

original: nāma, tathāvacanañca vandanīyassa vattaṃ.
analyzed: nāma tathāvacanam ca vandanīyassa vattam
translated: And the words “I pay homage” are a duty to one who is worthy of homage.

original: Ṇāpimhi na vuddhi, vadāpeti, vadāpayati.
analyzed: na vadāpayati
translated: In na vuddhi, vadāpeti, vadāpayati,🔽the -ādes- is in gamavadadānaṃ ghammavajjadajjā vā, and the -l- is in ūlasse.

original: ‘Gamavadadānaṃ ghammavajjadajjā vā’ti vajjādeso, ‘ūlasse’ti lassa ettaṃ, vajjeti, vajjenti.
analyzed: ghamma vajja dajjā vāti vajja ādesaḥ ūlassa iti lassaḥ ettam vajja iti vajjenti
translated: Vajjeti, vajjenti.

original: Kamme-vajjīyati, vajjīyanti.
analyzed: kammevajjīyati vajjīyanti
translated: In kamme-vajjīyati, vajjīyanti,

original: Kārite-vajjāpeti, vajjāpayati.
analyzed: vajjāpayati
translated: kārite-vajjāpeti, vajjāpayati,

original: Eyyādimhi-‘eyyeyyāseyyaṃnaṃṭe’iti eyyādīnaṃ ekavacanānaṃ ettaṃ, vade, vadeyya, vajje, vajjeyya, vadeyyuṃ, vajjeyyuṃ.
analyzed: eyya ādi ekavacanānam ettam vade vadeyya vajje vadeyya vadeyyum vajjeyyum
translated: in eyyādimhi-‘eyyeyyāseyyaṃnaṃṭe’iti eyyādīnaṃ ekavacanānaṃ ettaṃ, vade, vadeyya, vajje, vajjeyya, vadeyyuṃ, vajjeyyuṃ.

original: Vajjādese mahāvuttinā eyyassa āttaṃ, eyyumādīnaṃ eyyasaddassa lopo, so vajjā, te vajjuṃ.
analyzed: vajja ādese mahāvuttinā eyyassa āttam eyyum ādīnam eyya saddassa lopaḥ saḥ vajjā te vajjum
translated: In the -ādes- the -yy- of eyyā becomes -ā-, and the -yy- of eyyumā, etc., is elided, thus so vajjā, te vajjuṃ.

original: Eyyādīnaṃ yyāsaddassa lopo vā, tvaṃ vajjāsi, vajjesi, tumhe vajjātha, vajjetha, ahaṃ vajjāmi, vajjemi, mayaṃ vajjāma, vajjema, ahaṃ vajjaṃ, mayaṃ vajjāmhe, vajjeyyāmhe.
analyzed: eyya ādīnam yyā saddassa lopaḥ vā tvam vajjāsi vajjesi tumhe vajjātha vajjetha aham vajjāmi vajjemi mayam vajjāma vajjema aham vajjam mayam vajjāmhe vajjeyyāmhe
translated: Or the -yy- of eyyā, etc., is elided, thus tvaṃ vajjāsi, vajjesi, tumhe vajjātha, vajjetha, ahaṃ vajjāmi, vajjemi, mayaṃ vajjāma, vajjema, ahaṃ vajjaṃ, mayaṃ vajjāmhe, vajjeyyāmhe.

original: Atrimā pāḷī-vajjuṃ vā te na vā vajjuṃ, natthi nāsāya rūhanā jā. 1.3.33, ammaṃ ārogyaṃ
analyzed: pāḷīvajjum vā te na vā vajjum natthi
translated: whether the verse is correct or not, there is no need to be offended.🔽Be well, dear, and be happy, dear.

original: vajjāsi, tvañca tāta sukhī bhava jā. 2.22.2148, ammaṃ ārogyaṃ vajjātha, ayaṃ no neti
analyzed: vajjāsi tvam ca tāta sukhī bhava ārogyam vajjātha ayam naḥ na iti
translated: Be well, dear, and be happy, dear.

original: brāhmaṇo jā. 2.22.2174 iccādi.🔽Hiyyattaniyaṃ-so avadā, vadā, avajjā, vajjā, te avadū, vadū, avajjū, vajjū.
analyzed: brāhmaṇaḥ jāḥ i t ca ādi  avadā vadā avajjā vajjā te avadū vadū avajjū vajjū
translated: The brahmin said: ..🔽In the causative: he would cause to avoid, he would cause to avoid, he would cause to avoid, he would cause to avoid, they would cause to avoid, they would cause to avoid, they would cause to avoid, they would cause to avoid.🔽In the denominative: he would avoid, he would avoid, he would avoid, he would avoid, they would avoid, they would avoid, they would avoid, they would avoid, they would avoid, they would avoid, they would avoid, they would avoid.🔽In the future: he will avoid, he will avoid.

original: Ajjattaniyaṃ-so avadi, vadi, avajji, vajji, te avaduṃ, vaduṃ, avajjuṃ, vajjuṃ, avadiṃsu, vadiṃsu, avajjiṃsu, vajjiṃsu.🔽Ssatyādimhi-vadissati, vajjissati.
analyzed: avadi vadi avajji vajji te avadum vadum avajjum vajjum avadiṃsu vadiṃsu avajjiṃsu vajjiṃsu  ssatya ādi mhivadissati vajjissati
translated: In the desiderative: he would like to avoid, he would like to avoid.🔽In the denominative: he would cause to avoid, he would cause to avoid.

original: Ssādimhi-avadissā, avajjissā iccādi.
analyzed: ssa ādimhi avadissā avajjissā iti ādi
translated: In the causative: he causes to know, he causes to know.

original: Vida-ñāṇe, vidati.🔽‘Yuvaṇṇānamiyaṅauvaṅa sare’ti saramhi iyādeso, te vidiyanti.
analyzed: vidañāṇe vidati  yu va ṇ na miyaṅ auvaṅa sara iti saramhi iya ādesaḥ te vidiyanti
translated: In the causative: they know.

original: Kārite-nivedeti, paṭivedeti, nivedayati, paṭivedayati, paṭivedayāmi vo bhikkhave
analyzed: kāritenivedeti paṭivedeti nivedayati paṭivedayati paṭivedayāmi vaḥ bhikkhave
translated: In the causative: he causes to announce, he causes to announce, he causes to announce, he causes to announce, he causes to announce, he causes to announce, he causes to announce, he causes to announce, he causes to announce, he causes to announce, he causes to announce, he causes to announce.

original: ma. ni. 1.416, jānāpemīti attho. Vedayāmahaṃ bhante, vedayatīti maṃ saṅgho dhāretūti🔽cūḷava. aṭṭha. 102 jānāpemi, pākaṭaṃ karomīti vā attho.
analyzed: ma ni jāna apemi iti atthaḥ vedayāmaham bhante vedayati iti mamam saṅghaḥ dhāretu uti  cūḷava aṭṭha jānāpemi pākaṭam karomi iti vā atthaḥ
translated: ‘I am one who knows, venerable sir; let the Order remember me as one who knows.’🔽The meaning is: ‘I make known, I make clear.’🔽‘I am one who knows, venerable sir; let the Order remember me as one who knows.’

original: “Vediyāmahaṃ bhante, vediyatīti maṃ saṅgho dhāretū”tipi cūḷava. aṭṭha. 102 pāṭho, tattha apaccaye pare iyādeso yujjati.
analyzed: bhante vediyatī iti mam saṅghaḥ dhāretu utipi tattha a paccaye pare iya ādesaḥ yujjati
translated: The reading is: ‘I am one who knows, venerable sir; let the Order remember me as one who knows.’🔽Here the substitution of iyā for the final vowel of the preceding word is appropriate.

original: Eyyādimhi-videyya, vidiyeyya, videyyuṃ, vidiyeyyuṃ.
analyzed: eyya ādi mhivideyya vidiyeyya videyyum vidiyeyyum
translated: In the eyyādi class: videyya, vidiyeyya, videyyuṃ, vidiyeyyuṃ.

original: Īādimhi-paccayānaṃ khayaṃ avedi, te viduṃ, vidiṃsu.
analyzed: ī ādi mhi paccayānam khayam avedi te vidum vidiṃsu
translated: In the īādi class: avedi, paccayānaṃ khayaṃ, te viduṃ, vidiṃsu.

original: Kārite-nivedesi, nivedayi, paṭivedesi, paṭivedayi, nivedayuṃ, nivedayiṃsu, paṭivedayuṃ, paṭivedayiṃsu.
analyzed: kāritenivedesi nivedayi paṭivedesi paṭivedayi nivedayum nivedayiṃsu paṭivedayum paṭivedayiṃsu
translated: In the kārite class: nivedesi, nivedayi, paṭivedesi, paṭivedayi, nivedayuṃ, nivedayiṃsu, paṭivedayuṃ, paṭivedayiṃsu.

original: Ssatyādimhi-vidissati, vedissati, parisuddhāti vedissāmi mahāva. 134 iccādi.
analyzed: iccādi
translated: In the satyādi class: vidissati, vedissati, parisuddhāti vedissāmi Mahāvagga, and so on.

original: Vasa-nivāse, vasati, vasanti, nivasati, nivasanti.
analyzed: vasa nivāse vasati vasanti nivasati nivasanti
translated: In the vas class: vasati, vasanti, nivasati, nivasanti.

original: Kamme-adhi, āpubbo, tena gāmo adhivasīyati, āvasīyati, ajjhāvasīyati.
analyzed: tena gāmaḥ adhivasīyati āvasīyati ajjhāvasīyati
translated: In the kamme class: adhi, āpubbo, tena gāmo adhivasīyati, āvasīyati, ajjhāvasīyati.

original: ‘Assū’ti suttena akārassa uttaṃ, vussati, vussanti, vussare, “bhagavati brahmacariyaṃ vussatī”ti ma. ni. 1.257 pāḷi.
analyzed: assu uti suttena akārassa uttam vussati vussanti vussare bhagavati brahmacariyam vussati iti ma ni
translated: ‘Assu’ is a word. The u of the akāra is lengthened. He lives, they live, they live, ‘He lives the spiritual life under the Blessed One.’

original: Kārite-vāseti, adhivāseti, vāsayati, adhivāsayati.
analyzed: kāritevāsa iti adhivāsa iti vāsayati adhivāsayati
translated: ‘Kārite-vāse’ means he consents, he causes to live, he causes to consent.

original: Ṇāpimhi vuddhi natthi, vasāpeti, vasāpayati.
analyzed: ṇāpimhi natthi vasāpeti vasāpayati
translated: ‘Ṇāpimhi vuddhi natthi’ means he causes to live, he causes to live.

original: Īādimhi-avasi, vasi, avasuṃ, vasuṃ, avasiṃsu, vasiṃsu.
analyzed: ī ādimhi avasi vasi avasum vasum avasiṃsu vasiṃsu
translated: ‘Īādimhi’ means he lived, they lived, they lived, they lived, they lived, they lived.

original: Ssatyādīsu-‘labha vasa chida gama bhida rudānaṃ cchaṅa’iti ssena saha dhātvantassa🔽cchādeso, vacchati, vasissati, vacchanti, vasissanti, āyasmato nissāya vacchāmi mahāva.
analyzed: vasa chida gama bhida rudānam chaṅaḥ eti s sena saha dhātu antassa  cchā desaḥ vacchati vasissati vacchanti vasissanti āyasmataḥ nissāya vacchāmi mahāva
translated: ‘Ssatyādīsu’ means ‘labha vasa chida gama bhida rudānaṃ cchaṅa’ (Pā. 1.1.66). The ss is added to the end of the root.

original: 77, na te vacchāmi santike jā. 2.22.1933, avacchā, avasissā, avacchaṃsu, avasissaṃsu.
analyzed: na te vacchāmi santike jā avacchā avasissā avacchaṃsu avasissaṃsu
translated: ‘Vacchati’ means he lives, he will live, they live, they will live. ‘I live depending on the venerable one’ (Mahāva. 28.1). ‘I do not live near you’ (Jā. 1.35). ‘He lived, he will live, they lived, they will live.’

original: Visa-pavisane, pavisati, pavisanti.
analyzed: visa pavisane pavisati pavisanti
translated: ‘Visa-pavisane’ means he enters, they enter.

original: Kamme-pavisīyati, pavisīyanti, pavisīyate, pavisīyante.
analyzed: kamme pavisīyati pavisīyanti pavisīyate pavisīyante
translated: ‘Kamme’ means he is caused to enter, they are caused to enter, he is caused to enter, they are caused to enter.

original: Yassa pubbarūpatte-pavissati, pavissanti, pavissare, pavissate, pavissante, pavissare.
analyzed: yassa pubbarūpatte pavissati pavissanti pavissare pavissate pavissante pavissare
translated: ‘Yassa pubbarūpatte’ means he enters, they enter, they enter, he enters, they enter, they enter.

original: Kārite-paveseti, pavesayati.
analyzed: pavesayati
translated: He causes to enter, he enters.

original: Kamme-pavesīyati, pavesīyanti.
analyzed: kammepavesīyati pavesīyanti
translated: They cause to enter, they enter.

original: Īādimhi upasaggassa dīgho vā, pāvisi.
analyzed: ī ādimhi upasaggassa dīghaḥ vā pāvisi
translated: In the beginning, the prefix has the long vowel, he enters.

original: Mahāvuttinā dhātvantassa kkho hoti, pāvekkhi pathaviṃ cecco jā. 1.19.98, so pāvekkhi kāsirājā jā. 1.15.266, so tassa gehaṃ pāvekkhi jā. 1.15.303, pāvisuṃ, pāvisiṃsu, pāvekkhiṃsu.🔽Ssatyādīsu ‘vaca bhuja muca visānaṃ kkhaṅa’iti ssena saha dhātvantassa kkho, pavekkhati,
analyzed: mahāvuttinā dhātu antassa kkho hoti pāvekkhi pathavim ceccaḥ jā saḥ pāvekkhi kāsi rājā jā  saḥ tassa geham pāvekkhi jā pāvisum pāvisiṃsu pāvekkhiṃsu  s s satya ādīsu vaca bhuja muca visānam kkha ṅa eti ssena saha dhātu antassa kkho pavekkhati
translated: In the Mahāvagga, the kkhaṅ of the end of the base is kkha, he will look over the earth, he looked over the earth, the king of Kāsi, he looked over his house, they entered, they entered, they looked over.

original: pavisissati, pavekkhanti, pavisissanti, esa bhiyyo pavekkhāmi, vammikaṃ sataporisaṃ
analyzed: pavisissati pavekkhanti pavisissanti esa bhiyyas pavekkhāmi vammikam sata porisam
translated: In the case of ‘truth’ and so on, ‘vaca bhuja muca visānaṃ kkhaṅa’ (Pā. 1.2.67), the kkhaṅ of the end of the base together with the ss is kkha, he looks over, he will enter, they look over, they will enter, I will look over more, the ant-hill of a hundred men,

original: jā. 1.4.100, pāvekkhā, pavisissā, pāvekkhaṃsu, pavisissaṃsu.
analyzed: jā pāvekkhā pavisissā pāvekkhaṃsu pavisissaṃsu
translated: he will look over, he will enter, they looked over, they will enter.

original: Sada-saṃsīdane, ‘jarasadānamīma vā’tiādisaramhā īmaāgamo hoti vā, sīdati, sīdanti, lābūni sīdanti, silā plavanti jā. 1.1.77, saṃsīdati, visīdati, osīdati, avasīdati.
analyzed: vā sīdati sīdanti lābūni sīdanti silā plavanti jā saṃsīdati visīdati osīdati avasīdati
translated: In the case of ‘sitting down’ and ‘lying down’, the āgamas īma and īma come from the root ‘to sit’ (sad) and so on, he sits down, they sit down, the gourds sit down, the stone floats, he lies down, he lies down, he lies down, he lies down.

original: Nipubbo nisajjāyaṃ, nisīdati, nisīdanti.
analyzed: nipubbaḥ nisajja ayam nisīdati nisīdanti
translated: In the case of ‘sitting’, the nipāta is nisīdati, nisīdanti.

original: Papubbo pasāde, pasīdati, pasīdanti.
analyzed: papubbaḥ pasāde pasīdati pasīdanti
translated: He has faith, he is faithful, they are faithful.

original: Kāritepi na vuddhi ādesantarattā, sīdeti, sīdayati, saṃsīdeti, saṃsīdayati, osīdeti, osīdayati, osīdāpeti, osīdāpayati, nisīdāpeti, nisīdāpayati.
analyzed: na sīda iti sīdayati saṃsīda iti saṃsīdayati osīda iti osīdayati osīdāpeti osīdāpayati nisīdāpeti nisīdāpayati
translated: Even when done, there is no increase because of the ending of the middle, he sinks, he causes to sink, he causes to sink together, he causes to sink together, he causes to sink down, he causes to sink down, he causes to sink down, he causes to sink down, he causes to sink down, he causes to sink down.

original: Papubbamhi īma na hoti, pitā puttaṃ buddhe pasādeti, pasādayati, pasādenti, pasādayanti.
analyzed: na hoti pitā puttam buddhe pasādeti pasādayati pasādenti pasādayanti
translated: In the past, this is not so, the father has faith in the Buddha, he causes to have faith, they have faith, they cause to have faith.

original: Kamme-pasādīyati, pasādīyanti.
analyzed: kammepasādīyati pasādīyanti
translated: In the action, he is caused to have faith, they are caused to have faith.

original: Hana-hiṃsā, gatīsu, hanati, hananti.
analyzed: hana hiṃsāḥ gatīsu hanati hananti
translated: To kill-to harm, in the verbal roots, he kills, they kill.

original: ‘Kvaci vikaraṇāna’nti suttena lavikaraṇassa lope hanti, phalaṃ ve kadaliṃ hanti, sakkāro kāpurisaṃ hanti cūḷava. 335, hanti kuddho puthujjano a. ni. 7.64.
analyzed: kvaci suttena la vikaraṇassa lope hanti phalam kadalim hanti sakkāraḥ kāpurisam hanti hanti hanti kuddhaḥ puthujjanaḥ a
translated: In the sutta ‘in some cases the verbal roots’, the elision of the la of vikaraṇa is by way of the rule: ‘hanti’ (he kills), the fruit kills the plantain, respect kills the bad person, the small kills the big, the angry ordinary person kills the one without hatred.

original: Mahāvuttinā kvaci dhātvantalopo, vikkosamānā tibbāhi, hanti nesaṃ varaṃ varaṃ jā. 2.22.2370, luddakā migaṃ hanti, kevaṭṭā macchaṃ hanti.
analyzed: mahāvuttinā kvaci dhātu anta lopaḥ vikkosamānā tibbāhi hanti nesam varam varam jā luddakā migam hanti kevaṭṭā maccham hanti
translated: In the Mahā-vutti, in some cases there is elision of the final vowel, the very sharp ones who are reviling, they kill the best of the best, the hunters kill the deer, the fishermen kill the fish.

original: Kamme-hanīyati, hanīyanti.
analyzed: hanīyanti
translated: In the action, he is caused to be killed, they are caused to be killed.

original: Dhātvantassa cavaggatte yassa pubbarūpattaṃ, haññati, haññanti.
analyzed: dhātu antassa ca vagga tte yassa pubba rūpa ttam haññati haññanti
translated: When the root is changed to the past tense, the form of the present tense is the same as the future tense.

original: Kārite –🔽654. Hanassa ghāto ṇānubandhe ka. 591; rū. 544; nī. 1195.🔽Hanassa ghāto hoti ṇānubandhe paccaye.
analyzed: kārite  hanassa ghātaḥ ṇa anubandhe ka rū nī  hanassa ghātaḥ hoti ṇa anubandhe paccaye
translated: In the causative:

original: Ghāteti, ghātayati, ghātāpeti, ghātāpayati.
analyzed: ghāta iti ghātayati ghātāpa iti ghātāpayati
translated: The causative of han is ghāteti, ghātayati, ghātāpeti, ghātāpayati.

original: Kamme-ghātīyati, ghātāpīyati.
analyzed: kammeghātīyati ghātāpīyati
translated: In the passive: ghātīyati, ghātāpīyati.

original: Īādimhi-ahani, hani, ahaniṃsu, haniṃsu.
analyzed: ī ādi ahani hani ahaniṃsu haniṃsu
translated: In the present tense: ahani, hani, ahaniṃsu, haniṃsu.

original: Kamme-ahaññi, haññi, ahaññiṃsu, haññiṃsu.
analyzed: kamme ahaññi haññi ahaññiṃsu haññiṃsu
translated: In the passive: ahaññi, haññi, ahaññiṃsu, haññiṃsu.

original: Ssatyādimhi –🔽655. Hanā jekhā ka. 481; rū. 524; nī. 967, 969? ‘…chakhā’ (bahūsu) ‘chekhā’ (katthaci).🔽Hanamhā parassa ssakārassa je, khādesā honti vā, mahāvuttinā dhātvantassa pararūpattaṃ.
analyzed: s satya ādimhi  hanā jekhā ka rū nī chakhā bahūsu chekhā katthaci  ha namhā parassa ssakārassa je khādesāḥ honti vā mahāvuttinā dhātu antassa para rūpattam
translated: In the future tense:

original: Hajjeti, hanissati, hajjenti, hajjesi, hajjetha, hajjemi, hanissāmi, hajjema, hanissāma.
analyzed: hajjeti hanissati hajjenti hajjesi hajjetha hajjemi hanissāmi hajjema hanissāma
translated: The future of han is hanissati, hanissāmi, hanissāma.🔽The future of han is hanissati, hanissāmi, hanissāma.🔽The future of han is hanissati, hanissāmi, hanissāma.

original: Khādese mahāvuttinā dhātvantassa vaggantattaṃ, paṭihaṅkhati, paṭihanissati, paṭihaṅkhanti, paṭihaṅkhasi, paṭihaṅkhāmi, paṭihaṅkhāma, paṭihanissāma.
analyzed: khā dese mahāvuttinā dhātu antassa vagga anta ttam paṭihaṅkhati paṭihanissati paṭihaṅkhanti paṭihaṅkhasi paṭihaṅkhāmi paṭihaṅkhāma paṭihanissāma
translated: In the Aorist, the future, and the Imperative, the root hā is changed to vag, and the vowel of the root is lengthened.

original: Hara-haraṇe, harati, haranti.🔽Kamme-harīyati, harīyanti.🔽Kārite-hāreti, hārayati.🔽Ṇāpimhi na vuddhi, harāpeti, harāpayati.
analyzed: hara haraṇe harati haranti  kammeharīyati harīyanti  kāritā ihārā iti hārayati  na harāpeti harāpayati
translated: In the Perfect, the root hā is changed to harā, and the vowel of the root is lengthened.🔽In the Causative, the root hā is changed to harā, and the vowel of the root is lengthened.

original: Kamme-hārīyati, harāpīyati.🔽Ā, īādīsu –🔽656. Āīādīsu harassā.
analyzed: kammehārīyati harāpīyati  ā ī ādīsu  āī ādīsu ha rassā
translated: In the Passive, the root hā is changed to harī, and the vowel of the root is lengthened.🔽In the Causative of the Passive, the root hā is changed to harāpī, and the vowel of the root is lengthened.

original: Āādīsu īādīsu ca harassa rakārassa ā hoti vā, so ahā, aharā.🔽Īādimhi-so ahāsi, ajini maṃ ahāsi me dha. pa. 3-4, attānaṃ upasaṃhāsi, āsanaṃ abhihāsi,
analyzed: ā ādīsu ī ādīsu ca harassa rakārassa ā hoti vā saḥ ahā aharā  ahāsi mam ahāsi me dha pa attānam upasaṃhāsi āsanam abhihāsi
translated: In the Aorist, the root hā is changed to harā, and the vowel of the root is lengthened.🔽In the Aorist, the future, and the Imperative, the root hā is changed to harā, and the vowel of the root is lengthened.🔽In the Aorist, the future, and the Imperative, the root hā is changed to harā, and the vowel of the root is lengthened.🔽In the Aorist, the future, and the Imperative, the root hā is changed to harā, and the vowel of the root is lengthened.

original: sāsane vihāsi, vihāsi purisuttamo gavesitabbaṃ, dhammaṃ payirudāhāsi, ahari, hari,🔽vihāsuṃ, āhiṃsu, vihiṃsu vā, “mā me tato mūlaphalaṃ āhaṃsū”ti jā. 2.18.22 pāḷi, ahāsuṃ,
analyzed: sāsane vihāsi vihāsi purisuttamaḥ gavesitabbam dhammam payirudāhāsi ahari hari 🔽vihāsum vā mā me tatas mūla phalam
translated: In the Aorist, the future, and the Imperative, the root hā is changed to harā, and the vowel of the root is lengthened.🔽In the Aorist, the future, and the Imperative, the root hā is changed to harā, and the vowel of the root is lengthened.

original: aharuṃ, haruṃ, ahariṃsu, hariṃsu, tvaṃ ahāsi, ahari, tumhe ahāsittha, aharittha,
analyzed: aharum harum ahariṃsu hariṃsu tvam ahāsi ahari tumhe ahāsittha aharittha
translated: Aharum, harum, ahariṃsu, hariṃsu, you ahasi, ahari, you all ahāsittha, aharittha,

original: ahaṃ ahāsiṃ, ahariṃ, vihāsiṃ sāsane rato apa. thera 1.2.84, mayaṃ ahāsimhā, aharimhā.
analyzed: aham a hāsim a harim vihāsim sāsane rataḥ apa thera mayam a hāsimhā a harimhā
translated: I ahasiṃ, ahariṃ, I lived, delighting in the Dispensation. Thera, we ahasimhā, aharimhā.

original: Parachakke assa tthattaṃ, so ahāsittha, aharittha.
analyzed: paracchakke saḥ ahāsittha aharittha
translated: In the other tense, the form is tthattam, he ahāsittha, aharittha.

original: Ssatyādīsu –🔽657. Harassa cāhaṅa sse ‘hāssa cāhaṅa ssena’ (bahūsu).
analyzed: s satya ādīsu  harassa ca ahaṅa sse hāssa ca ahaṅa ssena bahūsu
translated: In the case of ‘truth’ and so on:

original: Ssakāravatīsu vibhattīsu ssena saha harassa ca karassa ca rakārassa āhaṅa hoti vā.
analyzed: ssakāravatīsu vibhattīsu ssena saha harassa ca karassa ca rakārassa āhaṅa hoti vā
translated: . Of har, and of kar, and of rak, āhaṅa is optionally substituted for ss by ss.

original: Iu āgame-hāhiti, khārikājañca hāhiti jā. 2.22.1759. Hāhati vā, harissati, hāhinti,
analyzed: iu hāhiti jā hāhati vā
translated: In the future: āgame – āhahiti, and khārikājañca āhahiti jā. ... āhahati optionally, harissati, āhanti,

original: hāhanti, harissanti, hāhasi, sukhaṃ bhikkhu vihāhisi dha. pa. 379. Hāhatha, hāhāmi, hāhāma, harissāma.
analyzed: sukham bhikkhu vihāhisi sukham bhikkhu
translated: āhanti, harissanti, āhasi, a bhikkhu will live happily, delighting in the Dispensation. Dha. pa. . āhatha, āhāmi, āhāma, harissāma.🔽.

original: Mahāvuttinā harassa dhātvantassa lopo ca, “yo imasmiṃ dhammavinaye appamatto vihassati saṃ. ni. 1.185, purakkhatvā vihassāma therīgā. 121, ahaṃ udakamāhissa”nti jā. 2.22.1931 pāḷī.
analyzed: mahāvuttinā harassa dhātu antassa lopo ca yaḥ imasmin dhamma vinaye appamattaḥ vihassati sam ni purakkhatvā vihassāma therī gāḥ aham
translated: The elision of the final vowel of the syllable mahā, and of the syllable vuttinā, and of the syllable harassa, and of the syllable dhātvantassa, and the elision of the final vowel of the syllable saṃ, and the elision of the final vowel of the syllable vihassati, and the elision of the final vowel of the syllable vihassāma, and the elision of the final vowel of the syllable therīgā, and the elision of the final vowel of the syllable udakamāhissa, are Pāli.

original: Ssādimhi-ahāhā, aharissā, ahāhaṃsu, aharissaṃsu.
analyzed: ssa ādimhi ahāhā aharissā aharissaṃsu
translated: In the sense of ‘having reached’ the forms are: aharissā, ahāhaṃsu, aharissaṃsu.

original: Āpubba sīsa-patthanāyaṃ, āsīsati, āsīsanti, paccāsīsati, paccāsīsanti.
analyzed: āsīsati āsīsanti paccāsīsati paccāsīsanti
translated: The prefix ā with the root sīsa in the sense of ‘aspiration’ has the forms: āsīsati, āsīsanti, paccāsīsati, paccāsīsanti.
