original: 658. Ādismā sarā caṃ. 5.1.3; pā. 6.1.2.
analyzed: ādismā sarā cam
translated: . In the beginning, and in sarā, caṃ. ..; pā. ...

original: Ādibhūtā saramhā paraṃ paṭhamasaddarūpaṃ ekassaraṃ dverūpaṃ hoti, iminā sarapubbānaṃ dhātupadānaṃ padadvitte āsīsa, sīsa iti rūpadvayaṃ bhavati.
analyzed: ādi bhūtā param paṭhama sadda rūpam ekassaram dvi rūpam hoti iminā dhātu padānam pada dvitte āsīsa sīsaḥ iti rūpa dvayam bhavati
translated: The first sound of the root is the first syllable, and the second sound is the second syllable. By this means, the two syllables āsīsa, sīsa are formed from the two syllables of the root dhātu.

original: 659. Loponādibyañjanassa caṃ. 6.2.112; pā. 7.4.60.
analyzed: lopa ūna ādi byañjanaḥ sa cam pā
translated: . In the elision of the initial consonant, and in byañjanassa, caṃ. ..; pā. ...

original: Dvitte anādibhūtassa ekassa byañjanassa lopo hotīti purime sīsarūpe sakāralopo.
analyzed: an ādi bhūtassa ekassa byañjanassa lopaḥ hoti iti purime sīsa rūpe sakāra lopo
translated: The elision of the single initial consonant in the second syllable takes place. Therefore, in the first syllable sīsa, the consonant is elided.

original: Āsīsīsati, āsīsīsanti iccādi.
analyzed: āsīsīsanti iccādi
translated: The forms are: āsīsīsati, āsīsīsanti, and so on.

original: Tathā ‘parokkhāyañcā’ti sutte casaddena kamādīnaṃ dhātupadānaṃ padadvitte kate ‘loponādibyañjanassā’ti
analyzed: tathā sutte ca saddena kama ādīnam dhātu padānam pada dvitte kate lopa ūna ādi byañjanassa ati
translated: Likewise in the sutta ‘Parokkhāyañcā’ (p. 101) the word ‘ca’ makes the two words ‘kam’ and ‘ādīnaṃ’ into a compound.

original: purime padarūpe anādibyañjanalopo, ‘kavaggahānaṃ cavaggajā’ti sesassa kavaggassa
analyzed: purime pada rūpe an ādi byañjana lopaḥ kavagga hānam cavagga jāti sesassa kavaggassa
translated: In the first word ‘anādibyañjanalopo’ (p. 101) the initial consonant of ‘ādi’ is elided.🔽In the rest of the word ‘kavaggahānaṃ cavaggajā’ (p. 101) the ‘ka’ group becomes the ‘ca’ group.🔽In the word ‘niggahītañcā’ (p. 101) the ‘ñ’ is elided and the ‘c’ is added.

original: cavaggattaṃ, ‘niggahītañcā’ti niggahītāgamo, caṅkamati, caṅkamanti, caṅkamatu, caṅkamantu,
analyzed: ca vak gattam niggahītam ca ati niggahīta āgamaḥ caṅkamati caṅkamanti caṅkamatu caṅkamantu
translated: Caṅkamati, caṅkamanti, caṅkamatu, caṅkamantu,

original: caṅkameyya, caṅkameyyuṃ iccādi.
analyzed: caṅkameyya caṅkameyyum i t ca ādi
translated: caṅkameyya, caṅkameyyuṃ, etc.

original: Kuca-saṅkocane, caṅkocati, caṅkocanti.
analyzed: kuca saṅkocane caṅkocati caṅkocanti
translated: Ku- means ‘to contract’: kucaṅkocati, kucaṅkocanti.

original: Cala-calane, cañcalati, cañcalanti.
analyzed: cala calane cañcalati cañcalanti
translated: Cala- means ‘to move’: cañcalati, cañcalanti.

original: Mahāvuttinā niggahītassa pararūpatte jara-bhijjane, jajjarati jajjaranti.
analyzed: mahāvuttinā niggahītassa pararūpatte jarabhijjane jajjarati jajjaranti
translated: In the Mahā-vutti the elided form of niggahīta becomes the other form: jara- means ‘to break’: jajjarati, jajjaranti.

original: Daḷa-dittiyaṃ, daddallati, daddallanti.
analyzed: daḷadittiyam daddallati daddallanti
translated: Daḷa- means ‘to see’: daddallati, daddallanti.

original: Muha-vecitte, momuhati, momuhanti, mahāvuttinā ussa ottaṃ.
analyzed: muhavecitte momuhati momuhanti mahāvuttinā
translated: Muha- means ‘to be confused’: momuhati, momuhanti. The Mahā-vutti has ussa ottaṃ.

original: Tathā ru-sadde, roruvati, roruvanti.
analyzed: tathā rusadde roruvati roruvanti
translated: Similarly ru- means ‘to cry’: roruvati, roruvanti.

original: Lupa-giddhe, loluppati, loluppanti iccādi.
analyzed: lupa giddhe loluppati loluppanti iccādi
translated: Lupa- means ‘to be greedy’: loluppati, loluppanti, etc.

original: Padadvittaṃ nāma padatthānaṃ atisayatādīpanatthaṃ, vicchāyaṃ pana ponopuñña, sambhamādīsu
analyzed: pada dvittam nāma pada tthānam atisaya tā dīpana ttham vicchāyam pana sambhama ādīsu
translated: The word-group of the two-word-base is used for the purpose of showing excess, etc., but in the case of vicchāyaṃ, ponopuñña, sambhamā, etc.,

original: ca dvitte anādibyañjanalopo natthi, gāmo gāmo ramaṇīyo. Tathā kvaci atisayadīpanepi,
analyzed: ca dvitte an ādi byañjana lopaḥ natthi gāmaḥ gāmaḥ ramaṇīyo tathā kvaci ati saya dīpane pi
translated: there is no elision of the initial vowel in the second word, as in gāmo gāmo ramaṇīyo. So too, in some instances, in the case of showing excess,

original: rūparūpaṃ, dukkhadukkhaṃ, ajjhattajjhattaṃ, devadevo, munimuni, rājarājā, brahmabrahmā,
analyzed: rūpa rūpam dukkha dukkham ajjhatta ajjhattam devadevaḥ muni muni rājarājā brahmabrahmā
translated: as in rūparūpaṃ, dukkhadukkhaṃ, ajjhattajjhattaṃ, devadevo, munimuni, rājarājā, brahmabrahmā,

original: varavaro, aggaaggo, jeṭṭhajeṭṭho, seṭṭhaseṭṭho, pasatthapasattho, uggatauggato, ukkaṭṭhukkaṭṭho,
analyzed: varavaraḥ agga aggaḥ jeṭṭha jeṭṭhaḥ seṭṭha seṭṭhaḥ pasattha pasatthaḥ uggata uggataḥ ukkaṭṭha ukkaṭṭhaḥ
translated: varavaro, aggaaggo, jeṭṭhajeṭṭho, seṭṭhaseṭṭho, pasatthapasattho, uggatauggato, ukkaṭṭhukkaṭṭho,

original: omakomako, dubbaladubbalo, abalaabalo, mahantamahanto iccādi.
analyzed: omaka umakaḥ dubbala dubbalaḥ abala abalaḥ mahanta mahantaḥ iccādi
translated: omakomako, dubbaladubbalo, abalaabalo, mahantamahanto, etc.

original: Bhūvādigaṇo niṭṭhito.
analyzed: bhūva ādi gaṇaḥ niṭṭhito
translated: The group beginning with bhū has been completed.

original: Rudhādigaṇa
analyzed: rudh ādi gaṇa
translated: The group beginning with rudhā

original: Atha rudhādigaṇo vuccate.
analyzed: atha rudhādi gaṇaḥ vuccate
translated: Now the group beginning with rudhā is stated.

original: ‘Kattarī’ti padaṃ vattate, tañca bahulādhikārā vikaraṇānaṃ kattari nibandhaṃ bhāva,🔽kammesu anibandhaṃ vikappena pavattiṃ dīpeti, tasmā bhāva, kammesu ca kāritarūpesu
analyzed: kattari iti padam vattate tat ca bahula adhikārāḥ kattari  kammesu anibandham vikappena pavattim dīpeti tasmai bhāva kammesu ca kārita rūpesu
translated: The word kattarī is used, and that shows the occurrence of the verbal-noun-forming suffixes in the sense of the agent by the general rule,

original: ca vikaraṇānaṃ pavatti veditabbā hotīti.
analyzed: ca vikaraṇānam pavatti veditabbā hoti iti
translated: and their occurrence by substitution in the sense of the object. Therefore the occurrence of the verbal-noun-forming suffixes should be understood in the sense of the agent and in the sense of the object in the case of the verbal-noun-forming suffixes in the sense of the cause.

original: Chida, bhida, bhuja, muca, yuja, rica, rudha, lipa, vida, sica, subha.
analyzed: chida bhida bhuja muca yuja rica rudha lipa vida sica subha
translated: Chida, bhida, bhuja, muca, yuja, rica, rudha, lipa, vida, sica, subha.

original: 660. Mañca rudhādīnaṃ ka. 446; rū. 509; nī. 926; caṃ. 1.1.93; pā. 3.1.78.🔽Rudhādīhi kriyatthehi kattari lo hoti, tesañca rudhādīnaṃ pubbantasaramhā paraṃ niggahītaṃ
analyzed: mañca rudha ādīnam ka rū nī cam pā  rudh ādīhi kriyatthehi kattari laḥ hoti tesam ca rudh ādīnam pubbanta saramhā param niggahītam
translated: . Mañca rudhādīnaṃ ka. ; rū. ; nī. ; caṃ. ..; pā. ...🔽The affix lo is added to the verbs rudha, etc., to form the agent noun. And the affix niggahīta is added to the final vowel of the root.

original: āgacchati, mānubandho pubbantadīpanattho, akāro uccāraṇattho, casaddena rudha, subhādīhi
analyzed: āgacchati ma anubandhaḥ pubba anta dīpana tthaḥ akāraḥ uccāraṇa atthaḥ ca saddena subha ādīhi
translated: It comes after the affix mañca. The meaning of the affix is to indicate the beginning. The letter a is for pronunciation. The word ca includes rudha, subha, etc.

original: i, ī, e, opaccaye saṅgaṇhāti, niggahītassa vaggantattaṃ.
analyzed: i ī e o paccaye saṅgaṇhāti niggahītassa vagga anta ttam
translated: The affix niggahīta has the form of the vowel a.

original: Rundhati.
analyzed: rundhati
translated: Rundhati.

original: Chida-dvidhākaraṇe, chindati, chindanti.
analyzed: chidadvidhākaraṇe chindati chindanti
translated: Chida, to cut in two: chindati, chindanti.

original: Kamme kyo, ‘tavaggavaraṇānaṃ ye cavaggabayañā’ti yamhi dhātvantassa cavaggattaṃ, ‘vaggalasehi te’ti yassa pubbarūpattaṃ. Chijjati, chijjanti.
analyzed: kamme kyaḥ ta vagga vara ṇānam ye ca vagga bayañā ati yamhi dhātu antassa ca vagga ttam vagga lasehi ta iti yassa pubba rūpa ttam chijjati chijjanti
translated: In the passive, the affix kyo is added. ‘Ta, vagga, varaṇa, yaññā’ means that the vowel a of the root is changed to the vowel a of the affix. Chijjati, chijjanti.

original: ‘Garupubbā rassā re ntentīna’nti catunnaṃ nte, ntīnaṃ rettaṃ, chindate, chijjate, chijjante, chijjare.
analyzed: garu pubbāḥ rassāḥ re catunnam nte ntīnam rettam chindate chijjate chijjante chijjare
translated: ‘Garupubbā rassā re ntentīna’ means that the re of the four ntes and ntīnas is lengthened. Chindate, chijjate, chijjante, chijjare.

original: Iminā niggahītāgamo, chindīyati, chindīyanti, chindīyate, chindīyante.
analyzed: iminā niggahīta āgamaḥ chindīyati chindīyanti chindīyate chindīyante
translated: By this rule the a of the reduplicate is lengthened: chindīyati, chindīyanti, chindīyate, chindīyante.

original: Kārite-chedeti, chedayati, chedāpeti, chedāpayati, chindeti, chindayati, chindāpeti, chindāpayati.
analyzed: kāritecheda iti chedayati chedāpa iti chedāpayati chinda iti chindayati chindāpa iti chindāpayati
translated: In the passive of the causative: chedayati, chedāpeti, chedāpayati, chindeti, chindayati, chindāpeti, chindāpayati.

original: Īādimhi-acchindi, chindi, acchinduṃ, chinduṃ, acchindiṃsu, chindiṃsu.🔽Mahāvuttinā dhātvantassa ccho pubbassa dvittañca, acchecchi taṇhaṃ, vivattayi saṃyojanaṃ itivu. 53, “acchejjī”tipi divādipāṭho dissati, acchecchuṃ vata bho rukkhaṃ jā. 2.22.1788.🔽Kamme-acchijji, chijji, acchindiyi, chindiyi.🔽Kārite-chedesi, kaṇṇanāsañca chedayi jā. 1.4.49, chindesi, chindayi.🔽Ssatyādimhi-‘labhavasachidagamabhidarudānaṃ cchaṅa’iti ssena saha dhātvantassa ccho,
analyzed: ī ādimhi acchindi chindi acchindum chindum acchindiṃsu chindiṃsu  mahāvuttinā dhātu antassa cchaḥ pubbassa acchecchi taṇham vivattayi saṃyojanam divā ādi pāṭhaḥ dissati acchecchum vata bho rukkham  kamme acchijji chijji acchindiyi chindiyi  kaṇṇanāsañca chedayi jā chindesi chindayi  s s s tya ādi mhila bha vasa chida gama bhida rudānam ccha ṅa eti s sena saha dhātu antaḥ sa cchaḥ
translated: In the Aorist: acchindi, chindi, acchinduṃ, chinduṃ, acchindiṃsu, chindiṃsu.

original: checchati, chindissati, checchanti, chindissanti, checchasi, checchata, checchāmi,
analyzed: checchati chindissati checchanti chindissanti checchasi checchata checchāmi
translated: In the future: acchecchi, acchekkhi, acchekkhiṃsu, acchekkhiṃsu, acchekkhasi, acchekkhatha, acchekkhāmi, acchekkhāma, acchekkhāmaṃ, acchekkhāmaṃ, acchekkhiṃ, acchekkhiṃ, acchekkhiṃse, acchekkhiṃsu, acchekkhiṃse, acchekkhiṃsu, acchekkhiṃse, acchekkhiṃsu, acchekkhiṃse, acchekkhiṃsu, acchekkhiṃse, acchekkhiṃsu, acchekkhiṃse, acchekkhiṃsu, acchekkhiṃse, acchekkhiṃsu, acchekkhiṃse, acchekkhiṃsu, acchekkhiṃse, acchekkhiṃsu, acchekkhiṃse, acchekkhiṃsu, acchekkhiṃse, acchekkhiṃsu, acchekkhiṃse, acchekkhiṃsu, acchekkhiṃse, acchekkhiṃsu, acchekkhiṃse, acchekkhiṃsu, acchekkhiṃse, acchekkhiṃsu, acchekkhiṃse, acchekkhiṃsu, acchekkhiṃse, acchekkhiṃsu, acchekkhiṃse, acchekkhiṃsu, acchekkhiṃse, acchekkhiṃsu, acchekkhiṃse, acchekkhiṃsu, acchekkhiṃse, acchekkhiṃsu, acchekkhiṃse, acchekkhiṃsu, acchekkhiṃse, acchekkhiṃsu,

original: checchāma, chindissāma.
analyzed: checchāma chindissāma
translated: We will cut, we will cut.

original: Ssādimhi-acchecchā, acchindissā, acchecchaṃsu, acchindissaṃsu.
analyzed: acchindissāḥ acchindissaṃsu
translated: In the future: We will cut, we will cut, we will cut, we will cut.

original: Bhida-vidāraṇe, bhindati, bhindanti.
analyzed: bhida vidāraṇe bhindati bhindanti
translated: Bhida - in the sense of splitting, he splits, they split.

original: Kamme-bhijjati, bhijjanti, bhijjare, bhindiyati, bhindiyanti.
analyzed: bhijjanti bhijjare
translated: In the root: It splits, they split, they will split, it is split, they are split.

original: Kārite-bhikkhū bhikkhūhi bhedeti mahāva. 107, bhedayati, bhedāpeti, bhedāpayati, bhindeti, bhindayati, bhindāpeti, bhindāpayati.
analyzed: kāritebhikkhū bhikkhūhi bhedeti bhedayati bhedāpeti bhedāpayati bhindeti bhindayati bhindāpeti bhindāpayati
translated: In the passive: The monks are split by the monks, the great one splits, it causes to split, it causes to be split, it splits, it causes to split, it causes to be split, it causes to be split.

original: Kamme-bhedīyati, bhedāpīyati.
analyzed: kammebhedīyati bhedāpīyati
translated: In the root: It is split, it is caused to be split.

original: Īādimhi-abhindi, bhindi, abhinduṃ, bhinduṃ, abhindiṃsu, bhindiṃsu.🔽Kamme-abhijji, bhijji, abhindiyi, bhindiyi.
analyzed: ī ādimhi abhindi bhindi abhindum bhindum abhindiṃsu bhindiṃsu  kamme abhijji bhijji abhindiyi bhindiyi
translated: In the past: It split, it split, it split, it split, they split, they split.🔽In the root: It was split, it was split, it was split, it was split.

original: Kārite-abhedesi, bhedesi, abhedayi, bhedayi, bhedāpesi, bhedāpayi.
analyzed: kārite abhedesi bhedesi abhedayi bhedayi bhedāpesi bhedāpayi
translated: In the passive: It was not split, it was split, it was caused to be split, it was caused to be split.

original: Ssatyādimhi-‘labhavasa…’iccādinā ssena saha dassa ccho, bhecchati, bhindissati, bhecchanti,
analyzed: s s s ti ādi mhi la bhava sai c ca ādinā s sena saha dassa cchaḥ bhecchati bhindissati bhecchanti
translated: In the future: ‘Labhavasa…’ and so on, with the ss, together with the future: It will cut, it will split, they will cut,

original: bhindissanti, bhecchasi, bhecchatha, bhecchāmi, bhecchāma, bhindissāma, “taṃ te paññāya
analyzed: bhindissanti bhecchasi bhecchatha bhecchāmi bhecchāma bhindissāma tam te paññāya
translated: they will split, you will cut, you will cut, you will cut, we will cut, we will split, “That to you by wisdom

original: bhecchāmī”ti su. ni. 445 pāḷi.
analyzed: bhecchāmi iti su ni
translated: In the future: “I will cut off, I will cut off,” etc.

original: Ssādimhi-acchecchā, acchindissāiccādi.🔽Bhuja-pālana, byavaharaṇesu, bhuñjati, bhuñjanti.
analyzed: acchindi ssā iccādi  bhuja pālana byavaharaṇesu bhuñjati bhuñjanti
translated: In the senses of “enjoying” and “transacting,” “he enjoys,” “they enjoy.”

original: Kamme-bhujjati, bhujjanti.🔽Kārite-bhojeti, bhojayati, bhojāpeti, bhojāpayati.🔽Kamme-bhojīyati, bhojāpīyati.
analyzed: bhujjanti  kāritebhojā iti bhojayati bhojāpa iti bhojāpayati  kammebhojīyati bhojāpīyati
translated: In the sense of action: “He enjoys,” “they enjoy.”🔽In the sense of causing to be done: “He causes to be enjoyed,” “he causes to be enjoyed,” “he causes to be enjoyed,” “he causes to be enjoyed.”🔽In the sense of action: “He is enjoyed,” “they are enjoyed,” “he is caused to be enjoyed,” “they are caused to be enjoyed.”

original: Ssatyādimhi-‘vacabhujamucavisānaṃ kkhaṅa’iti ssena saha dhātvantassa kkho, ādivuddhi, bhokkhati, bhuñjissati, bhokkhanti, bhokkhasi, bhokkhatha, bhokkhāmi, bhokkhāma, bhuñjissāma.
analyzed: ssati ādi mhi vaca bhuja muca visānam kkha ṅa eti ssena saha dhātu antassa kkhaḥ ādi vuddhi bhokkhati bhuñjissati bhokkhanti bhokkhasi bhokkhatha bhokkhāmi bhokkhāma bhuñjissāma
translated: In the sense of the future, etc.: “He will enjoy,” “he will enjoy,” “they will enjoy,” “he will enjoy,” “they will enjoy,” “I will enjoy,” “we will enjoy,” “we will enjoy.”

original: Ssādimhi-abhokkhā, abhuñjissā, abhokkhaṃsu, abhuñjissaṃsu iccādi.🔽Muca-mocane, muñcati, muñcanti, muñcare.
analyzed: ssa ādimhi a bhokkhā a bhuñjissā a bhokkhaṃsu a bhuñjissaṃsu iccādi  muca mocane muñcati muñcanti muñcare
translated: In the sense of the future, etc.: “He did not enjoy,” “he will not enjoy,” “he did not enjoy,” “they will not enjoy,” etc.🔽In the sense of “letting go,” “he lets go,” “they let go,” “they let go.”

original: Kamme-muccati, muccanti, muñcīyati, muñcīyanti.
analyzed: muccanti muñcīyati
translated: In the sense of action: “He is let go,” “they are let go,” “he is caused to be let go,” “they are caused to be let go.”

original: Kārite-mocāpeti, mocāpayati.
analyzed: mocāpayati
translated: In the sense of causing to be done: “He causes to be let go,” “he causes to be let go.”

original: Īādimhi-amuñci, muñci, amuñciṃsu, muñciṃsu.
analyzed: ī ādi mhi amuñci muñci amuñciṃsu muñciṃsu
translated: In the sense of the past, etc.: “He let go,” “he let go,” “they let go,” “they let go.”

original: Kārite-amocesi, mocesi, amocayi, mocayi, amocesuṃ, mocesuṃ, amocayuṃ, mocayuṃ, amociṃsu, mociṃsu, amocayiṃsu, mocayiṃsu.
analyzed: kārite amocesi mocesi amocayi mocayi amocesum mocesum amocayum mocayum amociṃsu mociṃsu amocayiṃsu mocayiṃsu
translated: He has yoked, he yokes, he has caused to yoke, he causes to yoke, they have yoked, they yoke, they have caused to yoke, they cause to yoke, they have yoked, they yoke, they have caused to yoke, they cause to yoke.

original: Ssatyādimhi-ssena saha cassa kkho, mokkhati, muñcissati, mokkhanti mārabandhanā dha. pa. 37. Na me samaṇa mokkhasi saṃ. ni. 1.140. Mokkhatha, mokkhāmi, mokkhāma, muñcissāma.
analyzed: saha cassa kkho mokkhati muñcissati mokkhanti māra bandhanāḥ na me samaṇa mokkhasi sam ni mokkhatha mokkhāmi mokkhāma muñcissāma
translated: In the case of ‘truth’ etc. – he is freed, he will free, they are freed, they will free, from the bonds of Māra, dhammas that are to be directly known, he is not freed, monk, saṃyojana, etc. .. They are freed, I am freed, we are freed, we will free.

original: Ssādimhi-amokkhā, mokkhā, amuñcissā, muñcissā, amokkhaṃsu, mokkhaṃsu, amuñcissaṃsu, muñcissaṃsu.
analyzed: ssa ādimhi a mokkhā mokkhā a muñcissā muñcissā a mokkhaṃsu mokkhaṃsu a muñcissaṃsu muñcissaṃsu
translated: In the case of ‘truth’ etc. – he is not freed, he is freed, he will not free, he will free, they have not freed, they have freed, they will not free, they will free.

original: Yuja-yoge, yuñjati buddhasāsane, ārabhatīti attho, yuñjanti, pamādamanuyuñjanti, bālā dummedhino janā dha. pa. 26. Yuñjasi, yuñjatha buddhasāsane saṃ. ni. 1.185. Yuñjāmi, yuñjāma.
analyzed: yuja yoge yuñjati buddha sāsane ārabhati iti atthaḥ yuñjanti pamādam anuyuñjanti bālāḥ dummedhinaḥ janāḥ buddha sāsane sam ni yuñjāmi yuñjāma
translated: In the case of ‘yoke’ – he is yoked, he yokes, he is diligent in the Buddha’s Dispensation, this is the meaning, they are diligent, they are diligent in heedlessness, foolish, unintelligent people, dhammas that are to be directly known, you are diligent, you are diligent in the Buddha’s Dispensation, saṃyojana, etc. .. I am diligent, we are diligent.

original: Kamme-yuñjīyati, yuñjīyanti.
analyzed: kammeyuñjīyati yuñjīyanti
translated: In the case of ‘action’ – he is diligent, they are diligent.

original: Kārite-yojeti, payojeti, niyojeti, uyyojeti, yojayati, payojayati, niyojayati, uyyojayati.
analyzed: kāriteyojā iti payojā iti niyojā iti uyyojā iti yojayati payojayati niyojayati uyyojayati
translated: In the case of ‘having yoked’ – he causes to yoke, he causes to be yoked, he causes to be directed, he causes to be sent forth, he causes to be yoked, he causes to be caused to be yoked, he causes to be directed, he causes to be sent forth.

original: Kamme-yojīyati, payojīyati, niyojīyati, uyyojīyati.🔽Rudha-āvaraṇe, rundhati, rundhiti, rundhīti, rundheti, rundhoti, rundhanti, orundhati,🔽avarundhati, rundhāpeti, rundhāpayati, avarodheti, avarodhayati, uparodheti, uparodhayati,🔽rodhāpeti, rodhāpayati.🔽Kamme-avarodhīyati iccādi.
analyzed: kammeyojīyati payojīyati niyojīyati uyyojīyati  rudhaḥ āvaraṇe rundhati rundhiti rundhi iti rundha iti rundhanti orundhati  avarundhati rundhāpa iti rundhāpayati avarodha iti avarodhayati uparodha iti uparodhayati  rodhāpa iti rodhāpayati  i t ca ādi
translated: In a (causative) action: is employed, is engaged, is appointed, is sent.

original: Lipa-limpane, limpati, limpanti.🔽Kamme-limpīyati.🔽Kārite-limpeti, limpayati, limpāpeti, limpāpayati, lepeti, lepayati, lepāpeti, lepāpayati iccādi.🔽Vida-paṭilābhe, vindati, vindanti.🔽Kamme-vindīyati, vindīyanti.🔽Kārite-vindeti, vindayati, vindāpeti, vindāpayahi.
analyzed: lipa limpane limpati limpanti  kammelimpīyati  kārite limpa iti limpayati limpāpeti limpāpayati lepeti lepayati lepāpeti lepāpayati iccādi  vida paṭilābhe vindati vindanti  kammevindīyati vindīyanti  kāritevinda iti vindayati vindāpa iti
translated: In closing up a hole: closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up,

analyzed: ī ādimhi avindi vindi udaṅgaṇe tattha avindum jā avindiṃsu vindiṃsu iccādi 🔽sica secane siñcati siñcanti 🔽siñcīyanti
translated: closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes up, closes

original: Kārite-siñceti, siñcayati, siñcāpeti, siñcāpayati, siñceyya vā siñcāpeyya vā pāci. 140 iccādi.
analyzed: kārite siñca iti siñcayati siñcāpa iti siñcāpayati siñceyya vā siñcāpeyya vā it cādi
translated: Siñceti, siñcayati, siñcāpeti, siñcāpayati, siñceyya vā siñcāpeyya vā pāci.

original: Subha-sampahāre, yo no gāvova sumbhati jā. 2.22.2132. Sumbhanti, sumbhasi, sumbhatha, bhūmiṃ sumbhāmi vegasā jā. 1.5.51, sumbhāma, sumbhiti, sumbhīti, sumbheti, sumbhoti iccādi.
analyzed: subha sampahāre yaḥ naḥ gāvaḥ iva sumbhati jāḥ sumbhanti sumbhasi sumbhatha bhūmim sumbhāmi vegasā jāḥ sumbhāma sumbhiti sumbhīti sumbha iti sumbha iti iccādi
translated: Subha-sampahāre, yo no gāvova sumbhati jā. .. Sumbhanti, sumbhasi, sumbhatha, bhūmiṃ sumbhāmi vegasā jā. .., sumbhāma, sumbhiti, sumbhīti, sumbheti, sumbhoti iccādi.

original: Gahadhātupi idha saṅgahitā. Gaha-upādāne. ‘Mañca rudhādīna’nti niggahītena saha lapaccayo.
analyzed: gaha dhātupi idha saṅgahitāḥ gaha aupādāne niggahītena saha la paccayaḥ
translated: The gaha-group is also included here. Gaha-upādāne. ‘Mañca rudhādīna’nti niggahītena saha lapaccayo.

original: 661. Ṇo niggahītassa ka. 490; rū. 518; nī. 982.
analyzed: ṇaḥ niggahītassa ka rū nī
translated: . Ṇo niggahītassa ka. ; rū. ; nī. .

original: Gahadhātumhi āgatassa niggahītassa ṇo hoti. Mahāvuttinā vikappena lassa dīgho.
analyzed: gaha dhātumhi āgatassa niggahītassa ṇaḥ hoti mahāvuttinā vikappena lassa dīghaḥ
translated: In the gaha-group, for the ṇo of the reduplicated syllable of the reduplicated aorist is lengthened by the rule of the Mahā-vutti.

original: Gaṇhāti, gaṇhati vā, gaṇhanti, gaṇhasi, gaṇhatha, gaṇhāmi, gaṇhāma.
analyzed: gaṇhāti gaṇhati vā gaṇhanti gaṇhasi gaṇhatha gaṇhāmi gaṇhāma
translated: Gaṇhāti, gaṇhati vā, gaṇhanti, gaṇhasi, gaṇhatha, gaṇhāmi, gaṇhāma.

original: Kamme-gaṇhīyati, gaṇhīyanti.
analyzed: kammegaṇhīyati gaṇhīyanti
translated: In the passive voice: gaṇhīyati, gaṇhīyanti.

original: ‘Hassa vipallāso’ti ha, yānaṃ vipariyāyo, gayhati, gayhanti, gayhare.
analyzed: vipallāsaḥ ti ha yānam vipariyāyaḥ gayhati gayhanti gayhare
translated: ‘Hassa vipallāso’ti ha, yānaṃ vipariyāyo, gayhati, gayhanti, gayhare.

original: Kārite-gāheti, gāhayati, gāhāpeti, gāhāpayati iccādi.
analyzed: kāritegāha iti gāhayati gāhāpa iti gāhāpayati iti ca ādi
translated: Kārite-gāheti, gāhayati, gāhāpeti, gāhāpayati iccādi.

original: 662. Gahassa gheppo ka. 489; rū. 519; nī. 901.
analyzed: gahassa gheppaḥ ka rū nī
translated: Gahassa gheppo ka. 489; rū. 519; nī. 901.

original: Nta, māna, tyādīsu gahassa gheppādeso hoti vā.
analyzed: nta māna tya ādīsu gahassa gha ippa ādesaḥ hoti vā
translated: In nta, māna, etc., the substitution of gheppādeso for gahassa is optional.

original: Gheppati, gheppanti.
analyzed: gheppati gheppanti
translated: Heppati, heppanti.

original: Kamme-gheppīyati, gheppīyanti.
analyzed: kammegheppīyati gheppīyanti
translated: In the passive: gheppīyati, gheppīyanti.

original: Īādimhi-agaṇhi, gaṇhi.
analyzed: ī ādi a gaṇhi gaṇhi
translated: In Īādimhi: aggahi, gaṇhi.

original: Mahāvuttinā niggahītalopo, iñaāgamassa ettaṃ, aggahesi, paṭiggahesi, anuggahesi, aggaṇhiṃsu, gaṇhiṃsu. Aggahesuṃ, paṭiggahesuṃ, anuggahesuṃ.
analyzed: mahāvuttinā niggahīta lopaḥ iña āgamassa ettam aggahesi paṭiggahesi anuggahesi aggaṇhiṃsu gaṇhiṃsu aggahesum paṭiggahesum anuggahesum
translated: The long vowel is suppressed by the Mahā-vutti. This is the reading of the Iṇāgama: aggahesi, paṭiggahesi, anuggahesi, aggahiṃsu, gahiṃsu. Aggahesuṃ, paṭiggahesuṃ, anuggahesuṃ.

original: Ssatyādimhi-gaṇhissati, gahessati, gaṇhissanti, gahessanti iccādi.
analyzed: ssati ādimhi gaṇhissati gahessati gaṇhissanti gahessanti iccādi
translated: In Ssatyādimhi: gaṇhissati, gahessati, gaṇhissanti, gahessanti, etc.

original: Rudhādigaṇo niṭṭhito.
analyzed: rudhādi gaṇaḥ niṭṭhitaḥ
translated: The group beginning with rudha is finished.

original: Divādigaṇa
analyzed: divādi gaṇa
translated: The group beginning with divā

original: Atha divādigaṇo vuccate.
analyzed: atha divādi gaṇaḥ vuccate
translated: Now the group beginning with divā is stated.

original: Idha dhātūnaṃ kamo antakkharavasena vattabbo sabbaso sadisarūpattā.🔽Muca, vica, yuja, luja, vija, gada, pada, mada, vida, idha, kudha, gidha, budha,
analyzed: idha dhātūnam kamaḥ anta kkhara vasena vattabbaḥ sabbaso sadisa rūpa ttā  muca vica yuja luja vija gada pada mada vida idha kudha gidha budha
translated: Here the order of the roots should be stated according to the last letter, because they are all similar in form.🔽Muca, vica, yuja, luja, vija, gada, pada, mada, vida, idha, kudha, gidha, budha,

original: yudha, vidha, sidha, sudha mana, hana, kupa, dīpa, lupa, vapa, supa, divu, sivu,
analyzed: yudha vidha sidha sudha mana hana kupa dīpa lupa vapa supa divu sivu
translated: yudha, vidha, sidha, sudha, mana, hana, kupa, dīpa, lupa, vapa, supa, divu, sivu,

original: tasa, tusa, disa, dusa, sisa, susa, daha, naha, muha.
analyzed: tasa tusa disa dusa sisa susa daha naha muha
translated: Tasa, tusa, disa, dusa, sisa, susa, daha, naha, muha.

analyzed: divā dīhi ya ka ka rū nī cam pā
translated: . By divā, etc., yaka ka. ; rū. ; nī. ; caṃ. ..; pā. ...

original: Divādīhi kriyatthehi kattari kānubandho yapaccayo hoti.
analyzed: div ādīhi kriyatthehi kattari ka anubandhaḥ ya paccayaḥ hoti
translated: The affix ya is added to the denominative verbs beginning with divā in the sense of the agent.

original: Dibbati.
analyzed: dibbati
translated: It shines.

original: Muca-muttiyaṃ, yassa pubbarūpattaṃ, muccati, vimuccati. Akammakattā suddhakammarūpaṃ na labbhati.
analyzed: mucamuttiyam yassa pubba rūpa ttam muccati vimuccati akammaka ttā suddha kamma rūpam na labbhati
translated: In the sense of release, the form of the past participle is muccati, vimuccati. Because it is not an action, pure action-form is not found.

original: Kārite-moceti, mocayati, mocāpeti, mocāpayati.🔽Kamme-mocīyati, mocāpīyati, muccatu, dukkhā muccantu.
analyzed: mocayati mocāpa iti mocāpayati  kammemocīyati mocāpīyati muccatu dukkhāḥ muccantu
translated: In the sense of the action, it is moceti, mocayati, mocāpeti, mocāpayati.🔽In the sense of the passive, it is mociyati, mocāpīyati. May it be released, may they be released from suffering.

original: Ssatyādimhi dhātvantassa kkho, mokkhati, mokkhanti.
analyzed: ssatya ādimhi dhātu antassa kkho mokkhati mokkhanti
translated: In the sense of truth, etc., the final vowel of the root is kkho, it is mokkhati, mokkhanti.

original: Vica-viveke, viviccati, viviccanti.🔽Kārite-viveceti, vivecayati, vivecāpeti, vivecāpayati.
analyzed: vica viveke viviccati viviccanti  vivecayati vivecāpa iti vivecāpayati
translated: In the sense of separation, it is viviccati, viviccanti.🔽In the sense of the action, it is viveceti, vivecayati, vivecāpeti, vivecāpayati.

original: Kamme-vivecīyati, vivecāpīyati iccādi.
analyzed: iti ca ādi
translated: In the sense of the passive, it is vivecīyati, vivecāpīyati, and so on.

original: Yuja-yuttiyaṃ, yujjati, yujjanti.🔽Luja-vināse, lujjati, lujjanti.
analyzed: yujayuttiyam yujjati yujjanti  luja vināse lujjati lujjanti
translated: In the sense of suitability, it is yujjati, yujjanti.🔽In the sense of destruction, it is lujjati, lujjanti.

original: Vija-bhaya, calanesu, saṃvijjati, saṃvijjanti.
analyzed: vijabhaya calanesu saṃvijjati saṃvijjanti
translated: In the sense of fear, trembling, it is saṃvijjati, saṃvijjanti.

original: Kārite-saṃvejeti, saṃvejayati, saṃvejenti, saṃvejayanti iccādi.
analyzed: saṃvejayati saṃvejenti saṃvejayanti iccādi
translated: He causes to be ashamed, causes to be ashamed, causes to be ashamed, causes to be ashamed.

original: Gada-gajjane, megho gajjati, gajjanti.
analyzed: gada gajjane meghaḥ gajjati gajjanti
translated: In the rumbling of thunder: The cloud rumbles, rumbles.

original: Pada-gatimhi, uppajjati, uppajjanti, nipajjati, vipajjati, sampajjati, āpajjati, samāpajjati, paṭipajjati.
analyzed: pada gatimhi uppajjati uppajjanti nipajjati vipajjati sampajjati āpajjati samāpajjati paṭipajjati
translated: In going: He arises, arise, he lies down, he fails, he succeeds, he falls into, he attains, he undertakes.

original: Kamme-tena āpatti āpajjati, jhānaṃ samāpajjati, maggo paṭipajjati.🔽Kyamhi parepi yaka hoti, tena āpatti āpajjīyati. Jhānaṃ samāpajjīyati, maggo paṭipajjīyati.
analyzed: kammetena āpatti āpajjati jhānam samāpajjati maggo paṭipajjati  kyamhi pare pi hoti tena āpatti āpajjīyati jhānam samāpajjīyati maggo paṭipajjīyati
translated: In action: By that he falls into an offence, he attains jhāna, he undertakes the path.🔽In the passive: By that he is made to fall into an offence, he is made to attain jhāna, he is made to undertake the path.

original: Kārite-uppādeti, uppādayati, nipphādeti, nipphādayati. Sampādeti, sampādayati, āpādeti, āpādayati, paṭipādeti, paṭipādayati, paṭipajjāpeti, paṭipajjāpayati.
analyzed: kārite uppādeti uppādayati nipphādeti nipphādayati sampādeti sampādayati āpādeti āpādayati paṭipādeti paṭipādayati paṭipajjāpeti paṭipajjāpayati
translated: In causing to be done: He causes to arise, causes to arise, he causes to be produced, causes to be produced, he causes to be accomplished, causes to be accomplished, he causes to be fallen into, causes to be fallen into, he causes to be undertaken, causes to be undertaken, he causes to be undertaken, causes to be undertaken.

original: Kamme-uppādīyati, nipphādīyati, sampādīyati, āpādīyati, paṭipādīyati.
analyzed: nipphādīyati sampādīyati āpādīyati paṭipādīyati
translated: In action: He is caused to arise, is caused to be produced, is caused to be accomplished, is caused to be fallen into, is caused to be undertaken.

original: Uppajjatu, uppajjantu, uppajjeyya, uppajjeyyuṃ, kinti nu kho saddhivihārikassa patto
analyzed: uppajjatu uppajjantu uppajjeyya uppajjeyyum kinti nu kho saddhivihārikassa patto
translated: May he arise, may they arise, may he arise, may they arise, how now, of the robe of the pupil

original: uppajjiyetha, cīvaraṃ uppajjiyetha, parikkhāro uppajjiyethāti mahāva. 67 imāni pana kattu, kammarūpāni.
analyzed: uppajjiyetha cīvaram uppajjiyetha parikkhāraḥ uppajjiyetha ati imāni pana kattu kamma rūpāni
translated: But these are the forms of the verb to be made, to be done:

original: Īādimhi-uppajji, nipajji, vipajji, sampajji, āpajji, samāpajji, paṭipajji.🔽664. Kvaci vikaraṇānaṃ ka. 517; rū. 488; nī. 1105.
analyzed: ī ādimhi uppajji nipajji vipajji sampajji āpajji samāpajji paṭipajji  kvaci vikaraṇa anam ka rū nī
translated: In the sense of arising: arose, lay down, was scattered, was collected, was reached, was attained, was undertaken.

original: Vikaraṇānaṃ kvaci lopo hoti.
analyzed: vikaraṇānām kvaci lopaḥ
translated: In some verbs of the class of “to do” the reduplication is dropped.🔽Eye arose, knowledge arose, clear vision arose, light arose, they arose, they lay down.

original: Cakkhuṃ udapādi, ñāṇaṃ udapādi, vijjā udapādi, āloko udapādi saṃ. ni. 5.1081 iccādi, uppajjiṃsu, nipajjiṃsu.🔽Mada-ummāde, majjati, majjanti.
analyzed: cakkhum udapādi ñāṇam udapādi vijjā udapādi ālokaḥ udapādi sam ni iccādi uppajjiṃsu nipajjiṃsu  madaummāde majjati majjanti
translated: In the sense of being intoxicated: he is intoxicated, they are intoxicated.

original: Vida-sattāyaṃ, vijjati, saṃvijjati.🔽Idha-samiddhiyaṃ, ijjhati, samijjhati.
analyzed: vidasattā ayam vijjati saṃvijjati  ijjhati samijjhati
translated: In the sense of existing: it exists, they exist.🔽In the sense of being successful: it succeeds, they succeed.

original: Kudha-kope, kujjhati, kujjhanti.
analyzed: kudha kope kujjhati kujjhanti
translated: In the sense of being angry: he is angry, they are angry.

original: Budha-avagamane, bujjhati, sambujjhati.
analyzed: budha avagamane bujjhati sambujjhati
translated: In the sense of understanding: he understands, they understand.

original: Paṭipubbo niddakkhaye vikasane ca, paṭibujjhati.
analyzed: paṭipubbaḥ nidda khaye vikasane ca paṭibujjhati
translated: In the sense of waking up from sleep and in the sense of blossoming: he wakes up.

original: Kamme-tena dhammo bujjhati, dhammā bujjhanti, bujjhare, bujjhīyati, bujjhīyanti.
analyzed: kammetena dhammaḥ bujjhati dhammāḥ bujjhanti bujjhare bujjhīyati bujjhīyanti
translated: In the sense of action: the Dhamma is understood, the dhammas are understood, they are understood, it is understood, they are understood.

original: Kārite-bodheti, bodhayati, bodhāpeti, bodhāpayati, bujjhāpeti, bujjhāpayati.
analyzed: bodhayati bodhāpeti bodhāpayati bujjhāpeti bujjhāpayati
translated: He causes to be awakened, he awakens, he causes to be caused to awaken, he causes to be caused to awaken, he causes to be understood, he causes to be caused to understand.

original: Yudha-sampahāre, mallo mallena saddhiṃ yujjhati, dve senā yujjhanti, dve meṇḍā yujjhanti, dve usabhā yujjhanti, dve hatthino yujjhanti, dve kukkuṭā yujjhanti.
analyzed: yudha sampahāre mallaḥ mallena saddhim yujjhati dve senāḥ yujjhanti dve meṇḍāḥ yujjhanti dve usabhāḥ yujjhanti dve hatthinaḥ yujjhanti dve kukkuṭāḥ yujjhanti
translated: In the sense of fighting: a wrestler fights with a wrestler, two armies fight, two rams fight, two bulls fight, two elephants fight, two cocks fight.

original: Kamme-yujjhīyati, yujjhīyanti.
analyzed: kammeyujjhīyati yujjhīyanti
translated: In the sense of being employed: he is employed, they are employed.

original: Kārite-yodheti, yodhayati, yujjhāpeti, yujjhāpayati, “yodhetha māraṃ paññāvudhenā”ti dha. pa. 40 pāḷi.
analyzed: yodhayati yujjhāpeti yujjhāpayati yodhetha māram paññāvudhena ati dha pa
translated: He causes to be fought, he fights, he causes to be caused to fight, he causes to be caused to fight, “Fight Māra with the sword of wisdom” .

original: Vidha-tāḷane, sarena migaṃ vijjhati, dhammaṃ paṭivijjhati, paṭivijjhanti.
analyzed: vidhatāḷane sarena migam vijjhati dhammam paṭivijjhati paṭivijjhanti
translated: In the sense of piercing: he pierces with an arrow, he pierces the Dhamma, they pierce.

original: Kamme kattusadisampi rūpaṃ hoti, tena dhammo paṭivijjhati, dhammā paṭivijjhanti, paṭivijjhīyati, paṭivijjhīyanti.🔽Kārite-vedheti, vedhayati, paṭivedheti, paṭivedhayati, iccādi.
analyzed: kamme kattu sadisam pi rūpam hoti tena dhammaḥ paṭivijjhati dhammā paṭivijjhanti paṭivijjhīyati paṭivijjhīyanti  kāritevedha iti vedhayati paṭivedha iti paṭivedhayati iccādi
translated: In the sense of work: the form is like the verb, therefore the Dhamma is pierced, the dhammas are pierced, he is pierced, they are pierced.🔽In the sense of being caused to be pierced: he causes to be pierced, he pierces, he causes to be penetrated, he causes to be penetrated, and so on.

original: Sidha-saṃsiddhiyaṃ, sijjhati, sijjhanti, sijjhare.
analyzed: sijjhati sijjhanti
translated: In the sense of success: he succeeds, they succeed, they would succeed.

original: Kārite mahāvuttinā issa āttaṃ, sādheti, sādhayati, sādhenti, sādhayanti.
analyzed: kārite mahāvuttinā isse āttam sādheti sādhayati sādhenti sādhayanti
translated: In the meaning of ‘having done the great recitation’ (mahāvutti) issa āttaṃ, sādheti, sādhayati, sādhenti, sādhayanti.

original: Kamme-sādhīyati, sādhīyanti iccādi.
analyzed: sādhīyanti iti cādi
translated: In the sense of ‘accomplishing’ (sādhana) in a deed (kamma) sādhīyati, sādhīyanti, etc.

original: Sudha-suddhiyaṃ, sujjhati, sujjhanti, visujjhati, parisujjhati.
analyzed: sujjhati sujjhanti visujjhati parisujjhati
translated: In the sense of ‘purification’ (sudhi) sujjhati, sujjhanti, visujjhati, parisujjhati.

original: Kārite-sodheti, sodhayati.
analyzed: sodhayati
translated: In the sense of ‘having done’ (kārita) sodheti, sodhayati.

original: Mana-maññanāyaṃ, maññati, avamaññati, atimaññati, maññanti, avamaññanti, atimaññanti iccādi.
analyzed: mana maññanā ayam maññati avamaññati atimaññati maññanti avamaññanti atimaññanti iccādi
translated: In the sense of ‘conceiving’ (maññana) maññati, avamaññati, atimaññati, maññanti, avamaññanti, atimaññanti, etc.

original: Hana-vighāta, saṅghātesu, haññati, vihaññati, haññanti, vihaññanti iccādi.
analyzed: hana vighāta saṅghātesu haññati vihaññati haññanti vihaññanti iccādi
translated: In the sense of ‘destruction’ (hana) and ‘mass’ (saṅghāta) haññati, vihaññati, haññanti, vihaññanti, etc.

original: Kupa-kope, paro parassa kuppati, kucchivāto kuppati, rogo kuppati, paṭikuppati, tejodhātu pakuppati ma. ni. 1.305.
analyzed: kupa kope paraḥ parassa kuppati kucchi vātaḥ kuppati rogaḥ kuppati paṭikuppati tejaḥ dhātu pakuppati
translated: In the sense of ‘anger’ (kūpa) and ‘hatred’ (kopa) paro parassa kuppati, kucchivāto kuppati, rogo kuppati, paṭikuppati, tejodhātu pakuppati, etc.

original: Kārite-kopeti, kopayati iccādi.
analyzed: kārita ikopa iti kopayati iti ca ādi
translated: In the sense of ‘having done’ (kārita) kopeti, kopayati, etc.

original: Dīpa-dittiyaṃ, dippati, dippanti, pure adhammo dippati cūḷava. 437.🔽Kamme-dīpīyati, dīpīyanti.
analyzed: dīpa dittiyam dippati dippanti pure adhammaḥ dippati cūḷava  kammedīpīyati dīpīyanti
translated: In the sense of ‘light’ (dīpa) and ‘vision’ (ditti) dippati, dippanti, pure adhammo dippati, etc.🔽In the sense of ‘shining’ (dīpana) in a deed (kamma) dīpīyati, dīpīyanti.

original: Kārite garupantattā na vuddhi, dīpeti, dīpayati, dīpenti, dīpayanti iccādi.
analyzed: kārite dīpeti dīpayati dīpenti dīpayanti iccādi
translated: In the sense of ‘having done’ (kārita) dīpeti, dīpayati, dīpenti, dīpayanti, etc.

original: Lupa-adassane, luppati, luppanti.🔽Kārite-lopeti, lopayati iccādi.
analyzed: lupa a dassane luppati luppanti  kāritelopa iti lopayati i t ca ādi
translated: In the sense of not seeing, it lapses, they lapse.🔽In the sense of making lapse, it causes to lapse, they cause to lapse, etc.

original: Vapa-bījanikkhepe, vappati, vappanti iccādi.
analyzed: vapa bīja nikkhepe vappati vappanti iccādi
translated: In the sense of sowing seed, it grows, they grow, etc.

original: Supa-suppane, suppati, suppanti.
analyzed: supasuppane suppati
translated: In the sense of pressing, it presses, they press.

original: Mahāvuttinā ādivuddhi, soppati, soppanti.
analyzed: mahāvuttinā
translated: In the sense of great growth, it grows, they grow.

original: Samu-upasame nivāse ca, sammati, visammati, upasammati, vūpasammati, assame sammati, yattha sammati temiyo jā. 2.22.73, sammanti. Kārite na vuddhi, sameti, vūpasameti iccādi.
analyzed: nivāse ca sammati visammati upasammati vūpasammati assame sammati sammati sameti vūpasameti iccādi
translated: In the sense of pacification, abiding, and seclusion, it is pacified, it is not pacified, it is pacified, it is thoroughly pacified, it is pacified in seclusion, where it is pacified, there is a good path, it is pacified. In the sense of making pacified, it is pacified, it is thoroughly pacified, etc.

original: Divu-kīḷāyaṃ vijigīsāyaṃ byavahāre thuti, kanti, gati, sattīsu ca, ‘tavaggavaraṇānaṃ🔽ye cavaggabayañā’ti yamhi vassa battaṃ, ‘vaggalasehi te’ti yassa battaṃ, dibbati, dibbanti iccādi.
analyzed: vijigīsāyam byavahāre thuti kanti gati sattīsu ca  ye ca vagga bayañā ati yamhi vassa battam vagga lasehi te ti yassa battam dibbati dibbanti iccādi
translated: In the sense of playing, conquering, dealing, liking, going, and being strong, it rains, they rain.

original: Sivu-saṃsibbane, sibbati, sibbanti, sibbeyya vā sibbāpeyya vā pāci. 176 iccādi.
analyzed: sivu saṃsibbane sibbati sibbanti sibbeyya vā sibbāpeyya vā iccādi
translated: In the sense of sewing, it sews, they sew, one should sew, one should cause to sew, one cooks, etc.

original: Tasa-santāse, tassati.
analyzed: tasa santāse tassati
translated: In the sense of tormenting, it torments.

original: Mahāvuttinā tassa trattaṃ, utrassati, ubbijjatīti attho. Tassati, paritassati, pipāsatīti attho.
analyzed: mahāvuttinā tassa trattam utrassati ubbijjati iti attho tassati paritassati pipāsati iti attho
translated: The meaning is: he is frightened, he is terrified, he is terrified of it. The meaning is: he is anxious, he is thirsty.

original: Kārite-tāseti, tāsayati iccādi.
analyzed: tāsayati i t ca ādi
translated: He causes anxiety, he causes fear, etc.

original: Tusa-pītimhi, tussati, santussati.🔽Kammepi-tussati, santussati, tussīyati.
analyzed: tusa pītimhi tussati santussati  kammepitussati santussati tussīyati
translated: In the sense of delight, satisfaction, he delights, he is satisfied.🔽In the sense of action, he delights, he is satisfied, he is delighted.

original: Kārite-toseti, tosayati iccādi.
analyzed: tosayati i t ca ādi
translated: He causes satisfaction, he causes delight, etc.

original: Disa-paññāyane, dissati, padissati, sandissati. Dissanti bālā abyattā mahāva. 76,
analyzed: disapaññāyane dissati padissati sandissati dissanti bālāḥ abyattāḥ
translated: In the sense of showing, appearing, he appears, he will appear, he will show. Fools and the inexperienced, etc.

original: nimittāni padissanti bu. vaṃ. 2.82, ime dhammā mayi sandissanti, ahañca imesu dhammesu
analyzed: nimittāni ime dhammā mayi sandissanti aham ca imesu dhammesu
translated: Signs will appear, etc. These states appear in me, and I appear in these states.

original: sandissāmi ma. ni. 3.253 (thokaṃ visadisaṃ).
analyzed: sandissāmi ma ni thokam visadisam
translated: (Slightly different.)

original: Dusa-paṭighāte, dussati. Dosaneyyesu dussati. Padussati, dussanti, padussanti.
analyzed: dusa paṭighāte dussati dosaneyyesu dussati padussati dussanti padussanti
translated: In the sense of opposing, he opposes. He opposes those who should be opposed. He opposes, they oppose, they oppose.

original: Kārite dīgho, dūseti, dūsayati.
analyzed: kārite dīghaḥ dūsa iti dūsayati
translated: In the sense of long, he defiles. He defiles, he causes to defile.

original: Kamme-dūsīyati iccādi.
analyzed: it ca ādi
translated: In the sense of action, he is defiled, etc.

original: Sisa-asabbayoge, sissati, avasissati. Sarīrāni avasissanti.
analyzed: sisa asabba yoge sissati avasissati sarīrāni avasissanti
translated: In the sense of not being mixed up, he remembers, he remembers. Bodies will remain.

original: Kārite-seseti, sesayati iccādi.
analyzed: kāri tesesa iti sesayati it cādi
translated: He causes to remember, he causes to recollect, etc.

original: Susa-sussane, sussati. Aṭṭhi ca nhāru ca cammañca avasissatu, upasussatu me sarīre maṃsalohitaṃ ma. ni. 2.184 (thokaṃ visadisaṃ) iccādi.
analyzed: susasussane sussati aṭṭhi ca nhāru ca cammañca avasissatu upasussatu me sarīre maṃsa lohitam ma ni thokam visadisam iccādi
translated: In susa-sussana, it dries up, it dries. Bone, sinew, and hide remain, let the flesh and blood dry up in my body.

original: Daha-dāhe, ha, yānaṃ vipariyāyo, dayhati, dayhanti, ekacitakamhi dayhare.
analyzed: daha dāhe ha yānam vipariyāyaḥ dayhati dayhanti
translated: In daha-dāha, it burns, they burn, they burn in one fire.

original: Kārite-dāheti, dāhayati iccādi.
analyzed: kāritā idāha iti dāhayati it ca ādi
translated: In kārite-dāha, it burns.

original: Naha-bandhane, sannayhati, sannayhanti iccādi.
analyzed: naha bandhane sannayhati sannayhanti iti ca ādi
translated: In naha-bandhana, it is bound, it is bound.

original: Muha-muyhane, muyhati, sammuyhati, sammuyhāmi, pamuyhāmi. Sabbā muyhanti me disā jā. 2.22.2185.
analyzed: muha muyhane muyhati sammuyhati sammuyhāmi pamuyhāmi sabbā muyhanti me disā jā
translated: In muha-muyhana, it is deluded, it is deluded, I am deluded, I am deluded. All directions are deluded to me.

original: Kārite-moheti, mohayati iccādi.
analyzed: mohayati iti ca ādi
translated: In kārite-moha, it deludes.

original: Divādigaṇo niṭṭhito.
analyzed: divādi gaṇaḥ niṭṭhitaḥ
translated: The group of words beginning with ‘divā’ is finished.

original: Svādigaṇa
analyzed: su ādi gaṇa
translated: The group of words beginning with ‘svā’

original: Atha svādigaṇo vuccate.
analyzed: atha su ādi gaṇaḥ vuccate
translated: Now the group of words beginning with ‘svā’ is said.

original: Gi, ci, mi, vu, su, hi, āpa, saka.
analyzed: gi ci mi vu su hi āpa saka
translated: Gi, ci, mi, vu, su, hi, āpa, saka.

original: ‘Kā’ti vattate.
analyzed: kā ati vattate
translated: ‘Kā’ is said.

original: 665. Svādito kṇo ka. 448; rū. 512; nī. 929; caṃ. 1.1.95; pā. 3.1.74; ‘svādīhi…’ (bahūsu).
analyzed: svādito kṇo ka rū nī cam pā svādīhi bahūsu
translated: . In svādita, kṇo is ka; rū; nī; caṃ; pā; ‘svādīhi’ (in many).

original: Svādīhi kriyatthehi paraṃ kānubandhā ṇā, ṇo iti dve paccayā honti.
analyzed: su ādīhi kriyatthehi param ka anubandhā ṇā ṇo iti dve paccayāḥ honti
translated: With svādīhi in the sense of ‘doing’, two endings are made, ṇā, ṇo, after kā is connected.

original: 666. Na te kānubandhanāgamesu.
analyzed: na te ka anubandhana āgamesu
translated: . Not in the words connected with kā.🔽.

original: Ivaṇṇu’vaṇṇānaṃ akārassa ca te e, o, ā na honti kānubandhanāgamesu paresūti vuddhipaṭisedho.
analyzed: akārassa ca te e o ā na honti ka anubandhana āgamesu paresu iti vuddhi paṭisedhaḥ
translated: The augment e is not added to the vowel i and to the vowel u, and the augment o is not added to the vowel a, in the following words, which are formed by the addition of the verbal nouns kamma, bandhana, and para.

original: Suṇāti, suṇoti.
analyzed: suṇāti suṇoti
translated: Suṇāti, suṇoti.🔽In the root giṇ, the augment ṇ is not added by the rule given above, and the augment ṇ is added by the rule given below.

original: Gi-sadde, giṇāti, giṇoti, anugiṇāti, paṭigiṇāti.
analyzed: gi sadde giṇāti giṇoti anugiṇāti paṭigiṇāti
translated: Giṇāti, giṇoti, anugiṇāti, paṭigiṇāti.🔽The first syllable is elided in the following words.

original: Pubbassaralopo, anugiṇanti, paṭigiṇanti.
analyzed: pubbassara lopaḥ anugiṇanti paṭigiṇanti
translated: Anugiṇanti, paṭigiṇanti.🔽In the root cin, the augment ṇ is not added by the rule given above, and the augment ṇ is added by the rule given below.

original: Ci-caye, mahāvuttinā ṇassa nattaṃ, vaḍḍhakī pākāraṃ cināti, cinoti, ācināti, ācinoti, apacināti, apacinoti, viddhaṃsetīti attho.
analyzed: cicaye mahāvuttinā ṇassa nattam vaḍḍhakī pākāram cināti cinoti ācināti ācinoti apacināti apacinoti viddhaṃseti iti atthaḥ
translated: Vaḍḍhakī pākāraṃ cināti, cinoti, ācināti, ācinoti, apacināti, apacinoti, viddhaṃsetīti attho.🔽The first syllable is elided in the following words.

original: Pubbassaralopo, cinanti, ācinanti, apacinanti.
analyzed: pubbassara lopaḥ cinanti ācinanti apacinanti
translated: Cinanti, ācinanti, apacinanti.

original: Kamme-cīyati, ācīyati, apacīyati, cinīyati, ācinīyati, apacinīyati.
analyzed: ācīyati apacīyati cinīyati ācinīyati apacinīyati
translated: In the passive voice, cīyati, ācīyati, apacīyati, cinīyati, ācinīyati, apacinīyati.

original: Kārite-cayāpeti, cayāpayati, cināpeti, cināpayati iccādi.
analyzed: cayāpayati cināpayati iti cināpayati it ca ādi
translated: In the causative, cayāpeti, cayāpayati, cināpeti, cināpayati, etc.🔽In the root miṇ, the augment ṇ is not added by the rule given above, and the augment ṇ is added by the rule given below.

original: Mi-pakkhepe, miṇāti, miṇoti, mināti, minoti vā.
analyzed: mipa kkhepe miṇāti miṇoti mināti minoti vā
translated: Miṇāti, miṇoti, mināti, minoti.🔽In the root vuṇ, the augment ṇ is not added by the rule given above, and the augment ṇ is added by the rule given below.

original: Vu-saṃvaraṇe, saṃvuṇāti, saṃvuṇoti, āvuṇāti, āvuṇoti.
analyzed: saṃvuṇāti saṃvuṇoti āvuṇāti āvuṇoti
translated: Saṃvuṇāti, saṃvuṇoti, āvuṇāti, āvuṇoti.🔽In the root suṇ, the augment ṇ is not added by the rule given above, and the augment ṇ is added by the rule given below.

original: Su-savane, suṇāti, suṇoti, suṇanti, suṇāsi, suṇosi.
analyzed: su savane suṇāti suṇoti suṇanti suṇāsi suṇosi
translated: Suṇāti, suṇoti, suṇanti, suṇāsi, suṇosi.

original: Rassatte-suṇasi nāga mahāva. 126. Suṇātha, suṇotha, suṇāmi, suṇomi, suṇāma, suṇoma.🔽Kamme ‘dīgho sarassā’ti kyamhi dīgho, sūyati, suyyati, sūyanti, suyyanti, suṇīyati, suṇīyanti.
analyzed: nāga mahāva suṇātha suṇotha suṇāmi suṇomi suṇāma suṇoma  kamme dīghaḥ sarassāti kyamhi dīghaḥ sūyati suyyati sūyanti suyyanti suṇīyati suṇīyanti
translated: Do you hear, O serpent, very well.🔽Listen, listen, I hear, I hear, we hear, we hear.🔽In the verb ‘long’ in the sense of ‘hearing’ is long, it is heard, it is heard, they are heard, they are heard, it is heard, they are heard.

original: Kārite-sāveti, anusāveti, sāvayati, anusāvayati, suṇāpeti, suṇāpayati.
analyzed: kāritesāva iti anusāva iti sāvayati anusāvayati suṇāpa iti suṇāpayati
translated: In the passive it is caused to hear, it is caused to hear, it is caused to hear, it is caused to hear, it is caused to hear, it is caused to hear, it is heard, it should be heard, they should hear, it would be heard, it would be heard, they would hear, they would hear, it would be caused to hear, they would be caused to hear.

original: Kamme-sāvīyati, anusāvīyati.🔽Suṇātu, suṇantu, suyyatu, suyyantu, sāvetu, sāventu, suṇe, suṇeyya, suṇeyyuṃ, sūyeyya, suyyeyya, sūyeyyuṃ, suyyeyuṃ, sāveyya, sāveyyuṃ.
analyzed: kammesāvīyati anusāvīyati  suṇātu suṇantu suyyatu suyyantu sāvetu sāventu suṇe suṇeyya suṇeyyum sūyeyya suyyeyya sūyeyyum suyyeyum sāveyya sāveyyum
translated: In the passive it is caused to be heard, it is caused to be heard.🔽Let him hear, let them hear, let it be heard, let them be heard, let it be caused to hear, let them be caused to hear, let it be heard, let it be heard, let them be heard, let it be heard, let it be heard, let them be heard, let them be heard, let it be caused to hear, let them be caused to hear.

original: Īādimhi-asuṇi, suṇi.
analyzed: ī ādi mhi a suṇi suṇi
translated: In the present and future tenses it is heard, it is heard.

original: 667. Tesu suto kṇokṇānaṃ roṭa ka. 517; rū. 488; nī. 1105.
analyzed: tesu sutaḥ kṇokṇānam roṭa ka ru
translated: Among them, the heard is the kṇokṇānaṃ roṭa ka. ; rū. ; nī. .

original: Tesu īādīsu ssakāravantesu ca vacanesu sudhātuto paresaṃ kṇo, kṇānaṃ roṭa hoti, rānubandho sabbādesadīpanattho. ‘Rānubandhentasarādissā’ti suttena ādisarassa lopo, dvittaṃ.
analyzed: tesu ī ādīsu ssakāra vantesu ca vacanesu su dhātutaḥ paresam kṇaḥ kṇānam hoti ra anubandhaḥ sabba ādesa dīpana tthaḥ suttena ādi sarassa lopaḥ dvittam
translated: Among them, in the present and future tenses and in the verbs ending in ssak, the kṇo, kṇānaṃ roṭa is formed from the heard, the rānubandha is for the purpose of indicating all the places. By the rule ‘rānubandhentasarādissa’, the initial r of the present and future tenses is elided, the second.

original: Assosi, assosuṃ, assosi, assosittha, assosiṃ, assosimhā, assosumhā, assosittha iccādi.
analyzed: assosi assosum assosi assosittha assosim assosimhā assosumhā assosittha iccādi
translated: Assosi, assosuṃ, assosi, assosittha, assosiṃ, assosimhā, assosumhā, assosittha, etc.

original: Ssatyādimhi-suṇissati, sossati, suṇissanti, sossanti, suṇissasi, sossasi, suṇissatha, sossatha, suṇissāmi, sossāmi, suṇissāma, sossāma. Evaṃ parachakke.
analyzed: ssatya ādimhi su ṇissati sossati su ṇissanti sossanti su ṇissasi sossasi su ṇissatha sossatha su ṇissāmi sossāmi su ṇissāma sossāma evam para chakke
translated: In the future tense: Suṇissati, sossati, suṇissanti, sossanti, suṇissasi, sossasi, suṇissatha, sossatha, suṇissāmi, sossāmi, suṇissāma, sossāma. So also in the other person’s tense.

original: Ssādimhi-asuṇissā, asossā, asuṇissaṃsu, sossaṃsu iccādi.
analyzed: ssa ādi mhi asu ossā asu sossaṃsu iccādi
translated: In the past tense: Asuṇissā, asossā, asuṇissaṃsu, sossāṃsu, etc.

original: Papubbo hi-pesane, pahiṇāti, pahiṇoti, pahiṇanti.
analyzed: papubbaḥ hi pesane pahiṇāti pahiṇoti pahiṇanti
translated: In the future of the future: Pesane, pahiṇāti, pahiṇoti, pahiṇanti.

original: Īādimhi-dūtaṃ pahiṇi, pahiṇiṃsu, ‘kvaci vikaraṇāna’nti vikaraṇalopo, mahāvuttinā passa dīgho, dūtaṃ pāhesi pārā. 297; mahāva. 198, pāhesuṃ iccādi.
analyzed: ī ādi mhi dūtam pahiṇi pahiṇiṃsu kvaci vikaraṇān anti vikaraṇa lopaḥ mahāvuttinā passa dīghaḥ dūtam pāhesi pārā  /
translated: In the present of the future: Pahiṇi, pahiṇiṃsu, ‘Kvaci vikaraṇāna’nti vikaraṇalopo, mahāvuttinā passa dīgho, dūtaṃ pāhesi pārā. ; mahāva. , pāhesuṃ, etc.

original: Āpa-pāpuṇane papubbo –🔽668. Sakāpānaṃ kukku kṇe ka. 517; rū. 488; nī. 1105; “…kukakū ṇe” (bahūsu).🔽Saka, āpadhātūnaṃ kānubandhā kukāra, ukārā kamena āgamā honti kṇamhi paccaye.
analyzed: āpa pāpuṇane papubbaḥ  saka apānam kukku kṇe ka rū nī kukakū ṇe bahūsu  sakaḥ āpa dhātūnam ka anubandhā kukāra ukārā kamena āgamāḥ honti kṇamhi paccaye
translated: Āpa is the root for reaching.

original: Pāpuṇoti, pāpuṇanti, sampāpuṇanti.
analyzed: pāpuṇoti pāpuṇanti sampāpuṇanti
translated: The k of kukku is the k of the k of kukku, the u of kukku is the u of kukku, the k of kukku is the k of kukku, the k of kukku is the k of kukku, the k of kukku is the k of kukku, the k of kukku is the k of kukku, the k of kukku is the k of kukku, the k of kukku is the k of kukku, the k of kukku is the k of kukku, the k of kukku is the k of kukku, the k of kukku is the k of kukku, the k of kukku is the k of kukku, the k of kukku is the k of kukku, the k of kukku is the k of kukku, the k of kukku is the k of kukku, the k of kukku is the k of kukku, the k of kukku is the k of kukku, the k of kukku is the k of kukku, the k of kukku is the k of kukku, the k of kukku is the k of kukku, the k of kukku is the k of kukku, the k of kukku is the k of kukku, the k of kukku

original: Paripubbo pariyattiyaṃ, pariyāpuṇāti, pariyāpuṇanti.
analyzed: paripubbaḥ pariyattiyam pariyāpuṇāti pariyāpuṇanti
translated: The p.p. of pari + puñj is paripuṭṭha, he has studied much, he has learned much.

original: Saṃpubbo-samāpuṇāti, parisamāpuṇāti, niṭṭhānaṃ gacchatīti attho.
analyzed: parisamāpuṇāti niṭṭhānam gacchati iti attho
translated: The p.p. of sam + puñj is saṃpuṭṭha, he has learned, he has fully learned, the meaning is he has completed.

original: Kṇeti kiṃ? Pappoti.
analyzed: kim
translated: What is the p.p. of k + puñj? He obtains.

original: Kamme-pāpīyati, pāpīyanti.
analyzed: kammepāpīyati pāpīyanti
translated: In the kammadh. he is puñjīyati, puñjīyanti.

original: Kārite-pāpeti, pāpayati, pāpenti, pāpayanti.
analyzed: pāpayati pāpenti pāpayanti
translated: In the kārita he is pāpeti, pāpayati, pāpenti, pāpayanti.

original: Kamme-pāpīyati, pāpīyanti.
analyzed: kammepāpīyati pāpīyanti
translated: In the kammadh. he is puñjīyati, puñjīyanti.

original: Īādimhi-pāpuṇi, pāpuṇiṃsu iccādi.
analyzed: ī ādi mhi pāpuṇi pāpuṇiṃsu it ca ādi
translated: In the 1st sing. he is puñji, puñjimsu, etc.

original: Saka-sattiyaṃ, sakkuṇoti, sakkuṇāti.
analyzed: sakasattiyam sakkuṇoti sakkuṇāti
translated: In the sak-sattiya he is sakkoti, sakkuṇāti.

original: Kṇeti kiṃ? Sakkoti, sakkuṇanti.
analyzed: kim sakkoti sakkuṇanti
translated: What is the p.p. of k + puñj? He is sakkoti, sakkuṇanti.

original: Īādimhi-asakkuṇi, sakkuṇi, asakkuṇiṃsu, sakkuṇiṃsu.
analyzed: ī ādimhi a sakkuṇi sakkuṇi a sakkuṇiṃsu sakkuṇiṃsu
translated: In the 1st sing. he is asakkuṇi, sakkuṇi, asakkuṇiṃsu, sakkuṇiṃsu.

original: 669. Sakā kṇāssa kho īādo ‘…ṇāssa kha…” (bahūsu).🔽Sakamhā parassa kṇāssa kho hoti īādimhi.🔽Asakkhi, sakkhi, asakkhiṃsu, sakkhiṃsu iccādi.
analyzed: sakā bahūsu  sakamhā parassa kṇāssa kho hoti ī ādimhi  asakkhi sakkhi asakkhiṃsu sakkhiṃsu iccādi
translated: In the sak-k-k-n-a, in the 1st sing. he is sakko, sakkhasi, sakkhasiṃsu, sakkhasiṃsu.🔽In the sak-k-k-n-a, in the 1st sing. he is sakko, sakkhasi, sakkhasiṃsu, sakkhasiṃsu.🔽In the sak-k-k-n-a, in the 1st sing. he is sakko, sakkhasi, sakkhasiṃsu, sakkhasiṃsu.🔽In the sak-k-k-n-a, in the 1st sing. he is sakko, sakkhasi, sakkhasiṃsu, sakkhasiṃsu.

original: 670. Sse vā ka. 517; rū. 488; nī. 1105.🔽Sakamhā parassa kṇassa kho hoti vā sse pare.
analyzed: s s e vā ka rū nī 🔽sakamhā parassa kṇassa khaḥ hoti vā sse pare
translated: In the sak-k-k-n-a, in the 1st sing. he is sakko, sakkhasi, sakkhasiṃsu, sakkhasiṃsu.🔽In the sak-k-k-n-a, in the 1st sing. he is sakko, sakkhasi, sakkhasiṃsu, sakkhasiṃ

original: Sakkhissati, sakkuṇissati, sakkhissanti, sakkuṇissanti, sakkhissasi, sakkhissatha, sakkhissāmi, sakkhissāma, sakkuṇissāma.
analyzed: sakkhissati sakkuṇissati sakkhissanti sakkuṇissanti sakkhissasi sakkhissatha sakkhissāmi sakkhissāma sakkuṇissāma
translated: Sakkhissati, sakkuṇissati, sakkhissanti, sakkuṇissanti, sakkhissasi, sakkhissatha, sakkhissāmi, sakkhissāma, sakkuṇissāma.

original: ‘Dakkha sakkha hehi hohīhi lopo’ti ssassa vikappena lopo, sakkhiti, sakkhissati, sakkhinti, sakkhissanti.
analyzed: dakkha sakkha hehi hohīhi lopaḥ iti ssassa vikappena lopaḥ sakkhiti sakkhissati sakkhinti sakkhissanti
translated: ‘Dakkha sakkha hehi hohīhi lopo’ti ssassa vikappena lopo, sakkhiti, sakkhissati, sakkhinti, sakkhissanti.

original: Ssādimhi-asakkhissā, sakkhissā, asakkuṇissā, sakkuṇissā iccādi.
analyzed: ssa ādimhi a sakkhissā sakkhissā a sakkuṇissā sakkuṇissā iccādi
translated: Ssādimhi-asakkhissā, sakkhissā, asakkuṇissā, sakkuṇissā iccādi.

original: Svādigaṇo niṭṭhito.
analyzed: su ādi gaṇaḥ niṭṭhitaḥ
translated: The group with svā has been completed.

original: Kyādigaṇa
analyzed: kya ādi gaṇa
translated: The group with kyā

original: Atha kyādigaṇo vuccate.
analyzed: atha kyādi gaṇaḥ vuccate
translated: Now the group with kyā is stated.

original: Kī, ji, ñā, dhū, pu, bhū, mā, mū, lū.
analyzed: kī ji ñā dhū pu bhū mā mū lū
translated: Kī, ji, ñā, dhū, pu, bhū, mā, mū, lū.
. Kyādīhi kṇā ka. ; rū. ; nī. ; caṃ. .. …pe… ...

original: Kīiccādīhi kriyatthehi paraṃ kattari kānubandho ṇāpaccayo hoti.
analyzed: kīicca ādīhi kriyatthehi param kattari ka anubandhaḥ ṇā paccayaḥ hoti
translated: . Kīiccādīhi kriyatthehi paraṃ kattari kānubandho ṇāpaccayo hoti.

analyzed: kṇā knāsu rasso ka rū nī cam pā
translated: . Kṇāknāsu rasso ka. ; rū. ; nī. ; caṃ. ..; pā. ...

original: Etesu dīghadhātūnaṃ rasso hoti.🔽Kī-dabbavinimaye, kiṇāti, kiṇanti, vikkiṇāti, vikkiṇanti.
analyzed: etesu dīgha dhātūnam rassaḥ hoti  kīdabba vinimaye kiṇāti kiṇanti vikkiṇāti vikkiṇanti
translated: . Etesu dīghadhātūnaṃ rasso hoti.🔽Kī-dabbavinimaye, kiṇāti, kiṇanti, vikkiṇāti, vikkiṇanti.

original: Kamme-kīyati, kiyyati, vikkīyati, vikkiyyati, vikkiyyanti.
analyzed: kammekīyati kiyyati vikkīyati vikkiyyati
translated: Kamme-kīyati, kiyyati, vikkīyati, vikkiyyati, vikkiyyanti.

original: Kārite-vikkāyeti, vikkāyayati, kīṇāpeti, kīṇāpayati iccādi.🔽673. Jyādīhi knā ka. 449; rū. 513; nī. 930.
analyzed: vikkāyayati kīṇāpa iti kīṇāpayati icca ādi
translated: Kārite-vikkāyati, kīṇāpeti, kīṇāpayati, etc.🔽. With jy, etc., knā ka is the reduplicated form.

original: Jiiccādīhi kattari kānubandho nāpaccayo hoti.
analyzed: ji icca ādīhi kattari ka anubandhaḥ na a paccayaḥ hoti
translated: . With ji, etc., the affix kā is not used in the passive.

original: Jināti, jinanti.
analyzed: jināti jinanti
translated: Jināti, jinanti.

original: Kamme-jīyati, jiyyati, jinīyati, jiniyyati.
analyzed: kammejīyati jiyyati jinīyati jiniyyati
translated: In the passive: jīyati, jiyyati, jinīyati, jiniyyati.

original: Kārite-jayāpeti, jayāpayati, parājeti, parājayati, parājenti, parājayanti, jināpeti, jināpayati, ajini, jini, ajiniṃsu, jiniṃsu, jinissati, jinissanti iccādi.
analyzed: jayāpayati parājeti parājayati parājenti parājayanti jināpeti jināpayati ajini jini ajiniṃsu jiniṃsu jinissati jinissanti iccādi
translated: In the causative: jayāpeti, jayāpayati, parājeti, parājayati, parājeti, parājayanti, jināpeti, jināpayati, ajini, jini, ajiniṃsu, jiniṃsu, jinissati, jinissanti, etc.

original: Ñā-avabodhane.🔽674. Ñāssa ne jā ka. 470; rū. 514; nī. 950; caṃ. 6.1.107; pā. 7.3.70, 79.
analyzed: ñā avabodhane  ñāssa ne jā ka rū nī cam pā
translated: Ñā – in the sense of knowing.🔽. Ñāssa ne jā ka is the reduplicated form.

original: Nāpaccaye pare ñāssa jā hoti.🔽Jānāti, pajānāti, ājānāti, sañjānāti, vijānāti, abhijānāti, parijānāti, paṭijānāti, jānanti.
analyzed: nā paccaye pare ñā assa jā hoti  jānāti pajānāti ājānāti sañjānāti vijānāti abhijānāti parijānāti paṭijānāti jānanti
translated: . When the affix kā is not used, ñāssa ne jā is the reduplicated form.🔽Jānāti, pajānāti, ājānāti, sañjānāti, vijānāti, abhijānāti, parijānāti, paṭijānāti, jānanti.

original: Kamme-ñāyati, paññāyati, aññāyati, saññāyati, viññāyati, abhiññāyati, pariññāyati, paṭiññāyati, ñāyanti.
analyzed: kammeñāyati paññāyati aññāyati saññāyati viññāyati abhiññāyati pariññāyati paṭiññāyati ñāyanti
translated: In the passive: ñāyati, paññāyati, aññāyati, saññāyati, viññāyati, abhiññāyati, pariññāyati, paṭiññāyati, ñāyanti.

original: Kārite-ñāpeti, ñāpayati, ñāpenti, ñāpayanti, jānāpeti, jānāpayati, jānāpenti, jānāpayanti.
analyzed: kāriteñāpeti ñāpayati ñāpenti ñāpayanti jānāpeti jānāpayati jānāpenti jānāpayanti
translated: He causes to know, he causes to be known, they cause to know, they cause to be known, he causes to know, he causes to be known, they cause to know, they cause to be known.

original: Kamme-ñāpīyati, saññāpīyati, jānāpīyati.
analyzed: kammeñāpīyati saññāpīyati jānāpīyati
translated: In a (grammatical) operation: he is caused to know, he is caused to be known, he is caused to know.

original: 675. Ñāssa sanāssa nāyo timhi ka. 509; rū. 516; nī. 1022.
analyzed: ñāssa sanāssa nāyaḥ timhi ka rū nī
translated: In the sense of “having a nose” etc.: in timhi, ka, rū, nī, the form of ñā is ñāssa, sanāssa, nāyo.

original: Nāsahitassa ñāssa nāyo hoti timhi, suttavibhattiyā anti, antesu ca.
analyzed: nā sahitassa ñāssa nā yaḥ hoti timhi sutta vibhattiyā anti antesu ca
translated: In timhi, ka, the form of ñā is ñāssa, sanāssa, nāyo, in the case of the endings and in the case of the endings of the sutta-declension.

original: Nāyati. Viceyya viceyya atthe panāyatīti kho bhikkhave vipassīti vuccati dī. ni. 2.41-44. Nāyanti. “Animittā na nāyare”ti visuddhi 1.174 pāḷi.
analyzed: nāyati viceyya viceyya atthe panāyati iti kho bhikkhave vipassī iti vuccati ni nāyanti animittā visuddhi
translated: He leads: “He leads on, having examined, having examined, he is called Vipassī, bhikkhus” (D. i. 100). They lead: “They do not lead to the signless” (Vism. 101).

original: Eyyādimhi-jāneyya, jāneyyuṃ, jāneyyāsi, jāneyyātha, jāneyyāmi, jāneyyāma.
analyzed: jāneyyum jāneyyāsi jāneyyāsi atha jāneyyāmi jāneyyāma
translated: In the sense of “having to be known” etc.: he would know, they would know, you would know, you all would know, I would know, we would know.

original: Utte-jāneyyāmu.
analyzed: uttejāneyyāmu
translated: In the sense of “having to be known” etc. in the optative: I would know.

original: Eyyāmassa emutte “kathaṃ jānemu taṃ maya”nti jā. 2.22.7 pāḷi.🔽676. Eyyassiyāñā vā ka. 508; rū. 515; nī. 1021.
analyzed: katham tam  eyyassiya āñā vā ka rū nī
translated: In the sense of “having to be known” etc. in the optative: “How should we know that?” (Jā. i, 15).

original: Ñāto eyyassa iyā, ñā honti, vāsaddena eyyumādīnampi ñū, ñāsi, ñātha, ñāmi, ñāmādesā honti, eyyamiccassa ñañca.
analyzed: ñātaḥ eyyassa iyāḥ ñā honti vā saddena eyyum ādīnam pi ñū ñāsi ñā atha ñāmi ñāma ādesāḥ honti eyyam iccassa ñañca
translated: In the sense of “having to be known” etc. in the optative: in eyyādimhi, ka, rū, nī, the form of ñā is ñāto, eyyassa iyā, ñā honti, by the addition of vā, ñū, ñāsi, ñātha, ñāmi, ñāmādesā are formed, and also ñañca in the case of eyyamicc.

original: Jāniyā.
analyzed: jāniyā
translated: In the sense of “having to be known” etc. in the optative: he would know.

original: 677. Ñāmhi jaṃ ka. 470; rū. 514; nī. 950.🔽Ñādese pare sanāssa ñāssa jaṃ hoti.🔽Jaññā, vijaññā.🔽Suttavibhattena ñūādīsupi jaṃ hoti. “Pāpaṃ katvā mā maṃ jaññūti icchati su. ni. 127;🔽vibha. 894 ‘jaññā’ti, vivekadhammaṃ ahaṃ vijaññaṃ gavesitabbaṃ, jaññāmu ce sīlavantaṃ🔽vadaññu”nti jā. 2.22.1301 pāḷī. ‘Jaññāsi, jaññātha, jaññāmi, jaññāmā’tipi yujjati.🔽678. Īssatyādīsu knālopo ka. 517; rū. 488; nī. 1105.🔽Knāssa lopo hoti vā īādimhi ssatyādimhi ca.
analyzed: ñāmhi jam ka rū nī  ña ā dese pare sa na āssa ña āssa jam hoti  jaññā vijaññā  sutta vibhattena ñū ādīsu pi jam hoti pāpam katvā mā mam icchati su ni  vibha jaññāti viveka dhammam aham vijaññam gavesitabbam jaññāmu ce sīlavantam  pāḷī jaññā asi jaññā atha jaññāmi jaññāma atipi yujjati  īs satya ādīsu kna a lopaḥ ka rū nī  knāssa lopaḥ hoti vā ī ādimhi ssatya ādimhi ca
translated: I shall know.🔽The form jaṃ is used in the sense of “I shall know” when preceded by the pronouns of the second case.🔽One should know, one should distinguish.🔽The form jaṃ is also used with the verbal nouns formed by adding the suffixes ñū, etc., to the present tense of verbs: “He wishes, ‘May no one know that I have done evil’” (SuNi 127).🔽The following passage occurs in the Jātaka commentary: “I shall know, I shall distinguish, the one who has the nature of being secluded and who should be sought out. If I should know a virtuous person,🔽a generous one” (Jā. 2.2.1301). The forms jaññāsi, jaññātha, jaññāmi, jaññāmā are also appropriate.🔽In the words īsatyā, etc., the k is elided.🔽The k is elided optionally in the words īsatyā, etc., and in the words ssatyā, etc.

original: 679. Ssassa hi kamme ka. 517; rū. 488; nī. 1105.
analyzed: ssassa hi kamme ka rū nī
translated: For ss in a verb:

original: Ñāto ssassa hi hoti vā kamme.
analyzed: ñātaḥ ssassa hi hoti vā kamme
translated: For ss in a verb there is hi.🔽Paññāyihi. “Paññāyihī” is said of the young.

original: Paññāyihi. “Paññāyihinti etā, daharā”ti jā. 2.17.197 pāḷi. Paññāyissati, paññāyissanti iccādi.
analyzed: paññāyihi paññāyihinti etā daharāti jā pāḷi paññāyissati paññāyissanti iccādi
translated: Paññāyissati, paññāyissanti, etc.

original: Dhū-vidhunane, knāmhi rasso, dhunāti, dhunanti.
analyzed: dhū vidhunane rassaḥ dhunāti dhunanti
translated: Dhū-shaking: I am rassa, dhunāti, dhunanti.

original: Kamme-dhunīyati, dhunīyanti.
analyzed: kammedhunīyati dhunīyanti
translated: In a verb: dhunīyati, dhunīyanti.

original: Kārite-dhunāpeti, dhunāpayati.
analyzed: dhunāpayati
translated: In a causative: dhunāpeti, dhunāpayati.

original: Pu-sodhane, punāti, punanti.
analyzed: pusodhane punāti punanti
translated: Pu-purifying: punāti, punanti.

original: Bhū-pattiyaṃ, rasso, abhisambhunāti, abhisambhunanti. Nāssa ṇatte-abhisambhuṇāti, abhisambhuṇanti.
analyzed: bhūpattiyam rassaḥ abhisambhunāti abhisambhunanti na assa abhisambhuṇāti abhisambhuṇanti
translated: Bhū-attaining: I am rassa, abhisambhunāti, abhisambhunanti. In the absence of ṇat: abhisambhuṇāti, abhisambhuṇanti.

original: Mā-parimāṇe, mahāvuttinā dhātvantassa ittaṃ, mināti, nimmināti.
analyzed: mā parimāṇe mahāvuttinā dhātu antassa ittam mināti nimmināti
translated: Mā-measuring: I am mahāvutti, the extent of the element is mināti, nimmināti.

original: Kamme-upamīyati, upamīyanti, nimmīyati, nimmīyanti.
analyzed: upamīyanti nimmīyati nimmīyanti
translated: In a verb: upamīyati, upamīyanti, nimmīyati, nimmīyanti.

original: Kārite-nagaraṃ māpeti, māpayati, māpīyati, māpīyanti, nimmini, nimminiṃsu, māpesi, māpayi, māpesuṃ, māpayuṃ, nimminissati, nimminissanti, māpessati, māpessanti iccādi.
analyzed: kārita nagaram māpeti māpayati māpīyati māpīyanti nimmini nimminiṃsu māpesi māpesum māpayum nimminissati nimminissanti māpessati māpessanti iccādi
translated: In a causative: nagaraṃ māpeti, māpayati, māpīyati, māpīyanti, nimmini, nimminiṃsu, māpesi, māpayi, māpesuṃ, māpayuṃ, nimminissati, nimminissanti, māpessati, māpessanti, etc.

original: Mū-bandhane, munāti.
analyzed: mūbandhane munāti
translated: In the sense of ‘binding’ (munāti).

original: Lū-chedane, rassattaṃ, lunāti, lunanti.🔽Kamme-lūyati, lūyanti.🔽Kārite-lāvayati, lāvayanti.
analyzed: lū chedane lunāti lunanti  kammelūyati lūyanti  kāritelāvayati lāvayanti
translated: In the sense of ‘cutting’ (rassattaṃ), lunāti, lunanti.🔽In the passive voice (lūyati, lūyanti).🔽In the causative (lāvayati, lāvayanti).

original: Kamme-lāvīyati iccādi.
analyzed: kammelāvīyati i t ca ādi
translated: In the passive causative (lāvīyati, etc.).

original: Kyādigaṇo niṭṭhito.🔽Tanādigaṇa
analyzed: kyādi gaṇaḥ niṭṭhitaḥ  tan ādi gaṇa
translated: The class with kyā has been completed.🔽The class with tanā, etc.

original: Atha tanādigaṇo vuccate.
analyzed: atha tan ādi gaṇaḥ vuccate
translated: Now the class with tanā, etc., is stated.

original: Āpa, kara, tana, saka.
analyzed: āpa kara tana saka
translated: Āpa, kara, tana, saka.

analyzed: tan ādi tvā ka rū nī cam pā
translated: Tanāditvo ka; rū; nī; caṃ; pā.

original: Tanādīhi paraṃ opaccayo hoti.
analyzed: tan ādīhi param o paccayaḥ hoti
translated: After tanā, etc., the augment op is added.

original: Tanoti.
analyzed: tanoti
translated: Tanoti.

original: Āpa-pāpuṇane papubbo. Dhātvantassa dvittaṃ rasso ca, pappoti, papponti.
analyzed: āpa pāpuṇane papubbaḥ dhātu antassa dvittam ca pappoti papponti
translated: Āpa-pāpuṇane papubbo. The vowel of the root is doubled and the final is ra, pappoti, papponti.

original: Kamme-pāpīyati, pāpīyanti.
analyzed: kammepāpīyati pāpīyanti
translated: In the passive voice (pāpīyati, pāpīyanti).

original: Kārite-pāpeti, pāpayati.
analyzed: pāpayati
translated: In the causative (pāpeti, pāpayati).

original: Kamme-pāpīyati pāpīyanti iccādi.
analyzed: iccādi
translated: In the passive causative (pāpīyati, pāpīyanti, etc.).

original: Kara-karaṇe, karoti, karonti.🔽Kamme-karīyati, karīyanti.
analyzed: kara karaṇe karoti karonti  karīyanti
translated: Kara-karaṇe, karoti, karonti.🔽In the passive voice (karīyati, karīyanti).

original: ‘Tavaggavaraṇānaṃ ye cavaggabayañā’ti yamhi dhātvantassa yattaṃ, kayyati, kayyanti, kayyare, kayyate, kayyante.
analyzed: ta vagga vara ṇānam ye ca vagga bayañā ati yamhi dhātu antassa ya ttam kayyati kayyanti kayyare kayyate kayyante
translated: ‘The yatta of the roots of the tavaggavaraṇā class is changed to ya in the passive voice’ (Pā. 1.3.1), kayyati, kayyanti, kayyare, kayyate, kayyante.

original: Kārite-kāreti, kārayati, kārenti, kārayanti, kārāpeti, kārāpayati, kārāpenti, kārāpayanti.
analyzed: kāritekāreti kārayati kārenti kārayanti kārāpa iti kārāpayati kārāpenti kārāpayanti
translated: Kārayati, kārenti, kārayanti, kārāpeti, kārāpayati, kārāpenti, kārāpayanti.

original: 681. Karassa sossa kuṃ ka. 511; rū. 521; nī. 1124.

analyzed: okāra sahitassa karassa kum hoti mi mesu paresu
translated: O-kārasahitassa karassa kuṃ hoti mi, mesu paresu.

original: Kummi, kumma, “bhattu apacitiṃ kummi jā. 1.3.126, dhammassāpacitiṃ kummī”ti jā. 2.22.1752 pāḷī.
analyzed: kummi kumma bhattu apacitim kummi jā  dhammassa apacitim kummi iti jā

original: Saṅkharoti, saṅkharonti, abhisaṅkharoti, abhisaṅkharonti.
analyzed: saṅkharoti saṅkharonti abhisaṅkharoti abhisaṅkharonti

analyzed: saṅkharīyanti

analyzed: kāritesaṅkhārā iti saṅkhārayati
translated: Kārite-saṅkhāreti, saṅkhārayati.

analyzed: na saṅkharāpeti saṅkharāpayati

translated: Kamme-saṅkhārīyati, saṅkharāpīyati.

original: 683. Karassa sossa kubbakurukayirā ka. 511-2; rū. 521-2; nī. 1077-8-9-10; caṃ. 5.2.103; pā. 6.4.110.

original: O-kārasahitassa karassa kubba, kuru, kayirā honti vā nta, māna, tyādīsu, mahāvuttinā vikappena kussa kruttaṃ.
analyzed: okāra sahitassa karassa honti vā tya ādīsu mahāvuttinā vikappena
translated: The forms kubba, kuru, kayirā are formed by adding the vowel u to the root kar, which is accompanied by the vowel o, in the same way as kubba, kuru, kayirā are formed in the words māna, tyādīsu, and by the substitution of krutta for kussa according to the Mahāvutti.

original: Kubbati kubbanti, krubbati, krubbanti.
analyzed: kubbati kubbanti krubbati krubbanti
translated: Kubbati, kubbanti, krubbati, krubbanti.

original: Karotu, saṅkharotu, kubbatu, krubbatu, kurutu, agghaṃ kurutu no bhavaṃ dī. ni. 2.318, kayiratu.
analyzed: karotu saṅkharotu kubbatu krubbatu kurutu aggham kurutu naḥ bhavam ni

analyzed: kareyya saṅkhareyya kubbeyya krubbeyya kayireyya

analyzed: ṭā ka rū nī

analyzed: kayi rādesataḥ parassa eyya vibhattissa ṭa anubandhaḥ ā hoti vā
translated: After the ending of the aorist, ā is added to the following e-ending participles, or not.

analyzed: so puññam kayirā puññam ce puriso kayirā dha pa kayirā nam punappunam dha pa

translated: The e-vowel of etha becomes ā after kayirā, etc.

original: So kayirātha, dīpaṃ kayirātha paṇḍito dha. pa. 28, kayirā ce kayirāthenaṃ dha. pa. 313; saṃ. ni. 1.89.

translated: Karissati saṅkharissati, kubbissati, krubbissati, kayirissati iccādi.
