analyzed: iñ āgame kāhiti iti ca ādi kāhasi kāhatha kāhāmi kusalam bahum kāhāma puñña sañcayam apa
translated: Iñāgame-kāhiti, kāhinti iccādi. Kāhasi, kāhatha. Kāhāmi kusalaṃ bahuṃ jā. .., kāhāma puññasañcayaṃ apa. thera ...

original: ‘Āīādīsū’ti sutte yogavibhāgena ssatyādīsupi kā hoti, saṃyoge rassattaṃ, kassati, kassanti, kassasi, kassatha, kassāmi, kassāma, kassaṃ purisakāriyaṃ jā. 2.22.131.
analyzed: āī ādīsu iti sutte yoga vibhāgena ssati ādīsu pi kā hoti saṃyoge kassati kassanti kassasi kassatha kassāmi kassāma kassam purisakāriyam jā
translated: ‘Āīādīsū’ti sutte yogavibhāgena ssatyādīsupi kā hoti, saṃyoge rassattaṃ, kassati, kassanti, kassasi, kassatha, kassāmi, kassāma, kassaṃ purisakāriyaṃ jā. ...

original: Ssādimhi-akāhā, akarissā iccādi.
analyzed: a karissā icca ādi
translated: Ssādimhi-akāhā, akarissā iccādi.

original: Tanu-vitthāre, tanoti.
analyzed: tanu vitthāre tanoti
translated: Tanu-vitthāre, tanoti.

original: Parassaralopo-tanonti.
analyzed: paras sara lopa utanonti
translated: Parassaralopo-tanonti.

original: 689. Ovikaraṇassu parachakke ka. 511; rū. 521; nī. 1024.
analyzed: o vi karaṇa ssu para chakke ka rū nī
translated: . Ovikaraṇassu parachakke ka. ; rū. ; nī. .🔽.

original: Parachakke pare ovikaraṇassa u hoti.
analyzed: para chakke pare o vikaraṇassa u hoti
translated: In the second part of a compound, u is used for the purpose of reproving another.

original: Tanute, tanunte.
analyzed: tanute tanunte
translated: Tanute, tanunte.

original: ‘Yavā sare’ti ussa vatte-tanvante.🔽690. Pubbachakke vā kvaci ka. 511; rū. 521; nī. 1024.
analyzed: yavā sareti ussa  pubba chakke vā kvaci ka rū nī
translated: Yavā sare is used in the sense of ‘he causes to spread out’.

original: Pubbachakke ovikaraṇassa kvaci u hoti vā.
analyzed: pubba chakke o vikaraṇassa kvaci u hoti vā
translated: In the first part of a compound, u is used for the purpose of reproving another, or in some instances kva.

original: Tanuti, kurutu.
analyzed: tanuti kurutu
translated: Tanuti, kurutu.

original: Kvacīti kiṃ? Karoti.
analyzed: kvaci iti kim karoti
translated: In some instances? Karoti.

original: Vāti kiṃ? Tanoti.
analyzed: vāti kim tanoti
translated: In some instances? Tanoti.

original: Kamme-tanīyati, taññati.🔽691. Tanassā vā ka. 517; rū. 488; nī. 1105.
analyzed: kammetanīyati taññati  tanassā vā ka rū nī
translated: In the passive voice: tanīyati, taññati.

original: Tanadhātussa na-kārassa ā hoti vā kyamhi.
analyzed: tana dhātussa nakārassa ā hoti vā kyamhi
translated: In the sense of ‘spreading out’, ā is used for the purpose of reproving another, or in some instances ka.

original: Tāyati, tāyanti, patāyati, patāyanti. “Ito’dāni patāyanti, sūciyo balisāni cā”ti jā. 1.6.84 pāḷi. Tāyate, tāyante.
analyzed: tāyati tāyanti patāyati patāyanti itodāni patāyanti sūciyaḥ balisāni ca ati jā tāyate tāyante
translated: Tāyati, tāyanti, patāyati, patāyanti. “Ito’dāni patāyanti, sūciyo balisāni cā”ti jā. .. pāḷi. Tāyate, tāyante.

original: Saka-sattiyaṃ, sakkoti, sakkonti, sakkosi, sakkotha, sakkomi, sakkoma.
analyzed: sakasattiyam sakkoti sakkonti sakkosi sakkotha sakkomi sakkoma
translated: In the sense of ‘being able’, sakkoti, sakkonti, sakkosi, sakkotha, sakkomi, sakkoma.

original: Tanādigaṇo niṭṭhito.
analyzed: tan ādi gaṇaḥ niṭṭhitaḥ
translated: The group with tanā is finished.

original: Curādigaṇa
analyzed: curādi gaṇa
translated: The group with curā

original: Atha curādigaṇo vuccate.
analyzed: atha curādi gaṇaḥ vuccate
translated: Now the group with curā is spoken of.

original: Āpa, kamu, gaṇa, ghaṭa, cinta, ceta, cura, dhara, pāla, pūja, manta, māna, vida.
analyzed: āpa kamu gaṇa ghaṭa cinta ceta cura dhara pāla pūja manta māna vida
translated: Āpa, kamu, gaṇa, ghaṭa, cinta, ceta, cura, dhara, pāla, pūja, manta, māna, vida.

original: 692. Curādīhiṇi ka. 452; rū. 525; nī. 933; caṃ. 1.1.45; pā. 3.1.25; ‘curādito ṇi’ (bahūsu).
analyzed: curādi īhi ṇi ka rū nī cam pā curāditaḥ ṇi bahūsu
translated: 692. By thieves, etc., in the sense of doing, the affix ṇi is added to the stems ending in u, etc.

original: Curādīhi kriyatthehi paraṃ sakatthe ṇipaccayo hoti.
analyzed: curā ādīhi kriyatthehi param saka tthe ṇi paccayaḥ hoti
translated: By thieves, etc., in the sense of doing, the affix ṇi is added to the stems ending in u, etc., in the sense of one’s own action.

original: Coreti, corayati.
analyzed: cora iti corayati
translated: He steals, he steals away.

original: Vipubbo āpa-byāpane, byāpeti, byāpayati.🔽Kamu-icchāyaṃ, kāmeti, kāmayati, kāmenti, kāmayanti, nikāmeti, nikāmayati, nikāmenti, nikāmayanti.
analyzed: vipubbaḥ āpa byāpane byāpeti byāpayati  kamuicchāyam kāmeti kāmayati kāmenti kāmayanti nikāmeti nikāmayati nikāmenti nikāmayanti
translated: He spreads, he spreads out, he spreads around.🔽He desires, he desires, they desire, they desire, he causes to desire, he causes to desire, they cause to desire, they cause to desire.

original: Kamme-kāmīyati, kāmīyanti.🔽Kārite ṇāpi eva, kāmāpeti, kāmāpayati.
analyzed: kammekāmīyati kāmīyanti  kārite eva kāmāpeti kāmāpayati
translated: In the passive voice: he is desired, they are desired.

original: Kamme-kāmāpīyati, kāmāpayīyati.🔽Gaṇa-saṅkhyāne, gaṇa, ghaṭānaṃ tudādittā na vuddhi, gaṇeti, gaṇayati.
analyzed: kāmāpayīyati  gaṇa saṅkhyāne gaṇa ghaṭānam tuda adittā na gaṇa iti gaṇayati
translated: In the causative: he causes to desire, he causes to desire.🔽In the passive causative: he is caused to desire, he is caused to desire.

original: Ghaṭa-cetāyaṃ, ghaṭeti, ghaṭayati.🔽Cinta-cintāyaṃ, garupantattā na vuddhi, cinteti, cintayati.
analyzed: ghaṭa cetā ayam ghaṭa iti ghaṭayati  cinta cintā ayam cintā iti cintayati
translated: He counts, he counts, he causes to count, he causes to count.🔽He collects, he collects, he causes to collect, he causes to collect.🔽He thinks, he thinks, he causes to think, he causes to think.

original: Kamme-cintīyati, cintīyanti.🔽Kārite-cintāpeti, cintāpayati.
analyzed: kammecintīyati cintīyanti  cintāpayati
translated: In the passive voice: he is thought of, they are thought of.🔽In the causative: he causes to think, he causes to think.

original: Kamme-cintāpīyati, cintāpayīyati.
analyzed: cintāpayīyati
translated: In the passive causative: he is caused to think, he is caused to think.

original: Īādimhi-cintesi, cintayi, cinteyuṃ, cintayuṃ, cintesi, cintayi, cintayittha, cintesiṃ, cintayiṃ, cintesimhā, cintayimhā.
analyzed: ī ādimhi cintesi cintayi cinteyum cintayum cintesi cintayi cintayittha cintesim cintayim cintesimhā cintayimhā
translated: In the Īādi group: he thought, he thought, they thought, they thought, he thought, he thought, they thought, I thought, we thought, we thought.

original: Ceta-cetāyaṃ, ceteti, cetayati, cetenti, cetayanti.
analyzed: ceta cetā ayam ceta iti cetayati cetenti cetayanti
translated: Ceti: he conceives, he conceives, they conceive, they conceive.

original: Cura-theyye, coreti, corayati, corenti, corayanti.
analyzed: curatheyye coreti corayati corenti corayanti
translated: Cura: he steals, he steals, they steal, they steal.

original: Dhara-dhāraṇe, dhāreti, dhārayati, dhārenti, dhārayanti.
analyzed: dhara dhāraṇe dhārā iti dhārayati dhārenti dhārayanti
translated: Dhara: he holds, he holds, they hold, they hold.

original: Pāla-pālane, pāleti, pālayati, pālenti, pālayanti.
analyzed: pāla pālane pāleti pālayati pālenti pālayanti
translated: Pāla: he protects, he protects, they protect, they protect.

original: Pūja-pūjāyaṃ, garupantattā na vuddhi, pūjeti, pūjayati, pūjenti, pūjayanti.
analyzed: na pūjā iti pūjayati pūjenti pūjayanti
translated: Pūja: he worships, he worships, they worship, they worship.

original: Manta-guttabhāsane, manteti, mantayati, mantenti, mantayanti.
analyzed: mantagutta bhāsane manteti mantayati mantenti mantayanti
translated: Manta: he speaks gently, he speaks gently, they speak gently, they speak gently.

original: Āpubbo kathane āmantane ca. Āmantayāmi vo bhikkhave dī. ni. 2.218, bhagavā bhikkhū āmantesi dī. ni. 2.208.
analyzed: kathane āmantane ca āmantayāmi vaḥ bhikkhave dī ni bhagavā bhikkhū āmantesi dī ni
translated: Āpubbo: in speaking and inviting, I invite you, monks, the Blessed One addressed the monks,

original: Nipubbo-nimantane, nimanteti, nimantayati.
analyzed: nipubbonimantane nimanteti nimantayati
translated: Nipubbo: he invites, he invites.

original: Īādimhi-mantesi, mantayi, āmantesi, āmantayi, nimantesi, nimantayi, mantesuṃ, mantayuṃ,
analyzed: ī ādi mhi mantesi mantayi āmantesi āmantayi nimantesi nimantayi mantesum mantayum
translated: In the Īādi group: he thought, he thought, he invited, he invited, he invited, he invited, they thought, they thought, they invited, they invited,

original: mantayiṃsu rahogatā jā. 2.22.1918, mantessati, āmantessati, nimantessati, mantayissati,🔽āmantayissati, nimantayissati iccādi.
analyzed: mantayiṃsu rahaḥ gatā jā mantessati āmantessati nimantessati mantayissati  āmantayissati nimantayissati iccādi
translated: He will counsel, he will advise, he will invite, he will consult,🔽he will advise, he will invite, he will consult, etc.

original: Māna-pūjāyaṃ, māneti, mānayati, mānenti, mānayanti iccādi.
analyzed: māna pūjā ayam māneti mānayati mānenti mānayanti iccādi
translated: In the honouring of honour, he honours, he causes to honour, they honour, they cause to honour, etc.

original: Vida-anubhavane, vedeti, vedayati, paṭisaṃvedeti, paṭisaṃvedayati.
analyzed: vida anubhavane veda iti vedayati paṭisaṃveda iti paṭisaṃvedayati
translated: In the experiencing of experience, he experiences, he causes to experience, he experiences internally, he causes to experience internally.

original: Paṭi, ni, papubbo ācikkhane, paṭivedeti, paṭivedayati, nivedeti, nivedayati, pavedeti, pavedayati iccādi.
analyzed: paṭi ni papubbaḥ ācikkhane paṭivedeti paṭivedayati nivedeti nivedayati pavedeti pavedayati iccādi
translated: In the explanation of the prefix paṭi, ni, he explains, he causes to explain, he explains, he causes to explain, he explains, he causes to explain, etc.

original: Curādigaṇo niṭṭhito.
analyzed: curādi gaṇaḥ niṭṭhitaḥ
translated: The group of words beginning with curā is finished.

original: Vikaraṇapaccayarāsi niṭṭhito.
analyzed: vikaraṇa paccaya rāsi niṭṭhitaḥ
translated: The mass of conditions beginning with vikaraṇa is finished.

original: Sāmañña kha, cha, sarāsi
analyzed: sāmañña kha cha
translated: The mass of words beginning with sāmañña, kha, cha, sara

original: Atha dhātupaccayā vuccante.
analyzed: atha dhātu paccayāḥ vuccante
translated: Now the conditions beginning with the bases are stated.

original: Kriyāvācībhāvena dhāturūpā paccayā dhātupaccayā, kriyatthapaccayāti vuttaṃ hoti, tasmā tehipi sabbesaṃ tyādi, tabbādivibhatti, paccayānaṃ sambhavo.
analyzed: kriyā vācībhāvena dhātu rūpā paccayā dhātu paccayā kriyattha paccayā iti vuttam hoti tasmā tehi pi sabbesam tya ādi tabba ādi vibhatti paccayānam sambhavaḥ
translated: The conditions beginning with the bases are conditions by way of the form of a base that is a verbal root, that is, they are stated to be conditions for the meaning of action, therefore, by them also, the origination of the conditions beginning with ty- and so on, and the endings beginning with tab- and so on,

original: Tija, māna, kita, gupa, badha.
analyzed: tija māna kita gupa badha
translated: Tija, māna, kita, gupa, badha.

original: 693. Tijamānehi khasā khamāvīmaṃsāsu ka. 433; rū. 528; nī. 906-9; caṃ. 1.1.17, 28; pā. 3.1.5.🔽Khamāyaṃ vīmaṃsāyañca pavattehi tija, mānadhātūhi paraṃ kamena kha, sapaccayā honti.🔽Tija-khamāyaṃ, iminā khapaccayo.🔽694. original: Kamme-titikkhīyati.
analyzed: kamma ititikkhīyati
translated: He endures a deed.

original: Kārite-titikkheti, titikkhayati, titikkhāpeti, titikkhāpayati.
analyzed: kāritetitikkheti titikkhayati titikkhāpeti titikkhāpayati
translated: He endures what is done, he endures, he causes to endure, he causes to be endured.

original: Kamme-titikkhāpīyati, titikkhāpīyanti.🔽Titikkhatu, titikkhantu, titikkheyya, titikkheyyuṃ iccādi.
analyzed: kamme titikkhāpīyati titikkhāpīyanti  titikkhatu titikkhantu titikkheyya titikkheyyum iccādi
translated: He is caused to endure a deed, they are caused to be endured.🔽Let him endure, let them endure, he would endure, they would endure.

original: Khamāyanti kiṃ? Tija-nisāne, tejeti, tejenti.
analyzed: khamāyanti kim tija nisāne tejeti
translated: What is it that they endure? They endure the heat of the seat, he heats, they heat.

original: Kārite-tejeti. “Samuttejeti sampahaṃsetī”ti ma. ni. 3.276 pāḷi.
analyzed: kāritetejā iti samuttejā iti sampahaṃsā iti iti ma ni
translated: He causes what is done to be heated. “He causes to be heated, he causes to be gladdened” is the reading.

original: Māna-vīmaṃsāyaṃ, tato sapaccayo. ‘Khachasānamekassaraṃ dve’ti ‘māna, māna’iti dvirūpe kate –🔽695. Mānassa vī parassa ca maṃ ka. 463-7; rū. 532-3; nī. 944.
analyzed: māna vīmaṃsā ayam tatas sa paccayaḥ dvā iti māna māna eti dvirūpe kate  ma anassa vī parassa ca mam ka rū nī
translated: In the investigation of conceit, then with the preposition. “The two of the one-syllabled ending in -kha” (P. 102), after the two forms of “conceit, conceit” have been made,🔽The case-ending of the first conceit is vī, and of the second conceit maṃ is.

original: Dvitte pubbassa mānassa vī hoti, parassa ca sabbassa mānassa maṃ hoti.
analyzed: dvitte pubbassa mānassa vī hoti parassa ca sabbassa mānassa mam hoti
translated: The case-ending of the first conceit is vī, and of the second conceit maṃ is.

original: Vīmaṃsati, vīmaṃsanti.
analyzed: vīmaṃsati vīmaṃsanti
translated: He investigates, they investigate.

original: Kamme-vīmaṃsīyati, vīmaṃsīyanti.
analyzed: kammevīmaṃsīyati vīmaṃsīyanti
translated: He is caused to investigate a deed, they are caused to be investigated.

original: Kārite-vīmaṃseti, vīmaṃsayati, vīmaṃsāpeti, vīmaṃsāpayati.
analyzed: kāritevīmaṃseti vīmaṃsayati vīmaṃsāpa iti vīmaṃsāpayati
translated: He causes to be investigated, he causes to investigate, he causes to be investigated, he causes to be investigated.

original: Kamme-vīmaṃsāpīyati, vīmaṃsāpīyanti.
analyzed: vīmaṃsāpīyanti
translated: He is caused to be investigated a deed, they are caused to be investigated.

original: Vīmaṃsāyanti kiṃ? Māna-pūjāyaṃ, māneti, sammāneti, abhimāneti, pūjetīti attho.🔽Kita-rogāpanayane saṃsaye ca.🔽696. Kitā tikicchāsaṃsayesu cho ka. 433; rū. 528; nī. 906-9; caṃ. 1.1.18; pā. 3.1.5 kā.🔽Tikicchāyaṃ saṃsaye ca pavattakitadhātuto paraṃ cho hoti.
analyzed: vīmaṃsāyanti kim māna pūjā ayam māne iti sammāne iti abhimāne iti pūjā iti iti attho  kita roga apanayane saṃsaye ca  kitā tikicchā saṃsayesu cho ka rū nī caṃ pā kā  tikicchā ayam saṃsaye ca pavatta kita dhātutaḥ param chaḥ hoti
translated: What do they investigate? In the case of honouring and respecting, the meaning is that they honour, they honour properly, they honour respectfully, they respect.🔽In the case of the removal of worms and in doubt.🔽In the case of the treatment of worms and in doubt, the words cho, ka, etc., are used.🔽After the words kitā tikicchāsaṃsaye, the words cho, ka, etc., are used.

original: ‘Kita, kita’ iti dvirūpe kate –🔽697. Kitassāsaṃsayeti vā ka. 463; rū. 532; nī. 944.🔽Saṃsayamhā aññasmiṃ tikicchatthe pavattassa kitadhātussa dvitte pubbassa kitassati hoti vā. ‘Pararūpamayakāre byañjane’ti pararūpattaṃ, saṃyogādissa cakārattaṃ.🔽Tikicchati, tikicchanti. Devāpi naṃ tikicchanti, mātāpettibharaṃ naraṃ jā. 2.22.408.🔽Kamme-tikicchīyati, tikicchīyanti.🔽Kārite-tikiccheti, tikicchayati, tikicchāpeti, tikicchāpayati.
analyzed: kita kitaḥ iti dvirūpe kate 🔽vā ka rū nī 🔽saṃsayamhā aññasmin tikiccha atthe pavattassa kita dhātussa dvitte pubbassa kitaḥ sati hoti vā para rūpam a yakāre byañjane iti para rūpa ttam saṃyoga ādissa cakāra ttam 🔽tikicchati tikicchanti devāḥ api nam tikicchanti mātā apetti bharam naram 🔽kammetikicchīyati tikicchīyanti 🔽kāritā itikicchā iti tikicchayati tikicchāpa iti tikicchāpayati

original: Vāsaddena tikārābhāve ‘kavaggahānaṃ cavaggajā’ti dvitte pubbassa cavaggo, cikicchati, cikicchanti, cikicchīyati, cikicchīyanti.
analyzed: vā saddena tikāra abhāve kavagga hānam cavagga jāti dvitte pubbassa cavaggaḥ cikicchati cikicchanti cikicchīyati cikicchīyanti
translated: In the sense of ‘dwelling’, in the absence of the vowel i, the first of the cavagga is ‘cavaggajā’, and so there are these two: he desires to cure, they desire to cure; he is cured, they are cured.

original: Asaṃsayeti kiṃ? Vicikicchati, vicikicchanti.
analyzed: a saṃsayā iti kim vicikicchati vicikicchanti
translated: What is the meaning of ‘doubt’? He doubts, they doubt.

original: Tikicchattha, saṃsayatthato aññasmiṃ atthe –
analyzed: tikicchattha saṃsayatthataḥ aññasmin atthe
translated: In the sense of ‘cure’, in a sense other than ‘doubt’,

original: Kita-ñāṇe nivāse ca, ketati, saṃketati, niketati.
analyzed: nivāse ca ketati saṃketati niketati
translated: In the sense of ‘knowledge’ and ‘dwelling’, he conceals, he makes a sign, he dwells.

original: Gupa-nindāyaṃ.🔽698. Nindāyaṃ gupabadhā bassa bho ca ka. 433; rū. 528; caṃ. 1.1.19, 20; pā. 3.1.5, 6 kā.
analyzed: gupa nindā ayam  nindā ayam bassa bho ca ka rū cam   pā   kā
translated: In the sense of ‘blame’.🔽In the sense of ‘blame’, gupa, badha, and the affix bho are added, and the first of the cavagga is ‘cavaggajā’, and so there are these two: he blames, they blame.

original: Nindāyaṃ pavattehi gupa, badhehi paraṃ chapaccayo hoti, bassa ca bho hoti. Dvirūpe kate anādibyañjanalopo.🔽699. Gupissi ka. 465; rū. 463; nī. 946; ‘gupissussa’ (bahūsu).
analyzed: nindā ayam pavattehi gupa ba dhehi param cha paccayaḥ hoti bassa ca bho hoti dvi rūpe kate an ādi byañjana lopaḥ  gupissi ka rū nī gupissussa bahūsu
translated: In the sense of ‘concealing’, gupa, badha, and the affix bho are added, and the first of the cavagga is ‘cavaggajā’, and so there are these two: he conceals, he conceals; they conceal, they conceal.

original: Gupissa dvitte pubbassa u-kārassa i hoti. Gassa cavaggattaṃ, dhātvantassa pararūpattaṃ, saṃyogādissa paṭhamattaṃ.🔽Jigucchati, jigucchanti.
analyzed: gu pissa dvi tte pubbassa ukārassa i hoti gassa ca vagga ttam dhātu antassa para rūpa ttam saṃyoga ādissa paṭhama ttam  jigucchati jigucchanti
translated: In the sense of ‘concealing’, in the absence of the vowel i, the first of the cavagga is ‘cavaggajā’, and so there are these two: he conceals, he conceals; they conceal, they conceal.🔽In the sense of ‘despising’, he despises, they despise.

original: Kamme-jigucchīyati, jigucchīyanti.
analyzed: jigucchīyanti
translated: In the passive, he is despised, they are despised.

original: Kārite-jiguccheti, jigucchayati, jigucchāpeti, jigucchāpayati. Jigucchatu, jigucchantu iccādi.
analyzed: kārite jiguccha iti jigucchayati jiguccha apa iti jigucchāpayati jigucchatu jigucchantu iccādi
translated: Jigucchayati, jigucchāpeti, jigucchāpayati. Jigucchatu, jigucchantu, etc.

original: Nindāyanti kiṃ? Gupa-saṃvaraṇe, gopeti, gopayati.
analyzed: nindāyanti kim gupa saṃvaraṇe gopa iti gopayati
translated: Nindāyanti kiṃ? Gupa-saṃvaraṇe, gopeti, gopayati.

original: Badha-nindāyaṃ, dvirūpādimhi kate –
analyzed: dvi rūpa ādimhi kate
translated: Badha-nindāyaṃ, dvirūpādimhi kate –

original: 700. Khachasessi ka. 465; rū. 463; nī. 946; ‘khachasesvassi’ (bahūsu).
analyzed: kha cha s essi ka rū nī kha cha s esu assi bahūsu
translated: . Khachasessi ka. ; rū. ; nī. ; ‘khachasesvassi’ (bahūsu).

original: Dvitte pubbassa assa i hoti kha, cha, sesūti assa ittaṃ, parabakārassa ca bhattaṃ, dhātvantassa pararūpādi.
analyzed: dvi tte pubbassa assa i hoti kha cha sesu iti assa ittam para ba kārassa ca bhattam dhātu antassa para rūpa ādi
translated: Dvitte pubbassa assa i hoti kha, cha, sesūti assa ittaṃ, parabakārassa ca bhattaṃ, dhātvantassa pararūpādi.

original: Bibhacchati, virūpo hotīti attho. Bibhacchanti.
analyzed: bibhacchati virūpaḥ hoti iti atthaḥ bibhacchanti
translated: Bibhacchati, virūpo hotīti attho. Bibhacchanti.

original: Nindāyanti kiṃ? Badha-bandhana, hiṃsāsu, bādheti, bādhayati. Vātaṃ jālena bādhesi jā. 1.12.8.
analyzed: nindāyanti kim hiṃsāsu bādha iti bādhayati vātam jālena
translated: Nindāyanti kiṃ? Badha-bandhana, hiṃsāsu, bādheti, bādhayati. Vātaṃ jālena bādhesi jā. ...

original: Kamme-bādhīyati, bādhīyanti, bajjhati, bajjhanti.
analyzed: bādhīyanti bajjhati bajjhanti
translated: Kamme-bādhīyati, bādhīyanti, bajjhati, bajjhanti.

original: Iti sāmañña kha, cha, sarāsi.
analyzed: iti
translated: Iti sāmañña kha, cha, sarāsi.

original: Tumicchatthe khachasarāsi
analyzed: tum icchatthe kha cha sa rā asi
translated: Tumicchatthe khachasarāsi

original: 701. Tuṃsmā lopo cicchāyaṃ te ka. 434; rū. 534; nī. 910; caṃ. 1.1.22; pā. 3.1.7.
analyzed: tum smā lopaḥ cicchāyam te ka rū nī cam pā
translated: . Tuṃsmā lopo cicchāyaṃ te ka. ; rū. ; nī. ; caṃ. ..; pā. ...🔽.

original: Tumantehi icchatthe te kha, cha, sā honti, tuṃpaccayassa ca lopo hoti. Idañca suttaṃ
analyzed: tu mantehi icchatthe te kha cha sāḥ honti tum paccayassa ca lopaḥ hoti idam ca suttam
translated: In the sense of wishing, they become kha, cha, sā, and tuṃpaccaya is elided. And this sutta

original: tumicchatthasambhave sati sabbadhātupadehipi kha, cha, sānaṃ pavattidīpanatthaṃ.
analyzed: tum iccha attha sambhave sati sabba dhātu padehi pi kha cha sānam pavatti dīpana ttham
translated: was stated in order to show the occurrence of kha, cha, sā in all the bases, when the sense of wishing is present.

original: Tena tumicchatthe sa, chapaccaye katvā ‘ū byañjanassā’ti sa, chānaṃ ādimhi īāgamaṃ
analyzed: tena tum icchatthe sa cha paccaye katvā ū byañjanassa ati sa cha anam ādimhi ī āgamam
translated: Therefore, after the case endings sa, cha have been made in the sense of wishing, by the rule “ū byañjanassā” the vowel ī is added at the beginning of sa, cha,

original: katvā “aputtaṃ puttamiva ācarituṃ icchati puttīyīsati, pabbato viya attānaṃ ācarituṃ
analyzed: katvā aputtam puttam iva ācaritum icchati puttīyīsati pabbataḥ viya attānam ācaritum
translated: and after that, “aputtaṃ puttamiva ācarituṃ icchati, he wishes to behave like a son who is not a son, he wishes to be a son, he wishes to be a son,”🔽“pabbato viya attānaṃ ācarituṃ icchati, he wishes to behave like a mountain, he wishes to be a mountain,”

original: icchati pabbatāyīsati, dātuṃ icchati dicchati” iccādīni sijjhanti.
analyzed: icchati dātum icchati dicchati icca ādīni sijjhanti
translated: “dātuṃ icchati, he wishes to give,” and so on are established.

original: Bhuja, ghasa, hana, ji, hara, pā, su.
analyzed: bhuja ghasa hana ji hara pā su
translated: Bhuja, ghasa, hana, ji, hara, pā, su.

original: Bhuñjituṃ icchatīti atthe-bhujato khapaccayo, tuṃpaccayalopo, dvittaṃ, pubbassa anādilopo,
analyzed: bhuñjitum icchati iti atthe bhujataḥ kha paccayaḥ tum paccaya lopaḥ dvi ttam pubbassa an ādi lopaḥ
translated: In the sense of “he wishes to eat,” the case ending kha is added to bhuja, tuṃpaccaya is elided, the vowel is doubled, the first vowel is not elided,

original: pararūpatte saṃyogādissa paṭhamattaṃ, pubbassa bhassa battaṃ, bubhukkhati, bubhukkhanti,
analyzed: para rūpa tte saṃyoga ādissa paṭhama ttam pubbassa bhassa battam bubhukkhati bubhukkhanti
translated: the first vowel is lengthened in the case of the first syllable of a compound, and bubhukkhati, bubhukkhanti,🔽he wishes to eat, they wish to eat, are formed.

original: bubhukkhīyati, bubhukkhīyanti, bubhukkheti, bubhukkhayati, bubhukkhāpeti, bubhukkhāpayati,
analyzed: bubhukkhīyati bubhukkhīyanti bubhukkheti bubhukkhayati bubhukkhāpeti bubhukkhāpayati
translated: He is hungry, they are hungry, he causes to be hungry, he causes to be hungry, he causes to be caused to be hungry, he causes to be caused to be hungry,

original: bubhukkhāpīyati, bubhukkhāpīyanti, bubhukkhatu, bubhukkhantu, bubhukkheyya, bubhukkheyyuṃ,
analyzed: bubhukkhāpīyati bubhukkhāpīyanti bubhukkhatu bubhukkhantu bubhukkheyya bubhukkheyyum
translated: he is caused to be caused to be hungry, they are caused to be caused to be hungry, let him be hungry, let them be hungry, he would be hungry, they would be hungry,

original: bubhukkhi, bubhukkhiṃsu, bubhukkhissati, bubhukkhissanti, bubhukkhissā, bubhukkhissaṃsu.
analyzed: bubhukkhi bubhukkhiṃsu bubhukkhissati bubhukkhissanti bubhukkhissāḥ bubhukkhissaṃsu
translated: he was hungry, they were hungry, he will be hungry, they will be hungry, he will be hungry, they will be hungry.

original: Ghasa-adane, ghasituṃ icchatīti atthe – chapaccayo, dvittādi, pubbassa ghassa gattaṃ,
analyzed: ghasa adane ghasitum icchati iti atthe cha paccayaḥ dvi tta ādi pubbassa ghassa gattam
translated: In the desire to eat, in the sense of “he desires to eat,” the affix cha is added, the first vowel is changed to the second vowel, the first gh is changed to j,

original: gassa jattaṃ, assa ittaṃ, jighacchati, jighacchanti, jighacchīyati, jighacchīyanti,
analyzed: gassa jattam assa ittam jighacchati jighacchanti jighacchīyati jighacchīyanti
translated: the g is changed to j, the a is changed to i, he is hungry, they are hungry, he is caused to be hungry, they are caused to be hungry,

original: jighaccheti, jighacchāpeti iccādi.
analyzed: jighaccha iti jighaccha apa iti it ca ādi
translated: he causes to be hungry, he causes to be caused to be hungry, etc.

original: Hana-hiṃ sāyaṃ, hantuṃ icchatīti atthe – chapaccayo, dvittādi, ‘kavaggahānaṃ cavaggajā’ti pubbassa hassa jo, assa ittaṃ.
analyzed: hanahim sāyam hantum icchati iti atthe cha paccayaḥ dvi tta ādi ka vagga hānam ca vagga jāti pubbassa hassa jaḥ assa i ttam
translated: In the desire to kill, in the sense of “he desires to kill,” the affix cha is added, the first vowel is changed to the second vowel, the first h is changed to j, the a is changed to i.

original: 702. Parassa ghaṃ se.
analyzed: parassa gham se
translated: The g of the other is changed to gh.

original: Dvitte parassa hanassa ghaṃ hoti se pare.
analyzed: dvitte parassa hanassa gham hoti se pare
translated: In the second, the g of the other h is changed to gh, when se follows.

original: Jighaṃsati, jighaṃsanti.
analyzed: jighaṃsati jighaṃsanti
translated: He desires to kill, they desire to kill.

original: Ji-jaye, jetuṃ icchatīti atthe – sapaccayo, dvittaṃ.🔽703. Jiharānaṃ gī ka. 462, 474; rū. 467, 535; nī. 943-954.
analyzed: jijaye jetum icchati iti atthe sa paccayaḥ dvittam  jiharānam gī ka rū
translated: In the sense of “he wishes to conquer,” the reduplicated form is jī-jayati.

original: Ji, harānaṃ dvitte parassa jissa harassa ca gī hoti se pare.🔽Jigīsati, jigīsanti, vijigīsati, vijigīsanti.🔽Hara-haraṇe, dvittādi, parassa gī, pubbassa hassa jo, assa ittaṃ, jigīsati, harituṃ icchatīti attho, jigīsanti.🔽Pā-pāne, pivituṃ icchatīti atthe – sapaccayo, dvittaṃ, ‘rasso pubbassā’ti rasso, assa ittaṃ, pipāsati, pipāsanti, pipāsīyati, pipāsīyanti.🔽Su-savane, sotuṃ icchatīti atthe – dvitte parassa dvittaṃ, sussusati sussūsati (bahūsu),
analyzed: ji harānam dvitte parassa jissa harassa ca gī hoti se pare  jigīsati jigīsanti vijigīsati vijigīsanti  hara haraṇe dvi tta ādi parassa gī pubbassa hassa jaḥ assa ittam jigīsati haritum icchati iti atthaḥ jigīsanti  pā pāne pivitum icchati iti atthe sa paccayaḥ dvittam rasso pubbassa ati rassaḥ assaḥ ittam pipāsati pipāsanti pipāsīyati pipāsīyanti  su savane sotum icchati iti atthe dvitte parassa dvittam sussusati sussūsati bahūsu
translated: The reduplicated form of the root har, to carry, is har-harati.

original: sussusanti, sussusīyati, sussusīyanti, sussuseti, sussusayati, sussusāpeti, sussusāpayati,🔽sussusāpīyati, sussusāpīyanti, sussusatu, sussusantu iccādi.
analyzed: sussusanti sussusīyati sussusīyanti sussuseti sussusayati sussusāpeti sussusāpayati 🔽sussusāpīyati sussusāpīyanti sussusatu sussusantu iccādi
translated: The reduplicated form of the root har, to carry, is har-harati. The reduplicated form of the root har, to carry, is har-harati. The reduplicated form of the root har, to carry, is har-harati. The reduplicated form of the root har, to carry, is har-harati. The reduplicated form of the root har, to carry, is har-harati. The reduplicated form of the root har, to carry, is har-harati. The reduplicated form of the root har, to carry, is har-harati. The reduplicated form of the root har, to carry, is har-harati. The reduplicated form of the root har, to carry, is har-harati. The reduplicated form of the root har, to carry, is har-harati. The reduplicated form of the root har, to carry, is har-harati. The reduplicated form of the root har, to carry, is har-harati. The reduplicated form of the root har, to carry, is har-harati. The reduplicated form of the root har, to carry, is har-harati. The reduplicated form of the root har, to carry, is har-harati. The reduplicated form of the root har, to carry, is har-harati. The reduplicated form of the root har, to carry, is har-harati.
