The reduplicated form of the root har, to carry, is har-harati. The reduplicated form of the root har, to carry, is har-harati. The reduplicated form of the root har, to carry, is har-harati. The reduplicated form of the root har, to carry, is har-harati. The reduplicated form of the root har, to carry,

original: Titikkhituṃ icchatīti atthe – titikkhato sapaccayo, sapaccayaparattā puna dvittappasaṅge –
analyzed: titikkhitum icchati iti atthe titikkhataḥ sa paccayaḥ sa paccaya parattā puna dvitta ppasaṅge
translated: He wishes to endure: in the sense of enduring, there is the -t- of the reduplicated form, and the -t- of the reduplicated form is followed by the -t- of the reduplicated form.

original: 704. Na puna caṃ. 5.1.6.
analyzed: na puna cam
translated: ... not again a second time.

original: Sakiṃ dvitte kate puna dvittaṃ na āpajjatīti puna dvittābhāvo, ‘ū byañjanassā’ti ū āgamo.🔽Titikkhisati, titikkhisanti iccādi. Evaṃ tikicchituṃ icchatīti tikicchisati, tikicchisanti, cikicchisati, cikicchisanti iccādi.
analyzed: sakim dvitte kate puna dvittam na āpajjati iti puna dvitta abhāvaḥ byañjanassa ati āgamaḥ  titikkhisati titikkhisanti iccādi evam tikicchitum icchati iti tikicchisati tikicchisanti cikicchisati cikicchisanti iccādi
translated: When a second time has been done, he does not commit a second offence: the absence of a second time is the -t- of the reduplicated form. The -ū- is the vowel sign.

original: Iti tumicchatthe kha, cha, sa rāsi.🔽Nāmadhāturāsi🔽Puttaṃ icchatīti atthe –🔽705. Īyo kammā ka. 437; rū. 538; nī. 912; caṃ. 1.1.23, 24; pā. 3.1.8, 9.🔽Kammatthā nāmapadamhā icchatthe īyo hotīti kammabhūtā puttasaddato icchāyaṃ īyo, ‘puttīya’iti dhātupaccayantarūpaṃ, tato tyādyuppatti.
analyzed: iti tum icchatthe kha cha sa rāsi  nāmadhātuḥ ā asi  puttam icchati iti atthe  īyaḥ kammā ka rū nī cam   pā  kamma tthā icchatthe īyaḥ hoti iti kamma bhūtā putta saddato icchāyam dhātu paccaya nta rūpam tatas tya ādi uppatti
translated: He endures, they endure.

original: Puttīyati, puttīyanti, puttīyeti, puttīyayati, puttīyāpeti, puttīyāpayati, puttīyāpīyati,
analyzed: puttīyati puttīyanti puttīyā iti puttīyayati puttīyāpa iti puttīyāpayati puttīyāpīyati
translated: Thus he wishes to cure: he cures, they cure, he has cured, he has cured them, they have cured, they have cured him, they have cured them, he is curing, he is curing them, they are curing, they are curing him, they are curing them, he will cure, he will cure them, they will cure, they will cure him, they will cure them, he should cure, he should cure them, they should cure, they should cure him, they should cure them, he might cure, he might cure them, they might cure, they might cure him, they might cure them, he could cure, he could cure them, they could cure, they could cure him, they could cure them, he would cure, he would cure them, they would cure, they would cure him, they would cure them, he might have cured, he might have cured them, they might have cured, they might have cured him, they might have cured them, he would have cured, he would have cured them, they would have cured, they would have cured him, they would have cured them, he would be curing, he would be curing them, they would be curing, they would be curing him, they would be curing them, he would have been curing, he would have been curing them, they would have been curing, they would have been curing him, they would have been curing them, he would have cured, he would have cured them, they would have cured, they would have cured him, they would have cured them, he would have been curing, he would have been curing them, they would have been curing, they would have been curing him, they would have been curing them, he would have cured, he would have cured them, they would have cured, they would have cured him, they would have cured them, he would have been curing, he would have been curing them, they would have been curing, they would have been curing

original: puttīyāpīyanti. Evaṃ cīvarīyati, cīvarīyanti, pattīyati, pattīyanti, parikkhārīyati,
analyzed: evam cīvarīyati cīvarīyanti pattīyati pattīyanti parikkhārīyati
translated: Thus cīvarīyati, cīvarīyanti, pattīyati, pattīyanti, parikkhārīyati,

original: parikkhārīyanti iccādi.
analyzed: parikkhārīyanti iccādi
translated: parikkhārīyanti, and so on.

original: Aputtaṃ sissaṃ puttamiva ācaratīti atthe –
analyzed: aputtam sissam puttam iva ācarati iti atthe
translated: In the sense ‘He behaves towards the pupil as if he were a son, though he is not a son,’

analyzed: upamāṇa ācāre ka rū nī cam pā
translated: in the case of the suffix īyo in the sense of ‘behaviour’ in the Upamāna and Ādhāra classes,🔽the Upamāna is the Upamānaṇa, that is, the object to be compared, and the Ādhāra is the Ādhāraṇa, that is, the basis.

original: Upamīyati upametabbo attho etenāti upamānaṃ, upamānabhūtā kammapadato ācāratthe īyo hoti.
analyzed: upamīyati upametabbaḥ atthaḥ etena ati upamānam upamāna bhūtā kamma padataḥ ācāra atthe īyaḥ hoti
translated: The meaning is compared by this, thus it is an Upamāna. The suffix īyo is added to the Upamāna and Ādhāra nouns in the sense of ‘behaviour.’

original: Puttīyati, puttīyanti sissaṃ.
analyzed: puttīyati puttīyanti sissam
translated: The pupil is compared, is behaved towards as if he were a son.

original: Kamme-aputtopi putto viya ācarīyati puttīyīyati, puttīyīyanti, puttīyeti, puttīyayati, puttīyāpeti, puttīyāpayati, puttīyāpīyati, puttīyāpīyanti. Evaṃ sissīyati, sissīyanti.
analyzed: kammeaputtaḥ api puttaḥ viya ācarīyati puttīyīyati puttīyīyanti puttīyā iti puttīyayati puttīyāpeti puttīyāpayati puttīyāpīyati puttīyāpīyanti evam sissīyati sissīyanti
translated: In the verb, though he is not a son, he is behaved towards as if he were a son, thus he is compared, is behaved towards as a son, is compared, are behaved towards as sons, he is compared, he behaves, he causes to be compared, he causes to be behaved towards as a son, he causes to be compared, he causes to be behaved towards as a son, he is caused to be compared, he is caused to be behaved towards as a son. Thus he is compared, they are compared.

original: Kuṭiyaṃ viya pāsāde ācaratīti atthe –🔽707. Ādhārā ka. 436; rū. 537; nī. 912; caṃ. 1.1.26; pā. 3.1.10.
analyzed: kuṭiyam viya pāsāde ācarati iti atthe  ādhārā ka rū nī caṃ pā
translated: In the sense ‘He behaves in the palace as if in a hut,’🔽in the case of the suffix īyo in the sense of ‘behaviour’ in the Upamāna and Ādhāra classes,

original: Upamānabhūtā ādhārabhūtā ca nāmamhā ācāratthe īyo hoti.
analyzed: upamāna bhūtā ādhāra bhūtā ca nāmamhā ācāra atthe īyas hoti
translated: the suffix īyo is added to the Upamāna and Ādhāra nouns in the sense of ‘behaviour.’

original: Kuṭīyati, kuṭīyanti pāsāde, nadiyaṃ viya samudde ācarati nadīyati, nadīyanti iccādi.
analyzed: kuṭīyati kuṭīyanti pāsāde samudde ācarati nadīyati nadīyanti iccādi
translated: He behaves like a hut, they behave like huts, in a palace: he behaves like a river, they behave like rivers, in a river, in the ocean.

original: Araññe viya nagare ācarati araññīyati, araññīyanti nagare. Evaṃ gehīyati vihāre.
analyzed: araññe viya nagare ācarati araññīyati araññīyanti nagare evam gehīyati vihāre
translated: He behaves like a forest, they behave like forests, in a town: he behaves like a town, they behave like towns, in a forest. So too with a house.

original: Lokadhammehi akampanīyaṭṭhena pabbato viya attānaṃ ācaratīti atthe –🔽708. Kattutāyo ka. 435; rū. 536; nī. 911; caṃ. 1.1.27; pā. 3.1.11.
analyzed: loka dhammehi a kampanīya ṭṭhena pabbataḥ viya attānam ācarati iti atthe  kattu tāyo ka rū nī cam pā
translated: In the sense of “he behaves like himself in the sense of being unshakable by worldly ideas, as a mountain does”🔽. The suffix -āyo is added to the noun

original: Upamānabhūtā kattubhūtā ca nāmamhā ācāratthe āyo hotīti pabbatasaddato āyo. Tato tyādyuppatti.
analyzed: upamāna bhūtā kattu bhūtā ca nāmamhā ācāra atthe āyaḥ hoti iti pabbata saddataḥ
translated: . The suffix -āyo is added to the noun pabbatā “mountain” in the sense of “behaviour” in the way beginning “He behaves like a mountain, they behave like mountains”. Then the ty-ādi is added.

original: Pabbatāyati saṅgho, pabbatāyanti, cicciṭo viya attānaṃ ācarati cicciṭāyati, saddo. Evaṃ paṭapaṭāyati, kaṭakaṭāyati, dhūmadhūmāyati, dhūpāyati, sandhūpāyati.
analyzed: pabbatāyati saṅghaḥ pabbatāyanti cicciṭaḥ viya attānam ācarati cicciṭāyati saddaḥ evam paṭapaṭāyati kaṭakaṭāyati dhūmadhūmāyati dhūpāyati sandhūpāyati
translated: The community behaves like a mountain, they behave like mountains. He behaves like a cicciṭa bird, the sound does. So too with paṭapaṭāyati, kaṭakaṭāyati, dhūmadhūmāyati, dhūpāyati, sandhūpāyati.

original: Abhusampi bhusaṃ bhavatīti atthe –🔽709. Jhatthe ka. 435; rū. 536; nī. 911; caṃ. 1.1.30; pā. 3.1.12, 13.
analyzed: abhusam pi bhusam bhavati iti atthe  jhatthe ka rū nī cam pā
translated: In the sense of “even what is not smoke becomes smoke”🔽. The suffix -āyo is added to the noun

original: Cīpaccayassa attho abbhūtatabbhāvo jhattho nāma. Kattuto jhatthe āyo hoti.
analyzed: cī paccayassa atthaḥ jhatthaḥ nāma kattutaḥ jhatthe āyaḥ hoti
translated: . The meaning of the preposition abbhūta is “becoming other than what it was”. The suffix -āyo is added to the noun jhattha “preposition” in the sense of “behaviour”.

original: Bhusāyati, bhusāyanti, apaṭopi paṭo bhavati paṭāyati, paṭāyanti, alohitampi lohitaṃ bhavati lohitāyati. Evaṃ nīlāyati, kamalāyati, candāyati, candanāyati, kañcanāyati, vajirāyati.
analyzed: bhusāyati bhusāyanti apaṭaḥ api paṭaḥ bhavati paṭāyati paṭāyanti alohitam pi lohitam bhavati lohitāyati evam nīlāyati kamalāyati candāyati candanāyati kañcanāyati vajirāyati
translated: He shines, they shine; a cloth becomes a cloth, it shines, they shine; even bloodless flesh becomes blood, it shines. So too with blue, with red, with white, with sandal, with gold, with lightning.

original: Kattutotveva? Bhusaṃ karoti.
analyzed: bhusam karoti
translated: In the sense of making? He makes shining.

original: Saddaṃ karotīti atthe –🔽710. Saddādīhi karoti ka. 435; rū. 536; nī. 911; caṃ. 1.1.36; pā. 3.1.17, 18; ‘saddādīni’ (bahūsu).🔽Saddādīhi dutiyantehi nāmehi karotyatthe āyo hoti.
analyzed: saddam karoti iti atthe  sadda ādīhi karoti ka rū nī caṃ pā   sadda ādīni bahūsu  sadda ādīhi dutiya ntehi nāmehi karoti atthe āyaḥ hoti
translated: In the sense of making sound?🔽Ka is used in the sense of making with sound, etc.,🔽as in saddāyati, saddāyanti, etc., and in the sense of making with the second nouns beginning with sound, etc., as in saddādīhi karoti, saddādīhi karoti, etc.

original: Saddāyati, saddāyanti, veraṃ karoti verāyati, verāyanti, kalahaṃ karoti kalahāyati,🔽kalahāyanti, mettaṃ karoti mettāyati, mettāyanti, karuṇaṃ karoti karuṇāyati, karuṇāyanti,
analyzed: saddāyati saddāyanti veram karoti verāyati verāyanti kalaham karoti kalahāyati  kalahāyanti mettam karoti mettāyati mettāyanti karuṇam karoti karuṇāyati karuṇāyanti
translated: Ka is used in the sense of making with sound, etc., as in saddāyati, saddāyanti, etc., and in the sense of making with the second nouns beginning with sound, etc., as in saddādīhi karoti, saddādīhi karoti, etc.🔽He makes enmity, it shines, they shine; he makes a quarrel, it shines, they shine; he makes loving-kindness, it shines, they shine; he makes compassion, it shines, they shine;

original: muditaṃ karoti muditāyati, muditāyanti, upekkhaṃ karoti upekkhāyati, upekkhāyanti,
analyzed: muditam karoti muditāyati muditāyanti upekkham karoti upekkhāyati upekkhāyanti
translated: he makes gladness, it shines, they shine; he makes equanimity, it shines, they shine;

original: kukkuccaṃ karoti kukkuccāyati, kukkuccāyanti, piyaṃ karoti piyāyati, piyāyanti, paccayaṃ
analyzed: kukkuccam karoti kukkuccāyati kukkuccāyanti piyam karoti piyāyati piyāyanti paccayam
translated: He causes anxiety, he is anxious, they are anxious. He causes love, he is loved, they are loved. He causes a condition, he is conditioned, they are conditioned.

original: saddahanaṃ karoti pattiyāyati, pattiyāyanti, taṇhaṃ karoti taṇhāyati, taṇhāyanti,
analyzed: sat dahanam karoti pattiyāyati pattiyāyanti taṇham karoti taṇhāyati taṇhāyanti
translated: He causes faith, he is faithful, they are faithful. He causes craving, he craves, they crave.

original: taṇhīyati, taṇhīyanti vā, karotyatthe īyo. Mama idanti karoti mamāyati, mamāyanti.
analyzed: taṇhīyati vā karoti atthe īyaḥ mamaḥ idanti karoti mamāyati mamāyanti
translated: He craves, they crave. In the sense of ‘he causes’, īyo is added. He causes ‘mine’, he is selfish, they are selfish.

original: Namo karotīti atthe –🔽711. Namotvasso caṃ. 1.1.37; pā. 3.1.19.
analyzed: namaḥ karoti iti atthe  namaḥ tvas saḥ cam pā
translated: In the sense of ‘he causes homage’:🔽Namotvasso caṃ. ..; pā. ...

original: Namosaddato karotyatthe asso hoti.
analyzed: namaḥ saddataḥ karoti atthe assaḥ hoti
translated: In the sense of ‘he causes’ by means of the word ‘homage’, asso is added.

original: Namassati, namassanti.
analyzed: namaḥ sati namaḥ santi
translated: He pays homage, they pay homage.

original: Samānaṃ sadisaṃ karotīti atthe –
analyzed: samānam sadisam karoti iti atthe
translated: In the sense of ‘he causes what is the same, what is similar’:

original: 712. Dhātvatthe nāmasmi pā. 3.1.21, 25.
analyzed: dhātvatthe nām asmi pā
translated: Dhātvatthe nāmasmi pā. .., .

original: Dhātvattho vuccati yā kāci kriyā. Nāmasmā dhātvatthe i hoti. ‘Yuvaṇṇānameo paccaye’ti issa ettaṃ.
analyzed: dhātu atthaḥ vuccati yā kāci kriyā dhātu atthe i hoti paccaya iti issaḥ e ttam
translated: Any action whatsoever is called ‘the meaning of the verbal root’. In the sense of the meaning of the verbal root, i is added to the noun. ‘Eonamayāvā sare’ means ‘issa ettaṃ’.

original: Samāneti, samānenti.
analyzed: samāneti samānenti
translated: He makes equal, they make equal.

original: ‘Eonamayāvā sare’ti essa ayādeso. ‘Ṇiṇāpyāpīhi vā’ti ettha vāsaddena lapaccayo, samānayati,
analyzed: e e u nama ya vā sa rā iti essa aya ādesaḥ vā ti ettha vā saddena la paccayaḥ samānayati
translated: ‘Eonamayāvā sare’ means ‘essa ayādeso’. ‘Ṇiṇāpyāpīhi vā’ means ‘lapaccayo’. He makes equal, they make equal.

original: samānayanti, piṇaṃ karoti piṇeti, piṇayati, kusalaṃ pucchati kusaleti, kusalayati,
analyzed: samānayanti piṇam karoti piṇa iti piṇayati kusalam pucchati kusala iti kusalayati
translated: He causes to be brought together, he makes a heap, he heaps, he heaps up, he asks about the profitable, he makes profitable, he makes profitable for,

original: visuddhaṃ hoti visuddheti, visuddhayati, vīṇāya upagāyati upavīṇeti, upavīṇāyati,🔽paññāya atikkamati atipaññeti, atipaññāyati, vaccaṃ karoti vacceti, vaccayati, muttaṃ
analyzed: visuddham hoti visuddha iti visuddhayati vīṇāya upagāyati upavīṇā iti upavīṇāyati  paññāya atikkamati atipaññeti atipaññāyati vaccam karoti vacceti vaccayati muttam
translated: he is purified, he purifies, he purifies for, he sings a lute, he sings a lute for, he sings a lute for,

original: karoti mutteti, muttayati, balena pīḷeti baleti, balayati.
analyzed: karoti muttā iti muttayati balena pīḍeti balā iti balayati
translated: he surmounts by understanding, he makes surmount by understanding, he makes surmount by understanding for, he makes a stool, he makes a stool for, he makes a stool for, he makes urine, he makes urine for, he makes urine for,🔽he oppresses with strength, he makes strong, he makes strong for.

original: Assa itte-balīyati, balīyanti. “Abalānaṃ balīyantī”ti pāḷi.
analyzed: assa ittebalīyati balīyanti abalānam balīyanti iti
translated: “The weak are made strong” is the reading.

original: Saccaṃ karotīti atthe –🔽713. Saccādīhāpi saṃyuttanikāye; rū. 540; nī. 914; pā. 3.1.25.
analyzed: saccam karoti iti atthe  sacca ādi iha api saṃyutta nikāye rū nī pā
translated: In the sense of “he makes truth”🔽. Truth, here, is also in the Saṃyutta Nikāya; Rū. ; Nī. ; Pā.

original: Saccādīhi nāmehi dhātvatthe āpi hoti.🔽Saccāpeti, saccāpenti, atthavibhāgaṃ karoti atthāpeti, atthāpenti, bedasatthaṃ karoti
analyzed: sacca ādīhi nāmehi dhātvatthe āpi hoti  sacca apeti sacca apenti attha vibhāgam karoti attha apeti attha apenti beda sattham karoti
translated: In the sense of “truth” and so on the abstract noun ending in -tā is also used.🔽He causes to be made true, they cause to be made true, he makes a division of the meaning, he causes to be made meaning, they cause to be made meaning, he makes a division of the meaning,

original: bedāpeti, bedāpenti, sukkhaṃ karoti sukkhāpeti, sukkhāpenti, sukhaṃ karoti sukhāpeti,
analyzed: bedāpeti bedāpenti sukham karoti sukkhāpeti sukkhāpenti sukham karoti sukhāpeti
translated: he causes to be made a division of the meaning, they cause to be made a division of the meaning, he makes dry, he causes to be made dry, they cause to be made dry, he makes pleasant, he causes to be made pleasant,

original: sukhāpenti, dukkhaṃ karoti dukkhāpeti, dukkhāpenti, uṇhaṃ karoti uṇhāpeti, uṇhāpenti iccādi.
analyzed: sukhāpenti dukkham karoti dukkhāpeti dukkhāpenti uṇham karoti uṇhāpeti uṇhāpenti iccādi
translated: He makes happy, he makes suffer, he makes suffer, he makes hot, he makes hot, he makes hot, etc.

original: Aputtaṃ puttamiva ācarati puttīyati, puttīyituṃ icchatīti atthe ‘tuṃsmā lopo cicchāyaṃ te’ti sapaccayo.
analyzed: aputtam puttam iva ācarati puttīyati puttīyitum icchati iti atthe tuṃ smāḥ lopaḥ ciccha ayam te ti sa paccayaḥ
translated: He behaves as if he were a son who is not a son, he is pleased, he wishes to be pleased, in the sense of ‘tuṃ is elided in the locative case after a vowel, and the locative case is formed by adding -e to the stem’,

original: 714. Yathiṭṭhaṃ syādino ka. 458; rū. 461; nī. 939; caṃ. 5.1.8; pā. 6.1.3.
analyzed: yathiṭṭham syāt inaḥ ka rū nī cam pā
translated: As it stands, of the ending in -ya, the locative case, the nominative case, the ablative case, the genitive case,🔽What is wished for is desirable. As it stands, of the desirable. The reading is also ‘yamiṭṭha’.

original: Icchīyatīti iṭṭhaṃ, yaṃ yaṃ iṭṭhaṃ yathiṭṭhaṃ. “Yamiṭṭha”ntipi pāṭho. Syādyantassa
analyzed: icchīyati iti iṭṭham yam yam iṭṭham yathiṭṭham yam iṭṭha ntipi
translated: As it stands, of the ending in -ya,

original: yathiṭṭhaṃ ekassaraṃ ādibhūta’maññaṃ vā dverūpaṃ hoti, na tyādissa viya ādibhūtamevāti
analyzed: yathiṭṭham ekassaram ādi bhūtam aññam vā dverūpam hoti na ādi bhūtam eva ati
translated: the first syllable is either a single syllable or a double syllable, not the first syllable only, as in the case of ty-ādīsu.

original: attho. ‘Ū byañjanassā’ti ū āgamo.
analyzed: atthaḥ ū byañjanassa ati ū āgamaḥ
translated: The meaning is ‘ū is added to the vowel’.

original: Ādimhi dvitte-pupputtīyisati.
analyzed: ādimhi dvi t te pupput tīyi sati
translated: In the beginning, the double consonant is -pupputtīyisati.

original: Majjhe dvitte-puttittīyisati.
analyzed: majjhe dvi tte putti ttīyi sati
translated: In the middle, the double consonant is -puttittīyisati.

original: Akamalaṃ kamalaṃ bhavati kamalāyati, kamalāyituṃ icchatīti kakamalāyisati, kamamalāyisati, kamalalāyisati iccādi.
analyzed: a kamalam kamalam bhavati kamalāyati kamalāyitum icchati iti icca ādi
translated: It becomes a spotless lotus, it is pleased, it wishes to be pleased, thus it is kakamalāyisati, kamamalāyisati, kamalalāyisati, etc.

original: Iti nāmadhāturāsi.
analyzed: iti nāmadhātuḥ āsi
translated: Thus the collection of the noun base.

original: Iti niruttidīpaniyā nāma moggallānadīpaniyā
analyzed: iti niruttidīpaniyā nāma moggallānadīpaniyā
translated: Thus the explanation of the analysis called Niruttidīpanī, composed by Moggallāna,

original: Tyādikaṇḍo nāma ākhyātakaṇḍo
analyzed: tya ādi kaṇḍaḥ nāma ākhyāta kaṇḍaḥ
translated: The chapter named Tyādikaṇḍa is the chapter of narration.

original: Niṭṭhito.
analyzed: niṭṭhitaḥ
translated: The chapter called “The Particle” is finished.

original: 7. Kitakaṇḍa🔽Dhātvantavikārarāsi🔽Visaṃyogarūparāsi
analyzed: kita kaṇḍa  dhātu anta vikāra rāsi  visaṃyoga rūpa rā asi
translated: . The chapter on the kit affix

original: Atha dhātupaccayasaṃsiddhaṃ kāla, kāraka, liṅga, saṅkhyā, kriyābhedadīpakaṃ dabbappadhānavācakaṃ kitakapadaṃ dīpiyate.
analyzed: atha dhātu paccaya saṃsiddham kāla kāraka liṅga saṅkhyā kriyā bheda dīpakam dabba ppadhāna vācakam kitaka padam dīpiyate
translated: The kit affix is now explained, which, when combined with the conditions of the noun-stem, illuminates the distinctions of time, agent, gender, number, and action, and expresses the dabbāna (i.e., the kit affix).

original: Tattha atītādayo kālabhedo nāma.
analyzed: atīta ādayaḥ kāla bhedaḥ nāma
translated: Herein, the distinction of time is called past, etc.

original: Kattā ca kammañca karaṇañca sampadānañca apādānañca adhikaraṇañca bhāvo cāti satta sādhanāni kārakabhedo nāma.
analyzed: kattā ca kammañca karaṇañca sampadānañca apādānañca adhikaraṇañca bhāvaḥ ca ati satta sādhanāni kāraka bhedaḥ nāma
translated: The distinction of agent is called the seven means of expression: the doer, the object, the instrument, the cause, the source, the basis, and the state.

original: Itthiliṅgādīni liṅgabhedo nāma.
analyzed: itthi liṅga ādīni liṅga bhedaḥ nāma
translated: The distinction of gender is called feminine gender, etc.

original: Ekatta, bahuttabhedo saṅkhyābhedo nāma.
analyzed: saṅkhyā bhedaḥ nāma
translated: The distinction of number is called singularity and plurality.

original: Tassīlakriyā, taddhammakriyā, tassādhukārakriyā, attamānakriyā, abhikkhaññakriyā,
analyzed: tad sīla kriyā tad dhamma kriyā tad sādhukāra kriyā atta māna kriyā abhikkhañña kriyā
translated: The distinction of action is called the action of that (i.e., the noun-stem), the action of that quality, the action of that proper means, the action of self-respect, the action of going forward,

original: arahakriyā, sakkakriyā, pesanakriyā, atisaggakriyā, pattakālārocanakriyā, avassambhāvīkriyādayo kriyābhedo nāma.
analyzed: araha kriyā sakka kriyā pesana kriyā atisagga kriyā pattakāla ārocana kriyā avassambhāvī kriyā ādayaḥ kriyā bhedaḥ nāma
translated: the action of deserving, the action of being able, the action of sending, the action of excess, the action of announcing the proper time, the action of being indispensable, etc.🔽.

original: “Gamanaṃ bhavati, pacanaṃ jānāti” iccādīsu paccayatthabhūto bhāvo nāma sādhanarūpo
analyzed: gamanam bhavati pacanam jānāti iccādīsu paccaya ttha bhūtaḥ bhāvaḥ nāma sādhana rūpaḥ
translated: In such passages as “He goes, he cooks,” the state which is the condition is the means of proof.

original: hoti. Jāti viya saṅkhatadhammassa dhātvatthabhūtāya sādhyakriyāya sādhakattā liṅgattayayutto🔽ca hoti, kriyā, kāro, karaṇanti siddhattā saṅkhyābhedayutto ca hoti-nānādhātvatthānañca
analyzed: hoti jāti viya saṅkhata dhammassa dhātvattha bhūtāya sādhya kriyāya sādhaka ttā liṅga ttaya yuttaḥ  ca hoti kriyā kāro siddhattā
translated: It is like birth, which is endowed with the three genders because it is the means of accomplishing the action of becoming of a formed state which is the meaning of the root,🔽and it is endowed with the distinction of number because it is established as an action, a doing, an instrument. And because it is possible for it to have the same form as the distinction of the various roots’ meanings,

original: kattu, kammānañca kālādīnañca bhedena sarūpabhedasabbhavato, tasmā sopi dabbe eva
analyzed: kattu kammānam ca kāla ādīnam ca bhedena sarūpa bheda sabbhavato tasmā saḥ api dabbe eva
translated: of the agent, the object, and time, etc., therefore it is included in the word-base itself.

original: saṅgayhatīti katvā ‘dabbappadhānavācaka’nti vuttaṃ. Sesaṃ sabbaṃ tyādikaṇḍe bhāvasādhanavinicchaye vuttameva.
analyzed: saṅgayhati iti katvā dabba ppadhāna vācakanti vuttam sesam sabbam tyādi kaṇḍe bhāva sādhana vinicchaye vuttam eva
translated: So it is said to be “denoted by the word-base.” The rest is all stated in the “Section on the Means of Proof in the Case of a State” in the Ty-ādis-ekanda.

original: ‘Bahula’nti ca ‘kriyatthā’ti ca vattante –
analyzed: bahulanti ca kriyattha ati ca vattante
translated: The words “often” and “in the sense of action” are used.

original: 715. Kattari bhūte kta ktavantu ktāvī ka. 555; rū. 612; nī. 1142; caṃ. 1.2.66 …pe… 3.2.102.
analyzed: kattari bhūte kta ktavantu ktāvī ka rū nī cam pe
translated: The kta affix, the ktavant affix, and the ktvā affix are used in the agent when it is a noun.

original: Abhavīti bhūto, atīto, bhūte vattabbe kriyatthā kattari kānubandhā ta, tavantu, tāvīpaccayā honti, kānubandhā ‘na te kānubandhanāgamesū’ti sutte visesanatthā.
analyzed: abhavīti bhūtaḥ atītaḥ bhūte vattabbe kriyatthā kattari ka anubandhā honti ka anubandhā na te ka anubandha na āgamesu iti sutte visesana tthā
translated: The past tense is the past, the gone, the become. In the case of the past tense, the verbal noun is the agent, and the verbal adjective is the object. The verbal noun is the cause, and the verbal adjective is the condition. The verbal noun is not the condition in the case of the verbal adjective.🔽Who? In the case of the verbal noun and the verbal adjective, the verbal noun is the agent, and the verbal adjective is the object.

original: 716. Kto bhāvakammesu ka. 556; rū. 622; nī. 1143; caṃ. 1.2.67 …pe… 3.2.102; 3.4.70.🔽Bhūte vattabbe kriyatthā bhāva, kammesu kānubandho tapaccayo hoti.
analyzed: ktaḥ bhāva kammesu ka rū nī cam pe  bhūte vattabbe kriyatthā bhāva kammesu ka anubandhaḥ ta paccayaḥ hoti
translated: In the case of the past tense, the verbal noun is the cause, and the verbal adjective is the object.

original: Abhavīti bhūto-puriso, bhūtā-itthī, bhūtaṃ-kulaṃ, kārite dhātuto ṇānubandhānaṃ paṭhamaṃ🔽sampattattā ‘na te kānubandhanāgamesū’ti paṭisedho na pāpuṇāti, ‘yuvaṇṇānameo paccaye’ti
analyzed: bhūtopurisaḥ bhūtāitthī bhūtaṃkulam kārite dhātutaḥ ṇa anubandhānam paṭhamam  sampatta ttā na te kā anubandhana āgamesu iti paṭisedhaḥ na pāpuṇāti paccaye ti
translated: The past tense is the past, the gone, the become. The past tense is the man who has become, the woman who has become, the family which has become. In the case of the verbal noun and the verbal adjective, the verbal noun is the cause, and the verbal adjective is the condition.🔽The prohibition “The verbal adjective is not the condition in the case of the verbal noun” does not apply because the verbal noun is the first to be reached.🔽The addition “The verbal adjective is the condition in the case of the verbal noun” applies.🔽The verbal adjective is the object in the case of the verbal noun.

original: ovuddhi, ‘āvāyā ṇānubandhe’ti ossa āvattaṃ, tato tapaccayo.🔽717. Ñī byañjanassa ka. 605; rū. 547; nī. 1210.🔽Byañjanādipaccayassa ādimhi ñānubandho īkāro āgacchati.
analyzed: āvāyāḥ ṇa anubandha iti ossaḥ āvattam tataḥ ta paccayaḥ  ñī byañjanassa ka rū nī  byañjana ādi paccayassa ādimhi ña anubandhaḥ īkāraḥ āgacchati
translated: The verbal adjective is the condition in the case of the verbal noun.🔽The verbal adjective is the object in the case of the verbal noun.🔽The verbal adjective is the condition in the case of the verbal noun.🔽The verbal adjective is the object in the case of the verbal noun.🔽The verbal adjective is the condition in the case of the verbal noun.🔽The verbal adjective is the object in the case of the verbal noun.🔽The verbal adjective is the condition in the case of the verbal noun.🔽The verbal adjective is the object in the case of the verbal noun.🔽The verbal adjective is the condition in the case of the verbal noun.🔽The verbal adjective is the object in the case of the verbal noun.🔽The verbal adjective is the condition in the case of the verbal noun.🔽The verbal adjective is the object in the case of the verbal noun.🔽The verbal adjective is the condition in the case of the verbal noun.🔽The verbal adjective is the object in the case of the verbal noun.🔽The verbal adjective is the condition in the case of the verbal noun.

original: Kattari-abhāvayitthāti bhāvito-puriso, bhāvitāitthī, bhāvitaṃ-kulaṃ.
analyzed: bhāvitaḥ purisaḥ bhāvitā aitthī bhāvitaṃkulam
translated: The verbal adjective is the object in the case of the verbal noun.🔽The verbal adjective is the condition in the case of the verbal noun.🔽The verbal adjective is the

original: Kamme-anubhūyitthāti anubhūto-bhogo, anubhūtāsampatti, anubhūtaṃ-sukhaṃ.
analyzed: anubhūtaḥ bhogaḥ anubhūta a sampatti anubhūtam sukham
translated: The past participle of the verb anubhoti is anubhūyittha.🔽The past participle of the verb bhāveti is bhāvīyittha.🔽The past participle of the verb bhavati is bhūta.

original: Kārite-bhāvīyitthāti bhāvito-maggo, bhāvitāpaṭipadā, bhāvitaṃ-cittaṃ.
analyzed: bhāvitaḥ maggaḥ bhāvitā a paṭipadā bhāvitam cittam
translated: The past participle of the verb bhavati is bhāvī.🔽The past participle of the verb bhavati is bhūtāvī.🔽The past participle of the verb bhavati is bhūtāvinī.🔽The past participle of the verb bhavati is bhūtāvi.🔽The past participle of the verb bhavati is bhūtāvī.🔽The past participle of the verb bhavati is bhūtāvinī.

original: Tavantu, tāvīsu-abhavīti bhūtavā-puriso, bhūtavantī, bhūtavatī-itthī, bhūtavaṃ-kulaṃ,
analyzed: bhūtavā purisaḥ bhūtavantī bhūtavatī itthī
translated: The past participle of the verb bhavati is bhūtāvi.🔽The past participle of the verb bhavati is bhūtāvī.🔽The past participle of the verb bhavati is bhūtāvinī.🔽The past participle of the verb bhavati is bhūtāvi.🔽The past participle of the verb bhavati is bhūtāvī.

original: guṇavantusamaṃ. Bhūtāvī-puriso. Bhūtāvinī-itthī, bhūtāvi-cittaṃ, daṇḍī, daṇḍinīsamaṃ.
analyzed: bhūtāvī purisaḥ bhūtāvinī itthī bhūtāvi cittam daṇḍī daṇḍinī samam
translated: The past participle of the verb bhavati is bhūtāvinī.🔽The past participle of the verb bhavati is bhūtāvi.🔽The past participle of the verb bhavati is bhūtāvī.

original: Puriso bhogaṃ anubhūto, purisena bhogo anubhūto.
analyzed: purisaḥ bhogam purisena bhogaḥ anubhūtaḥ
translated: The past participle of the verb bhavati is bhūtāvinī.🔽The past participle of the verb bhavati is bhūtāvi.🔽The past participle of the verb bhavati is bhūtāvī.🔽The past participle of the verb bhavati is bhūtāvinī.🔽The past participle of the verb bhavati is bhūtāvi.

original: Ettha ca kitapaccayānaṃ attho duvidho vāccattho, abhidheyyattho cāti sabbaṃ tyādikaṇḍe vuttanayena veditabbaṃ.
analyzed: ettha ca k ita paccayānam atthaḥ duvidhaḥ vācca atthaḥ abhidheyya tthaḥ ca ati sabbam t y ādi kaṇḍe vutta nayena veditabbam
translated: The past participle of the verb bhavati is bhūtāvī.🔽The past participle of the verb bhavati is bhūtāvinī.🔽The past participle of the verb bhavati is bhūtāvi.🔽The past participle of the verb bhavati is bhūtāvī.

original: Purimesu pana chasu sādhanesu paccayānaṃ abhidheyyattho padantarena ācikkhīyati, bhāvasādhane pana attano dhātunā eva.
analyzed: purimesu pana chasu sādhanesu paccayānam abhidheyya tthaḥ pada antarena ācikkhīyati bhāva sādhane pana attanaḥ dhātunā eva
translated: The past participle of the verb bhavati is bhūtāvinī.🔽The past participle of the verb bhavati is bhūtāvi.🔽The past participle of the verb bhavati is bhūtāvī.🔽The past participle of the verb bhavati is bhūtāvinī.🔽The past participle of the verb bhavati is bhūtāvi.

original: Tattha ca kattusatti, kammasatti, karaṇasatti, sampadānasatti, apādānasatti, adhikaraṇasattisaṅkhātaṃ
analyzed: tattha ca kattu satti kamma satti karaṇa satti sampadāna satti apādāna satti adhikaraṇa satti saṅkhātam
translated: The past participle of the

original: vāccatthaṃ ujuṃ vadantā kitapaccayā attano abhidheyyapadena samānaliṅga, vibhatti,
analyzed: vāccattham ujum vadantā kita paccayā attanaḥ abhidheyya padena samāna liṅga vibhatti
translated: They speak the meaning of the words in the right way, according to the text, by means of the case- endings that are appropriate to their own names.

original: saṅkhyāyuttā hutvā vadanti.
analyzed: saṅkhyā yuttāḥ hutvā vadanti
translated: They speak by means of the gender, the case-ending, and the number.

original: Taṃ yathā? –
analyzed: tam yathā
translated: How is that?

original: Kattari tāva-puriso bhogaṃ anubhūto, purisā bhogaṃ anubhūtā…pe… purisesu bhogaṃ anubhūtesu,🔽itthī bhogaṃ anubhūtā, itthiyo bhogaṃ anubhūtāyo…pe… itthīsu bhogaṃ anubhūtāsu, kulaṃ
analyzed: kattari purisesu bhogam anubhūtesu  itthī bhogam anubhūtā itthiyaḥ bhogam anubhūtāya upe itthīsu bhogam anubhūtāsu kulam
translated: First, as regards the nominative case: A man has experienced enjoyment, men have experienced enjoyment … When enjoyment has been experienced by men,🔽a woman has experienced enjoyment, women have experienced enjoyment … When enjoyment has been experienced by women, a family

original: bhogaṃ anubhūtaṃ, kulāni bhogaṃ anabhūtāni…pe… kulesu bhogaṃ anubhūtesu.
analyzed: bhogam anubhūtam kulāni kulesu bhogam anubhūtesu
translated: has experienced enjoyment, families have experienced enjoyment … When enjoyment has been experienced by families,

original: Kamme-bhogo purisena anubhūto, bhogā purisena anubhūtā…pe… bhogesu purisena anubhūtesu,🔽sampatti purisena anubhūtā, sampattiyo purisena anubhūtāyo…pe… sampattīsu purisena
analyzed: kammebhogo purisena anubhūtaḥ bhogā purisena anubhūtā ape bhogesu purisena anubhūtesu  sampatti purisena anubhūtā sampattiyaḥ purisena sampattīsu purisena
translated: As regards the accusative case: Enjoyment has been experienced by a man, enjoyments have been experienced by a man … When enjoyments have been experienced by a man,

original: anubhūtāsu, sukhaṃ purisena anubhūtaṃ, sukhāni purisena anubhūtāni…pe… sukhesu purisena🔽anubhūtesu. Esa nayo karaṇādīsupi.
analyzed: anubhūtāsu sukham purisena anubhūtam sukhāni purisena sukhesu purisena 🔽anubhūtesu e saḥ nayaḥ karaṇa ādī supi
translated: prosperity has been experienced by a man, prosperities have been experienced by a man … When prosperities have been experienced by a man, happiness has been experienced by a man, happinesses have been experienced by a man … When happinesses have been experienced by a man. The same method applies to the other cases.

original: Evaṃ kitavācakā attano abhidheyyapadena samānaliṅga, vibhatti, saṅkhyāyuttā hutvā taṃ taṃ sādhanaṃ vadanti.
analyzed: evam abhidheyya padena saṅkhyā yuttāḥ hutvā tam tam sādhanam vadanti
translated: Thus the gamblers, using their own names, are in the same case, have the same case-ending, and are in the same number as the means of proof they mention.

original: ‘Itthiyamaṇatikayakyā cā’ti itthiyaṃ tipaccayo, anubhavanaṃ, anubhūyate vā anubhūti.
analyzed: ca ati itthiyam ti paccayaḥ anubhavanam anubhūyate vā
translated: ‘In the feminine, in the neuter, in the feminine and neuter, in the feminine and masculine, in the feminine and neuter, in the feminine and masculine and neuter’—in the feminine there is the locative case-relation, experience, or that which is experienced is experience.

original: “Tissassa anubhūti, phussassa anubhūti” iccādikā bahū anubhūtiyopi sijjhanti, tasmā
analyzed: tissassa anubhūti phussassa anubhūti iccā ādikāḥ bahū anubhūtiyaḥ api sijjhanti tasmā
translated: “Tissa’s experience, Phussa’s experience” and so on—there are many experiences. Therefore

original: “anubhūti, anubhūtiyo, anubhūtiṃ, anubhūtiyo…pe… anubhūtīsū”ti yujjati.
analyzed: anubhūti anubhūtiyaḥ anubhūtim anubhūti yope
translated: “experience, experiences, an experience, experiences … an experience, experiences, an experience, experiences” is correct.

analyzed: kattari l tuṇaka ka rū  nī   cam pā
translated: In the nominative case the verbal nouns in -tu and -taka are formed.

original: Kattukārake kriyatthā ltu, ṇakā honti, lānubandho tussa kattari nibandhanattho, ‘ltupitādīnamā’ti visesanattho ca.
analyzed: kattu kārake kriya tthāḥ l tu ṇakāḥ honti la anubandhaḥ tussa kattari nibandhana tthaḥ ca
translated: In the nominative case the verbal nouns in -tu and -taka are formed. The -tu suffix is attached to the verbal root and has the meaning of the nominative case. The -taka suffix has the meaning of the nominative case and the meaning of a particular.

original: Anubhavatīti anubhūtā, anubhūtāro, satthusamaṃ.
analyzed: anubhavati iti anubhūtāḥ anubhūtāraḥ satthu samam
translated: One who experiences is an experiencer, experiencers, equal to the Teacher.

original: Sāmaññavidhānattā arahatthe sattiatthe tassīla, taddhamma, tassādhukāra, attamānesu ca kālattaye ca bhavanti.
analyzed: sāmañña vidhāna ttā araha atthe satti atthe ca kāla ttaye ca bhavanti
translated: Because of the rule of generality, the -ssa suffix is added to the verbal root sat, meaning “to be,” in the sense of “worthy,” and the -ila suffix is added in the sense of “having that quality,” the -ka suffix in the sense of “having that as one’s welfare,” and the -māṇa suffix in the sense of “pride,” and in the three times.

original: Arahatthe-brahmaṇo brahmaṇiyā pariggahitā.
analyzed: arahatthebrahmaṇaḥ brahmaṇiyā pariggahitā
translated: In the sense of the state of an Arahant: “The brahmin and the brahmin woman are possessed of the Brahma-state.”

original: Sattiatthe-bhagavā anuppannassa maggassa uppādetā.🔽Tassīlādīsu-pasayhapavattā.
analyzed: satti atthe bhagavā anuppannassa maggassa uppādetā  tassīla ādīsu upasayha pavattā
translated: In the sense of a weapon: “The Blessed One is the producer of the unproduced Path.”🔽In the sense of a self: “The self is the chief of the self.”🔽In the sense of a self: “One who thinks oneself wise is one who honours the wise.”🔽In the sense of a self: “The self is the chief of the self.”

original: Attamāne-attānaṃ paṇḍitaṃ maññatīti paṇḍitamānitā.🔽719. Pubbekakattukānaṃ ka. 564; rū. 640; nīti. 1150-6; caṃ. 1.3.131; pā. 3.4.21.
analyzed: atta māne attānam paṇḍitam maññati iti paṇḍita māni tā  pubba eka kattukānam ka rū ni iti caṃ pā
translated: In the sense of a self: “One who thinks oneself wise is one who honours the wise.”🔽In the sense of a self: “The self is the chief of the self.”🔽In the sense of a self: “One who thinks oneself wise is one who honours the wise.”🔽In the sense of a self: “The self is the chief of the self.”🔽In the sense of a self: “One who thinks oneself wise is one who honours the wise.”🔽In the sense of a self: “The self is the chief of the self.”🔽In the sense of a self: “One who thinks oneself wise is one who honours the wise.”🔽In the sense of a self: “The self is the chief of the self.”

original: Yāsaṃ visesana, visesyānaṃ dvinnaṃ pubbā’parakriyānaṃ kattā ekova hoti. Tāsu pubbakriyāyaṃ
analyzed: yāsam dvinnam pubba apara kriyānam kattā ekaḥ iva hoti tāsu
translated: In the sense of a self: “One who thinks oneself wise is one who honours the wise.”🔽In the sense of a self: “The self is the chief of the self.”🔽In the sense of a self: “One who thinks oneself wise is one who honours the wise.”🔽In the sense of a self: “The self is the chief of the self.”🔽In the sense of a self: “One who thinks oneself wise is one who honours the wise.”

original: bhāvatthe tuna, tvāna, tvāpaccayā honti. ‘Eonamayavā sare’ti īkāre pare ovuddhiyā avattaṃ.
analyzed: bhāva tthe tuna tvāna tvā paccayāḥ honti e o na ma ya vā sa rā iti īkāre pare o vuddhiyā avattam
translated: In the sense of a self: “The self is the chief of the self.”🔽In the sense of a self: “One who thinks oneself wise is one who honours the wise.”

original: Bhogaṃ anubhavituna, anubhutvāna, anubhutvā.🔽Ekakattukānanti kiṃ? Devadatto bhuñji, yaññadatto gacchati.
analyzed: bhogam anubhavituna anubhutvāna anubhutvā  kim devadattaḥ bhuñji yaññadattaḥ gacchati
translated: In the sense of a self: “The self is the chief of the self.”🔽In the sense of a self: “One who thinks oneself wise is one who honours the wise.”🔽In the sense of a self: “The self is the chief of the self.”🔽In the sense of a self: “One who thinks oneself wise is one who honours the wise.”

original: Pubbeti kiṃ? Pacchā bhuñjati, paṭhamaṃ pacati.
analyzed: pubbe iti kim pacchā bhuñjati paṭhamam pacati
translated: In the sense of a self: “The self is the chief of the self.”🔽In the sense of a self: “One who thinks oneself wise is

original: Bahulādhikārā samānā’parakriyāsupi nānākattukāsupi tunādayo bhavanti. Thakkacca daṇḍo patati, dvāraṃ saṃvaritvā nikkhamati, puriso sīhaṃ disvā bhayaṃ uppajjatīti.
analyzed: bahula adhikārā samāna apara kriyā supi nānā kattukā supi tuna ādayaḥ bhavanti daṇḍaḥ patati dvāram saṃvaritvā nikkhamati puriso sīham disvā bhayam uppajjati iti
translated: And although the verbs are different, the particles are the same in the following, where the verbs are not different: “The stick falls down deliberately,” “he goes out after closing the door,” “fear arises in the man after seeing the lion.”

original: Yasmiṃ vākye aparakriyāpadaṃ na dissati. Yathā? Pabbataṃ atikkamma nadī, atikkamma
analyzed: yasmin vākye apara kriyā padam na dissati yathā pabbatam atikkamma nadī atikkamma
translated: In a sentence where the verb of action is not seen, as in “after crossing the mountain, the river,”

original: nadiṃ pabbato, ye te santā vimokkhā atikkamma rūpe arūpāti, tatthapi sattākriyā viññāyateva
analyzed: nadim pabbataḥ ye te santā vimokkhāḥ atikkamma rūpe arūpā ti tattha api sattā kriyā viññāyateva
translated: “after crossing the river, the mountain,” “the formless liberations that are beyond form,” there too the action is understood

original: sabbapadatthānaṃ sattānātivattanato. Aparakriyārahite asamānakattuke ca vākye paṭhamantayogassa
analyzed: sabba pada tthānam satta an ativattanataḥ apara kriyā rahite asamāna kattuke ca vākye paṭhama anta yogassa
translated: because all the meanings of the words are subordinate to the action. And in a sentence where there is no verb of action and the verbs are different, the particles are used

original: diṭṭhattā kattaripi tunādīnaṃ sambhavo yutto.
analyzed: diṭṭhattā kattari pi tuna ādīnam sambhavaḥ yuttaḥ
translated: in the nominative case because they are seen in the nominative case.

original: 720. Paṭisedhālaṃkhalūnaṃ tuna tvāna tvā vā paṭisedhelaṃkhalūnaṃ tunattvāna ttvā vā’ (bahūsu).
analyzed: paṭisedha alaṃkhalūnam vā paṭisedha ilaṃkhalūnam bahūsu
translated: “After having refused, after having rejected, after having refused, after having rejected” (in many).

original: Paṭisedhatthānaṃ alaṃ, khalūnaṃ yoge tunādayo honti vā.
analyzed: alam khalu ūnam yoge tuna ādayaḥ honti vā
translated: The particles are used after verbs of refusing and rejecting.

original: Alaṃ bhutvā, khalu bhutvā, alaṃ bhuttena, khalu bhuttena vā.
analyzed: alam bhutvā khalu bhutvā alam bhuttena khalu bhuttena vā
translated: “After having eaten enough,” “after having eaten enough,” “after having eaten enough,” “after having eaten enough.”

original: 721. Tuṃtāyetave bhāve bhavissatikriyāyaṃ tadatthāyaṃ ka. 561-2-3; rū. 636, 638-9; nī. 1148-9.
analyzed: tuṃtāya itave bhāve tad attha ayam
translated: Tuṃ, tāye, tave, for the future of the verb, in the sense of the state of being.

original: Tassā tassā kriyāya atthabhūtāya bhavissamānakriyāya gamyamānāya bhāvatthe tuṃ, tāye, tavepaccayā bhavanti. Suttapadavaḍḍhanena tuyepaccayopi.
analyzed: tassā tassā kriyāya attha bhūtāya bhavissamāna kriyāya gamyamānāya bhāva tthe tum tāye tave paccayāḥ bhavanti sutta pada vaḍḍhanena tuye paccayaḥ api
translated: Tuṃ, tāye, tave are formed from the future of the verb in the sense of the state of being, which is the meaning of the verb. Tuyā is formed by adding the sutta-ending -ya.

original: Anubhavituṃ gacchati, anubhavitāye gacchati, anubhavitave gacchati, anubhavituṃ icchati,
analyzed: anubhavitum gacchati anubhavitāye gacchati anubhavitave gacchati anubhavitum icchati
translated: He goes to experience, he goes to be experienced, he goes to be experienced, he wishes to experience,

original: kāmeti, sakkoti, jānāti. Tathā kālo anubhavituṃ, samayo anubhavituṃ, velā anubhavituṃ.
analyzed: kāma iti jānāti tathā kālaḥ anubhavitum samayaḥ anubhavitum velāḥ anubhavitum
translated: he desires, he is able, he knows. Likewise: the time for experiencing, the occasion for experiencing, the moment for experiencing.

original: Tathā anubhavituṃ mano, anubhavituṃ soko, cakkhu daṭṭhuṃ, sotaṃ sotuṃ, mano viññātuṃ,
analyzed: tathā anubhavitum manaḥ anubhavitum sokaḥ cakkhu daṭṭhum sotam sotum manaḥ viññātum
translated: Likewise: the mind for experiencing, grief for experiencing, the eye for seeing, the ear for hearing, the mind for cognizing,

original: hattho kātuṃ, pādo gantuṃ, dhanu yujjhituṃ, jaḷo vattuṃ, mando gantuṃ, alaso kattunti.
analyzed: hatthaḥ kātum pādaḥ gantum dhanu yujjhitum jaḷaḥ vattum mandaḥ gantum alasaḥ kattunti
translated: the hand for doing, the foot for going, the bow for fighting, the dull man for speaking, the slow man for going, the lazy man for doing.

original: Ettha ca “kālo anubhavitu”ntiādīsu sattāvasena hetukriyā sijjhati, tasmā “anubhavituṃ kālo bhavatī”tiādinā attho veditabbo.
analyzed: ettha ca kālaḥ anubhavitum ti ādīsu sattā vasena hetu kriyā sijjhati tasmai anubhavitum kālaḥ bhavati iti ādinā atthaḥ veditabbo
translated: And here in the phrases “the time to experience” and so on, the causal state is established by means of the living being, so the meaning should be understood in this way: “The time for you to experience is come.”🔽And these are the uses of the forms with tāya, tuya, and payoga:

original: Ime panettha tāye, tuyepayogā – āgatāmha imaṃ dhammasamayaṃ, dakkhitāye aparājitasaṅghaṃ
analyzed: ime pana ittha tāye āgatāmha imam dhamma samayam aparājita saṅgham
translated: We have come to this Dhamma occasion, to see the unconquered Saṅgha.🔽It is fitting for you to laugh, having seen me like this.

original: dī. ni. 2.332. Alañhi te jagghitāye, mamaṃ disvāna edisaṃ jā. 1.5.137. Ko tādisaṃ
analyzed: alam hi te mamam disvānaḥ edisam jā
translated: Who is worthy to eat him?

original: arahati khāditāye jā. 1.16.92, atthi hehiti so maggo, na so sakkā na hotuye bu. vaṃ.
analyzed: arahati khāditāye jā atthi hehiti saḥ maggaḥ na saḥ sakkā na
translated: There is that path, it is not possible for him not to be.

original: 2.9 ‘hetuye’, arahasi naṃ yācituye tuvampi, arahasi no jānituye katāni iccādi.
analyzed: hetuye arahasi nam yācituye arahasi no jānituye katāni iccādi
translated: ‘For the cause’—you are worthy to ask him; you are worthy to know what has been done.

original: 722. Bhāvakammesu tabbānīyā ka. 540; rū. 545; nī. 1125.
analyzed: bhāva kammesu tabbānīyā ka rū nī
translated: In the case of verbs of becoming, the forms tabbāni, tabba, and tabba are used.🔽And in the case of verbs of action, the forms tabba, tabbāni, tabbaṃ, tabbā, and tabbāni are used.

original: Bhāve kammani ca tabba, anīyā honti. Suttapadavaḍḍhanena tabya, tāya, teyyapaccayāpi honti.
analyzed: bhāve kammani ca tabba anīyā honti sutta pada vaḍḍhanena tāya teyya paccayā api honti
translated: The forms tabya, tāya, and teyya are used with the addition of a word of the sutta.

original: Anubhavitabbo-bhogo, anubhavitabbā-sampatti, anubhavitabbaṃ-sukhaṃ.
analyzed: anubhavitabbaḥ bhogaḥ anubhavitabba a sampatti anubhavitabbam sukham
translated: The forms anubhavitabbo, anubhavitabbā, and anubhavitabba are used.

original: Bahulādhikārā kattādīsvapi bhavanti, tapantīti tapanīyāpāpadhammā, upaṭṭhātīti upaṭṭhānīyo-sisso.
analyzed: bahula adhikārā kattā ādīsu api bhavanti tapanti iti tapanīyā apāpa dhammā upaṭṭhāti iti upaṭṭhānīya usissaḥ
translated: They are used also in the sense of “many” in such passages as “Kattādisu bahulādhikārā” . They are called “to be heated” because they heat, i.e. are the cause of the arising of evil states. They are called “to be attended on” because they are attended on, i.e. pupils.

original: Pavuccati etenāti pavacanīyo-upajjhāyo, niyyanti etenāti niyyānīyo, so eva niyyāniko.
analyzed: pavuccati etena ati pavacanīyaḥ upajjhāyaḥ niyyanti etena ati niyyānīyo saḥ eva niyyānikaḥ
translated: They are called “to be spoken to” because one is spoken to by means of them, i.e. preceptors. They are called “to be gone forth by means of” because one goes forth by means of them, i.e. the going forth itself.

original: Sinā-soceyye, sināyanti etenāti sinānīyaṃcuṇṇaṃ, dīyate assāti dānīyo-brāhmaṇo. Sammā vattati etthāti sammāvattanīyo-guru.
analyzed: sinā soceyye sināyanti etena ati sinānīyam cuṇṇam dīyate assa ati dānīyaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ sammā vattati ettha ati sammāvattanīyaḥ guru
translated: They are called “to be bathed in” because one is bathed in them, i.e. bathing powder. They are called “to be given” because they are given to him, i.e. a brahmin. They are called “to be conducted rightly” because they are conducted rightly, i.e. a teacher.

original: Idha gāthā vuccati –
analyzed: idha gāthā vuccati
translated: Herein, a verse:

original: Arahatthe ca sakkatthe, pattakāle ca pesane;
analyzed: arahatthe ca sakkatthe pattakāle ca pesane
translated: In the sense of “worthy,” “honorable,” “timely,” “to be sent,”

original: Tabbādayo atisagge, avassādhamiṇesu ca.
analyzed: tabba ādayaḥ atisagge avassa adhamiṇesu ca
translated: “To be done,” etc., “to be surpassed,” and “to be disappointed in.”

original: Tattha “araha sakka visiṭṭhe kattarī”ti vuttiyaṃ vuttaṃ, tasmā bhavatīti bhabbo, bhavituṃ arahatīti attho, majjatīti majjaṃ, madanīyaṃ, majjituṃ sakkotīti attho, evampi yujjati.🔽Pattakāle-kattabbo bhavatā kaṭo, esa kālo kaṭakaraṇassāti dīpeti.
analyzed: tattha araha sakka visiṭṭhe kattari iti vuttiyam vuttam tasmai bhavati iti bhabbaḥ bhavitum arahati iti atthaḥ majjati iti majjam madanīyam majjitum sakkoti iti atthaḥ evam pi yujjati 🔽bhavatā kaṭaḥ esa kālaḥ kaṭa karaṇassa ati dīpeti
translated: Herein, it is said in the commentary that “araha sakka visiṭṭhe kattarī” , and therefore it is “to be become” , the meaning is “to be able to become.” It is “to be drunk” , the meaning is “to be able to be drunk.” It is “to be sent” , the meaning is “to be sent at the right time.”

original: Pesane-gantabbo bhavatā gāmo, gacchatu bhavaṃ gāmanti dīpeti.🔽Atisajjanaṃ sambodhanaṃ atisaggo, upadeso ceva vidhi ca. Tattha kattabbā’kattabbassa
analyzed: bhavatā gāmaḥ gacchatu bhavam gāmanti dīpeti  atisajjanam sambodhanam atisaggo upadeso ca iva vidhi ca tattha kattabba a kattabbassa
translated: “You should go to the village on an errand,” “Go to the village, good man.”

original: kammassa ācikkhaṇaṃ upadeso, dānaṃ dātabbaṃ, sīlaṃ rakkhitabbaṃ, pāṇo na hantabbo,🔽adinnaṃ na ādātabbaṃ dī. ni. 3.85. Kattabbā’kattabbākāradassanaṃ vidhi, sakkaccaṃ
analyzed: kammassa ācikkhaṇam upadesaḥ dānam dātabbam sīlam rakkhitabbam pāṇaḥ na hantabbaḥ  a dinnam na ādātabbam dī ni kattabba a kattabba ākāra dassanam vidhi sakkaccam
translated: Over-familiarity is familiarity to excess, over-familiarity. Instruction is also a rule. Herein, the pointing out of what should be done and what should not be done is instruction: “Give a gift, guard morality, see a sight,” etc.; “Do not kill breathing things, do not take what is not given,” etc.

original: dānaṃ dātabbaṃ, no asakkaccaṃ.
analyzed: dānam dātabbam no asakkaccam
translated: The showing of the way to do what should be done and what should not be done is a rule: “Give a gift respectfully, do not give without respect,” etc.

original: Avassake-gamanīyo abhisamparāyo, avassaṃ gantabboti attho.
analyzed: avassakegamanīyaḥ abhisamparāyaḥ avassam gantabbaḥ iti attho
translated: “The world beyond is to be gone to without a boat,” the meaning is, “The world beyond is to be gone to without a boat.”

original: Yaṃ iṇaṃ adentassa daṇḍo āgacchati, idaṃ adhamiṇaṃ nāma, sataṃ me dātabbaṃ bhavatāti.
analyzed: yam iṇam a dentassa daṇḍaḥ āgacchati idam adhamiṇam nāma satam me dātabbam bhavata ati
translated: The penalty that comes to one who does not pay a debt is called a debt-penalty. “You owe me a hundred,” etc.

original: Ime panettha tabya, tāya, teyyapayogā – na brāhmaṇe addhike tiṭṭhamāne, gantabyamāhu🔽dvipadinda seṭṭha jā. 1.10.13 (gantabba). Bhūtagāmapātabyatā, kāmesu pātabyatā pāci.
analyzed: ime pana ittha na brāhmaṇe addhike tiṭṭhamāne gantabyam āhu 🔽dvipadinda seṭṭha jā gantabba bhūta gāma pātabya tā kāmesu pātabya tā pāci

original: 90, alajjitāye lajjanti dha. pa. 316, lajjitāye na lajjare. Ghātetāyaṃ vā ghātetuṃ,
analyzed: a lajjita āye lajjanti lajjita āye na lajjare vā
translated: Out of shame they are ashamed, out of shame they are not ashamed.🔽To kill or to have killed,

original: pabbājetāyaṃ vā pabbājetuṃ ma. ni. 1.357, ñāteyyaṃ, diṭṭheyyaṃ, patteyyaṃ, viddheyyaṃ
analyzed: pabbājeta ayam vā pabbājetum ma ni ñāteyyam diṭṭheyyam patteyyam viddheyyam
translated: to banish or to have banished, to know, to see, to reach, to pierce,

original: maṃ amaññatha jā. 2.22.297.
analyzed: mam amaññatha jā
translated: they thought of me.

original: Ta,ti, tu, tavantu, tāvī, tvā, tvāna, tuna, tuṃ, tave, tāye, tuye, tabba. Ime takārapaccayā nāma.
analyzed: tati tu tavantu tāvī tvā tvāna tuna tum tave tāye tuye tabbe ime takāra paccayāḥ nāma
translated: Ta, ti, tu, tavantu, tāvī, tvā, tvāna, tuna, tuṃ, tave, tāye, tuye, tabba. These are called the endings with the particle ta.

original: Kara, khanu, gā, gamu, jana, ṭhā, tanu, thara, dhā, dhara, namu, pā, phara, bhara, mana, mara, ramu, sara, hara, hana.
analyzed: kara khanu gā gamu jana ṭhā tanu thara dhā dhara namu pā phara bhara mana mara ramu sara hara hana
translated: Kara, khanu, gā, gamu, jana, ṭhā, tanu, thara, dhā, dhara, namu, pā, phara, bhara, mana, mara, ramu, sara, hara, hana.

original: 723. Gamādirānaṃ lopontassa ka. 586-7; rū. 600, 632; nī. 1190, 1191.
analyzed: gam ādi rānam lopaḥ u ntassa ka rū
translated: . The ka of gamādirānaṃ lopontassa -; rū. , ; nī. , .

original: Gamādīnaṃ makāra, nakārantānaṃ rakārantānañca dhātūnaṃ antassa lopo hoti kānubandhe tapaccaye pare tvādivajjite.
analyzed: gama ādīnam makāra nakāra antānam rakāra antānam ca dhātūnam antassa lopaḥ hoti ka anubandhe ta paccaye pare tu ādi vat jite
translated: The final of gamādirānaṃ makāra, nakārantānaṃ rakārantānañca dhātūnaṃ is elided in kānubandhe tapaccaye pare tvādivajjite.

original: Kara-karaṇe, karīyitthāti kato-vihāro, katāgūhā, kataṃ-gehaṃ, sakkarīyitthāti sakkato, mahāvuttinā santassa so.
analyzed: kara karaṇe karīyittha ati katovihāro kataṃgeham sakkarīyittha ati sakkataḥ mahāvuttinā santassa so
translated: Kara-in making, karīyitthāti kato-vihāro, katāgūhā, kataṃ-gehaṃ, sakkarīyitthāti sakkato, mahāvuttinā santassa so.

original: ‘Karotissa kho’ti pādito karassa kassa kho, saṅkharīyitthāti saṅkhato, abhisaṅkhato,
analyzed: karotissa kho ti pāditaḥ karassa kassa kho saṅkharīyittha ati saṅkhataḥ abhisaṅkhataḥ
translated: ‘Karotissa kho’ means ‘it was made by a maker’. ‘Kassa kho’ means ‘it was made by a maker’. ‘Saṅkharīyittha’ means ‘it was made, was put together, was put together well’.

original: visaṅkharittha vikirīyitthāti visaṅkhato, upakarīyittha sajjīyitthāti upakkhaṭo,
analyzed: visaṅkharittha vikirīyittha ati visaṅkhataḥ upakarīyittha sajjīyittha ati upakkhaṭaḥ
translated: ‘Visaṅkharittha’ means ‘it was made, was scattered, was scattered about’. ‘Vikirīyittha’ means ‘it was scattered, was scattered about’. ‘Visaṅkhato’ means ‘it was scattered, was scattered about’. ‘Upakarīyittha’ means ‘it was made, was made ready’. ‘Sajjīyittha’ means ‘it was made ready’.

original: ‘tathanarānaṃ ṭaṭhaṇalā’ti tassa ṭo. Evaṃ dukkaṭaṃ.
analyzed: ta tha na rānam ṭa ṭha ṇa lā ti tassa ṭaḥ evam dukkaṭam
translated: ‘Tathanarānaṃ ṭaṭhaṇalā’ means ‘it was made, was made ready’. ‘Tassa ṭo’ means ‘it was made, was made ready’. Thus ‘dukkata’.

original: Parito karīyitthāti parikkhato, purato karīyitthāti purakkhato, purekkhato vā, mahāvuttinā purassa ettaṃ.
analyzed: paritas karīyittha ati parikkhataḥ puratas karīyittha ati purakkhataḥ purekkhataḥ vā mahāvuttinā purassa
translated: ‘Parito karīyittha’ means ‘it was made, was made around’. ‘Purato karīyittha’ means ‘it was made, was made in front’. ‘Purakkhato’ means ‘it was made, was made in front’. ‘Mahāvuttinā purassa ettaṃ’ means ‘it was made, was made in front’.

original: Khanu-avadāraṇe, khaññitthāti khato-āvāṭo.
analyzed: khanu avadāraṇe khaññitthā iti khataḥ āvāṭaḥ
translated: ‘Khanu-avadāraṇe, khaññitthāti khato-āvāṭo’ means ‘it was made, was made, was made in a hole’.

original: Gā-sadde.
analyzed: gāsadde
translated: ‘Gā-sadde’ means ‘it was made, was made, was made in a hole’.

original: 724. Gāpānamī ka. 588; rū. 620; nī. 1192.
analyzed: gāpānamī ka rū nī
translated: . Gāpānamī ka. ; rū. ; nī. .

original: Gā, pānaṃ anto īkāro hoti kānubandhe tapaccaye pare tvādivajjite.
analyzed: antaḥ īkāraḥ hoti ka anubandhe ta pad caye pare tu ādi vat jite
translated: ‘Gā, pānaṃ anto īkāro hoti kānubandhe tapaccaye pare tvādivajjite’ means ‘it was made, was made, was made in a hole’.

original: Gāyitthāti gītaṃ, samodhānetvā gāyitthāti saṅgītopariyattidhammo.
analyzed: gāyittha ati gītam samodhānetvā gāyittha ati saṅgīta upariyatti dhammaḥ
translated: ‘Gāyitthāti gītaṃ’ means ‘it was made, was made, was made in a hole’. ‘Samodhānetvā gāyitthāti saṅgītopariyattidhammo’ means ‘it was made, was made, was made in a hole’.🔽.

original: Gamu-gatimhi agacchīti gato, agacchīyitthāti vā gato. Evaṃ āgato, uggato, duggato, niggato, vigato, sugato, saṅgato, anugato, apagato, avagato, upagato, adhigato.🔽Jana-jātiyaṃ.
analyzed: agacchi iti gataḥ agacchīyittha ati vā gataḥ evam āgataḥ uggataḥ duggataḥ niggataḥ vigataḥ sugataḥ saṅgataḥ anugataḥ apagataḥ avagataḥ upagataḥ adhigataḥ  jana jāti yam
translated: In the sense of “gone” (agacchi) in the sense of “he has gone, he has come” (agacchi), thus “he has come” (agato), “he has gone up” (uggato), “he has gone down” (duggato), “he has gone out” (niggato), “he has gone away” (viggato), “he has gone well” (sugato), “he has gone together” (saṅgato), “he has gone after” (anugato), “he has gone away” (apagato), “he has gone down” (avagato), “he has gone near” (upagato), “he has gone up to” (adhigato).🔽In the sense of “people” (jana) in the sense of “people” (jāti).

analyzed: ro
translated: . Janissa ka. ; rū. ; nī. .

original: Janissa nassa ā hoti kānubandhe tapaccaye pare tvādivajjite.
analyzed: janissa nassa ā hoti ka anubandhe ta paccaye pare tu ādi vat jite
translated: Janissa nassa ā becomes in the sense of “connection” (kānubandha) with the following syllable, as in “tvādivajjita”.

original: Ajāyitthāti jāto, dujjāto, sujāto, sañjāto, anujāto, avajāto, atijāto.
analyzed: ajāyittha ati jātaḥ dujjātaḥ sujātaḥ sañjātaḥ anujātaḥ avajātaḥ atijātaḥ
translated: “He has been born” (ajāyittha) is “born” (jāto), “hard to be born” (dujjāto), “well born” (sujāto), “born together” (sañjāto), “born after” (anujāto), “born down” (avajāto), “born over” (atijāto).

original: Suttavibhattena aññasmimpi vaṇṇe pare nassa ā hoti, puttaṃ vijāyitvā, vijāyituṃ,
analyzed: sutta vibhattena aññasmim pi vaṇṇe pare hoti puttam vijāyitvā vijāyitum
translated: In another case, with the locative case ending, nassa ā becomes with the following syllable, as in “having given birth to a son” (puttaṃ vijāyitvā), “to give birth” (vijāyituṃ),

original: vijāyanaṃ, vijāyantī-itthī, vijāyamānā, puttaṃ janetīti jāyā iccādi, sabbattha mahāvuttinā
analyzed: vijāyanam vijāyantī itthī vijāyamānā puttam janeti iti jāyā iccādi sabbattha mahāvuttinā
translated: “giving birth” (vijāyanaṃ), “a woman who gives birth” (vijāyantī-itthī), “giving birth” (vijāyamānā), “she gives birth to a son” (puttaṃ janetīti jāyā), and so on, in all cases

original: sare pare yāgamo, mahāvuttinā vā sabbattha nassa yādeso ādidīgho ca.
analyzed: sare pare ya āgamaḥ mahāvuttinā vā sabbattha nassa ya ādesaḥ ādi dīghaḥ ca
translated: with the locative case ending (sare pare yāgamo), or in all cases with the locative case ending (mahāvuttinā vā sabbattha nassa yādeso ādidīgho ca).

original: Ṭhā-gatinivattiyaṃ.
analyzed: ṭhā gati nivattiyam
translated: In the sense of “going” (ṭhā) in the sense of “returning” (nivattiyaṃ).🔽. Ṭhāssi ka. ; rū. ; nī. .

original: 726. Ṭhāssi ka. 588; rū. 620; nī. 1192.🔽Ṭhāssa i hoti kānubandhe takāre tvādivajjite.
analyzed: ṭhā assi ka rū nī 🔽ṭhā ssa i ha u ti ka anubandhe takāre tu ādi vat jite
translated: Ṭhāssi ka. 588; rū. 620; nī. 1192.🔽Ṭhāssi is used in the sense of “being bound to” and is like tvādivajjite.

original: Aṭṭhāsīti ṭhito, uṭṭhito, niṭṭhito, saṇṭhito, adhiṭṭhito.
analyzed: aṭṭhāsi iti ṭhitaḥ uṭṭhitaḥ niṭṭhitaḥ saṇṭhitaḥ adhiṭṭhitaḥ
translated: 8. He stood, he rose, he sat down, he sat cross-legged, he resolved.

original: Tanu-vitthāre, ātaññitthāti ātataṃ, vitataṃ, ātatavitataṃ, tūriyabhedo.
analyzed: tanu vitthāre ātaññitthāti ātatam vitatam ātatavitatam tūriyabhedaḥ
translated: 9. He was stretched out, he was extended, he was stretched out and extended, he was a musical instrument.

original: Thara-santharaṇe, santharīyitthāti santhato, vitthato.🔽Dhā-dhāraṇe.🔽727. Dhāssa hi ka. 517; rū. 488; nī. 1105.
analyzed: thara santharaṇe santharīyittha ati santhataḥ  dhā dhāraṇe  dhāssa hi ka rū
translated: 10. He was spread out, he was spread about, he was spread out and spread about.🔽11. He bore, he held.🔽For the syllable dhā has ka, ru, ni.

original: Dhādhātussa dhassa hi hoti kānubandhe takāre tvādivajjite.🔽Ādhīyitthāti āhito, āgyāhito, vidhīyitthāti vihito, nidhīyitthāti nihito, sandhīyitthāti
analyzed: dhā dhātussa dhassa hi hoti ka anubandhe takāre tu ādi vat jite  ādhīyitthāti āhitaḥ āgyāhitaḥ vidhīyitthāti vihitaḥ nidhīyitthāti nihitaḥ sandhīyitthāti
translated: In the connection with ka, the syllable dhā of the dhā-group has dh, but in the case of tvādi it is not so.

original: saṃhito, odhīyitthāti ohito, abhidhīyitthāti abhihito, pidhīyitthāti pihito, apihito.🔽Dvitte pubbassa tatiyattaṃ, ‘dhāssa ho’ti suttena parassa hattaṃ, ādahito, vidahito,
analyzed: saṃhitaḥ odhīyittha ati ohitaḥ abhidhīyittha ati abhihitaḥ pidhīyittha ati pihitaḥ apihitaḥ  dvitte pubbassa tatiya ttam dhāssa hoti suttena parassa hattam ādahitaḥ vidahitaḥ
translated: He was borne, he was carried, he was ordered, he was laid down, he was laid up, he was laid out, he was laid about, he was laid away, he was laid aside, he was laid by.

original: nidahito, saṃdahito, saddahito vā, sannidahito, odahito, pidahito, apidahito, paridahito.
analyzed: nidahitaḥ saṃdahitaḥ saddahitaḥ vā sannidahitaḥ odahitaḥ pidahitaḥ apidahitaḥ paridahitaḥ
translated: In the second, the third of the first is made the third of the second by the rule ‘dhāssa ho’ . He was taken up, he was laid out, he was laid down, he was laid up, he was laid out, he was laid about, he was laid away, he was laid aside, he was laid by, he was laid apart.

original: Dhara-dhāraṇe, uddharīyitthāti uddhaṭo, samuddhaṭo, niddhaṭo, tassa ṭattaṃ.
analyzed: dhara dhāraṇe uddharīyittha ati uddhaṭaḥ samuddhaṭaḥ niddhaṭaḥ tassa
translated: Dhara-dhāraṇe, uddharīyitthāti uddhaṭo, samuddhaṭo, niddhaṭo, tassa ṭattaṃ.

original: Namu-namane, namitthāti nato, unnato, samunnato, onato, avanato.
analyzed: namu namane namittha ati nataḥ unnataḥ samunnataḥ onataḥ avanataḥ
translated: Namu-namane, namitthāti nato, unnato, samunnato, onato, avanato.

original: Pā-pāne, ‘gāpānamī’ti īttaṃ, pīyitthāti pītaṃ.
analyzed: pāpāne īttam pīyittha ati pītam
translated: Pā-pāne, ‘gāpānamī’ti īttaṃ, pīyitthāti pītaṃ.

original: Phara-pharaṇe, pharittha, pharīyitthāti vā phuṭo, vipphuṭo, samphuṭo, ophuṭo, mahāvuttinā phassa uttaṃ, tassa ṭattaṃ.
analyzed: phara pharaṇe pharittha pharīyittha ati vā phuṭaḥ vipphuṭaḥ samphuṭaḥ ophuṭaḥ mahāvuttinā phassaḥ uttam tassa ṭattam
translated: Phara-pharaṇe, pharittha, pharīyitthāti vā phuṭo, vipphuṭo, samphuṭo, ophuṭo, mahāvuttinā phassa uttaṃ, tassa ṭattaṃ.

original: Bhara-dhāraṇe, bharīyitthāti bhato, ābhato, ābhaṭo vā. Udakātalamubbhato, ubbhataṃ saṅghena kathinaṃ mahāva. 317, sambhataṃ dhanaṃ.
analyzed: bhara dhāraṇe bharīyittha ati bhataḥ ābhataḥ ābhaṭaḥ vā udakātalam ubbhataḥ ubbhatam saṅghena kathinam sambhatam dhanam
translated: Bhara-dhāraṇe, bharīyitthāti bhato, ābhato, ābhaṭo vā. Udakātalamubbhato, ubbhataṃ saṅghena kathinaṃ mahāva. , sambhataṃ dhanaṃ.

original: Mana-ñāṇe, mato, mahājanena sammatoti mahāsammato, sammatā sīmā mahāva. 139, anumato, abhimato.
analyzed: mataḥ mahājanena sammato ti mahāsammataḥ sammatā sīmā anumataḥ abhimataḥ
translated: Mana-ñāṇe, mato, mahājanena sammatoti mahāsammato, sammatā sīmā mahāva. , anumato, abhimato.

original: Mara-pāṇacāge, maritthāti mato, kālaṅkato.🔽Ramu-kīḷāyaṃ, ramitthāti rato, abhirato.
analyzed: mara pāṇa cāge marittha ati mato  ramukīḍa ayam ramittha ati rataḥ abhirataḥ
translated: Mara-pāṇacāge, maritthāti mato, kālaṅkato.🔽Ramu-kīḷāyaṃ, ramitthāti rato, abhirato.

original: Ramu-uparame, virato, paṭivirato, uparato.
analyzed: ramu uparame virato paṭivirato uparato
translated: Ramu-uparame, virato, paṭivirato, uparato.

original: Sara-gati, cintāsu, bahulādhikārā kālattayepi tapaccayo, sarati, asari, sarissatīti sato, anussato, patissato.
analyzed: cintāsu bahula adhikārā kāla ttaye pi ta paccayaḥ sarati asari sarissati iti sataḥ anussataḥ
translated: The prefix sara- has the meaning of going. In the sense of thinking, in the sense of frequenting, in the sense of being a condition in the three times, it is a prefix meaning “to remember.” One who remembers is sato, anussato, patissato.

original: Hara-haraṇe, harīyitthāti hato, āhato, nihato.
analyzed: hara haraṇe harīyittha ati hataḥ āhataḥ nihataḥ
translated: The prefix hara- has the meaning of carrying away. One who is carried away is hato, āhato, nihato.

original: Tassa ṭatte-āhaṭo, nihaṭo, udāhaṭo, samudāhaṭo, avahaṭo.
analyzed: tassa nihaṭaḥ udāhaṭaḥ samudāhaṭaḥ avahaṭaḥ
translated: In the sense of its being carried, it is āhaṭa, nihaṭa, udāhaṭa, samudāhaṭa, avahaṭa.

original: Hana-hiṃsāyaṃ, haññitthāti hato, vihato, samūhato avippavāso mahāva. 145, samūhatā sīmā mahāva. 146.
analyzed: hana hiṃsā ayam haññittha ati hataḥ vihataḥ samūhataḥ a vippavāsaḥ mahāva samūhatā sīmā mahāva
translated: The prefix hana- has the meaning of harming. One who is harmed is hato, vihato, samūhato.

original: Tipaccayamhi bahulādhikārā akānubandhepi antalopo. Paṭhamaṃ karīyatīti pakati, ākāro
analyzed: ti paccayamhi bahula adhikārāḥ a ka anubandhe pi anta lopaḥ paṭhamam ākāraḥ
translated: In the sense of being a condition, in the sense of frequenting, in the sense of being a condition in the three times, in the sense of not being separated, there is elision of the final. The first is done is pakati, the form.

original: ākati, vikāro vikati, gāyanaṃ gīti, uggīti, saṅgīti, anugāyanaṃ anugīti, gamanaṃ
analyzed: vikāraḥ vikati gāyanam gīti uggīti saṅgīti anugāyanam anugīti gamanam
translated: The form is ākati, the change is vikati, the singing is gīti, the high singing is uggīti, the singing together is saṅgīti, the singing after is anugīti, the going is

original: gati, gantabbāti vā gati, gacchanti etthāti vā gati, āgamanaṃ āgati, sugati, duggati,
analyzed: gati gantabbā ati vā gati gacchanti ettha ati vā gati āgamanam āgati sugati duggati
translated: gati, or that which is to be gone is gati, or they go there is gati, the coming is āgati, the good destination is sugati, the bad destination is duggati,

original: samāgamanaṃ saṅgati, jananaṃ jāti, jāyanti etāya, etthāti vā jāti, ṭhānaṃ ṭhiti,
analyzed: samāgamanam saṅgati jananam jāti jāyanti etāya etthāti vā jāti ṭhānam ṭhiti
translated: the coming together is saṅgati, the being born is jāti, they are born by means of this, or there is jāti there, the standing is ṭhiti,

original: saṇṭhiti, avaṭṭhiti, punappunaṃ tananaṃ santati, dhārenti etāyāti dhīti, mahāvuttinā īttaṃ.🔽Namanaṃ nati, unnati, samunnati, onati, avanati, bharitabbāti bhati, manati jānāti🔽etāyāti mati, vividhā mati vimati, ramaṇaṃ rati, āramaṇaṃ ārati, viramaṇaṃ virati,🔽abhiramaṇaṃ abhirati, paṭiviramaṇaṃ pativirati, saraṇaṃ sati, saranti etāyāti vā
analyzed: saṇṭhiti avaṭṭhiti punappunam tananam santati dhārenti mahāvuttinā  namanam nati unnati samunnati onati avanati bharitabbāti bhati manati jānāti  mati vividhā mati vimati ramaṇam rati āramaṇam ārati viramaṇam virati  abhiramaṇam abhirati paṭiviramaṇam pativirati saraṇam sati saranti etāyāti vā
translated: It is the state of being spread out, the state of being extended, the state of being repeated again and again, the state of being a continuity. It is what is carried by this, thus it is a dhīti. The i is a mahāvutti.

original: sati, anussati, paṭissati, upahananaṃ upahati.🔽Tavantupaccayamhi-akāsīti katavā, ahanīti hatavā.🔽Tāvīpaccayamhi-katāvī, hatāvī.🔽Tvādīsu –🔽728. Tuṃtunatabbesu vā.🔽Karadhātussa ra-kārassa ā hoti vā tuṃ, tuna, tabbesu. Tunasaddena tvāna, tvāpi saṅgayhanti.🔽729. Karassā tave.🔽Karassa ra-kārassa ā hoti tavepaccayamhi.
analyzed: sati anussati paṭissati upahananam upahati  tava ntu paccayamhi akāsi iti katavā ahani iti hatavā  tāvī paccaya mhika tāvī ha tāvī  tva ādīsu  tum tuna tabbesu vā  kara dhātussa rakārassa ā hoti vā tum tuna tabbesu tuna saddena tvāna tvā api saṅgayhanti  karassā tave  karassa rakārassa ā hoti tavepaccayamhi
translated: It is the state of being bent, the state of being raised, the state of being lifted up, the state of being lowered, the state of being borne, thus it is a bhati. It is what is thought by this, thus it is a mati. It is a variety of thought, thus it is a vimati. It is the state of being delighted, thus it is a rati. It is the state of being delighted in, thus it is an ārati. It is the state of being refrained from, thus it is a virati.

original: Kātuṃ, kātave, kātuna, kātabbaṃ.
analyzed: kātum kātave kātuna kātabbam
translated: It is the state of being delighted in, thus it is an abhirati. It is the state of being refrained from, thus it is a pativirati. It is the state of being remembered, thus it is a sati. It is what is remembered by this, thus it is a sati. It is a recollection, a re-collection. It is a re-collection, a re-collection again. It is a re-collection, a re-collection again. original: Yathā karassa, tathā mahāvuttinā harassa rūpaṃ sijjhati, hāthuṃ, hātave, hātuna. Tesaṃ tuṇḍena hātūna, muñce pubbakataṃ iṇaṃ jā. 1.14.10.🔽Tvāmhi āssa ittaṃ, āhitvā, soṇḍāyudakamāhitvā jā. 1.10.9 (…hatvā).🔽Iti visaṃyogarūparāsi.
analyzed: yathā karassa tathā mahāvuttinā harassa rūpam sijjhati hāthum hātave hātuna tesam tuṇḍena hātūna muñce pubba katam iṇam  āhitvā hatvā  iti
translated: As with the root kar, so with the root har: the form is sijjhati, hāthuṃ, hātave, hātuna.

original: Sadisasaṃyogarūparāsi🔽Atha sadisasaṃyogarūparāsi vuccate.🔽Tupaccayamhi –🔽730. Pararūpamayakāre byañjane.🔽Yakāravajjite byañjanapaccaye pare sabbadhātūnaṃ antabyañjano pararūpaṃ āpajjate.🔽Karotīti kattā, kātuṃ arahati, kātuṃ sakkoti, karaṇasīlo, karaṇadhammo, sakkaccaṃ vā karotīti attho. Bharatīti bhattā, haratīti hattā.🔽Tvādīsu ra-kārassa āttaṃ, saṃyoge pare rassattañca, katvā, katvāna.
analyzed: sa disa saṃyoga rūpa rā asi 🔽atha sadisa saṃyoga rūpa rāsi vuccate 🔽tu paccayamhi 🔽para rūpam ayakāre byañjane 🔽yakāra vat jite byañjana paccaye pare sabba dhātūnam anta byañjanaḥ para rūpam āpajjate 🔽karoti iti kattā kātum arahati kātum sakkoti karaṇa sīlaḥ karaṇa dhammo sakkaccam vā karoti iti atthaḥ bharati iti bhattā harati iti hattā 🔽tu ādīsu rakārassa ā t tam saṃyoge pare katvā
translated: Of them, with the beak, having plucked, having taken, having carried off, having killed, having slain, having struck, having cut off, having cut out, having cut down, having cut away, having cut off, having cut out, having cut down, having cut away, having cut off, having cut out, having cut down, having cut away, having cut off, having cut out, having cut down, having cut away, having cut off, having cut out, having cut down, having cut away, having cut off, having cut out, having cut down, having cut away, having cut off, having cut out, having cut down, having cut away, having cut off, having cut out, having cut down, having cut away, having cut off, having cut out, having cut down, having cut away, having cut off, having cut out, having cut down, having cut away, having cut off, having cut out, having cut down, having cut away, having cut off, having cut out, having cut down, having cut away, having cut off, having cut out, having cut down, having cut away, having cut off, having cut out, having cut down, having cut away, having cut off, having cut out, having cut down, having cut away, having cut off, having cut out, having cut down, having cut away, having cut off, having cut out, having cut down, having cut away, having cut off, having cut out, having cut down, having cut away, having cut off, having cut out, having cut down, having cut away, having cut off, having cut out, having cut down, having cut away, having cut off, having cut out, having cut down, having cut away, having cut off, having cut out, having cut down, having cut away, having cut off, having cut out, having cut down, having cut away, having cut off, having cut out, having cut down, having cut away, having cut off, having cut out, having cut down, having cut away, having cut off, having cut out, having cut down, having cut away, having cut off, having cut out, having cut down, having cut away, having cut off, having cut out, having cut down, having cut away, having cut off,

original: Pararūpattaṃ, kattuna, kattuṃ, kattabbaṃ, bharaṇaṃ bhattuṃ, bhattave, haraṇaṃ hattuṃ, abhihattuṃ, hattave.
analyzed: para rūpattam kattunā kattum kattabbam bharaṇam bhattum bhattave haraṇam hattum abhihattum hattave
translated: The form of another is: kattuna, kattum, kattabbam, bharaṇam, bhattum, bhattave, haraṇam, hattum, abhihattum, hattave.

original: Āpa, ṇāpa, khipa, gupa, caja, ñapa, ñāpa, tapa, dīpa, dhūpa, pada, bhaja, bhuja,
analyzed: āpa ṇāpa khipa gupa caja ñapa ñāpa tapa dīpa dhūpa pada bhaja bhuja
translated: Āpa, ṇāpa, khipa, gupa, caja, ñapa, ñāpa, tapa, dīpa, dhūpa, pada, bhaja, bhuja,

original: mada, mida, yuja, rica, ranja, lipa, lupa, vaca, vatu, vada, vapa, vica, sanja, sica,
analyzed: mada mida yuja rica ranja lipa lupa vaca vatu vada vapa vica sanja sica
translated: mada, mida, yuja, rica, ranja, lipa, lupa, vaca, vatu, vada, vapa, vica, sanja, sica,

original: sambhu, sūca, sūda, supa.
analyzed: sambhu sūca sūda supa
translated: sambhu, sūca, sūda, supa.

original: Dhātvantabyañjanassa pararūpattaṃ, tapaccayamhi vipubbo āpabyāpane, byāpayati khippaṃ ñāṇabyāpanena byāpituṃ sakkotīti byatto, viyatto.
analyzed: dhātu anta byañjanassa para rūpa ttam ta paccayamhi vipubbaḥ āpa byāpane byāpayati khippam ñāṇa byāpanena byāpitum sakkoti iti byattaḥ viyattaḥ
translated: The form of another of the final consonant of a base is: tapaccayamhi vipubbo āpabyāpane, byāpayati khippaṃ ñāṇabyāpanena byāpituṃ sakkotīti byatto, viyatto.

original: Paripubbo pariyāpuṇane pahutte ca, pariyatto.
analyzed: paripubbaḥ pariyāpuṇane pahutte ca pariyattaḥ
translated: Paripubbo pariyāpuṇane pahutte ca, pariyatto.

original: Saṃpubbo paripuṇṇabhāve, samāpayitthāti samatto, parisamatto.
analyzed: saṃpubbaḥ paripuṇṇa bhāve samāpayittha ati samattaḥ parisamattaḥ
translated: Saṃpubbo paripuṇṇabhāve, samāpayitthāti samatto, parisamatto.

original: Āpubbo ṇāpa-pesane, āṇāpīyitthāti āṇatto.
analyzed: āpubbaḥ ṇā papesane āṇāpīyittha ati āṇattaḥ
translated: Āpubbo ṇāpa-pesane, āṇāpīyitthāti āṇatto.

original: Khipa-khipane, khipīyitthāti khitto-daṇḍo, khittā-mattikā, khittaṃ-leṭṭu. Evaṃ sabbattha. Pakkhitto, ukkhitto, nikkhitto, vikkhitto, okkhitto, saṃkhitto.
analyzed: khipa khipane khipīyittha ati khittodaṇḍaḥ khittāmattikā khittaṃleṭṭu evam sabbattha pakkhittaḥ ukkhittaḥ nikkhittaḥ vikkhittaḥ okkhittaḥ saṃkhittaḥ
translated: The meaning of the root khipa is throwing. The past participle is khitta, as in: a stick thrown, clay thrown, a clod thrown. So in all cases. Thrown away, thrown up, thrown out, thrown about, thrown off, thrown together.

original: Gupa-guttiyaṃ, gopīyitthāti gutto, saṃgutto.
analyzed: gupa guttiyam gopīyittha ati guttaḥ saṃguttaḥ
translated: The meaning of the root gupa is covering. The past participle is gutta, as in: covered, well covered.

original: Caja-cāge, cajīyitthāti catto.🔽Upa-paññāpane, paññapīyitthāti paññatto-vinayo, paññattaṃsikkhāpadaṃ, paññattaṃ-āsanaṃ.
analyzed: caja cāge cajīyittha ati catto  upapaññāpane paññapīyittha ati paññattaḥ vinayaḥ paññattam sikkhāpadam paññattam āsanam
translated: The meaning of the root caja is throwing away. The past participle is catto, as in: thrown away.🔽The meaning of the root upa is announcing. The past participle is paññatto, as in: the Vinaya is announced, the training rules are announced, a seat is announced.

original: Ñāpa-ñāpane, vikatidhātu nāmesā kāritantattā, paññāpīyitthāti paññatto, saññāpīyitthāti saññatto, viññāpīyitthāti viññatto.
analyzed: ñā pañāpane vikati dhātu nāma īsā kāri tanta ttā paññāpīyittha iti paññattaḥ saññāpīyittha iti saññattaḥ viññāpīyittha ati viññattaḥ
translated: The meaning of the root ñāpa is announcing. The past participle is paññatto, as in: announced, well announced, well known. The past participle is saññatto, as in: announced, well announced, well known. The past participle is viññatto, as in: announced, well announced, well known.

original: Tapa-santāpe, atappīti tatto, santatto.🔽Dīpa-dittiyaṃ, adīpitthāti ditto, paditto, āditto.
analyzed: tapa santāpe atappi iti tattaḥ santattaḥ  dīpa dittiyam adīpittha ati dittaḥ padittaḥ ādittaḥ
translated: The meaning of the root tapa is heating. The past participle is tatto, as in: heated, well heated.🔽The meaning of the root dīpa is shining. The past participle is ditto, as in: shining, well shining, blazing.

original: Dhūpa-soṇḍiye, dhūpati, adhūpi, dhūpissatīti dhutto, surādhutto, akkhadhutto su. ni. 106.
analyzed: dhūpa soṇḍiye dhūpati adhūpi dhūpissati iti dhuttaḥ surādhuttaḥ akkhadhuttaḥ su ni
translated: The meaning of the root dhūpa is smoke. The past participle is dhutto, as in: drunk with liquor, drunk with gambling, drunk with women.

original: Pada-gatiyaṃ, apajjīti patto, nipatto, sampatto.
analyzed: pada gatiyam apajji iti pattaḥ nipattaḥ sampattaḥ
translated: The meaning of the root pada is going. The past participle is patto, as in: gone, well gone, arrived.

original: Bhaja-sambhattiyaṃ, bhajatīti bhatto, sambhatto.
analyzed: bhaja sambhattiyam bhajati iti bhattaḥ sambhattaḥ
translated: In the sense of ‘having been mixed together’, he who is mixed together is a bhatto, a sambhatto.

original: Vipubbo puthakkaraṇe, vibhajitthāti vibhatto.
analyzed: vipubbaḥ puthakkaraṇe vibhajittha ati vibhattaḥ
translated: In the sense of ‘having been divided separately’, he who is divided is a vibhatto.

original: Bhuja-pālana, byavaharaṇesu, bhuñjittha, bhuñjīyitthāti vā bhutto, paribhutto.
analyzed: bhuja pālana byavaharaṇesu bhuñjittha bhuñjīyittha ati vā bhuttaḥ paribhuttaḥ
translated: In the sense of ‘having been eaten’, he who is eaten is a bhutto, a paribhutto.

original: Mada-ummāde, majjitthāti matto, sammatto, pamatto, ummatto.
analyzed: mada aummāde majjittha ati mattaḥ sammattaḥ pamattaḥ ummattaḥ
translated: In the sense of ‘having been intoxicated’, he who is intoxicated is a matto, a sammatto, a pamatto, an ummatto.

original: Mida-sinehane, mijjatīti mitto.
analyzed: mid asi nehane mijjati iti
translated: In the sense of ‘having been mixed’, he who is mixed is a mitto.

original: Yuja-yoge, yuñjatīti yutto, payutto, uyyutto, niyutto, viyutto, saṃyutto, saññutto.
analyzed: yuja yoge yuñjati iti yuttaḥ payuttaḥ uyyuttaḥ niyuttaḥ viyuttaḥ saṃyuttaḥ saññuttaḥ
translated: In the sense of ‘having been yoked’, he who is yoked is a yutto, a payutto, a uyyutto, a niyutto, a viyutto, a saṃyutto, a saññutto.

original: Rica-viriñcane, riñcatīti ritto.
analyzed: rica viriñcane riñcati iti
translated: In the sense of ‘having been abandoned’, he who is abandoned is a ritto.

original: Ranja-rāge, rañjatīti ratto, sāratto, viratto.🔽Lipa-limpane, limpīyitthāti litto, ullitto, avalitto.
analyzed: ranja rāge rañjati iti ratto sārattaḥ viratto  lipa limpane limpīyittha ati littaḥ ullittaḥ avalittaḥ
