original: Vāti kiṃ? Ādiyitvā, samādiyitvā, ‘ū byañjanassā’ti īāgamo, ‘dāssiyaṅa’iti suttena sare pare samāse iyādeso.
analyzed: vā ati kim ādiyitvā samādiyitvā ū byañjanassa ati ī āgamaḥ suttena sare pare samāse iya ādesaḥ
translated: What is extended? Ādiyitvā, samādiyitvā, ‘ū byañjanassā’ti īāgamo, ‘dāssiyaṅa’iti suttena sare pare samāse iyādeso.

original: 762. Tuṃyānā.
analyzed: tuṃyānā
translated: . Tuṃyānā.

original: Tvāssa tuñca yānañca honti kvaci samāse.
analyzed: tvāssa tun ca yānañ ca honti kvaci samāse
translated: Tvāssa tuñca yānañca honti kvaci samāse.

original: Bahulādhikārā gāthāyaṃ asamāsepi, nekkhamaṃ daṭṭhu khemato su. ni. 426, kimabbhutaṃ daṭṭhu marū pamoditā, bindulopo.
analyzed: bahula adhikārā gāthāyam asamāse pi nekkhamam daṭṭhu khemataḥ su ni kim abbhutam daṭṭhu
translated: Bahulādhikārā gāthāyaṃ asamāsepi, nekkhamaṃ daṭṭhu khemato su. ni. , kimabbhutaṃ daṭṭhu marū pamoditā, bindulopo.

original: Abhihattuṃ pavāreyya, “abhihaṭu”ntipi pāṭho, saṃyogādissa lopo tassa ṭattaṃ. “Abhihaṭṭhu”ntipi pāci. 2.243 paṭhanti. Byañjanaṃ na sameti.
analyzed: abhihattum pavāreyya pāṭhaḥ saṃyoga ādissa lopaḥ tassa pāci paṭhanti byañjanam na sameti
translated: He should invite after the meal is finished: the reading is also “abhihaṭṭhu” (i.e. abhihattu), the elision of the i is by the rule “saṃyogādissa lopo tassa ṭattaṃ” . They also read “abhihaṭṭhu” . The spelling does not agree.

original: Ādiyāna, upādiyāna. Vidhāya, nidhāya, sandhāya, odhāya, samodhāya, vidahitvā, nidahitvā, odahitvā, samodahitvā. Pahāya, vihāya, ohāya, hitvā, jahitvā.
analyzed: ādiyāna upādiyāna vidhāya nidhāya sandhāya odhāya samodhāya vidahitvā nidahitvā odahitvā samodahitvā pahāya vihāya ohāya hitvā jahitvā
translated: Ādiyāna, upādiyāna. Vidhāya, nidhāya, sandhāya, odhāya, samodhāya, vidahitvā, nidahitvā, odahitvā, samodahitvā. Pahāya, vihāya, ohāya, hitvā, jahitvā.

original: Ivaṇṇesu pyassa dvittaṃ, vikkiyya, vikkiṇitvā.
analyzed: i vaṇṇesu dvittam vikkiyya vikkiṇitvā
translated: Ivaṇṇesu pyassa dvittaṃ, vikkiyya, vikkiṇitvā.

original: Viceyya dānaṃ dātabbaṃ pe. va. 329, ‘ūlasse’ti issa ettaṃ, vicinitvā, vineyya, vinetvā, vinayitvā, allīya, allīyitvā, paṭisallīya, paṭisallīyitvā, yāgamo.
analyzed: viceyya dānam dātabbam pe va  ūlassa iti issaḥ ettam vicinitvā vineyya vinetvā vinayitvā allīya allīyitvā paṭisallīya paṭisallīyitvā yāgamaḥ
translated: Viceyya dānaṃ dātabbaṃ pe. va. , ‘ūlasse’ti issa ettaṃ, vicinitvā, vineyya, vinetvā, vinayitvā, allīya, allīyitvā, paṭisallīya, paṭisallīyitvā, yāgamo.

original: 763. Pye sissā ka. 517; rū. 488; nī. 1105.
analyzed: pye sissā ka rū nī
translated: . Pye sissā ka. ; rū. ; nī. .

original: Pye pare sissa ā hoti.
analyzed: pye pare sissaḥ ā hoti
translated: Pye pare sissa ā hoti.

original: Nissāya, upanissāya, apassāya, apassayitvā, avassāya, avassayitvā.
analyzed: nissāya upanissāya apassāya apassayitvā avassāya avassayitvā
translated: Nissāya, upanissāya, apassāya, apassayitvā, avassāya, avassayitvā.

original: Vāti kiṃ? Adhisetvā, adhisayitvā.
analyzed: vāti kim adhisetvā adhisayitvā
translated: Vāti kiṃ? Adhisetvā, adhisayitvā.

original: Bhū-sattāyaṃ, rassattaṃ, sambhuyya, vibhuyya, anubhuyya, adhibhuyya, paribhuyya, abhibhuyya.
analyzed: bhūsatta ayam rassattam sambhuyya vibhuyya anubhuyya adhibhuyya paribhuyya abhibhuyya
translated: Bhū-sattāyaṃ, rassattaṃ, sambhuyya, vibhuyya, anubhuyya, adhibhuyya, paribhuyya, abhibhuyya.

original: Samāseti kiṃ? Bhutvā, edantesu mahāvuttinā essa āttaṃ, nijjhāya, nijjhāyitvā, upanijjhāya, upanijjhāyitvā, abhijjhāya, abhijjhāyitvā.
analyzed: samāse iti kim bhutvā e t antesu mahāvuttinā āttam nijjhāya nijjhāyitvā upanijjhāya upanijjhāyitvā abhijjhāya abhijjhāyitvā
translated: In compounds what? Bhutvā, edantesu mahāvuttinā essa āttaṃ, nijjhāya, nijjhāyitvā, upanijjhāya, upanijjhāyitvā, abhijjhāya, abhijjhāyitvā.

original: Byañjanantadhātūsu ‘vaggalalehi te’ti suttena cavagga, pavagga, sakārehi yassa pubbarūpattaṃ.
analyzed: byañjana anta dhātūsu vagga la lehi ta iti suttena cavagga pavagga sakārehi yassa pubbarūpa ttam
translated: In the endings of verbs and in roots ‘vaggalalehi te’ means cavagga, pavagga, by the syllables yassa pubbarūpattaṃ.

original: Tavagge ‘tavaggavaraṇānaṃ ye cavaggabayañā’ti tavaggassa cavaggo, tato yassa pubbarūpattaṃ,
analyzed: tavagge tavagga varaṇānam ye tavaggassa cavaggaḥ tatas yassa pubbarūpattam
translated: In the tavagga ‘tavaggavaraṇānaṃ ye cavaggabayañā’ means cavagga of the tavagga, then yassa pubbarūpattaṃ,

original: vipacca, paripacca, vimucca, adhimucca.
analyzed: vipacca paripacca vimucca adhimucca
translated: vipacca, paripacca, vimucca, adhimucca.

original: Mahāvuttinā yalopo dīgho ca, āpucchā, anāpucchā, vibhajja, saṃvibhajja, visajja, nisajja, paṭinisajja.
analyzed: mahāvuttinā ya lopaḥ dīghaḥ ca āpucchā anāpucchā vibhajja saṃvibhajja visajja nisajja paṭinisajja
translated: By mahāvuttinā yalopo dīgho ca, āpucchā, anāpucchā, vibhajja, saṃvibhajja, visajja, nisajja, paṭinisajja.

original: Ujjha-visagge, yalopo, ujjha, ujjhiya, ujjhitvā.
analyzed: ujjha visagge ya lopaḥ ujjhaḥ ujjhiyaḥ ujjhitvā
translated: In the ujjha-visagge, yalopo, ujjha, ujjhiya, ujjhitvā.

original: Kati-chedane, kacca, vikacca, kantitvā, vikantitvā.
analyzed: kati chedane kacca vikacca kantitvā vikantitvā
translated: In the kati-chedane, kacca, vikacca, kantitvā, vikantitvā.

original: Nikara-vañcane, nikacca kitavasseva saṃ. ni. 1.35.
analyzed: nikara vañcane nikacca kitavassa iva sam ni
translated: In the sense of deceiving a group, as in the gambler’s saying, “I’ll do it by the group.”

original: Pata-gatiyaṃ, pacca, nipacca, patitvā, nipatitvā.
analyzed: patagatiyam pacca nipacca patitvā nipatitvā
translated: In the sense of a falling motion, as in “having fallen, having fallen down.”

original: Katha-kathane, sākaccha.
analyzed: katha kathane sākaccha
translated: In the sense of talking, as in “conversation.”

original: Pada-gatiyaṃ, pajja, āpajja, nipajja, vipajja, sampajja, upasampajja, paṭipajja.
analyzed: pada gatiyam pajjaḥ āpajja nipajja vipajja sampajjaḥ upasampajja paṭipajja
translated: In the sense of a going by foot, as in “having gone, having gone to, having gone down, having gone away, having gone together, having gone up to, having gone back.”

original: ‘Ū byañjanassā’ti īāgame ‘padādīnaṃ yuka’iti yāgamo, pubbarūpaṃ, pajjiya, pajjiyāna, āpajjiya, āpajjiyāna, nipajjiya, vipajjiya, sampajjiya, paṭipajjiya.
analyzed: ū byañjanassa ati ī āgame pada ādīnam yu ka eti ya āgamaḥ pubbarūpam pajjiya pajjiyāna āpajjiya āpajjiyāna nipajjiya vipajjiya sampajjiya paṭipajjiya
translated: The vowel i is added to the base by the rule “The vowel i is added to the base ū,” and the vowel a is added by the rule “The vowel a is added to the base pad and so on.” The prefix pubbu is added by the rule “The prefix pubbu is added to the base ū.” The verbal noun is formed by the rule “The verbal noun is formed in the ya-suffix.” The passive gerund is formed by the rule “The passive gerund is formed in the ya-suffix.” The passive gerundive is formed by the rule “The passive gerundive is formed in the ya-suffix.”

original: Āpubba sada-ghaṭṭane, āsajja naṃ tathāgataṃ itivu. 89, kākova selamāsajja. Chejja,🔽chijja, chindiya, acchijja, acchindiya, vicchijja, vicchindiya, paricchijja, paricchindiya,
analyzed: sada ghaṭṭane āsajja nam tathāgatam kākaḥ iva selam āsajja chejja  chijja chindiya acchijja acchindiya vicchijja vicchindiya paricchijja paricchindiya
translated: In the sense of striking, as in “having struck him, the Tathāgata,” and “the crow struck the rock.”🔽The verbal noun is formed by the rule “The verbal noun is formed in the ya-suffix.” The passive gerund is formed by the rule “The passive gerund is formed in the ya-suffix.” The passive gerundive is formed by the rule “The passive gerundive is formed in the ya-suffix.”

original: bhejja, bhijja, sambhijja, paṭisambhijja, bhindiya, sambhindiya.
analyzed: bhejja bhijja sambhijja paṭisambhijja bhindiya sambhindiya
translated: In the sense of breaking, as in “it should be broken, it should be split, it should be cut, it should be cut off, it should be cut up, it should be cut across, it should be cut about, it should be cut down, it should be cut off.”

original: Budha-ñāṇe, bujjha, sambujjha, abhisambujjha, bujjhiya, bujjhiyāna, “marīcikūpamaṃ abhisambuddhāno”ti pāḷi, dādese assa ottaṃ katvā siddhā yathā ‘anupādiyāno’ti.
analyzed: budha ñāṇe bujjha sambujjha abhisambujjha bujjhiya bujjhiyāna marīcikūpamam abhisambuddhānaḥ ti da ādese assa ottam katvā siddhā yathā
translated: In the sense of ‘awakening to knowledge’, the forms are: bujjha, bujjha, sambujjha, abhisambujjha, bujjhiya, bujjhiyāna. The text has: ‘Having awakened to the truth that is like a mirage’, as though it were a compound word formed with the prefix dāsa.

original: Vadha-hiṃsāyaṃ, vajjha, vajjhiya.
analyzed: vadha hiṃsā ayam
translated: In the sense of ‘killing, slaying’, the forms are: vajjha, vajjhiya.

original: Vidha-tāḷane, vijjha, vijjhiya.
analyzed: vidhatāḷane vijjha vijjhiya
translated: In the sense of ‘piercing, stabbing’, the forms are: vijjha, vijjhiya.

original: Khana-vilekhane, khañña, khaṇiya, nāssa ṇattaṃ.
analyzed: khana vilekhane khañña khaṇiya na assa
translated: In the sense of ‘scratching, scraping’, the forms are: khañña, khaṇiya. The ṇatta is not used.

original: Pavagge –
analyzed: pavagge
translated: In the sense of ‘throwing away’, the forms are:

original: Khippa, nikhippa, saṃkhippa, khipiya, saṃkhipiya.
analyzed: khippa nikhippa saṃkhippa khipiya saṃkhipiya
translated: khippa, nikhippa, saṃkhippa, khipiya, saṃkhipiya.

original: Labi-avasaṃsane, yalopo, ālamba, vilamba, avalamba.
analyzed: labi avasaṃsane ya lopaḥ ālamba vilamba avalamba
translated: In the sense of ‘covering, concealing’, the forms are: yalopo, ālamba, vilamba, avalamba.

original: Lubi-santhambhane, daṇḍamolumba tiṭṭhati, jhānamolumba vattati.
analyzed: lupi santhambhane daṇḍam olumba tiṭṭhati jhānam olumba vattati
translated: In the sense of ‘supporting, upholding’, the forms are: daṇḍamolumba tiṭṭhati, jhānamolumba vattati.

original: Upubbo uddharaṇe “ullumbatu maṃ bhante saṅgho”ti mahāva. 71 (ullumpatu) ādīsu viya, ullumba, ārabbha, samārabbha, labbhā, upalabbhā, dīgho.
analyzed: upubbaḥ uddharaṇe ullumbatu mama bhante saṅghaḥ iti ullumpatu ādīsu viya ullumbaḥ ārabbha samārabbha labbhā upalabbhā dīghaḥ
translated: In the sense of ‘lifting up’, the forms are: upubbo uddharaṇe ‘ullumbatu maṃ bhante saṅgho’ ti mahāva.  (ullumpatu) ādīsu viya, ullumba, ārabbha, samārabbha, labbhā, upalabbhā, dīgho.

original: Pakkamma, akkamma, vikkamma, nikkhamma, okkamma, abhikkamma, atikkamma, paṭikkamma, āgamma, saṅgamma.
analyzed: pakkamma akkamma vikkamma nikkhamma okkamma abhikkamma atikkamma paṭikkamma āgamma saṅgamma
translated: In the sense of ‘going forth, going away’, the forms are: pakkamma, akkamma, vikkamma, nikkhamma, okkamma, abhikkamma, atikkamma, paṭikkamma, āgamma, saṅgamma.

original: Sama-upadhāraṇe. Nisamma rāja kayirā, nānisamma disampati jā. 1.4.128 (nisamma khattiyo).
analyzed: sama upadhāraṇe nisamma rāja kayirā nisamma khattiyaḥ
translated: In the sense of ‘equalizing’ (sama-upadhāraṇa). A king should act judiciously, not unjudiciously, O lord of the earth. (Judiciously, O prince).

original: Samu-santiyaṃ khede ca, upasamma, vūpasamma, vissamma.
analyzed: samusantiyam khede ca upasamma vūpasamma vissamma
translated: In the sense of ‘coming together’ (sam-usanti), ‘in the case of’ (kheda), ‘judiciously’ (upasamma), ‘completely’ (vūpasamma), ‘thoroughly’ (vissamma).

original: Kasa-kaḍḍhane, apakassa.
analyzed: kasa kaḍḍhane apa kassa
translated: In the sense of ‘pulling out’ (kasa-kaḍḍhana), ‘having pulled out’ (apakassa).

original: Disa-pekkhane, ādissa, uddissa, odissa, apadissa.
analyzed: dis apekkhane ādissa uddissa odissa apadissa
translated: In the sense of ‘looking at a direction’ (disa-pekkhana), ‘indicating’ (ādissa), ‘aiming at’ (uddisa), ‘directing’ (odissa), ‘not directing’ (apadissa).

original: Phusa-samphasse. Phussa phussa byantīkaroti a. ni. 4.195.
analyzed: phusa samphasse phussa phussa byantīkaroti a ni
translated: In the sense of ‘touching’ (phusa-samphassa). He makes it disappear as soon as he touches it. (ni. ..)

original: Vasa-nivāse. Upavassaṃ kho pana kattikatemāsapuṇṇamaṃ pārā. 653 (kattikapuṇṇamaṃ), bindāgamo.
analyzed: vasa nivāse upavassam kho pana kattika temāsa puṇṇamam pārā kattika puṇṇamam bindāgamaḥ
translated: In the sense of ‘dwelling’ (vasa-nivāsa). Having dwelt for the full moon of the month of Kattika, the last month of the rainy season. (The full moon of Kattika), ‘the coming of the drop’.

original: Visa-pavesane, pavissa, nivissa, abhinivissa iccādi.
analyzed: visa pavesane pavissa nivissa abhinivissa iccādi
translated: In the sense of ‘entering’ (visa-pavesana), ‘having entered’ (pavisa), ‘having settled down’ (nivisa), ‘having settled upon’ (abhinivisa). And so on.

original: Iti tvādivikārarāsi.
analyzed: iti tvādi vikāra rāsi
translated: Thus, the group of declensions beginning with ‘ta’.

original: Paccayavikārarāsi niṭṭhito.🔽Pakatirūparāsi
analyzed: pakati rūpa rā asi
translated: The group of declensions based on prepositions is finished.🔽The group of simple nouns

original: Tādipaccayarāsi
analyzed: ta ādi pad ca ya rāsi
translated: The group of prepositions

original: Atha pakatirūparāsi vuccate.
analyzed: atha vuccate
translated: Now, the group of simple nouns is said to be:

original: Ta,ti, tu, tavantu, tāvī, tvā, tvāna, tuna, tuṃ, tave, tāye, tabba.
analyzed: tati tu tavantu tāvī tvā tvāna tuna tum tave tāye
translated: Ta, ti, tu, tavantu, tāvī, tvā, tvāna, tuna, tuṃ, tave, tāye, tabba.

original: Dā, khyā, gā, ghā, ṭā, ṭhā, tā, thā, dā, dhā, pā, phā, bhā, mā, yā, lā, vā, sā, hā.
analyzed: dā khyā gā ghā ṭā ṭhā tā thā dā dhā pā phā bhā mā yā lā vā sā hā
translated: Dā, khyā, gā, ghā, ṭā, ṭhā, tā, thā, dā, dhā, pā, phā, bhā, mā, yā, lā, vā, sā, hā.

original: Akkhāto, svākkhāto, ākhyāto, vikhyāto.
analyzed: akkhāto su ākkhātaḥ ākhyātaḥ vikhyātaḥ
translated: Declared, well-declared, declared, proclaimed.

original: ‘Ū byañjanassā’ti kvaci īāgamo rasso ca, saṅgāyito, ghāyito, ñāto.
analyzed: ū byañjanassa ati kvaci ī āgamaḥ rassaḥ ca saṅgāyitaḥ ghāyitaḥ ñātaḥ
translated: ‘Ū byañjanassā’ means sometimes the addition of ī and shortening, collected, smelt, known.

original: ‘Jyādīhi knā’ti nāpaccayo, jānito.
analyzed: jyā ādīhi knāti nā pad cayaḥ jānitaḥ
translated: ‘Jyādīhi knā’ means no affix, known.

original: Kārite-ñāpito, ñāpayito. Puttaṃ tāyati rakkhatīti tāto-pitā. Datto, dvittaṃ rassattañca. Devadatto, brahmadatto, yaññadatto, dāpito, dāpayito.
analyzed: puttam tāyati rakkhati iti tāta upitā dattaḥ dvittam rassattam ca devadattaḥ brahmadattaḥ yaññadattaḥ dāpitaḥ dāpayito
translated: Made known, made known to. He protects his son, therefore father-father. Given, double, and shortening. Devadatta, Brahmadatta, Yaññadatta, made to give, made to give to.

original: Mahāvuttinā passa pivo, pivito.
analyzed: mahāvuttinā passa pivaḥ
translated: Mahāvuttinā means see, drink, drunk.

original: Phā-vuddhiyaṃ, phito pabhātā ratti.
analyzed: phāvuddhiyam phitaḥ pabhātā
translated: Phā-vuddhiyaṃ means planted, the night has dawned.

original: Mā-māne, mito, sammito, upamito, nimmito, yāto, lāto, vāto.
analyzed: mā māne mitaḥ sammitaḥ upamitaḥ nimmitaḥ yātaḥ lātaḥ vātaḥ
translated: Mā-māne means measured, well-measured, compared, created, gone, blown, blown.

original: Mahāvuttinā vāssuttaṃ, nibbuto, parinibbuto, nibbāpito, parinibbāpito, osito, pariyosito, osāpito, pariyosāpito, pahito, pajahito, hāpito.
analyzed: mahāvuttinā vāssuttam nibbutaḥ parinibbutaḥ nibbāpitaḥ parinibbāpitaḥ ositaḥ pariyositaḥ osāpitaḥ pariyosāpitaḥ pahitaḥ pajahitaḥ hāpitaḥ
translated: Mahāvuttinā means the sutta of the great utterance, extinguished, fully extinguished, made to extinguish, made to fully extinguish, laid down, fully laid down, made to lay down, made to fully lay down, removed, made to remove, made to take away.

original: Timhi-ñatti, datti, pāti, phāti, nibbuti, parinibbuti.
analyzed: datti pāti phāti nibbuti parinibbuti
translated: Timhi-ñatti means given, given to, given to, given to, extinction, full extinction.

original: Tumhi-saṅkhātā sabbadhammānaṃ jā. 2.22.1451, akkhātāro tathāgatā dha. pa. 276 aññātāro bhavissanti dī. ni. 2.68, ñāpetā, ñāpayitā. Uṭṭhātā vindate dhanaṃ saṃ. ni. 1.246.
analyzed: sabba dhammānam jā  akkhātāraḥ tathāgatāḥ dha pa  aññātāraḥ bhavissanti ni  ñāpetā ñāpayitā uṭṭhātā vindate dhanam sam ni
translated: The expounders, the cause, the support, the giver, the giver of gifts, the supporter, the supporter of others, the builder, the builder of others, the one who causes to be extinguished, the one who causes to be extinguished, the one who causes to be removed, the one who causes to be removed.

original: ‘Ū lasse’ti kvaci īssa ettaṃ, uṭṭhāpetā, samuṭṭhāpetā, aghassa tātā, tāyitā, dātā, dāpetā, sandhātā, sandhāpetā, māpitā, māpayitā, nibbāpetā, nibbāpayitā, hāpetā, hāpayitā.🔽Tavantu, tāvīsu-akkhatā, akkhātāvī iccādi.🔽Tvādīsu saṃyoge rassattaṃ, ñatvā, jānitvā, ñāpetvā, jānāpetvā, ṭhatvā.🔽Pādito ṭhāssa ṭhaho, saṇṭhahitvā, patiṭṭhahitvā.
analyzed: u lassa iti kvaci īssaḥ ettam uṭṭhāpetā samuṭṭhāpetā aghassa tātā tāyitā dātā dāpetā sandhātā sandhāpetā māpitā māpayitā nibbāpetā nibbāpayitā hāpetā hāpayitā  tavantu tāvīsu akkhatā akkhātāvī iccādi  tu ādīsu saṃyoge rassa ttam ñatvā jānitvā ñāpetvā jānāpetvā ṭhatvā  pāditaḥ saṇṭhahitvā patiṭṭhahitvā
translated: 'Ū lasse' is sometimes used for īssa. The one who causes to rise, the one who causes to rise up, the father of evil, the protector, the giver, the one who causes to give, the supporter, the one who causes to support, the builder, the one who causes to build, the one who causes to be extinguished, the one who causes to be extinguished, the one who causes to be removed, the one who causes to be removed.

original: Kārite kvaci rassattaṃ, ṭhapetvā, paṭṭhapetvā, patiṭṭhāpetvā, datvā, ādiyitvā, samādiyitvā, dajjitvā.🔽Dada-dāne, tvāssa pyo, yamhi dassa jo, yassa pubbarūpaṃ dīgho, dajjā, dāpetvā.
analyzed: kārite kvaci ras sattam ṭhapetvā paṭṭhapetvā patiṭṭhāpetvā datvā ādiyitvā samādiyitvā dajjitvā 🔽dadadāne tvāssa pyaḥ yamhi dassa jaḥ yassa pubbarūpam dīghaḥ dajjā dāpetvā
translated: Your own, those two, those many, those many, those many, those many, those many, those many, those many, those many, those many, those many, those many, those many, those many, those many, those many, those many, those many, those many, those many, those many, those many, those many, those many, those many, those many, those many, those many, those many, those many, those many, those many, those many, those many, those many, those many, those many, those many, those many, those many, those many, those many, those many, those many, those many, those many, those many, those many, those many, those many, those many, those many, those many, those many, those many, those many, those many, those many, those many, those many, those many, those many, those many, those many, those many, those many, those many, those many, those many, those many, those many, those many, those many, those many, those many, those many, those many, those many, those many, those many, those many, those many, those many, those many, those many, those many, those many, those many, those many, those many, those many, those many, those many, those many, those many, those many, those many, those many, those many, those many, those many, those many, those many, those many,

original: Pādito rasso, samādapetvā.
analyzed: pāditaḥ rassaḥ samādapetvā
translated: Pādito rasso, samādapetvā.

original: Dhā-dhāraṇe, dvittaṃ, pubbassa tatiyattaṃ rasso ca, parassa ‘dhāssa ho’ti ho, padahitvā, vidahitvā, nidahitvā, saddahitvā, odahitvā, pidahitvā, paridahitvā.
analyzed: dhā dhāraṇe dvittam pubbassa tatiya ttam rasso ca parassa dhāssa hoti ho padahitvā vidahitvā nidahitvā saddahitvā odahitvā pidahitvā paridahitvā
translated: Dhā-dhāraṇe, dvittaṃ, pubbassa tatiyattaṃ rasso ca, parassa ‘dhāssa ho’ti ho, padahitvā, vidahitvā, nidahitvā, saddahitvā, odahitvā, pidahitvā, paridahitvā.

original: Kārite-ādhapetvā, sannidhāpetvā, pivitvā, pitvā vā, pāyetvā, māpetvā, osāpetvā, pariyosāpetvā, hitvā, pajahitvā, hāpetvā, pajahāpetvā.
analyzed: sannidhāpetvā pivitvā pitvā vā pāyetvā māpetvā osāpetvā pariyosāpetvā hitvā pajahitvā hāpetvā pajahāpetvā
translated: Kārite-ādhapetvā, sannidhāpetvā, pivitvā, pitvā vā, pāyetvā, māpetvā, osāpetvā, pariyosāpetvā, hitvā, pajahitvā, hāpetvā, pajahāpetvā.

original: Tuṃ, tavesu-akkhātuṃ, akkhātave, saṅkhātuṃ, saṅkhātave, ñātuṃ, ñātave, jānituṃ, jānitave,
analyzed: tum akkhātave saṅkhātum saṅkhātave ñātum ñātave jānitum jānitave
translated: Tuṃ, tavesu-akkhātuṃ, akkhātave, saṅkhātuṃ, saṅkhātave, ñātuṃ, ñātave, jānituṃ, jānitave,

original: ñāpetuṃ, ñāpetave, jānāpetuṃ, jānāpetave, ṭhātuṃ, ṭhātave, saṇṭhātuṃ, saṇṭhātave,
analyzed: ñāpetum ñāpetave jānāpetum jānāpetave ṭhātum ṭhātave saṇṭhātum saṇṭhātave
translated: ñāpetuṃ, ñāpetave, jānāpetuṃ, jānāpetave, ṭhātuṃ, ṭhātave, saṇṭhātuṃ, saṇṭhātave,

original: saṇṭhahituṃ, saṇṭhahitave, ṭhapetuṃ, ṭhapetave, saṇṭhāpetuṃ, saṇṭhāpetave, dātuṃ,
analyzed: saṇṭhahitum saṇṭhahitave ṭhapetum ṭhapetave saṇṭhāpetum saṇṭhāpetave dātum
translated: saṇṭhahituṃ, saṇṭhahitave, ṭhapetuṃ, ṭhapetave, saṇṭhāpetuṃ, saṇṭhāpetave, dātuṃ,

original: dātave, padātuṃ, padātave, ādātuṃ, ādātave, dajjituṃ, dajjitave, dāpetuṃ, dāpetave,
analyzed: dātave padātum padātave ādātum ādātave dajjitum dajjitave dāpetum dāpetave
translated: dātave, padātuṃ, padātave, ādātuṃ, ādātave, dajjituṃ, dajjitave, dāpetuṃ, dāpetave,

original: samādapetuṃ, samādapetave, sandhātuṃ, sandhātave, saddahituṃ, saddahetuṃ, saddahetave,🔽nidhetuṃ, nidhetave sandhāpetuṃ, nidhāpetuṃ, pātuṃ, pivituṃ, pātave, pivetave, mātuṃ,
analyzed: samādapetum samādapetave sandhātum sandhātave saddahitum saddahetum saddahetave  nidhetum nidhetave sandhā petum nidhā petum pātum pivitum pātave pivetave mātum
translated: to inspire, to cause to inspire, to unite, to cause to unite, to believe, to cause to believe, to cause to believe in,🔽to store, to cause to store, to cause to store up, to drink, to cause to drink, to cause to drink, to drink, to cause to drink, to drink,

original: minituṃ, pametuṃ, upametuṃ, yātuṃ, yāyituṃ, yātave, osāyetuṃ, osāpetuṃ, pariyosāpetuṃ,
analyzed: minitum pametum upametum yātum yāyitum yātave osāyetum osāpetum pariyosāpetum
translated: to compare, to cause to compare, to cause to compare with, to go, to cause to go, to cause to go, to cause to go, to cause to go, to cause to go,

original: hātuṃ, pahātuṃ, māradheyyaṃ pahātave dha. pa. 34, jahituṃ, pajahituṃ, hāpetuṃ, pahāpetuṃ, jahāpetuṃ.
analyzed: hātum pahātum māradheyyam pahātave dha pa jahitum pajahitum hāpetum pahāpetum jahāpetum
translated: to abandon, to cause to abandon, to cause to abandon, to give up, to give up, to cause to give up, to cause to give up.

original: Tabbamhi-akkhātabbaṃ, saṅkhātabbaṃ, saṅkhyātabbaṃ, gāyitabbaṃ, ñātabbaṃ, jānitabbaṃ,
analyzed: tabbamhi akkhātabbam saṅkhātabbam saṅkhyātabbam gāyitabbam ñātabbam jānitabbam
translated: It is to be said, it is to be reckoned, it is to be counted, it is to be sung, it is to be known, it is to be understood,

original: ñāpetabbaṃ, jānāpetabbaṃ, ṭhātabbaṃ, ṭhapetabbaṃ, dātabbaṃ, ādātabbaṃ, samādātabbaṃ,
analyzed: ñāpetabbam jānāpetabbam ṭhātabbam ṭhapetabbam dātabbam ādātabbam samādātabbam
translated: it is to be made known, it is to be made to understand, it is to be stood on, it is to be made to stand, it is to be given, it is to be taken, it is to be undertaken,

original: dāpetabbaṃ, samādapetabbaṃ, vidhātabbaṃ, vidahitabbaṃ, pātabbaṃ, pivitabbaṃ, minitabbaṃ,
analyzed: dāpetabbam samādapetabbam vidhātabbam vidahitabbam pātabbam pivitabbam minitabbam
translated: it is to be made to give, it is to be made to undertake, it is to be made to stand, it is to be made to stand, it is to be drunk, it is to be drunk, it is to be measured,

original: minetabbaṃ, yātabbaṃ, lātabbaṃ, pahātabbaṃ.
analyzed: minetabbam yātabbam lātabbam pahātabbam
translated: it is to be measured, it is to be gone, it is to be taken, it is to be given up.

original: Ivaṇṇesu vipubbo i-gatyaṃ, vīto, vītadoso vītamoho saṃ. ni. 1.249, udito, samudito, dāgamo.
analyzed: i vi pubbaḥ i k atyam vītaḥ vīta dosaḥ vīta mohaḥ sam ni uditaḥ samuditaḥ da āgamaḥ
translated: In colours: variegated, gone to, free, free from hate, free from delusion.

original: Samito, sameto, samaveto, apeto, upeto, samupeto, abhito, kīto, kayito, kiṇito, cito,
analyzed: samitaḥ sametaḥ samavetaḥ apetaḥ upetaḥ samupetaḥ abhitas kītaḥ kayitaḥ kiṇitaḥ citaḥ
translated: Equal, united, fully united, departed, arrived, fully arrived, all around, measured, marked, pierced, thought out,

original: cinito, ācito, upacito, sañcito, jito, parājito, ḍito, oḍḍito, nīto, ānīto, vinīto,
analyzed: cinitaḥ ācitaḥ upacitaḥ sañcitaḥ jitaḥ parājitaḥ ḍitaḥ oḍḍitaḥ nītaḥ ānītaḥ vinītaḥ
translated: weighed, heaped up, accumulated, conquered, defeated, burnt, well burnt, led, brought, well led,

original: oṇīto, paṇīto, nassa ṇattaṃ.
analyzed: oṇītaḥ paṇītaḥ nassa
translated: brought down, brought up, destroyed, not destroyed.

original: Pīto, bhīto, mito, sito, nissito, pahito.
analyzed: pītaḥ bhītaḥ mitaḥ sitaḥ nissitaḥ pahitaḥ
translated: Drunk, afraid, measured, white, dependent, sent away.

original: Timhi-samiti, viciti, nīti, dvitte ādivuddhi, netti, saddhammanetti, bhīti.
analyzed: viciti nīti dvitte ādi vuddhi saddhamma netti bhīti
translated: In Timhi-samiti, viciti, nīti, dvitte ādivuddhi, netti, saddhammanetti, bhīti.

original: Tumhi-sametā, abhisametā, vicetā, jetā, netā, vinetā, ninnetā.
analyzed: abhisametā vicetāḥ jetā netā vinetā ninnetā
translated: In Tumhi-sametā, abhisametā, vicetā, jetā, netā, vinetā, ninnetā.

original: Tavantu, tāvīsu-sametavā, sametāvī, abhisametavā, abhisametāvī iccādi.
analyzed: tavantu tāvīsu sametavā sametāvī abhisametavā abhisametāvī iccādi
translated: In Tavantu, tāvīsu-sametavā, sametāvī, abhisametavā, abhisametāvī and so on.

original: Tvādīsu-sametvā, upetvā, kiṇitvā, vicinitvā, jetvā, vijetvā, jinitvā, vijinitvā, parājetvā, netvā, ānetvā vinetvā, nayitvā, ānayitvā, vinayitvā, allīyitvā, paṭisallīyitvā, sayitvā.🔽Tuṃ, tavesu-sametuṃ, upetuṃ, samupetuṃ, sametave, ketuṃ, kiṇituṃ, ketave, vicetuṃ,🔽vicinituṃ, jetuṃ, vijetuṃ, nituṃ, ānituṃ, vinituṃ, netuṃ, ānetuṃ, vinetuṃ, nayituṃ,
analyzed: upetvā kiṇitvā vicinitvā jetvā vijetvā jinitvā vijinitvā parājetvā netvā ānetvā vinetvā nayitvā ānayitvā vinayitvā allīyitvā paṭisallīyitvā sayitvā  tum tava isu sametum upetum samupetum sametave ketum kiṇitum ketave vicetum  vicinitum jetum vijetum nitum ānitum vinitum netum ānetum vinetum nayitum
translated: Having come together, having approached, having come together, having collected, having searched, having conquered, having overcome, having led, having brought, having disciplined, having guided, having brought back, having disciplined, having brought back, having disciplined, having gone to, having gone back to, having lain down.

original: ānayituṃ, vinayituṃ, netave.
analyzed: ānayitum vinayitum netave
translated: Having come together, having collected, having searched, having conquered, having overcome, having led, having brought, having disciplined, having guided, having brought back, having disciplined, having brought back, having disciplined, having gone to, having gone back to, having lain down.

original: Tabbamhi-sametabbaṃ, ketabbaṃ, kiṇitabbaṃ iccādi.
analyzed: tabba mhisa metabbam ketabbam kiṇitabbam iccādi
translated: It should be come together, it should be collected, it should be searched, and so on.

original: Uvaṇṇesu-cuto, cavito.
analyzed: u aṇṇe su cutaḥ ca vitaḥ
translated: In cuto, cavito.

original: Kārite-cāvito.
analyzed: kārita i ca a vitaḥ
translated: In cāvito.

original: Juto, javito, thuto, abhitthuto, abhitthavito,
analyzed: jutaḥ javitaḥ thutaḥ abhitthutaḥ abhitthavitaḥ
translated: In juto, javito, thuto, abhitthuto, abhitthavito,

original: Saṃpubbo dhu-vallabhe, sandhuto-mitto. “Asaṇṭhutaṃ cirasaṇṭhutenā”tipi pāḷi.
analyzed: sam pubbaḥ dhu vallabhe sandhu tomittaḥ a saṇṭhutam cira saṇṭhutena atipi pāṭi
translated: In saṃpubbo, dhu-vallabhe, sandhuto-mitto. The reading is also “asaṇṭhutaṃ cirasaṇṭhutenā.”

original: Du-gatiyaṃ hiṃsāyañca, duto, upadduto.
analyzed: dugatiyam hiṃsāyan ca dutaḥ upaddutaḥ
translated: In du-gatiyaṃ, hiṃsāyañca, duto, upadduto.

original: Dhū-kampane, dhuto, niddhuto.
analyzed: dhū kampane dhutaḥ niddhutaḥ
translated: In dhū-kampane, dhuto, niddhuto.

original: Bhūto, sambhūto.
analyzed: bhūtaḥ sambhūtaḥ
translated: In bhūto, sambhūto.

original: Kārite-bhāvito, sambhāvito, vibhāvito, paribhāvito.
analyzed: kāritebhāvitaḥ sambhāvitaḥ vibhāvitaḥ paribhāvitaḥ
translated: Kārite-bhāvito, sambhāvito, vibhāvito, paribhāvito.

original: Yu-missane, saṃyuto.
analyzed: yu missane saṃyutaḥ
translated: Yu-missane, saṃyuto.

original: Ru-sadde, ruto, luto, vuto, saṃvuto, susaṃvuto, suto, vissuto.
analyzed: ru sadde rutaḥ lutaḥ vutaḥ saṃvutaḥ susaṃvutaḥ sutaḥ vissutaḥ
translated: Ru-sadde, ruto, luto, vuto, saṃvuto, susaṃvuto, suto, vissuto.

original: Hu-pūjāyaṃ, huto.
analyzed: hupūjā ayam
translated: Hu-pūjāyaṃ, huto.

original: Timhi-cavanaṃ cuti, thavanaṃ thuti, bhūti, vibhūti, savanaṃ suti,
analyzed: timhicavanam cuti thavanam thuti bhūti vibhūti savanam suti
translated: Timhi-cavanaṃ cuti, thavanaṃ thuti, bhūti, vibhūti, savanaṃ suti,

original: Tumhi-cavitā, cāvetā, javitā, thavitā, santhavitā, sotā, sāvetā.
analyzed: tumhicavitā cāvetā javitā thavitā santhavitā sotā sāvetā
translated: Tumhi-cavitā, cāvetā, javitā, thavitā, santhavitā, sotā, sāvetā.

original: Tavantu tāvīsu-cutavā, cutāvī, cāvetavā, cāvetāvī iccādi.
analyzed: tavantu cutāvī cāvetavā cāvetāvī it ca ādi
translated: Tavantu tāvīsu-cutavā, cutāvī, cāvetavā, cāvetāvī iccādi.

original: Tvādīsu-cavitvā, cavitvāna, cavituna, javitvā, abhitthavitvā, bhutvā, anubhavitvā, bhāvetvā, bhāvayitvā, sutvā, suṇitvā, sāvetvā, sāvayitvā.
analyzed: cavitvāna cavituna javitvā abhitthavitvā bhutvā anubhavitvā bhāvetvā bhāvayitvā sutvā suṇitvā sāvetvā sāvayitvā
translated: Tvādīsu-cavitvā, cavitvāna, cavituna, javitvā, abhitthavitvā, bhutvā, anubhavitvā, bhāvetvā, bhāvayitvā, sutvā, suṇitvā, sāvetvā, sāvayitvā.

original: Tuṃ, tavesu-cavituṃ, cāvetuṃ, bhotuṃ, bhavituṃ, anubhavituṃ, bhāvetuṃ, bhāvayituṃ, sotuṃ, sāvetuṃ.
analyzed: tum cāvetum bhotum bhavitum anubhavitum bhāvetum bhāvayitum sotum sāvetum
translated: Tuṃ, tavesu-cavituṃ, cāvetuṃ, bhotuṃ, bhavituṃ, anubhavituṃ, bhāvetuṃ, bhāvayituṃ, sotuṃ, sāvetuṃ.

original: Hū-sattāyaṃ, hotuṃ. “Yā icche puriso hotuṃ jā. 2.22.1282. Na so sakkā na hotuye”ti bu. vaṃ. 2.9 ‘…hetuye’ pāḷī.
analyzed: icche puriso hotum icche puriso hotum na saḥ sakkā na hotuyā iti
translated: Hū-sattāyaṃ, hotuṃ. “Yā icche puriso hotuṃ jā. ... Na so sakkā na hotuye”ti bu. vaṃ. . ‘…hetuye’ pāḷī.

original: Tabbamhi-cavitabbaṃ, bhavitabbaṃ, anubhavitabbaṃ, bhāvetabbaṃ, sotabbaṃ. Dvitte-sottabbaṃ, sāvetabbaṃ.
analyzed: bhavitabbam anubhavitabbam bhāvetabbam sotabbam sāvetabbam
translated: I must die, I must be, I must experience, I must develop, I must hear. I must hear again, I must cause to hear.

original: Edantesu mahāvuttinā kvaci ekārassa ittaṃ, gāyito, apacāyito, apacito vā, ujjhāyito, nijjhāyito, abhijjhāyito.
analyzed: e t antesu mahāvuttinā kvaci e kārassa ittam gāyitaḥ apacāyitaḥ apacitaḥ vā ujjhāyitaḥ nijjhāyitaḥ abhijjhāyitaḥ
translated: In the ed-group, in some places the it-form is by the great method: it has been sung, it has been honoured, it has been despised, it has been complained about, it has been pondered, it has been coveted.

original: Gāyanaṃ gīti, apacāyanaṃ apaciti.
analyzed: gāyanam gīti apacāyanam apaciti
translated: The act of singing is singing, the act of honouring is honouring.

original: Tumhi-gāyitā, apacāyitā, ujjhāyitā.
analyzed: tumhigāyitā apacāyitā ujjhāyitā
translated: You have been sung, you have been honoured, you have been complained about.

original: Tavantu, tāvīsu-gāyitavā, gāyitāvī iccādi.
analyzed: tavantu tāvīsugāyitavā gāyitāvī it ca ādi
translated: Your, their, his, her, its, our, our (fem.), their (fem.) has been sung, has been sung by him, has been sung by them, etc.

original: Gāyitvā, jhāyitvā, abhijjhāyitvā.
analyzed: gāyitvā jhāyitvā abhijjhāyitvā
translated: Having sung, having complained, having coveted.

original: Gāyituṃ, gāyitave, apacāyituṃ, apacāyitave, jhāyituṃ, jhāyitave, abhijjhāyituṃ, abhijjhāyitave.
analyzed: gāyitum gāyitave apacāyitum apacāyitave jhāyitum jhāyitave abhijjhāyitum abhijjhāyitave
translated: To sing, to have sung, to honour, to have honoured, to complain, to have complained, to ponder, to have pondered, to covet, to have coveted.

original: Gāyitabbaṃ, apacāyitabbaṃ, ujjhāyitabbaṃ.
analyzed: gāyitabbam apacāyitabbam ujjhāyitabbam
translated: It must be sung, it must be honoured, it must be complained about.

original: Iti ekabyañjanadhātūnaṃ pakatirūparāsi.

translated: Thus the collection of the individual forms of the roots with one consonant.

original: Bhūvādigaṇa
analyzed: bhūva ādi gaṇa

original: Anekabyañjanadhātūnaṃ pakatirūpāni tyādikaṇḍe vibhāganayena bhūvādīhi sattahi dhātugaṇehi ca kāritapaccayehi ca dhātupaccayehi ca yathālābhaṃ vibhajitvā vitthāretabbāni.

translated: having been enlightened, should be enlightened, should be enlightened, should be enlightened.🔽Having caused to be satisfied, satisfied, the one who satisfies, has been satisfied, has been satisfied, having satisfied, should satisfy, should be satisfied, should be satisfied.🔽Having caused to be satisfied, satisfied, the one who satisfies, has been satisfied, has been satisfied, having satisfied, should satisfy, should be satisfied.

original: Kārite-tosito, tositā, tosetā vā, tositavā, tositāvī, tosetvā, tosetuṃ, tosetabbaṃ, dibbito, dibbitā, dibbitavā, dibbitāvī, dibbitvā, dibbituṃ, dibbitabbaṃ.

original: Atha visesarāsi vuccate.
analyzed: atha visesarāsi vuccate
translated: Now the separate group is stated.

original: 767. Kattari cārambhe ka. 556-7; rū. 606, 622; nī. 1143-4.
analyzed: kattari ca ārambhe ka rū   nī
translated: In the agent and in the beginning, ka; in the present, rū; in the past, nī.

original: Ārambho nāma ādikriyā-paṭhamārambho. Kriyārambhe vattabbe kattari ca bhāva, kammesu🔽ca kto hoti, etena paccuppannepi kriyāsantāne paṭhamārambhaṃ paṭicca atītavisayo
analyzed: ārambhaḥ nāma ādi kriyā paṭhama ārambhaḥ kriyā ārambhe vattabbe kattari ca bhāva kammesu  ca ktaḥ hoti etena paccuppanne pi kriyā santāne paṭhama ārambham paṭicca atīta visayaḥ
translated: The beginning is the first beginning, the first doing. In the present doing, in the agent and in the verbs,🔽bhāva and kta are used. By this, even in the present continuum of action, the past object is

original: tapaccayo vihito, yathā? Bhuttāvī pavāritoti pāci. 238.
analyzed: ta paccayaḥ vihitaḥ yathā bhuttāvī pavāritaḥ iti
translated: designated as a condition on account of the first beginning. How? Having eaten, he dismissed, he cooked.

original: Puriso kaṭaṃ pakato, purisena kaṭo pakato.🔽768. Ṭhāsavasasilisasīruhajarajanīhi ka. 556; rū. 606, 622; nī. 1143-4.
analyzed: purisaḥ kaṭam pakataḥ purisena kaṭaḥ pakataḥ  ṭha asa vasa sili sa sīruha jaraja nī hi ka rū
translated: The man cooked the pot, the pot was cooked by the man.🔽In the standing, the wearing, the cutting, the tree, the month, the night, ka; in the present, rū; in the past, nī.

original: Ṭhādīhi kattari ca bhāva, kammesu ca kto hoti.
analyzed: ṭha ādīhi kattari ca bhāva kammesu ca ktaḥ hoti
translated: In the standing, etc., in the agent, bhāva and kta are used in the verbs.

original: Ṭhāmhi-upaṭṭhito garuṃ sisso, upaṭṭhito garu sissena.
analyzed: ṭhāmhi upaṭṭhitaḥ garum sissaḥ upaṭṭhitaḥ garu sissena
translated: Standing, he served the teacher, the pupil served the teacher.

original: Āsamhi-upāsito garuṃ sisso, upāsito garu sissena.
analyzed: āsamhiupāsitaḥ garum sissaḥ upāsitaḥ garu sissena
translated: I am revered by the pupil who reveres the teacher. The teacher is revered by the pupil who reveres the teacher.

original: Vasamhi-anuvusito garuṃ sisso, anuvusito garu sissena.🔽Silisa-āliṅgane, āsiliṭṭho pitaraṃ putto, āsiliṭṭho pitā puttena.
analyzed: vasamhi anuvusitaḥ garum sissaḥ anuvusitaḥ garu sissena  silisa āliṅgane āsiliṭṭhaḥ pitaram puttaḥ āsiliṭṭhaḥ pitā puttena
translated: I am obedient to the pupil who is obedient to the teacher. The teacher is obedient to the pupil who is obedient to the teacher.🔽In the case of embracing in the case of virtue: the son clings to the father. The father clings to the son.

original: Sīmhi-adhisayito ukkhaliṃ jano, adhisayitā ukkhali janena, uddhanaṃ āropitāti attho.
analyzed: sīmhi adhisayitaḥ ukkhalim janaḥ adhisayitā ukkhali janena uddhanam āropitā ati attho
translated: In the case of the cooking pot: the people are superior to the cooking pot. The cooking pot is superior to the people. The meaning is: it is placed on the fire.

original: Ruhamhi-ārūḷho rukkhaṃ jano, ārūḷho rukkho janena.
analyzed: ruhamhi ārūḍhaḥ rukkham janaḥ ārūḍhaḥ rukkhaḥ janena
translated: In the case of the tree: the people climb the tree. The tree is climbed by the people.

original: Jaramhi-anujiṇṇo vasaliṃ devadatto, anujiṇṇā vasalī devadattena, anujāto māṇavikaṃ māṇavo, anujātā māṇavikā māṇavena.
analyzed: jaramhi anujiṇṇaḥ vasalim devadattaḥ anujiṇṇā vasalī devadattena anujātaḥ māṇavikam māṇavaḥ anujātā māṇavikā māṇavena
translated: In the case of old age: Devadatta is decrepit with the low-caste woman. The low-caste woman is decrepit with Devadatta. The youth is born of the young woman. The young woman is born of the youth.

original: 769. Gamanatthākammakādhāre ca ka. 556-7; rū. 606, 622; nī. 1143-4.
analyzed: gamanattha akammaka ādhāre ca ka rū    nī
translated: In the case of the meaning of going, the bases, and the state of being an instrument, and the state of being a support.

original: Gamanatthadhātūhi akammakadhātūhi ca paraṃ ādhāre ca kattari ca bhāva, kammesu ca kto hoti.
analyzed: gamana attha dhātūhi akammaka dhātūhi ca param ādhāre ca kattari ca bhāva kammesu ca ktaḥ hoti
translated: The state of being is formed with the bases in the sense of going, with the bases in the sense of not being an instrument, and with the state of being a support and an agent, and with the verbal nouns.

original: Yanti etthāti yātaṃ, idaṃ tesaṃ yātaṃ. Padaṃ akkamati etthāti padakkantaṃ, idaṃ tesaṃ padakkantaṃ. Iha te yātā, ayaṃ tehi yāto maggo, iha tehi yātaṃ.🔽Akammakamhi-idaṃ tesaṃ āsitaṃ ṭhānaṃ, iha te āsitā, idaṃ tehi āsitaṃ ṭhānaṃ, idha tehi āsitaṃ.
analyzed: yanti ettha ati yātam idam tesam yātam padam akkamati ettha ati padakkantam idam tesam padakkantam iha te yātāḥ ayam tehi yātaḥ maggaḥ iha tehi yātam  akammakamhi idam tesam āsitam ṭhānam iha te āsitāḥ idam tehi āsitam ṭhānam idha tehi āsitam
translated: ‘They have gone there’ is ‘gone by them’. ‘They have trodden there’ is ‘trodden by them’. ‘They have sat there’ is ‘sat by them’.🔽‘They have eaten there’ is ‘eaten by them’. ‘They have drunk there’ is ‘drunk by them’. ‘They have chewed there’ is ‘chewed by them’. ‘They have tasted there’ is ‘tasted by them’.

original: 770. Āhāratthā ka. 556-7; rū. 606, 622; nī. 1143-4.🔽Ajjhoharaṇatthadhātuto kattari ca bhāva, kammesu ca ādhāre ca kto hoti.
analyzed: āhāratthā ka rū    ajjhoharaṇa attha dhātutaḥ kattari ca bhāva kammesu ca ādhāre ca ktaḥ hoti
translated: ‘They have eaten here’ is ‘eaten by them’. ‘They have drunk here’ is ‘drunk by them’. ‘They have chewed here’ is ‘chewed by them’. ‘They have tasted here’ is ‘tasted by them’.

original: Iha te bhuttā, asitā, pītā, khāyitā, sāyitā. Imāni tehi bhuttāni, asitāni, pītāni,🔽khāyitāni, sāyitāni. Iha tesaṃ bhuttaṃ, asitaṃ, pītaṃ, khāyitaṃ, sāyitaṃ. Idaṃ tesaṃ🔽bhuttaṃ ṭhānaṃ, asitaṃ ṭhānaṃ, pītaṃ ṭhānaṃ, khāyitaṃ ṭhānaṃ, sāyitaṃ ṭhānaṃ.
analyzed: iha te bhuttā asitā pītā khāyitā sāyitā imāni tehi bhuttāni asitāni pītāni  khāyitāni sāyitāni iha tesam bhuttam asitam pītam khāyitam sāyitam idam tesam  bhuttam ṭhānam asitam ṭhānam pītam ṭhānam khāyitam ṭhānam sāyitam ṭhānam
translated: ‘They have eaten here’ is ‘eaten by them’. ‘They have drunk here’ is ‘drunk by them’. ‘They have chewed here’ is ‘chewed by them’. ‘They have tasted here’ is ‘tasted by them’.🔽‘They have eaten here’ is ‘eaten by them’. ‘They have drunk here’ is ‘drunk by them’. ‘They have chewed here’ is ‘chewed by them’. ‘They have tasted here’ is ‘tasted by them’.🔽‘They have eaten here’ is ‘eaten by them’. ‘They have drunk here’ is ‘drunk by them’. ‘They have chewed here’ is ‘chewed by them’. ‘They have tasted here’ is ‘tasted by them’.

original: Iti tādipaccayarāsi.
analyzed: iti ta ādi pad caya rāsi
translated: Thus a mass of conditions in the manner of what is similar.

original: Anīyapaccayarāsi
analyzed: an īya paccaya rā si
translated: A mass of conditions in the manner of what is not to be done

original: ‘Bhāvakammesu tabbānīyā’ti anīyo, anubhuyyatīti anubhavanīyo.
analyzed: bhāva kammesu anīyaḥ
translated: ‘What is to be done in the manner of what is not to be done’ is ‘not to be done’. ‘What is to be experienced’ is ‘to be experienced’.

original: Ākārantesu parassaralopo, kvaci yāgamo, upaṭṭhānīyo, dānīyo, padahatīti padhānīyo-yogāvacaro,🔽pātabbanti pānīyaṃ, sāyituṃ arahatīti sāyanīyaṃ, paṭisāyanīyaṃ, pahānīyaṃ, abhitthavanīyaṃ,🔽sotabbanti savanīyaṃ, hutabbanti havanīyaṃ, upāsanīyo, abhikkamitabboti abhikkamanīyo,🔽rañjetīti rajjanīyo, gantabboti gamanīyo, vuccatīti vacanīyo.🔽Kara, tara, thara, dhara, sara, hara.🔽771. Rā nassa ṇo ka. 549; rū. 550; nī. 1135.🔽Rakārantadhātumhā parassa paccayanakārassa ṇo hoti.🔽Kattabbanti karaṇīyaṃ, taritabbanti taraṇīyaṃ, attharitabbanti attharaṇīyaṃ, dhāretabbanti dhāraṇīyaṃ, sāretabbanti sāraṇīyaṃ, haritabbanti haraṇīyaṃ iccādi.
analyzed: ākāra antesu parassara lopaḥ kvaci ya āgamaḥ upaṭṭhānīyaḥ dānīyaḥ padahati iti padhānīyaḥ yoga avacaraḥ  pātabbanti pānīyam sāyitum arahati iti sāyanīyam paṭisāyanīyam pahānīyam abhitthavanīyam  sotabbanti savanīyam hutabbanti havanīyam upāsanīyaḥ abhikkamitabbaḥ iti abhikkamanīyaḥ  rañjeti iti rajjanīyaḥ gantabbaḥ iti gamanīyaḥ vuccati iti vacanīyaḥ  kara tara thara dhara sara hara  rā nassa ṇaḥ ka rū nī  rakāra anta dhātumhā parassa paccaya nakārassa ṇaḥ hoti  kattabbanti karaṇīyam taritabbanti taraṇīyam attharitabbanti attharaṇīyam dhāretabbanti dhāraṇīyam sāretabbanti sāraṇīyam haritabbanti haraṇīyam iccādi
translated: In the case of the endings, the -r- of parassa becomes -l- by the rule of parassaralopa, and kvaci the -y- of yāgamo is lost. original: yojetabbanti yojanīyaṃ, dibbitabbanti dibbanīyaṃ, bujjhitabbanti bujjhanīyaṃ, pāpuṇitabbanti🔽pāpanīyaṃ, ñāpetabbanti ñāpanīyaṃ, cintetabbanti cintanīyaṃ, vajjetabbanti vajjanīyaṃ,
analyzed: yojetabbanti yojanīyam dibbitabbanti dibbanīyam bujjhitabbanti bujjhanīyam pāpuṇitabbanti  pāpanīyam ñāpetabbanti ñāpanīyam cintetabbanti cintanīyam vajjetabbanti vajjanīyam
translated: Should be yoked: to be yoked. Should be worshipped: to be worshipped. Should be awakened: to be awakened. Should be reached: to be reached.🔽Should be known: to be known. Should be thought: to be thought. Should be avoided: to be avoided.

original: titikkhitabbanti titikkhanīyaṃ, vīmaṃsitabbanti vīmaṃsanīyaṃ iccādi.
analyzed: titikkhitabbanti titikkhanīyam vīmaṃsitabbanti vīmaṃsanīyam iccādi
translated: Should be endured: to be endured. Should be investigated: to be investigated.

original: Iti anīyapaccayarāsi.
analyzed: iti anīya paccaya rāsi
translated: Thus the collection of indeclinables.

original: Nta, mānapaccayarāsi
analyzed: nta māna paccaya rāsi
translated: The collection of words with nta as the case-ending

original: Atha nta, mānapaccayā vuccante.🔽772. Nto kattari vattamāne ka. 565; rū. 646; nī. 1157.
analyzed: atha nta māna paccayā vuccante  n taḥ kattari vattamāne ka rū nī
translated: Now the words with nta as the case-ending are stated.🔽Nto is used as the case-ending for the nominative singular.

original: Vattamāno vuccati paccuppanno, vattamāne kāle kriyatthā paraṃ kattari nto hoti.
analyzed: vattamānaḥ vuccati paccuppannaḥ vattamāne kāle kriyatthā param kattari ntaḥ hoti
translated: The present is called the present time. The meaning of action is the nominative. Nto is the case-ending for the nominative singular.

original: Bhū-sattāyaṃ, ‘kattari lo’ti apaccayo, ‘yuvaṇṇānameopaccaye’ti ovuddhi, bhavatīti bhonto-puriso, bhontaṃkulaṃ, bhontī-itthī.
analyzed: bhūsattā ayam kattari laḥ ti a paccayaḥ bhavati iti bhontopurisaḥ bhontaṃkulam bhontīitthī
translated: In the feminine, ‘kattari lo’ is not a case-ending. ‘Yuvaṇṇānameopaccaye’ is the addition of o. Bhavati is bhonta-puriso, bhontaṃ-kulaṃ, bhonti-itthī.

original: Puna ‘eonamayavā sare’ti ossa avādeso, bhavaṃpuriso, bhavantaṃ-kulaṃ, bhavantī, bhavatī, bhotī vā-itthī.
analyzed: punar e o na ma ya vā sa ra iti o saḥ a va ādesaḥ bhavaṃpurisaḥ bhavantaṃkulam bhavantī bhavatī bhotī vā aitthī
translated: Again, ‘eonamayavā sare’ is the addition of o. Bhavam-puriso, bhavantaṃ-kulaṃ, bhavantī, bhavatī, bhotī vā-itthī.

analyzed: māno ka rū nī

original: Vattamāne kāle kriyatthā paraṃ kattari māno hoti.
analyzed: vattamāne kāle kriyatthā param kattari mānaḥ hoti
translated: Pride is used in the sense of the future in the active voice with reference to the agent.

original: Bhavamāno-puriso, bhavamānaṃ-kulaṃ, bhavamānā-itthī.
analyzed: bhavamānopurisaḥ bhavamānaṃkulam bhavamānāitthī
translated: A man who will be, a family which will be, a woman who will be.

original: 774. Bhāvakammesu ca ka. 565; rū. 646; nī. 1157.
analyzed: bhāva kammesu ca ka rū nī
translated: 2. And in the sense of the future in the passive voice with reference to the state and the action.

original: Vattamāne kāle kriyatthā paraṃ bhāva, kammesu ca māno hoti. ‘Kyo bhāvakammesū…’ti yapaccayo.
analyzed: vattamāne kāle param bhāva kammesu ca mānaḥ hoti bhāva kammesu iti ya paccayaḥ
translated: Pride is used in the sense of the future in the passive voice with reference to the state and the action. ‘Kyos in the sense of the future in the passive voice with reference to the state and the action’ is a post-position.

original: Anubhūyateti anubhūyamāno bhogo purisena, anubhūyamānā sampatti, anubhūyamānaṃ sukhaṃ.
analyzed: anubhūyate iti anubhūyamānaḥ bhogaḥ purisena anubhūyamānā sampatti anubhūyamānam sukham
translated: What is experienced is being experienced. A man’s enjoyment, a man’s prosperity, a man’s happiness.

original: Yassa dvittaṃ, anubhuyyamāno.
analyzed: yassa dvittam anubhuyyamānaḥ
translated: The dual of this is being experienced by two.

original: 775. Te ssapubbānāgate.
analyzed: te ssa pubba anāgate
translated: 3. And in the future tense with reference to the passive.

original: Anāgate kāle vattabbe te nta, mānapaccayā ssapubbā honti.
analyzed: anāgate kāle vattabbe te nta māna paccayā ssa pubbā honti
translated: When it is necessary to speak in the future tense, the passive is used with reference to the passive.

original: Bhavissatīti bhavissanto rū. 403-piṭṭhe rūpavidhi passitabbo -puriso, bhavissantaṃ-kulaṃ, bhavissantī-vibhatti, bhavissatī vā, bhavissamāno, bhavissamānaṃ, bhavissamānā.
analyzed: bhavissati iti bhavissantaḥ rū rūpa vidhi passitabbaḥ purisaḥ bhavissantam kulam bhavissantī vibhatti bhavissatī vā bhavissamānaḥ bhavissamānam bhavissamānā
translated: One who will be is a man who will be, a family which will be, a declension which will be, or it will be, what will be, what will be, what will be.

original: Kamme-anubhūyissamāno.🔽776. Mānassa massa.
analyzed: kamme anubhūyissamānaḥ 🔽mānassa massa
translated: In the action: what will be experienced.🔽4. And in the sense of the future with reference to the passive.🔽The passive is used with reference to the passive in the sense of the future.

original: Mānapaccayassa massa kvaci lopo hoti.
analyzed: māna paccayassa massa kvaci lopaḥ hoti
translated: In the case of the word māna, the vowel of the first syllable is elided in the sense of ‘pride’.

original: Nisinno vā sayāno khu. pā. 9.9 vā, sato sampajāno dī. ni. 1.217, niccaṃ nalopo.
analyzed: nisinnaḥ vā sayānaḥ khu pā vā sataḥ sampajānaḥ dī ni niccam na lopaḥ
translated: The vowel of the first syllable is elided in the sense of ‘sitting’, ‘lying down’, ‘being mindful’, ‘being clearly comprehending’, ‘being constantly’, ‘being always’.

original: Paññāyanto, paññāyamāno.🔽Kamme-viññāyamāno.🔽Kārite-ñāpento, ñāpayanto, ñāpayamāno.
analyzed: paññāyantaḥ paññāyamāno  kammeviññāyamāno  kārita iñāpentaḥ ñāpayantaḥ ñāpayamānaḥ
translated: The vowel of the first syllable is elided in the sense of ‘understanding’, ‘being understood’.🔽The vowel of the first syllable is elided in the sense of ‘being known’.🔽The vowel of the first syllable is elided in the sense of ‘causing to know’, ‘causing to understand’, ‘causing to be known’.

original: Kamme-ñāpīyamāno.🔽Kiyādigaṇe-jānanto, jānamāno.
analyzed: kammeñāpīyamānaḥ  kiyā ādi gaṇe jānantaḥ jānamānaḥ
translated: The vowel of the first syllable is elided in the sense of ‘being caused to know’.🔽The vowel of the first syllable is elided in the sense of ‘knowing’, ‘being known’.

original: Kārite-jānāpento, jānāpayamāno.
analyzed: jānāpayamānaḥ
translated: The vowel of the first syllable is elided in the sense of ‘causing to know’, ‘causing to understand’, ‘causing to be known’.

original: Kamme-jānāpīyamāno.
analyzed: kamma ījāna apīyamānaḥ
translated: The vowel of the first syllable is elided in the sense of ‘being caused to know’.

original: Tiṭṭhaṃ, tiṭṭhanto, tiṭṭhamāno, saṇṭhahaṃ, saṇṭhahanto, saṇṭhahamāno.
analyzed: tiṭṭham tiṭṭhantaḥ tiṭṭhamāno saṇṭhaham saṇṭhahantaḥ saṇṭhahamāno
translated: The vowel of the first syllable is elided in the sense of ‘standing’, ‘standing still’, ‘standing up’, ‘stopping’, ‘stopping still’, ‘stopping up’.

original: Kamme-upaṭṭhīyamāno.
analyzed: kamme upaṭṭhīyamānaḥ
translated: The vowel of the first syllable is elided in the sense of ‘being attended to’.

original: Kārite-patiṭṭhāpento, patiṭṭhāpayanto, patiṭṭhāpayamāno.
analyzed: patiṭṭhāpentaḥ patiṭṭhāpayantaḥ patiṭṭhāpayamānaḥ
translated: The vowel of the first syllable is elided in the sense of ‘causing to be established’, ‘causing to be placed’, ‘causing to be settled’.

original: Kamme-patiṭṭhāpīyamāno.
analyzed: kamme patiṭṭhāpīyamānaḥ
translated: The vowel of the first syllable is elided in the sense of ‘being caused to be established’.

original: Dento, dadanto, dajjanto, samādiyanto, dadamāno, dajjamāno, samādīyamāno.🔽Kamme-dīyamāno, diyyamāno.🔽Kārite-dāpento, dāpayanto, samādapayanto, rasso.
analyzed: dentaḥ dadantaḥ dajjantaḥ samādiyantaḥ dadamānaḥ dajjamānaḥ samādīyamānaḥ  kammedīyamānaḥ diyyamānaḥ  dāpayantaḥ samādapayantaḥ rasso
translated: The vowel of the first syllable is elided in the sense of ‘giving’, ‘giving to’, ‘giving away’, ‘taking up’, ‘giving to oneself’, ‘being given to oneself’, ‘being taken up’.🔽The vowel of the first syllable is elided in the sense of ‘being given’, ‘being given to’.🔽The vowel of the first syllable is elided in the sense of ‘causing to give’, ‘causing to give to’, ‘causing to give away’, ‘causing to take up’.

original: Kamme-dāpīyamāno, samādāpīyamāno.
analyzed: kammedāpīyamānaḥ samādāpīyamānaḥ
translated: The vowel of the first syllable is elided in the sense of ‘being caused to give’, ‘being caused to give to’.

original: Nidhento, nidahanto, nidahamāno, nidhiyyamāno, nidhāpento, nidhāpayanto, nidhāpayamāno,
analyzed: nidhentaḥ nidahantaḥ nidahamānaḥ nidhiyyamānaḥ nidhāpentaḥ nidhāpayantaḥ nidhāpayamānaḥ
translated: (He) is causing to be hidden, is causing to be hidden, is causing to be hidden, is being hidden, is causing to be hidden, is causing to be hidden, is causing to be hidden,

original: nidhāpīyamāno, yāyanto. Yāyanta’manuyāyanti jā. 2.22.1753, yāyamāno mahārājā, addā
analyzed: nidhāpīyamānaḥ yāyantaḥ yāyantam anuyāyanti jā yāyamānaḥ mahā rājā addā
translated: is being caused to be hidden, is going, is going, they follow, they follow, he follows, he follows, the great king, he was born in the middle of the island.

original: sīdantare nage jā. 2.22.566. Vāyanto, vāyamāno, nibbāyanto, parinibbāyanto, nibbāyamāno,
analyzed: sīdantare nage jā vāyantaḥ vāyamānaḥ nibbāyantaḥ parinibbāyantaḥ nibbāyamānaḥ
translated: He is striving, is striving, is extinguishing, is extinguishing completely, is extinguishing,

original: nibbāpento, nibbāpayamāno, nibbāpīyamāno, osāyanto, osāpento, osāpayanto, pahāyanto,🔽pahāyamāno, jahanto, jahamāno, pahīyamāno, pahiyyamāno, jahīyamāno, hāpento, hāpayanto,
analyzed: nibbāpentaḥ nibbāpayamānaḥ nibbāpīyamānaḥ osāyantaḥ osāpentaḥ osāpayantaḥ pahāyantaḥ  pahāyamānaḥ jahantaḥ jahamānaḥ pahīyamānaḥ pahiyyamānaḥ jahīyamānaḥ hāpentaḥ hāpayantaḥ
translated: is causing to be extinguished, is causing to be extinguished, is being caused to be extinguished, is passing over, is causing to be passed over, is causing to be passed over, is abandoning,

original: hāpayamāno, jahāpento, jahāpayanto, jahāpayamāno, hāpīyamāno, jahāpīyamāno.
analyzed: hāpayamānaḥ jahāpentaḥ jahāpayantaḥ jahāpayamānaḥ hāpīyamānaḥ jahāpīyamānaḥ
translated: is abandoning, is giving up, is giving up, is being abandoned, is being given up, is being given up, is causing to be given up, is causing to be given up, is causing to be given up, is being caused to be given up, is causing to be given up.

original: Ivaṇṇesu-vikkayanto, vikkiṇanto, vinicchayanto, vinicchinanto, nito cassa cho.
analyzed: i v aṇṇesu vikkayantaḥ vikkiṇantaḥ vinicchayantaḥ vinicchinantaḥ n itaḥ cassa chaḥ
translated: He is exchanging, is exchanging, is deciding, is deciding, he has no doubt.

original: Ācayanto, ācinanto, jayanto, jinanto, ḍento, ḍemāno, nento, vinento, nayanto, vinayanto,
analyzed: ācayantaḥ ācinantaḥ jayantaḥ jinantaḥ ḍentaḥ ḍemānaḥ nentaḥ vinentaḥ nayantaḥ vinayantaḥ
translated: He is accumulating, is accumulating, is conquering, is conquering, is burning, is burning, is leading, is leading away, is leading, is disciplining,

original: nayamāno, niyyamāno, nayāpento, nayāpayamāno, sento, sayanto, semāno, sayamāno, sayāno
analyzed: nayamānaḥ niyyamānaḥ naya apentaḥ naya apayamānaḥ sentaḥ sayantaḥ semānaḥ sayamānaḥ sayānaḥ
translated: not leading, being led, leading, being led, sending, being sent, lying, lying down, lying there, lying down,

original: vā, pahiṇanto, pahiṇamāno.🔽Uvaṇṇesu-cavanto, cavamāno, ṭhānā cāvanto, cāvayanto, cāvayamāno, javanto, javamāno,🔽abhitthavanto, abhitthavamāno, abhitthavīyamāno, sandhavanto, sandhavamāno, dhunanto,
analyzed: vā pahiṇantaḥ pahiṇamānaḥ  cavamānaḥ ṭhānā cāvantaḥ cāvayantaḥ cāvayamānaḥ javantaḥ javamānaḥ  abhitthavantaḥ abhitthavamānaḥ abhitthavīyamānaḥ sandhavantaḥ sandhavamānaḥ dhunantaḥ
translated: or sending, being sent.

original: niddhunanto, dhunamāno, niddhunamāno, punanto, ravanto, lunanto, āvuṇanto, pasavanto, vissavanto.🔽Kamme-suyyamāno.
analyzed: niddhunantaḥ dhunamānaḥ niddhunamānaḥ punantaḥ ravantaḥ lunantaḥ āvuṇantaḥ pasavantaḥ vissavantaḥ  kammesuyyamānaḥ
translated: In the case of ‘falling away’: falling away, falling away, falling away from the place, causing to fall away, causing to fall away, causing to fall away, running, running,

original: Kārite-sāvento, sāvayanto.🔽Svādigaṇe-suṇanto, suṇamāno.🔽Kārite-suṇāpento, suṇāpayanto.🔽Hu-pūjāyaṃ, juhonto.🔽Papubbo pahutte, pahonto, sampahonto.
analyzed: sāvayantaḥ  su ādi gaṇe suṇantaḥ suṇamānaḥ  suṇāpayantaḥ  hupūjā ayam juhontaḥ  papubbaḥ pahutte pahontaḥ sampahontaḥ
translated: running towards, running towards, running towards, shaking,

analyzed: hūsattā ayam hontaḥ 🔽attham e ntamhi sūriye jā atthaṅgatamhi same ntaḥ abhisame

original: khāyanto, khāyamāno, gāyanto, gāyamāno, gāyīyamāno, gāyāpento, gāyāpayanto, apacāyanto,
analyzed: khāyantaḥ khāyamānaḥ gāyantaḥ gāyamānaḥ gāyīyamānaḥ gāyāpentaḥ gāyāpayantaḥ apacāyantaḥ
translated: is eating, is being eaten, is singing, is being sung to, is being sung to by, is honouring,

original: dhammaṃ apacāyamāno, jhāyanto, jhāyamāno, pajjhāyanto, ujjhāyanto, nijjhāyanto, abhijjhāyanto.
analyzed: dhammaṃ apacāyamāno jhāyantaḥ jhāyamānaḥ pajjhāyantaḥ ujjhāyantaḥ nijjhāyantaḥ abhijjhāyantaḥ
translated: is honouring the Dhamma, is meditating, is being meditated upon, is meditating upon, is reviling, is meditating on, is coveting.

original: Kārite-jhāpento, ujjhāpento, yalopo.
analyzed: ujjhāpentaḥ ya lopaḥ
translated: is making meditate, is making revile, is a loss.

original: gacchamāno, gacchīyamāno.
analyzed: gacchamānaḥ gacchīyamānaḥ
translated: Going, gone.

original: Yassa pubbarūpatte-gammamāno, adhigammamāno, anāgate ssapubbo- “labha vasa chida
analyzed: yassa adhigammamānaḥ anāgate ssapubbaḥ labha vasa chida
translated: In the future, the prefix is added to the root: “Get, have, cut,

original: gama bhida rudānaṃ cchaṅa”iti ssena saha dhātvantassa ccho, gacchanto, gamissanto,
analyzed: gama bhida rudānam cchaṅa eti ssena saha dhātu antassa cchaḥ gacchantaḥ gamissantaḥ
translated: come, go, break, weep” (the prefix is added to the root with the vowel o).

original: gacchamāno, gamissamāno, jiranto, jiramāno, jiyyanto, jiyyamāno, dahanto, dahamāno.
analyzed: gacchamānaḥ gamissamānaḥ jirantaḥ jiramānaḥ jiyyantaḥ jiyyamānaḥ dahantaḥ dahamānaḥ
translated: Going, will go, gone, will be gone, growing old, growing old, growing old, growing old, burning, burning.

original: Dahassa dassa ḍo, ḍahanto, ḍahamāno.
analyzed: dahassa dassa ḍaḥ ḍahantaḥ ḍahamānaḥ
translated: The root daha has the vowel o: burning, burning.

original: Kamme-ḍayhamāno.🔽Disa-pekkhane, passanto, passamāno, passīyamāno.
analyzed: kammā īḍayhamānaḥ  disa apekkhane passantaḥ passamānaḥ passīyamānaḥ
translated: In the passive voice: being burnt.🔽In the sense of “looking at a direction”: seeing, seeing, being seen.

original: Kārite-dassento, dassayanto, dassayamāno.
analyzed: dassayantaḥ dassayamāno
translated: In the passive voice: showing, showing, being shown.

original: Labhanto, labhamāno.🔽Kamme pubbarūpaṃ, labbhamāno, upalabbhamāno.
analyzed: labhantaḥ labhamānaḥ  kamme pubbarūpam labbhamānaḥ upalabbhamānaḥ
translated: Getting, getting.🔽In the future, the prefix is added to the root: getting, getting.

original: Anāgate-lacchanto, labhissanto, lacchamāno, labhissamāno.🔽Maranto, maramāno, miyanto, miyamāno.
analyzed: anāgate lacchantaḥ labhissantaḥ lacchamānaḥ labhissamānaḥ  marantaḥ maramāḥ miyantaḥ miyamānaḥ
translated: In the future, the prefix is added to the root: getting, getting.🔽Dying, dying, dying, dying.

original: Yamu-uparame, niyamanto, saññamanto, saññamamāno, niyacchanto.
analyzed: niyamantaḥ saññamantaḥ saññamamānaḥ niyacchantaḥ
translated: In the sense of “restraint”: restraining, restraining, restraining, restraining.

original: Kārite-niyāmento.
analyzed: kāriteniyāmento
translated: In the passive voice: being restrained.

original: Rudanto, rodanto, rodamāno.
analyzed: rudantaḥ rodantaḥ rodamānaḥ
translated: Weeping, weeping, weeping.

original: Anāgate-rucchanto, rodissanto, rucchamāno, rodissamāno.
analyzed: anāgateḥ rucchantaḥ rodissantaḥ rucchamānaḥ rodissamānaḥ
translated: In the future: will weep, weeping, will weep, weeping.

original: Vacanto, vacamāno.🔽Kamme ‘assū’ti uttaṃ, vuccamāno.🔽Kārite-vācento, vācayanto, vācayamāno.
analyzed: vacantaḥ vacamānaḥ  kamme assu iti uttam vuccamānaḥ  vācayantaḥ vācayamānaḥ
translated: Speaking, speaking.

original: Kamme-vācīyamāno.🔽Anāgate-‘vaca bhuja muca visānaṃ kkhaṅa’iti ssena saha dhātvantassa kkhādeso, vakkhanto, vakkhamāno, vadanto, vadamāno, ovadanto, ovadamāno, vajjanto, vajjamāno.🔽Kamme-vadīyamāno, ovadīyamāno, ovajjamāno.🔽Kārite-bheriṃ vādento, vādayamāno.🔽Vasanto vasamāno.🔽Kamme pubbarūpattaṃ, upavassamāno.🔽Vāsento, vāsayanto.
analyzed: kammā iva ācīyamānaḥ  anāgatevaca bhuja muca visānam kkhaṅaḥ eti ssena saha dhātu antassa kkha ādesaḥ vakkhantaḥ vakkhamānaḥ vadantaḥ vadamānaḥ ovadantaḥ ovadamānaḥ vajjantaḥ vajjamānaḥ  kammevadīyamānaḥ ovadīyamānaḥ ovajjamānaḥ  kārita ibherim vādentaḥ vādayamānaḥ  vasantaḥ vasamānaḥ  kamme pubbarūpattam upavassamānaḥ  vāsentaḥ vāsayantaḥ
translated: In a deed: tears.

original: Anāgate-vacchanto, vasissanto, vacchamāno, vasissamāno.🔽Pavisanto, pavisamāno.
analyzed: anāgatevacchantaḥ vasissantaḥ vacchamānaḥ vasissamānaḥ  pavisantaḥ pavisamānaḥ
translated: In the future: will make speak, making speak, will make speak, making speak.

original: Kamme-pavisīyamāno.🔽Anāgate-pavekkhanto, pavisissanto, pavekkhamāno, pavisissamāno iccādi.
analyzed: kammepavisīyamāno  anāgate pavekkhantaḥ pavisissantaḥ pavekkhamāno pavisissamāno iccādi
translated: In a deed: is made to speak.
