original: Kamme-rundhīyamāno.
analyzed: kammeḥ undhīyamānaḥ
translated: while eating at a job.

original: Pubbarūpatte-rujjhamāno.
analyzed: pubbarūpatteḥ ujjhamānaḥ
translated: while eating at the time of the previous existence.

original: Rodhento, rodhamāno, rodhīyamāno.🔽Chindanto, chindamāno, chindīyamāno, chijjamāno, chindāpento, chindāpayanto.
analyzed: rodhentaḥ rodhamānaḥ rodhīyamānaḥ  chindantaḥ chindamānaḥ chindīyamānaḥ chijjamānaḥ chindāpentaḥ chindāpayantaḥ
translated: while crying, crying, being cried over.🔽while cutting, cutting, being cut, being cut up, while having cut, having cut up.

original: Anāgate-checchanto, chindissanto, checchamāno, chindissamāno.
analyzed: anāgate checchantaḥ chindissantaḥ checchamānaḥ chindissamānaḥ
translated: while desiring to cut in the future, will cut, will be cutting, will be cutting up.

original: Bhindanto, bhindamāno, bhindīyamāno, bhijjamāno, bhecchanto, bhindissanto, bhecchamāno, bhindissamāno.
analyzed: bhindantaḥ bhindamānaḥ bhindīyamānaḥ bhijjamānaḥ bhecchantaḥ bhindissantaḥ bhecchamānaḥ bhindissamānaḥ
translated: while breaking, breaking, being broken, being broken up, while desiring to break, will break, will be breaking, will be breaking up.

original: Bhuñjanto, bhuñjamāno.
analyzed: bhuñjantaḥ bhuñjamānaḥ
translated: while eating, eating.

original: Kamme-bhuñjīyamāno.
analyzed: kammebhuñjīyamānaḥ
translated: while eating at a job.

original: Pubbarūpatte-bhujjamāno.🔽Bhojento, bhojayanto, bhojayamāno, bhojīyamāno.
analyzed: pubbarūpattebhujjamānaḥ  bhojentaḥ bhojayantaḥ bhojayamānaḥ bhojīyamānaḥ
translated: while eating at the time of the previous existence.🔽while feeding, having fed, feeding, being fed.

original: Anāgate-bhokkhanto, bhuñjissanto, bhokkhamāno, bhuñjissamāno.🔽Muñcanto, muñcamāno, muñcīyamāno, muccamāno.
analyzed: anāgate bhokkhantaḥ bhuñjissantaḥ bhokkhamānaḥ bhuñjissamānaḥ  muñcantaḥ muñcamānaḥ muñcīyamānaḥ muccamānaḥ
translated: while desiring to eat in the future, will eat, will be eating, will be eating up.🔽while releasing, releasing, being released, being released from.

original: Anāgate-mokkhanto, muñcissanto, mokkhamāno, muñcissamāno iccādi.
analyzed: muñcissantaḥ mokkhamānaḥ muñcissamānaḥ iccādi
translated: while desiring to release in the future, will release, will be releasing, will be releasing from.

original: Divādimhi suddhakatturūpaṃ suddhakammarūpañca pubbarūpe sadisameva, dibbanto, dibbamāno, dibbīyamāno.
analyzed: divā ādimhi suddha kattu rūpam suddha kamma rūpam ca pubba rūpe sadisam eva dibbantaḥ dibbamānaḥ dibbīyamānaḥ
translated: In the case of the words beginning with dibbam, pure visible form and pure kamma-resultant form are the same as the former, that is, as the words beginning with pubba.

original: Pubbarūpatte-dibbamāno.
analyzed: pubbarūpatte dibbamānaḥ
translated: In the case of the words beginning with pubbarūpatte, the former is the same as the words beginning with dibbamāno.

original: Chijjanto, chijjamāno, chedāpento, chedāpayamāno.
analyzed: chijjantaḥ chijjamānaḥ chedāpentaḥ chedāpayamānaḥ
translated: In the case of the words beginning with chijjanto, the former is the same as the words beginning with chedāpento.

original: Bujjhanto, bujjhamāno, bujjhīyamāno, bodhento, bodhayanto, bodhayamāno.
analyzed: bujjhantaḥ bujjhamānaḥ bujjhīyamānaḥ bodhentaḥ bodhayantaḥ bodhayamānaḥ
translated: In the case of the words beginning with bujjhanto, the former is the same as the words beginning with bodhento.

original: Muccanto, muccamāno, mocento, mocayanto, mocayamāno, mocīyamāno.🔽Yujjanto, yujjamāno iccādi.
analyzed: muccantaḥ muccamānaḥ mocentaḥ mocayantaḥ mocayamānaḥ mocīyamānaḥ  yujjantaḥ yujjamānaḥ i t ca ādi
translated: In the case of the words beginning with muccanto, the former is the same as the words beginning with mocento.

original: Svādimhi-suṇanto, suṇamāno.🔽Kamme-suyyamāno.🔽Kārite-sāvento, sāvayanto, sāvayamāno.
analyzed: suṇamānaḥ  kammesuyyamānaḥ  sāvayantaḥ sāvayamānaḥ
translated: In the case of the words beginning with yujjanto, the former is the same as the words beginning with yujjamāno.🔽In the case of the words beginning with suṇanto, the former is the same as the words beginning with suyyamāno.

original: Pāpuṇanto, dhammaṃ pariyāpuṇanto, pariyāpuṇamāno, pāpuṇīyamāno, pāpīyamāno.🔽Kārite-pāpento, pāpayanto, pāpayamāno.
analyzed: pāpuṇantaḥ dhammam pariyāpuṇantaḥ pariyāpuṇamāno pāpuṇīyamāno pāpīyamāno  pāpayantaḥ pāpayamānaḥ
translated: In the case of the words beginning with sāvento, the former is the same as the words beginning with pāpento.🔽In the case of the words beginning with pāpuṇanto, the former is the same as the words beginning with pāpīyamāno.

original: Pari, saṃpubbo-parisamāpento, parisamāpayanto, parisamāpayamāno, parisamāpīyamāno.🔽Sakkuṇanto, āvuṇanto iccādi.
analyzed: pari saṃpubbo parisamāpentaḥ parisamāpayantaḥ parisamāpayamānaḥ parisamāpīyamānaḥ 🔽sakkuṇantaḥ āvuṇantaḥ iccādi
translated: In the case of the words beginning with parisamāpento, the former is the same as the words beginning with sakkuṇanto.

original: Kiyādimhi-kiṇanto, kiṇāpento, vikkayanto iccādi.
analyzed: kiyā ādimhi kiṇantaḥ kiṇāpentaḥ vikkayantaḥ it ca ādi
translated: In kiyādi: kiṇanto, kiṇāpento, vikkayanto, etc.

original: Tanādimhi-tanonto, karonto, kubbanto, kubbamāno, krubbanto, krubbamāno, kurumāno, kayiranto, kayiramāno.
analyzed: karontaḥ kubbantaḥ kubbamānaḥ krubbantaḥ krubbamānaḥ kurumānaḥ kayirantaḥ kayiramānaḥ
translated: In tanādi: tanonto, karonto, kubbanto, kubbamāno, krubbanto, krubbamāno, kurumāno, kayiranto, kayiramāno.

original: Kamme-karīyamāno, kayyamāno, ‘tavaggavaraṇānaṃ ye cavaggabayañā’ti dhātvantassa yādeso.
analyzed: kamme karīyamānaḥ kayyamānaḥ ta vagga varaṇānam ye ca vagga bayañā ti dhātu antassa ya ādesaḥ
translated: In kamme: karīyamāno, kayyamāno, ‘tavaggavaraṇānaṃ ye cavaggabayañā’ ti dhātvantassa yādeso.

original: Saṅkharonto, abhisaṅkharonto.
analyzed: saṅkharontaḥ abhisaṅkharontaḥ
translated: Saṅkharonto, abhisaṅkharonto.

original: Kārite-kārento, kārayanto, kārayamāno, kārīyamāno.
analyzed: kāritekārentaḥ kārayantaḥ kārayamānaḥ kārīyamānaḥ
translated: In kārite: kārento, kārayanto, kārayamāno, kārīyamāno.

original: Sakkonto iccādi.
analyzed: sakkontaḥ i c ādi
translated: Sakkonto, etc.

original: Curādimhi-corento, corayanto, corayamāno, thenento, thenayanto, thenayamāno, cintento,
analyzed: cur ādimhi corentaḥ corayantaḥ corayamānaḥ thenentaḥ thenayantaḥ thenayamānaḥ cintentaḥ
translated: In curādi: corento, corayanto, corayamāno, thenento, thenayanto, thenayamāno, cintento,

original: cintayanto, cintayamāno, cintīyamāno, cintāpento, cintāpayanto, cintāpayamāno, cintāpīyamāno iccādi.
analyzed: cintayantaḥ cintayamānaḥ cintīyamānaḥ cintāpentaḥ cintāpayantaḥ cintāpayamānaḥ cintāpīyamānaḥ iccādi
translated: cintayanto, cintayamāno, cintīyamāno, cintāpento, cintāpayanto, cintāpayamāno, cintāpīyamāno, etc.

original: Titikkhanto, titikkhamāno, titikkhīyamāno, titikkhāpento, titikkhāpayanto, titikkhāpayamāno, vīmaṃsanto, tikicchanto, cikicchanto, vicikicchanto.
analyzed: titikkhantaḥ titikkhamānaḥ titikkhīyamānaḥ titikkhāpentaḥ titikkhāpayantaḥ titikkhāpayamānaḥ vīmaṃsantaḥ tikicchantaḥ cikicchantaḥ vicikicchantaḥ
translated: Titikkhanto, titikkhamāno, titikkhīyamāno, titikkhāpento, titikkhāpayanto, titikkhāpayamāno, vīmaṃsanto, tikicchanto, cikicchanto, vicikicchanto.

original: Bhuñjituṃ icchatīti bubhukkhanto, ghasituṃ icchatīti jighacchanto, pātuṃ paribhuñjituṃ🔽icchatīti pipāsanto, gottuṃ saṃvarituṃ icchatīti jigucchanto, harituṃ pariyesituṃ🔽icchatīti jigīsanto, vijetuṃ icchatīti vijigīsanto.
analyzed: bhuñjitum icchati iti bubhukkhantaḥ ghasitum icchati iti jighacchantaḥ pātum paribhuñjitum  icchati iti pipāsantaḥ gottum saṃvaritum icchati iti jigucchantaḥ haritum pariyesitum  icchati iti jigīsantaḥ vijetum icchati iti vijigīsantaḥ
translated: He wants to eat, thus he is hungry ; he wants to chew, thus he is famished ; he wants to drink and to consume, thus he is thirsty ; he wants to go and to restrain, thus he is disgusted ; he wants to carry and to seek, thus he is eager ; he wants to conquer, thus he is eager to conquer.

original: Pabbato viya attānaṃ caratīti pabbatāyanto, pabbatāyamāno, piyāyanto, mettāyantoiccādīni ca yojetabbāni.
analyzed: pabbataḥ viya attānam carati iti pabbatāyantaḥ pabbatāyamānaḥ piyāyantaḥ mettāyantaḥ icca ādīni ca yojetabbāni
translated: He behaves with himself like a mountain, thus he is a mountain-goer ; he is a mountain-goer, a lover, a loving-kindness-practiser, and so on.

original: Iti nta, mānapaccayarāsi.
analyzed: iti nta māna paccaya rāsi
translated: Thus nta, the group of bases ending in -na.

original: Ṇyādipaccayarāsi
analyzed: ṇi ādi pat ca ya rā si
translated: The group of bases ending in -ṇya, etc.

original: Atha ṇya, ya, yakapaccayantā vuccante.
analyzed: atha ṇya ya yaka pacca yantāḥ vuccante
translated: Now, those ending in -ṇya, -ya, and -ka are stated.

original: 777. Ghyaṇa.
analyzed: ghi aṇa
translated: . Ghyaṇa.

original: Bhāva, kammesu gha, ṇānubandho yapaccayo hoti. Ghānubandho ‘kagācajānaṃ ghānubandhe’tiādīsu visesanattho. Ṇānubandho vuddhidīpanattho. Evaṃ sabbattha.
analyzed: bhāva kammesu gha ṇa anubandhaḥ ya paccayaḥ hoti gha anubandhaḥ gha anubandha iti ādīsu visesana tthaḥ ṇa anubandhaḥ vuddhi dīpana tthaḥ evam sabbattha
translated: In the formation of nouns and verbs the suffix -ya is a cause of the affix -gha, and the suffix -ṇya is a cause of the affix -gha. The suffix -ka is a cause of the affix -gha in such words as ‘kagācajānaṃ ghānubandhe’ , etc., where it has the meaning of a restrictive particle. The suffix -ṇya has the meaning of an augment. So in all instances.

original: Anubhavitabboti anubhāviyo bhogo purisena, anubhāviyaṃ sukhaṃ, anubhāviyā sampatti.
analyzed: anubhavitabbaḥ ti anubhāviyaḥ bhogaḥ purisena anubhāviyam sukham anubhāviyā sampatti
translated: It is to be experienced, thus it is an experience ; an experience is a possession by a man ; happiness is an experience ; success is an experience.

original: 778. Āsse ca.
analyzed: āsse ca
translated: . Āsse ca.

original: Ādantadhātūnaṃ āssa e hoti ghyaṇamhi. Casaddena ivaṇṇadhātūnaṃ āgamaīkārassa ca ettaṃ.
analyzed: ā t anta dhātūnam āssaḥ e hoti ca saddena i v aṇṇa dhātūnam āgama īkārassa ca e ttam
translated: The letter e is the sign of the two elements of teeth and saliva. It is the sign of the vowel i and of the letter ñ.

original: Akkhātabbaṃ kathetabbanti akkheyyaṃ.
analyzed: akkhātabbam kathetabbam ti akkheyyam
translated: What is to be spoken is the speakable.

original: Yassa dvittaṃ, saṅkhātabbanti saṅkhyeyyaṃ, saṅkhātuṃ asakkuṇeyyanti asaṅkhyeyyaṃ,🔽gāyitabbanti geyyaṃ-sagāthakaṃ suttaṃ, ghāyituṃ arahatīti gheyyaṃ, ghāyanīyaṃ, apacāyituṃ🔽arahatīti apaceyyaṃ, ñātuṃ arahatīti ñeyyaṃ, ājānituṃ arahatīti aññeyyaṃ, viññeyyaṃ,
analyzed: yassa dvittam saṅkhātabbanti saṅkhyeyyam saṅkhātum a sakkuṇeyyanti asaṅkhyeyyam  gāyitabbanti geyyam sagāthakam suttam ghāyitum arahati iti gheyyam ghāyanīyam apacāyitum  arahati iti apaceyyam ñātum arahati iti ñeyyam ājānitum arahati iti aññeyyam viññeyyam
translated: What is to be counted is the countable. What is not to be counted is the uncountable.🔽What is to be sung is the singable. What is to be smelt is the smellable.

original: abhiññeyyaṃ, pariññeyyaṃ.
analyzed: abhiññeyyam pariññeyyam
translated: What is to be honoured is the honourable. What is to be known is the knowable. What is to be understood is the understandable.🔽What is to be directly known is the directly knowable. What is to be fully understood is the fully understandable.

original: Īāgame-jāniyaṃ, vijāniyaṃ, īssa rasso.🔽Jāneyyaṃ, vijāneyyaṃ, adhiṭṭhātabbanti adhiṭṭheyyaṃ, adhiṭṭhaheyyaṃ, dātabbanti deyyaṃ,
analyzed: ī āgamejāniyam vijāniyam īssa rassaḥ  jāneyyam vijāneyyam adhiṭṭhātabbanti adhiṭṭheyyam adhiṭṭhaheyyam dātabbanti deyyam
translated: In the prefix: jāniyaṃ, vijāniyaṃ. The letter i has a long sound.🔽The understandable, the understandable, the determinable, the giveable,

original: ādātabbanti ādeyyaṃ, saddahituṃ arahatīti saddaheyyaṃ, vidhātuṃ arahatīti vidheyyaṃ,
analyzed: ādātabbanti ādeyyam saddahitum arahati iti saddaheyyam vidhātum arahati iti vidheyyam
translated: the acceptable, the believable, the controllable,

original: na vidheyyaṃ avidheyyaṃ-anattalakkhaṇaṃ, mārassa āṇā dahati etthāti māradheyyaṃ,
analyzed: na vidheyyam a vidheyya anatta lakkhaṇam mārassa āṇā dahati ettha ati māradheyyam
translated: the uncontrollable, the characteristic of not-self, the realm of Māra,

original: maccudheyyaṃ, sannihitabbanti sannidheyyaṃ, abhidhātabbaṃ kathetabbanti abhidheyyaṃ,🔽pidahitabbanti pidheyyaṃ, alopo, apidheyyaṃ vā, pātabbanti peyyaṃ, minetabbanti meyyaṃ,🔽pametabbanti pameyyaṃ, upecca minituṃ arahatīti upameyyaṃ, hātabbanti heyyaṃ, paheyyaṃ, pajaheyyaṃ.
analyzed: maccudheyyam sannihitabbanti sannidheyyam abhidhātabbam kathetabbanti abhidheyyam  pidahitabbanti pidheyyam a lopaḥ a pidheyyam vā pātabbanti peyyam minetabbanti meyyam  pametabbanti pameyyam upecca minitum arahati iti upameyyam hātabbanti heyyam paheyyam pajaheyyam
translated: To be brought near: to be brought near is to be brought together, to be spoken, to be told is to be spoken about,🔽To be hidden: to be hidden is to be concealed, to be lost, or not to be hidden, To be drunk: to be drunk is to be drunk, to be measured: to be measured is to be measured,🔽To be compared: to be compared is to be compared, to be worthy of being measured after having been compared, to be abandoned: to be abandoned is to be abandoned, to be given up, to be rejected.

original: Ivaṇṇesu-ajjhāyitabbanti ajjheyyaṃ, adhiyeyyaṃ, upetabbanti upeyyaṃ, vikkiṇitabbanti
analyzed: iv aṇṇesu ajjhāyitabbanti ajjheyyam adhiyeyyam upetabbanti upeyyam vikkiṇitabbanti
translated: In the i-vowel group: to be thought about is to be thought about, to be understood is to be understood, to be approached is to be approached, to be sold is

original: vikkeyyaṃ, vikkāyiyaṃ, vikkāyeyyaṃ, vikkiṇeyyaṃ vā, vicinitabbanti viceyyaṃ, vicineyyaṃ,
analyzed: vikkeyyam vikkāyiyam vikkāyeyyam vikkiṇeyyam vā vicinitabbanti viceyyam vicineyyam
translated: to be sold, to be sold out, to be sold off, to be sold away, to be sought is to be sought, to be sought out,

original: jetabbanti jeyyaṃ, vijeyyaṃ, netabbanti neyyaṃ, vineyyaṃ, adhisayitabbanti adhiseyyaṃ,
analyzed: jetabbanti jeyyam vijeyyam netabbanti neyyam vineyyam adhisayitabbanti adhiseyyam
translated: To be conquered: to be conquered is to be conquered, to be won, to be led is to be led, to be disciplined, to be surpassed is to be surpassed,

original: pahitabbanti pāheyyaṃ, pahiṇeyyaṃ vā.🔽Uvaṇṇesu vuddhiāvādeso, ku-sadde, kuyyatīti kāveyyaṃ.
analyzed: pahitabbanti pāheyyam pahiṇeyyam vā  u v aṇṇesu v uddhi ā vā ādesaḥ ku sadde kuyyati iti kāveyyam
translated: To be sent: to be sent is to be sent off, to be sent away.🔽In the u-vowel group: growth, increase, in the ku-sound: to be composed is a poem.

original: Īssa abhāve vassa battaṃ rasso ca, kabyaṃ.
analyzed: īssaḥ abhāve vassa battam rasso ca kabyam
translated: In the absence of i: to be drunk is a drink, and it is long, it is poetry.

original: Pubbarūpatte kabbaṃ, cāvetabbanti cāveyyaṃ, javitabbanti javeyyaṃ, abhitthavitabbanti abhitthaveyyaṃ, bhavituṃ arahatīti bhabbaṃ. Juhotabbanti habyaṃ-sappi.
analyzed: pubbarūpatte kabbam cāvetabbanti cāveyyam javitabbanti javeyyam abhitthavitabbanti abhitthaveyyam bhavitum arahati iti bhabbam juhotabbanti habyaṃsappi
translated: In the past tense, the form is kabbaṃ. That which is to be crossed is cāveyyaṃ, that which is to be run is javeyyaṃ, that which is to be overcome is abhitthaveyyaṃ. That which is able to be is bhabbaṃ. That which is to be offered is habyaṃ, ghee.

original: Edantesu-apacāyitabbanti apaceyyaṃ, apacāyiyaṃ.
analyzed: e t antesu apacāyitabbanti apaceyyam apacāyiyam
translated: In the eda-group: That which is to be served is apaceyyaṃ, apaceyyaṃ.

original: Ve-tantasantāne, vetabbanti veyyaṃ.
analyzed: vetanta santāne vetabbanti veyyam
translated: In the ve-group: In the continuum, that which is to be covered is veyyaṃ.

original: Vaca, bhaja, bhuja, yujādīhi ghyaṇapaccayo.🔽779. Kagā cajānaṃ ghānubandhe ka. 623; rū. 554; nī. 1229.
analyzed: vaca bhaja bhuja yuja ādīhi ghi a ṇ pad cayaḥ  ka gā ca jānam gha anubandhe ka rū nī
translated: The suffix ghyaṇ is used with vaca, bhaja, bhuja, yuj, etc.🔽In the ka-group: In the sense of ‘to go’, the form is ka; in the sense of ‘to be’, the form is gā; in the sense of ‘to lead’, the form is cajānaṃ.

original: Ca, jānaṃ dhātvantānaṃ ka, gā honti ghānubandhe paccaye pare.
analyzed: ca jānam dhātu antānam ka gā honti gha anubandhe paccaye pare
translated: Ka and gā are used in the ka-group, in the sense of ‘to go’, ‘to be’, and ‘to lead’, respectively, when the suffix ghānubandha follows.

original: Vattabbanti vākyaṃ, vākkaṃ, vāccaṃ, vāceyyaṃ vā.
analyzed: vattabbanti vākyam vākkam vāccam vāceyyam vā
translated: That which is to be spoken is vākyaṃ, vākkaṃ, vāccaṃ, vāceyyaṃ.

original: Bhaja-sevāyaṃ, bhajitabbanti bhāgyaṃ, bhaggaṃ, bhuñjitabbanti bhogyaṃ, bhoggaṃ, yuñjitabbanti yogyaṃ, yoggaṃ.🔽780. Vadādīhi yo ka. 541; rū. 552; nī. 1126.
analyzed: bhajaseva ayam bhajitabbanti bhāgyam bhaggam bhuñjitabbanti bhogyam bhoggam yuñjitabbanti yogyam yoggam  vad ādīhi yaḥ ka rū nī
translated: In the sense of ‘to enjoy’, the form is bhāgyaṃ, bhaggaṃ; in the sense of ‘to eat’, the form is bhogyaṃ, bhoggaṃ; in the sense of ‘to yoke’, the form is yogyaṃ, yoggaṃ.

original: Vadādīhi bhāva, kammesu bahulaṃ yo hoti.
analyzed: vad ādīhi bhāva kammesu bahulam yaḥ hoti
translated: In the ka-group: In the sense of ‘to say’, etc., the form is ka; in the sense of ‘to be’, the form is gā; in the sense of ‘to lead’, the form is cajānaṃ.🔽Ka and gā are used in the ka-group, in the sense of ‘to say’, etc., ‘to be’, and ‘to lead’, respectively, when the suffix ghānubandha follows.

original: Bhuñjibhabbanti bhojjaṃ, khāditabbanti khajjaṃ, vituditabbanti vitujjaṃ, panuditabbanti panujjaṃ, pajjitabbanti pajjaṃ, majjati etenāti majjaṃ.
analyzed: bhuñjibhabbanti bhojjam khāditabbanti khajjam vituditabbanti vitujjam panuditabbanti panujjam pajjitabbanti pajjam majjati etena ati majjam
translated: “Edible” is bhojjaṃ, “chewable” is khajjaṃ, “to be sucked” is vitujjaṃ, “to be licked” is panujjaṃ, “to be drunk” is pajjaṃ, “to be intoxicated by this” is majjaṃ.

original: Muda-hāse, pamodati etenāti pāmojjaṃ, vadīyatīti vajjaṃ.
analyzed: muda hāse pamodati etena ati pāmojjam vadīyati iti vajjam
translated: “To be delighted by” is muda-hāse, “to be gladdened by this” is pāmojjaṃ, “to be blamed” is vajjaṃ.

original: Vadha-hiṃsāyaṃ, vadhitabbanti vajjhaṃ, vijjhitabbanti vijjhaṃ, punanti sujjhanti sattā etenāti puññaṃ, nāgamo.
analyzed: vadha hiṃsā ayam vadhitabbanti vajjham vijjhitabbanti vijjham punanti sujjhanti sattāḥ etena ati puññam na āgamaḥ
translated: “To be killed” is vadha-hiṃsāyaṃ, “to be killed” is vajjhaṃ, “to be pierced” is vijjhaṃ, “by this beings are purified” is puññaṃ, “without return”.

original: Vihaññate vihaññaṃ, vapiyateti vappaṃ, supanaṃ soppaṃ, labhitabbanti labbhaṃ, gantabbanti
analyzed: vihaññate vihaññam vapiyate iti vappam supanam soppam labhitabbanti labbham gantabbanti
translated: “To be harassed” is vihaññate, “to be sown” is vappaṃ, “to be slept” is soppaṃ, “to be obtained” is labbhaṃ, “to be gone” is

original: gammaṃ, damituṃ arahatīti dammaṃ, ramitabbanti rammaṃ, abhirammaṃ, nisāmīyate nisammaṃ,
analyzed: gammam damitum arahati iti dammam ramitabbanti rammam abhirammam nisāmīyate nisammam
translated: gammaṃ, “to be given” is dammaṃ, “to be delighted by” is rammaṃ, “to be delighted in” is abhirammaṃ, “to be considered” is nisammaṃ,

original: visamīyate visammaṃ, phusīyateti phasso, ussa attaṃ.
analyzed: visamīyate visammam phusīyate iti phassaḥ
translated: “to be considered wrongly” is visammaṃ, “to be touched” is phasso, “to be lifted up” is ussa attaṃ.

original: Sāsitabboti sisso, ‘sāsassa sisā’ti sittaṃ.
analyzed: sāsitabbaḥ iti sissaḥ sāsassa sisāti sittam
translated: “To be instructed” is sisso, “the head of instruction” is sittaṃ.

original: Gaha, guha, garaha, duha, vaha, saha.
analyzed: gaha guha garaha duha vaha saha
translated: Gaha, guha, garaha, duha, vaha, saha.

original: 781. Guhādīhi yaka ka. 541; rū. 552; nī. 1126.
analyzed: guhā ādi ya ka ka rū nī
translated: . Guhādīhi yaka ka. ; rū. ; nī. .🔽.

original: Etehi bhāva, kammesu bahulaṃ yaka hoti, hassa vipallāso.🔽Gahetabbanti gayhaṃ, guhitabbanti guyhaṃ.
analyzed: etehi bhāva kammesu bahulam hoti hassa vipallāsaḥ  gahetabbanti gayham guhitabbanti guyham
translated: These are formed by adding -va to the verbs.🔽The words gayhaṃ, guyhaṃ are from the root gahetabbaṃ, guhitabbaṃ.

original: Garaha-nindāyaṃ, garahitabbanti gārayhaṃ, duhitabbanti duyhaṃ, vahitabbanti vayhaṃ.
analyzed: garaha nindā ayam garahitabbanti gārayham duhitabbanti duyham vahitabbanti vayham
translated: The words gārayhaṃ, duyhaṃ, vayhaṃ are from the roots garahitabbanti, duhitabbanti, vahitabbanti.

original: Saha-sāhase, sahitabbanti sayhaṃ, pasayhaṃ.
analyzed: sahasā ahase sahitabbanti sayham pasayham
translated: The words sayhaṃ, pasayhaṃ are from the roots sahitabbanti, pasayhitabbanti.

original: 782. Kicca ghacca bhacca gabba lyā ‘…babbaleyyā’ (bahūsu).
analyzed: kicca ghacca bhacca gabba lyāḥ babbaleyyāḥ bahūsu
translated: The words kicca, ghacca, bhacca, gabba, lyā are formed by adding -la to the roots.

original: Ete saddā yapaccayantā sijjhanti, iminā yapaccayaṃ katvā tena saha karassa kiccaṃ, hanassa ghaccaṃ, bharassa bhaccaṃ, gussa gabbaṃ, lissa lyattaṃ katvā sijjhanti.
analyzed: ete saddāḥ sijjhanti iminā ya paccayam katvā tena saha karassa kiccam hanassa ghaccam bharassa bhaccam gussa gabbam lissa lyattam katvā sijjhanti
translated: These words are formed by adding -la to the roots, and then by adding the suffixes kicca, ghacca, bhacca, gabba, lyā.

original: Karīyateti kiccaṃ, kiccayaṃ vā, haññateti ghaccaṃ, haccaṃ vā, bharīyateti bhaccaṃ.
analyzed: karīyateti kiccam kiccayam vā haññateti ghaccam haccam vā bharīyateti bhaccam
translated: The word kicca is from the root karīyate; ghacca is from the root haññate; bhacca is from the root bharīyate; gabba is from the root gu; lyā is from the root lis.🔽The word bhāriyaṃ is from the root bhara-bharaṇa; hāriyaṃ is from the root hari; bhājiyaṃ is from the root bhājetabba.

original: Gu-dabbe, guyate gabbaṃ, paṭisallīyate paṭisalyaṃ.
analyzed: gudabbe guyate gabbam paṭisallīyate paṭisalyam
translated: The words paṭisalyaṃ, paṭisallīyate are from the root gu-dabba.

original: Visesavidhānaṃ –
analyzed: visesa vidhānam
translated: The following is a special rule:

original: Bhara-bharaṇe, bharitabbanti bhāriyaṃ, haritabbanti hāriyaṃ, bhājetabbanti bhājiyaṃ,
analyzed: bhara bharaṇe bharitabbanti bhāriyam haritabbanti hāriyam bhājetabbanti bhājiyam
translated: The words bhāriyaṃ, hāriyaṃ, bhājiyaṃ are formed by adding -ya to the roots bhara, hari, bhājetabba.

original: bhājeyyaṃ, upāsitabbanti upāsiyaṃ, icchitabbanti iccheyyaṃ, adhigantabbanti adhigameyyaṃ iccādi.
analyzed: bhājeyyam upāsitabbanti upāsiyam icchitabbanti iccheyyam adhigantabbanti adhigameyyam iccādi
translated: should be divided, should be served, should be desired, should be attained.

original: Rundhitabbanti rundheyyaṃ, chinditabbanti chindeyyaṃ, chejjaṃ iccādi.
analyzed: rundhitabbanti rundheyyam chinditabbanti chindeyyam chejjam iccādi
translated: should be run through, should be cut, should be cut off.

original: Dibbitabbanti dibbeyyaṃ, dibbaṃ, bujjhitabbanti bujjheyyaṃ, bodheyyaṃ, bojjhaṃ iccādi.
analyzed: dibbitabbanti dibbeyyam dibbam bujjhitabbanti bujjheyyam bodheyyam bojjham iccādi
translated: should be worshipped, should be worshipped, should be awakened, should be awakened, should be awakened.

original: Sotabbanti suṇeyyaṃ, pāpuṇitabbanti pāpuṇeyyaṃ, sakkuṇitabbanti sakkuṇeyyaṃ, na sakkuṇeyyaṃ asakkuṇeyyaṃ iccādi.
analyzed: sotabbanti suṇeyyam pāpuṇitabbanti pāpuṇeyyam sakkuṇitabbanti sakkuṇeyyam na sakkuṇeyyam a sakkuṇeyyam iccādi
translated: should be heard, should be attained, should be able, should not be able, should not be able.

original: Tanitabbanti tāneyyaṃ, taññaṃ, kātabbanti kāriyaṃ, kayyaṃ.🔽Coretabbanti coreyyaṃ, thenīyate theyyaṃ, nassa pararūpattaṃ, cintetabbanti cinteyyaṃ, na cinteyyaṃ acinteyyaṃ, acintiyaṃ, manteyyaṃ, mantiyaṃ, vediyaṃ, vedeyyaṃ iccādi.
analyzed: tanitabbanti tāneyyam taññam kātabbanti kāriyam kayyam  coretabbanti coreyyam thenīyate theyyam nassa pararūpattam cintetabbanti cinteyyam na cinteyyam a cinteyyam a cintiyam manteyyam mantiyam vediyam vedeyyam iccādi
translated: should be thought, should be thought, should be done, should be done, should be done.🔽should be stolen, should be stolen, should be stolen, should be thought, should be thought, should not be thought, should not be thought, should be thought, should be thought, should be known, should be known.

original: Titikkheyyaṃ, vīmaṃseyyaṃ iccādi ca yojetabbāni.
analyzed: titikkheyyam vīmaṃseyyam iccādi ca yojetabbāni
translated: should be endured, should be investigated.

original: Iti ṇyādipaccayarāsi.
analyzed: iti ṇi ādi pat ca ya rā si
translated: Thus the group of suffixes beginning with ṇ.

original: Aādipaccayarāsi
analyzed: a ādi pacca ya rā si
translated: The group of suffixes beginning with a

original: Atha a, aṇa, ghaka, ghaṇapaccayantā vuccante.🔽783. Bhāvakārakesvaghaṇaghaka ‘bhāvakārakesvaghaṇaghakā’ (bahūsu).
analyzed: atha a a ṇa ghaka gha ṇa paccaya antāḥ vuccante  bhāva kāraka isva gha ṇa ghaka bhāva kāraka isva gha ṇa ghakā bahūsu
translated: Now, a, aṇa, ghaka, ghaṇa are said to be the conditions.

original: Bhāve chasu kārakesu ca kriyatthā paraṃ a, ghaṇa, ghakapaccayā honti kammādimhi vā akammādimhi vā.
analyzed: bhāve chasu kārakesu ca param a ghaṇa ghaka paccayāḥ honti kamma ādimhi vā a kamma ādimhi vā
translated: In the six cases, in the six means of action, the conditions a, ghaṇa, gha are used after the verb, whether it is a verb of action, etc., or not.

original: 784. Kvacaṇa.
analyzed: kva caṇa
translated: In some cases aṇa.

original: Kammupapadamhā kriyatthā paraṃ kattari eva kvaci aṇa hoti.
analyzed: kamma upapada mhā kriyatthā param kattari eva kvaci hoti
translated: In some cases aṇa is used after the verb, whether it is a verb of action, etc., or not, when the nominative case is the agent.

original: A, aṇa, ghaka, ghaṇa.
analyzed: a a ṇa ghaka ghaṇa
translated: a, aṇa, ghaka, ghaṇa.

original: Amhi tāva –
analyzed: amhi tāva
translated: In the nominative case, first of all:

original: Aggaṃ jānātīti aggañño, vaṃsaṃ jānātīti vaṃsañño, magge tiṭṭhatīti maggaṭṭho-puriso, maggaṭṭhā-itthī, maggaṭṭhaṃ-ñāṇaṃ. Evaṃ phalaṭṭho, thalaṭṭho, jalaṭṭho, pabbataṭṭho, bhūmaṭṭho.🔽Go vuccati ñāṇaṃ saddo ca, gavaṃ tāyati rakkhatīti gottaṃ, parito bhayaṃ tāyati rakkhatīti
analyzed: aggam jānāti iti aggaññaḥ vaṃsam jānāti iti vaṃsaññaḥ magge tiṭṭhati iti magga ṭṭhopurisaḥ magga ṭṭhā itthī magga ṭṭhaṃñāṇam evam phala ṭṭhaḥ thala ṭṭhaḥ jala ṭṭhaḥ pabbata ṭṭhaḥ bhūma ṭṭhaḥ  go vuccati ñāṇam saddo ca gavam tāyati rakkhati iti gottam paritas bhayam tāyati rakkhati iti
translated: He who knows the head is aggañño, he who knows the lineage is vaṃsañño, he who stands on the path is maggaṭṭho, a man; maggaṭṭhā, a woman; maggaṭṭhaṃ, knowledge. So too: phalaṭṭho, thalaṭṭho, jalaṭṭho, pabbataṭṭho, bhūmaṭṭho.

original: parittaṃ, annaṃ detīti annado. Evaṃ vatthado, vaṇṇado, yānado, sukhado, dīpado, cakkhudo,
analyzed: parittam annam deti iti anna daḥ evam vattha daḥ vaṇṇa daḥ yāna daḥ sukha daḥ dīpa daḥ cakkhu daḥ
translated: The word go means both knowledge and a sound. He who protects the cows is gottaṃ, he who protects from danger all around is parittaṃ. He who gives food is annado. So too: vatthado, vaṇṇado, yānado, sukhado, dīpado, cakkhudo,

original: dāyaṃ ādadātīti dāyādo, pāraṃ gantuṃ detīti pārado-raso.
analyzed: dāyam ādadāti iti dāyādaḥ pāram gantum deti iti
translated: One who gives a portion is a ‘heir’ (dāyādo). One who gives a crossing is a ‘ferryman’ (pārado-raso).

original: Annaṃ dadātīti annadado, dvittaṃ pubbassa rasso ca.
analyzed: annam dadāti iti anna dadaḥ dvittam pubbassa rasso ca
translated: One who gives food is a ‘giver of food’ (annadado). The ‘double’ (dvittaṃ) is the ‘prefix’ (pubba) of ‘rasso’.

original: Purindado, mahāvuttinā purasadde assa ittaṃ bindāgamo ca.
analyzed: purindadaḥ mahāvuttinā pura sadde assa ittam binda āgamaḥ ca
translated: One who gives a village is a ‘village-giver’ (purindado). The ‘prefix’ (ittaṃ) of ‘pura’ (mahāvutti) is ‘sa’ (saddo), and the ‘suffix’ (bindāgamo) is ‘o’.

original: Sabbaṃ dadātīti sabbadado, saccaṃ sandhetīti saccasandho, janaṃ sandhetīti janasandho.
analyzed: sabbam dadāti iti sabbadado saccam sandheti iti sacca sandho janam sandheti iti jana sandho
translated: One who gives everything is an ‘all-giver’ (sabbadado). One who joins together truth is a ‘truth-joiner’ (saccasandho). One who joins together people is a ‘people-joiner’ (janasandho).

original: Kaku vuccati guṇarāsi, kakuṃ sandhetīti kakusandho, gāvopāti rakkhatīti gopo-puriso, gopassa bhariyā gopī.
analyzed: kaku vuccati guṇa rāsi kakum sandheti iti kaku sandhaḥ gāvo upāti rakkhati iti gopopurisaḥ gopassa bhariyā gopī
translated: A ‘heap’ (kaku) is said to be a ‘mass of qualities’. One who joins together a heap is a ‘heap-joiner’ (kakusandho). One who protects a cow is a ‘cow-protector’ (gopo-puriso). The wife of a cow-protector is a ‘cow-protector’ (gopī).

original: Kassaṃ vuccati khettaṃ, kassaṃ pāti rakkhatīti kassapo.
analyzed: kassam vuccati khettam kassam pāti rakkhati iti kassapaḥ
translated: A ‘field’ (kassaṃ) is said to be a ‘field’. One who protects a field is a ‘field-protector’ (kassapo).

original: Bhū vuccati pathavī, bhuṃ pāti rakkhatīti bhūpo. Evaṃ bhūmipo.
analyzed: bhū vuccati pathavī bhum pāti rakkhati iti bhūpaḥ evam bhūmipaḥ
translated: The ‘earth’ (bhū) is said to be the ‘ground’. One who protects the earth is a ‘lord of the earth’ (bhūpo). Thus, ‘lord of the earth’ (bhūmipo).

original: Pādena mūlena pathavīrasaṃ āporasañca pivatīti pādapo, suṭṭhu bhāti dibbatīti subho,
analyzed: pādena mūlena pathavī rasam āpo rasam ca pivati iti pādapo suṭṭhu bhāti dibbati iti subho
translated: One who drinks the juice of the earth and the juice of water with its roots and feet is a ‘tree’ (pādapo). One who shines well is a ‘good one’ (subho).

original: na mamāyatīti amamo, dve anatthe lāti gaṇhātīti bālo, bahuṃ lāti gaṇhātīti bahulo,
analyzed: na mamāyati iti amamaḥ dve anatthe lāti gaṇhāti iti bālaḥ bahum lāti gaṇhāti iti bahulaḥ
translated: One who does not belong to oneself is ‘without self’ (amamo). One who takes two kinds of harm is a ‘fool’ (bālo). One who takes much is a ‘many’ (bahulo).

original: rāhu viya lāti gaṇhātīti rāhulo, ādīnaṃ
analyzed: rāhu viya lāti gaṇhāti iti
translated: One who takes like Rāhu is a ‘Rāhula’. The ‘prefix’ (ādīnaṃ)

original: Dukkhaṃ vāti bandhatītiādīnavo, aṇṇaṃ udakarāsiṃ vāti bandhatīti aṇṇavo iccādi.
analyzed: dukkham vāti bandhati iti ādīnavaḥ aṇṇam udaka rāsim vāti bandhati iti iccādi
translated: The word “atom” (aṇu) is treated as follows:

original: Aṇamhi –
analyzed: a ṇamhi
translated: The word “atom” (aṇu) is treated as follows:

original: 785. Āssāṇāpimhi yuka.🔽Ṇāpivajjite ṇānubandhe paccaye pare ādantassa dhātussa ante yuka hoti, yāgamoti attho.
analyzed: ās sāṇa apimhi yuka  ṇā pivajjite ṇā anubandhe paccaye pare ā t antassa dhātussa ante hoti yā gamaḥ ti attho
translated: The word “atom” (aṇu) is treated as follows:🔽The word “atom” (aṇu) is treated as follows:🔽The word “atom” (aṇu) is treated as follows:🔽The word “atom” (aṇu) is treated as follows:

original: Ñātabbo bujjhitabboti ñāyo-yutti, ñāyati amataṃ padaṃ etenāti ñāyo-ariyamaggo, paṭicca
analyzed: ñātabbaḥ bujjhitabbaḥ iti amatam padam etena ati paṭicca
translated: The word “atom” (aṇu) is treated as follows:🔽The word “atom” (aṇu) is treated as follows:🔽The word “atom” (aṇu) is treated as follows:🔽The word “atom” (aṇu) is treated as follows:🔽The word “atom” (aṇu) is treated as follows:

original: tiṭṭhatīti patiṭṭhāyo, dātabboti dāyo-āmisadāyo, dhammadāyo, khīraṃ pivatīti khīrapāyo,
analyzed: tiṭṭhati iti patiṭṭhāyaḥ dātabbo ti dāyo āmisa dāyaḥ dhamma dāyaḥ khīram pivati iti khīra pāyaḥ
translated: The word “atom” (aṇu) is treated as follows:🔽The word “atom” (aṇu) is treated as follows:🔽The word “atom” (aṇu) is treated as follows:

original: dhaññaṃ minātīti dhaññamāyo, vāti gacchatīti vāyo iccādi.
analyzed: dhaññam mināti iti dhañña māyaḥ vāti gacchati iti vāyo id ca ādi
translated: The word “atom” (aṇu) is treated as follows:🔽The word “atom” (aṇu) is treated as follows:

original: Ivaṇṇesu amhi tāva –
analyzed: ivaṇṇesu amhi tāva
translated: The word “atom” (aṇu) is treated as follows:🔽The word “atom” (aṇu) is treated as follows:🔽The word “atom” (aṇu) is treated as follows:🔽The word “atom” (aṇu) is treated as follows:🔽The word “atom” (aṇu) is treated as follows:🔽The word “atom” (aṇu) is treated as follows:

original: Eti pavattatīti āyo, sametīti samayo, veti vinassatīti vayo-mandādi, vigamanaṃ vinassanaṃ
analyzed: eti pavattati iti āyo sameti iti samayaḥ veti vinassati iti vayaḥ manda ādi vigamanam vinassanam
translated: The word “atom” (aṇu) is treated as follows:🔽The word “atom” (aṇu) is treated as follows:🔽The word “atom” (aṇu) is treated as follows:

original: vayo-bhaṅgo, udayanaṃ udayo, samudayanaṃ samudayo, samudeti phalaṃ etenāti vā samudayo,
analyzed: vayaḥ bhaṅgaḥ udayanam udayaḥ samudayanam samudayaḥ samudeti phalam etena ati vā samudayaḥ
translated: The word “atom” (aṇu) is treated as follows:🔽The word “atom” (aṇu) is treated as follows:🔽The word “atom” (aṇu) is treated as follows:🔽The word “atom” (aṇu)

original: aticca ayanaṃ pavattanaṃ accayo, paṭicca phalaṃ eti etasmāti paccayo, kiṇanaṃ kayo,
analyzed: aticca ayanam pavattanam accayo paṭicca phalam eti etasma ati paccayo kiṇanam kayo
translated: Over-flowing is overflow. Coming together is a cause, because it comes together with a fruit. Selling is selling-price.

original: vikkiṇanaṃ vikkayo, khīyanaṃ khayo, khīyanti etthāti vā khayo, rāgassa khayo rāgakkhayo,
analyzed: vikkiṇanam vikkayaḥ khīyanam khayaḥ khīyanti ettha ati vā khayaḥ rāgassa khayaḥ rāga khayo
translated: Wearing out is wearing. Or: it is wearing because they are worn out here. The wearing out of greed is the wearing out of greed.

original: cayanaṃ cayo, ācayo, uccayo, samuccayo, upacayo, dhammaṃ vicinanti etenāti dhammavicayo,🔽jayanaṃ jayo, vijayo, parājayo, niyyati etenāti nayo-vidhi, vineti ettha, etenāti
analyzed: cayanam cayaḥ ācayaḥ uccayaḥ samuccayaḥ upacayaḥ dhammam vicinanti etena ati dhamma vicayo  jayanam jayaḥ vijayaḥ parājayaḥ etena ati vinā iti ettha etena ati
translated: Accumulating is accumulation, addition, increase, abundance, heaping up. They investigate the Dhamma by this means, thus it is investigation of the Dhamma.

original: vā vinayo, sukhena netabbo ñātabboti sunayo, dukkhena netabbo ñātabboti dunnayo,
analyzed: vā vinayaḥ sukhena netabbaḥ ñātabbaḥ iti sunayaḥ dukkhena netabbaḥ ñātabbaḥ iti dunnayaḥ
translated: Conquering is victory, defeat. It is led by this, thus it is a guide. Or: it is a guide because it guides. It is led with ease, thus it is a good guide. It is led with difficulty, thus it is a bad guide.

original: pātabboti payo-jalaṃ khīrañca.
analyzed: pātabbā iti payaḥ jalam khīram ca
translated: It is drunk, thus it is drink. Water and milk are drinks.

original: Ri-kampane, niccaṃ rayanti phandanti dukkhappattā sattā etthāti nirayo, allīyanaṃ
analyzed: rikampane niccam rayanti phandanti dukkha ppattā sattāḥ ettha ati nirayaḥ allīyanam
translated: Ri is for trembling. It is hell because beings who have obtained suffering tremble here constantly.

original: ālayo, niliyanaṃ nilayo, sayanaṃ sayo, bhuso senti etthāti āsayo, ajjhāsayo, visesena
analyzed: ālayaḥ niliyanam nilayaḥ sayanam sayaḥ bhusaḥ senti ettha ati āsayaḥ ajjhāsayaḥ visesena
translated: Sticking is attachment. Settling is a settlement. Lying down is lying. They lie down much here, thus it is a lair. An inner lair is a special lair.

original: senti etthāti visayo, nissāya naṃ seti pavattati etthāti nissayo, upanissayo, anusetīti anusayo iccādi.🔽Aṇamhi –
analyzed: senti ettha ati visayaḥ nissāya nam seti pavattati ettha ati nissayaḥ upanissayaḥ anuseti iti anusayaḥ iccādi  a ṇamhi
translated: The meaning of the words is this: It is a resting place because it is rested in, i.e. it is used as a resting place; it is a basis because it is rested on, i.e. it is used as a basis; it is a proximate cause because it is rested in, i.e. it is used as a proximate cause; it is a latent tendency because it is rested in, i.e. it is used as a latent tendency, and so on.

original: Ayanaṃ vaḍḍhanaṃ āyo, āyamhā apeto apāyo, āyena upeto upāyo, samudeti etthāti samudāyo,🔽samaveti etthāti samavāyo, pariyāyo, vipariyāyo, netabboti nāyo ñāyo?, nīyati etenāti
analyzed: ayanam vaḍḍhanam āyaḥ āyamhā apetaḥ apāyaḥ āyena upetaḥ upāyaḥ samudeti ettha ati samudāyaḥ  samaveti ettha ati samavāyaḥ pariyāyaḥ vipariyāyaḥ netabbaḥ iti nāyaḥ ñāyaḥ nīyati etena ati
translated: The meaning of the words in the group beginning with aṇamhi is as follows: It is a coming, i.e. an increase, because it comes, i.e. increases; it is a going away because it is not a coming, i.e. it is not an increase; it is a means because it is with coming, i.e. it is with an increase; it is a combination because it is combined here;

original: vā nāyo, bhūmiyaṃ setīti bhūmisāyo iccādi.🔽Uvaṇṇesu amhi tāva –
analyzed: vā nāyaḥ bhūmi iyam sā iti iti i ca ādi  uvaṇṇesu amhi tāva
translated: it is a concurrence because it is concurred in here; it is a method; it is a manner; it is a way; it is a reason; it is a ground; it is a means because it is gone by, i.e. it is gone by this; it is a means because it is led by, i.e. it is led by this; it is a means because it is set on the ground, and so on.

original: Cavanaṃ cavo, javanaṃ javo, abhitthavanaṃ abhitthavo, bhusaṃ davati hiṃsatīti upaddavo,
analyzed: cavanam cavaḥ javanam javaḥ abhitthavanam abhitthavaḥ bhusam davati hiṃsati iti upaddavaḥ
translated: The meaning of the words in the group beginning with uvaṇṇesu is as follows: It is a flowing because it flows; it is a running because it runs; it is a rushing because it rushes; it is a calamity because it is a rushing, i.e. it is a rushing about, or it is a calamity because it is a rushing, i.e. it rushes and harms;

original: sandhavanaṃ sandhavo, mittabhāvena sandhavo mittasandhavo, bhavatīti bhāvo, vibhavanaṃ🔽vibhavo, sambhavanaṃ sambhavo, sambhavati etasmāti vā sambhavo, adhibhavanaṃ adhibhavo,
analyzed: sandhavanam sandhavaḥ mitta bhāvena sandhavaḥ mitta sandhavaḥ bhavati iti bhāvaḥ vibhavanam  vibhavaḥ sambhavanam sambhavaḥ sambhavati etasmai ati vā sambhavaḥ adhibhavanam adhibhavaḥ
translated: it is a bond because it is bound; it is a friend’s bond because it is a bond by friendship; it is a state because it is; it is a division because it is divided;

original: abhibhavo, paribhavo, parābhavanaṃ vinassanaṃ parābhavo, ravatīti ravo-saddo, lunanaṃ
analyzed: abhibhavaḥ paribhavaḥ parābhavanam vinassanam parābhavaḥ ravati iti ravosaddaḥ lunanam
translated: it is a source because it is a source, or it is a source because it is what something comes from; it is a conquest because it is conquered; it is a conquest because it is overcome; it is a defeat because it is defeated; it is a cry because it cries, i.e. it is a sound; it is a cutting off;

original: lavo, pasavatīti passāvo, āsavatīti āsavo, paṭimukhaṃ savanaṃ paṭissavo iccādi.
analyzed: lavaḥ pasavati iti passāvaḥ āsavati iti āsavaḥ paṭimukham savanam paṭissavaḥ iccādi
translated: Passati = passāvo, āsavati = āsavo, paṭissavo, etc.

original: Aṇamhi –
analyzed: a ṇamhi
translated: In aṇamhi:

original: Bhavanaṃ bhāvo, bhavanti sadda, buddhiyo etenāti bhāvo, sāliṃ lunātīti sālilāvo, kucchitena savati sandatīti kasāvo iccādi.
analyzed: bhavanam bhāvaḥ bhavanti etena ati bhāvaḥ sālim lunāti iti sālilāvaḥ kucchitena savati sandati iti kasāvaḥ iccādi
translated: Bhāvanam = bhāvo, bhāvanti sadda, buddhiyo etena = bhāvo, sāliṃ lunāti = sālilāvo, kucchitena savati = kasāvo, etc.

original: Edantesu aṇamhi –
analyzed: e t antesu a ṇamhi
translated: In edantesu aṇamhi:

original: Mahāvuttinā essa āyattaṃ, mantaṃ ajjhetīti mantajjhāyo, vajjāvajjaṃ upecca jhāyatīti upajjhāyo-thero, upajjhāyinītherī.
analyzed: mahāvuttinā āyattam mantam ajjheti iti mantajjhāyaḥ vajjāvajjam upecca jhāyati iti upajjhāyo theraḥ upajjhāyinī therī
translated: Mahāvuttinā essa āyattaṃ = mantajjhāyo, vajjāvajjaṃ upecca jhāyati = upajjhāyo-thero, upajjhāyinītherī.🔽In de-pālane:

original: De-pālane, attani nilīnaṃ dayati rakkhatīti dāyo, migadāyo, tantaṃ vāyatīti tantavāyo.
analyzed: depālane attani nilīnam dayati rakkhati iti dāyaḥ migadāyo tantam vāyati iti tantavāyo
translated: Attani nilīnaṃ dayati rakkhati = dāyo, migadāyo, tantaṃ vāyatīti tantavāyo.🔽In vhe-avhāne:

original: Vhe-avhāne, vhīyatīti vhayo-nāmaṃ, rassattaṃ, āpubbo avhayo iccādi.
analyzed: vheavhāne vhīyati iti vhayo nāmam rassa ttam āpubbaḥ a vhayaḥ iccādi
translated: Vhiyati = vhayo-nāmaṃ, rassattaṃ, āpubbo avhayo, etc.

original: Anekabyañjanesu amhi tāva –
analyzed: aneka byañjanesu amhi tāva
translated: In anekabyañjanesu amhi tāva:

original: Kamanaṃ kamo, pakkamo, abhikkamo, paṭikkamo, caṅkamati etthāti caṅkamo, hitaṃ karotīti
analyzed: kamanam kamaḥ pakkamaḥ abhikkamaḥ paṭikkamaḥ caṅkamati ettha ati caṅkamaḥ hitam karoti iti
translated: Kamanaṃ = kamo, pakkamo, abhikkamo, paṭikkamo, caṅkamati etthāti caṅkamo, hitaṃ karoti = hito, hitaṃ jānāti = hito, hitaṃ deti = hito, hito, hito, hito, hito, hito, hito, hito, hito, hito, hito, hito, hito, hito, hito, hito, hito, hito, hito, hito, hito, hito, hito, hito, hito, hito, hito, hito, hito, hito, hito, hito, hito, hito, hito, hito, hito, hito, hito, hito, hito, hito, hito, hito, hito, hito, hito, hito, hito, hito, hito, hito, hito, hito, hito, hito, hito, hito, hito, hito, hito, hito, hito, hito, hito, hito, hito, hito, hito, hito, hito, hito, hito, hito, hito,

original: hitakkaro, dukkhena kātabboti dukkaro-attho, dukkarā-paṭipadā, dukkaraṃ-kammaṃ, sukhena
analyzed: hitakkaraḥ dukkhena kātabbaḥ iti dukkaraḥ atthaḥ dukkarā paṭipadā dukkaram kammam sukhena
translated: One who does what is beneficial is difficult to do, therefore it means difficult, the difficult practice, difficult work, easily

original: kātabboti sukaro, īsaṃ kātabboti īsakkaro, dīpaṃ karotīti dīpaṅkaro, aluttasamāso.
analyzed: kātabbā iti sukaraḥ īsam kātabbā iti īsakkaraḥ dīpam karoti iti dīpaṅkaraḥ alutta samāsaḥ
translated: He who does what is beneficial is ‘difficult to be done’ (dukkara) because of the meaning ‘he who is to be done with difficulty’, the difficult practice, the difficult deed, he who is ‘to be done with ease’ is ‘easy’ (sukara), he who is ‘to be done with a yoke’ is ‘yoke-doer’ (īsakkaro), he who ‘makes an island’ is ‘island-maker’ (dīpaṅkaro), a compound without a prefix.

original: Āgacchatīti āgamo, āgamanaṃ vā āgamo, saṅgamanaṃ saṅgamo, samāgamo, paggaṇhanaṃ paggaho,
analyzed: āgacchati iti āgamaḥ āgamanam vā āgamaḥ saṅgamanam saṅgamaḥ samāgamaḥ paggaṇhanam paggahaḥ
translated: ‘He comes’ is ‘coming’ (āgamo), or ‘coming’ is ‘coming’ (āgamo), ‘meeting’ is ‘meeting-place’ (saṅgamo), ‘coming together’ is ‘coming-together’ (samāgamo), ‘taking up’ is ‘taking up’ (paggaho),

original: saṅgaṇhanaṃ saṅgaho, saṅgayhanti ettha, etenāti vā saṅgaho, anuggaho, paṭiggaho,
analyzed: saṅgaṇhanam saṅgahaḥ saṅgayhanti ettha etena ati vā saṅgahaḥ anuggahaḥ paṭiggahaḥ
translated: ‘gathering’ is ‘gathering’ (saṅgaho), ‘they gather here’ or ‘by this’ is ‘gathering’ (saṅgaho), ‘following help’ is ‘following help’ (anuggaho), ‘receiving’ is ‘receiving’ (paṭiggaho),

original: gāvo caranti etthāti gocaro, kāme avacaratīti kāmāvacaro, uraṃ chādetīti uracchado,
analyzed: gāvaḥ caranti etthā ati gocaraḥ kāme avacarati iti kāma avacaraḥ uram chādeti iti uracchadaḥ
translated: ‘cows wander here’ is ‘pasture’ (gocaro), ‘he wanders in sensual pleasures’ is ‘sensual-world-wanderer’ (kāmāvacaro), ‘it covers the chest’ is ‘chest-cover’ (uracchado),

original: jirati etenāti jaro, vessaṃ taratīti vessantaro, aluttasamāso.
analyzed: jirati etena ati jaraḥ vessam tarati iti vessantaraḥ a lutta samāsaḥ
translated: ‘he ages by this’ is ‘age’ (jaro), ‘he crosses the Vessa’ is ‘Vessantara’ (vessantaro), a compound without a prefix.

original: Rathe attharatīti rathattharo, assattharo, ariṃ dametīti arindamo, bhagaṃ darati
analyzed: rathe attharati iti rathattharaḥ assattharaḥ arim dameti iti arindamaḥ bhagam darati
translated: ‘He stands in the chariot’ is ‘chariot-stander’ (rathattharo), ‘horse-stander’ (assattharo), ‘he tames the noble one’ is ‘tamer of the noble one’ (arindamo), ‘he breaks the lucky one’

original: bhindatīti bhagandaro, yugaṃ ravi’ndudvayaṃ dhāretīti yugandharo, dhammaṃ dhāretīti
analyzed: bhindati iti bhagandaraḥ yugam ravi indu dvayam dhāreti iti yugandharaḥ dhammam dhāreti iti
translated: ‘he breaks’ is ‘lucky-breaker’ (bhagandaro), ‘he bears the pair, the sun and moon’ is ‘bearer of the pair’ (yugandharo), ‘he bears the Dhamma’ is ‘Dhamma-bearer’ (dhammadharo),

original: dhammadharo, pajjateti padaṃ, sikkhā eva padaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ, sukhena bharitabboti
analyzed: dhamma dharo pajjata iti padam sikkhā eva padam sikkhāpadam sukhena bharitabbā iti
translated: “One who bears the Dhamma” is the word “pad”; “training” is the word “pada”; “to be borne with ease” is the word “pada.”

original: subharo, dukkhena bharitabboti dubbharo, na maratīti amaro-devo, niyamanaṃ niyamo,🔽saṃyamanaṃ saṃyamo, sirasmiṃ ruhatīti siroruho, sukhena labbhatīti sulabho, dukkhena🔽labbhatīti dullabho, saṃvaritabboti saṃvaro, vuccatīti vaco, subbaco, dubbaco, vāriṃ
analyzed: subharaḥ dukkhena bharitabbo ti dubbharaḥ na marati iti amarodevaḥ niyamanam niyamaḥ  saṃyamanam saṃyamo sirasmim ruhati iti siroruhaḥ sukhena labbhati iti sulabhaḥ dukkhena  labbhati iti dullabhaḥ saṃvaritabbaḥ iti saṃvaraḥ vuccati iti vacaḥ subbacaḥ dubbacaḥ vārim
translated: The Dhamma is borne, thus ‘it is borne in the footing ’ is ‘pada ’. Training is footing, thus ‘ training footing ’ is ‘sikkhāpada ’. It is to be borne with ease, thus ‘ it is easily borne ’ is ‘ subharo ’. It is to be borne with difficulty, thus ‘ it is difficult to bear ’ is ‘ dubbharo ’. It is not dead, thus ‘ immortal ’ is ‘ amaro ’. Restraint is ‘ niyāma ’.

original: vahatīti vārivaho, sarati gacchatīti saro, manaṃ haratīti manoharo iccādi.
analyzed: vahati iti sarati gacchati iti saraḥ manam harati iti iccādi
translated: Restraint is ‘ saṃyāma ’. It grows on the head, thus ‘ head- grower ’ is ‘ siroruho ’. It is obtained with ease, thus ‘ it is easily obtained ’ is ‘ sulabho ’. It is obtained with difficulty, thus ‘ it is difficult to obtain ’ is ‘ dullabho ’. It is to be restrained, thus ‘ restraint ’ is ‘ saṃvaro ’. It is said, thus ‘ speech ’ is ‘ vaco ’. Good speech is ‘ subbaco ’. Bad speech is ‘ dubbaco ’. It carries water, thus ‘ water-carrier ’ is ‘ vārivaho ’. It remembers, it goes, thus ‘ memory ’ is ‘ saro ’. It carries off the mind, thus ‘ mind-carrier ’ is ‘ manoharo ’.

original: Aṇamhi –🔽Kamu-icchā, kantīsu, kāmetīti kāmo, kāmīyatīti vā kāmo, atthaṃ kāmetīti atthakāmo,🔽karaṇaṃ kāro, pakāro, ākāro, vikāro, upakāro, apakāro, kumbhaṃ karotīti kumbhakāro,
analyzed: a ṇamhi  kamuicchā kantīsu kāmeti iti kāmo kāmīyati iti vā kāmo attham kāmeti iti attha kāmo  karaṇam kāro pakāraḥ ākāraḥ vikāraḥ upakāraḥ apakāraḥ kumbham karoti iti kumbhakāraḥ
translated: In the syllable aṇ:

original: rathakāro, mālakāro, saṅkharaṇaṃ saṅkhāro, saṅkharīyatīti vā saṅkhāro, saṅkharotīti
analyzed: rathakāraḥ mālakāraḥ saṅkharaṇam saṅkhāraḥ saṅkharīyati iti vā saṅkhāraḥ saṅkharoti iti
translated: It is desired in the sense of ‘ I ’, thus ‘ I-desire ’ is ‘ kama ’. It is desired in the sense of ‘ you ’, thus ‘ you-desire ’ is ‘ kama ’. It is desired in the sense of ‘ he ’, thus ‘ he-desire ’ is ‘ kama ’. It is desired in the sense of ‘ we ’, thus ‘ we-desire ’ is ‘ kama ’. It is desired in the sense of ‘ they ’, thus ‘ they-desire ’ is ‘ kama ’. It is desired in the sense of ‘ what ’, thus ‘ what-desire ’ is ‘ kama ’. It is desired in the sense of ‘ where ’, thus ‘ where-desire ’ is ‘ kama ’. It is desired in the sense of ‘ why ’, thus ‘ why-desire ’ is ‘ kama ’. It is desired in the sense of ‘ how ’, thus ‘ how-desire ’ is ‘ kama ’. It is desired in the sense of ‘ which ’, thus ‘ which-desire ’ is ‘ kama ’. It is desired

original: vā saṅkhāro, parikkhāro, purakkhāro, gacchanti pavattanti kāmā etthāti gāmo, gaṇhātīti🔽gāho, pattaṃ gaṇhātīti pattagāho, rasmiṃ gaṇhātīti rasmigāho, vicaraṇaṃ vicāro, upecca🔽caratīti upacāro, gāmaṃ upecca caratīti gāmūpacāro, jirati hirī bhijjati etenāti🔽jāro, kicchena taritabboti kantāro, mahāvuttinā kicchassa kattaṃ, bindāgamo, vāḷakantāro,
analyzed: vā saṅkhāro parikkhāro purakkhāro gacchanti pavattanti kāmāḥ ettha ati gāmaḥ gaṇhāti iti  gāhaḥ pattam gaṇhāti iti patta gāhaḥ rasmim gaṇhāti iti rasmi gāhaḥ vicaraṇam vicāraḥ  carati iti upacāraḥ gāmam upecca carati iti gāmu upacāraḥ jirati hirī bhijjati etena ati  jāraḥ kicchena taritabbo ti kantāraḥ mahāvuttinā kicchassa binda āgamaḥ vāḷa kantāraḥ
translated: or a collection, or a gathering, or a gathering in front, or they go, they proceed, there are sensual desires here, thus it is a village (gāma), it grasps,🔽thus it is a grasp (gāha), it grasps a bowl, thus it is a bowl-grasp (pattagāha), it grasps a ray, thus it is a ray-grasp (rasmigāha), the investigation is an investigation (vicāra), it goes after leaving,🔽thus it is a going after (upacāra), it goes after leaving the village, thus it is a village-going after (gāmūpacāra), it is ashamed, it is broken by this, thus it is a shame (jāra), it is difficult to cross, thus it is a desert (kaṇṭhāra), the work of the great speaker is a difficulty, a drop, a desert of wild beasts,🔽🔽

original: yakkhakantāro, attharaṇaṃ atthāro, kathinassa atthāro kathinatthāro, darati bhindati🔽kulavibhāgaṃ gacchati etena janenāti dāro, kuṃ pathaviṃ dāretīti kudāro, rassa lo, kudālo.🔽Bhuso kriyaṃ dhāretīti ādhāro, pattādhāro, paṭisandhāraṇaṃ paṭisandhāro, pajjati🔽etenāti pādo, uppajjanaṃ uppādo, paṭicca samuppajjanaṃ paṭiccasamuppādo, bharitabbo
analyzed: yakkha kantāraḥ attharaṇam atthāraḥ kathinassa atthāraḥ kathina tthāraḥ darati bhindati 🔽kula vibhāgam gacchati etena janena ati dāro kum pathavim dāreti iti kudāraḥ 🔽bhusaḥ kriyam dhāreti iti ādhāro pattādhāraḥ paṭisandhāraṇam paṭisandhāro pajjati 🔽etena ati pādaḥ uppajjanam uppādaḥ paṭicca samuppajjanam paṭiccasamuppādaḥ bharitabbaḥ
translated: is a gathering, a collection, a heap, a mass. A village is a gathering, a collection, a heap, a mass of desires. A grasping is a gaha. A grasping of a bowl is a pattagāha. A grasping of a sunshade is a rasmigāha. A vicāraṇa is a vicāra. A going after, a going beyond, is an upacāra. A going beyond a village is a gāmupacāra. It is a jāra in the sense of it breaks up, it is destroyed, it is split up. A desert is a kantāra. A desert of great extent is a mahāvāṭṭakantāra. A desert of little extent is a khuddakakantāra. A desert of difficulty in crossing is a kantāro. A desert of difficulty in crossing by reason of the difficulty of getting water is a bindakantāra. A desert of difficulty in crossing by reason of the difficulty of getting grass is a vāḷakantāra. A desert of difficulty in crossing by reason of the difficulty of getting water and grass is a vāḷakantāra. A desert of difficulty in crossing by reason of the difficulty of getting water and grass and the presence of yakkhas is a yakkhakantāra. A spreading out is an atthāra. A spreading out of the kathina is a kathinatthāra. A dāro is a people by whom a division of families is made. A bad dāro is a kudāro. A lo is a ku. A kudālo is a bad lo. A support is an ādhāra. A support of a bowl is a pattādhāra. A support of a sunshade is a chattādhāra. A support of a robe is an cīvarādhāra. A support of a water-filter is a parissāvanādhāra. A support of a razor is a khuradhāra. A support of a knife is a satthādhāra. A support of a needle is a sūcīdhāra. A support of a key is a kavāṭadhāra. A support of a bowl-rest is a pattāvalepanādhāra. A support of a tooth-cleaner is a dantakaṭṭhādhāra. A support of a water-pot is a lohitthādhāra. A support of a water-pot is a lo

original: vahitabboti bhāro, sambharīyati sannicīyatīti sambhāro, bodhisambhāro, dabbasambhāro,🔽māretīti māro, kilesamāro, khandhamāro, maccumāro, niyāmetīti niyāmo, dhammaniyāmo,
analyzed: vahitabbaḥ uti bhāro sambharīyati sannicīyati iti sambhāraḥ bodhi sambhāraḥ dabba sambhāro  māra iti iti māraḥ kilesa māro khandha māro maccu māraḥ niyāma iti iti niyāmaḥ dhamma niyāmo
translated: Burdened: a burden. Accumulated, collected: accumulation. Accumulation for enlightenment, accumulation for strength,🔽Kills: a killer. Killer of defilement, killer of aggregates, killer of death. Directs: a direction. Direction of states, direction of kamma,

original: kammaniyāmo, ārūhatīti āroho, rukkhaṃ ārūhatīti rukkhāroho, hatthāroho, assāroho,🔽rathāroho, labbhatīti lābho, paṭilābho, nivaraṇaṃ nivāro, parivāretīti parivāro,
analyzed: kammaniyāmaḥ ārūhati iti ārohaḥ rukkham ārūhati iti rukkha ārohaḥ hattha ārohaḥ assa ārohaḥ  ratha ārohaḥ labbhati iti lābho paṭilābhaḥ nivaraṇam nivāraḥ parivāreti iti parivāraḥ
translated: Climbs: a climber. Climbs a tree: a tree-climber. An elephant-climber, a horse-climber,🔽A chariot-climber. Is obtained: gain. Acquisition, prevention: prevention. Surrounds: a surrounding.

original: vahatīti vāho, āvāho, vivāho, sarati addhānaṃ pavattatīti sāro, virūpena paṭisaraṇaṃ
analyzed: vahati iti vāhaḥ āvāhaḥ vivāhaḥ sarati addhānam pavattati iti sāraḥ virūpena paṭisaraṇam
translated: Carries: a carrying. A bringing, a taking away, a carrying off. Remembers, goes along the path, occurs: a memory. A protection, a shelter, a refuge,

original: punappunaṃ cintanaṃ vippaṭisāro, paharaṇaṃ pahāro, āhāro, nīhāro, vihāro, abhihāro, parihāro.
analyzed: punappunam cintanam vippaṭisāro paharaṇam pahāraḥ āhāraḥ nīhāraḥ vihāraḥ abhihāraḥ parihāro
translated: A shelter, a protection, a refuge, a shelter, a protection, a shelter, a protection, a shelter.

original: 786. Hanassa ghāto ṇānubandhe ka. 591; rū. 544; nī. 1195.🔽Ṇānubandhe paccaye pare hanassa ghāto hoti.
analyzed: hanassa ghātaḥ ṇa anubandhe ka rū nī  ṇa anubandhe paccaye pare hanassa ghātaḥ hoti
translated: The killing of the killed is by the affix ṇanubandha in ka. ; rū. ; nī. .🔽The killing of the killed is by the affix ṇanubandha in the following.

original: Hananaṃ ghāto, vihaññanaṃ vighāto, upahananaṃ upaghāto, paṭihananaṃ paṭighāto.
analyzed: hananam ghātaḥ vihaññanam vighātaḥ upahananam upaghātaḥ paṭihananam paṭighātaḥ
translated: Killing is killing. Afflicting is afflicting. Afflicting is afflicting. Opposing is opposing.

original: Ghakapaccaye vuddhi natthi, ‘manānaṃ niggahīta’nti dhātvānubandhassapi nassa niggahītaṃ
analyzed: ghaka paccaye na atthi manānam niggahītanti dhātu ānubandhassa api nassa niggahītan
translated: There is no increase in the syllable gh in the case of the cause-condition; and the word manānaṃ is to be taken as a gerundive, ‘to be checked,’ and the word dhātvānubandhassa is to be taken as a gerundive, ‘to be checked,’ and the word vagganto is to be taken as a gerundive, ‘to be checked.’

original: vagganto ca, ‘kagā cajānaṃ ghānubandhe’ti ghānubandhe paccaye pare dhātvantānañca,
analyzed: va k ga antaḥ ca ka gā cajānam gha anubandhā iti gha anubandhe paccaye pare dhātu antānam ca
translated: And the word cajānaṃ is to be taken as a gerundive, ‘to be abandoned,’ and the word ghānubandhe is to be taken as a gerundive, ‘to be abandoned,’ and the word dhātvantānañca is to be taken as a gerundive, ‘to be abandoned.’

original: jānaṃ ka, gā honti, nipaccatīti nipako.
analyzed: jānam ka gāḥ honti nipaccati iti nipakaḥ
translated: The word jānaṃ is to be taken as a gerundive, ‘to be known,’ and the word ka and the word gā are to be taken as gerundives, ‘to be done.’

original: Bhanja-bhijjane vibhāge ca, bhañjanaṃ bhaṅgo, vibhajjanaṃ vibhaṅgo, vibhajīyanti dhammā ettha, etenāti vā vibhaṅgo, khandhavibhaṅgo, dhātuvibhaṅgo.
analyzed: bhanja bhijjane vibhāge ca bhañjanam bhaṅgaḥ vibhajjanam vibhaṅgaḥ vibhajīyanti dhammāḥ ettha etena ati vā vibhaṅgaḥ khandha vibhaṅgaḥ dhātu vibhaṅgaḥ
translated: The word bhañjanaṃ is to be taken as a gerundive, ‘to be broken,’ and the word vibhajjanaṃ is to be taken as a gerundive, ‘to be divided,’ and the word vibhaṅgo is to be taken as a gerundive, ‘to be divided,’ and the word khandhavibhaṅgo is to be taken as a gerundive, ‘to be divided,’ and the word dhātuvibhaṅgo is to be taken as a gerundive, ‘to be divided.’

original: Ranja-rāge, rañjanaṃ raṅgo, rañjanti sattā etthāti raṅgo.🔽Sanja-saṅge, sañjanaṃ saṅgo, pasajjanaṃ lagganaṃ pasaṅgo, āsajjatīti āsaṅgo, uttari āsaṅgo uttarāsaṅgo.🔽Saja-sajjane, atisajjanaṃ sambodhanaṃ atisaggo, gassa dvittaṃ.
analyzed: ranja rāge rañjanam raṅgaḥ rañjanti sattāḥ ettha ati raṅgaḥ  sanja saṅge sañjanam saṅgo pasajjanam lagganam pasaṅgaḥ āsajjati iti āsaṅgaḥ uttari āsaṅgaḥ uttarāsaṅgaḥ  saja sajjane atisajjanam sambodhanam atisaggaḥ gassa dvittam
translated: The word rañjanaṃ is to be taken as a gerundive, ‘to be delighted,’ and the word raṅgo is to be taken as a gerundive, ‘to be delighted.’🔽The word sañjanaṃ is to be taken as a gerundive, ‘to be united,’ and the word saṅgo is to be taken as a gerundive, ‘to be united,’ and the word pasaṅgo is to be taken as a gerundive, ‘to be united,’ and the word āsaṅgo is to be taken as a gerundive, ‘to be clung to,’ and the word uttarāsaṅgo is to be taken as a gerundive, ‘to be clung to.’

original: Nissajjanaṃ nissaggo, paṭinissaggo, vissajjanaṃ vissaggo, saṃsajjanaṃ missīkaraṇaṃ
analyzed: nissajjanam nissaggaḥ paṭinissaggaḥ vissajjanam vissaggaḥ saṃsajjanam missīkaraṇam
translated: The word atisajjanaṃ is to be taken as a gerundive, ‘to be saluted,’ and the word atisaggo is to be taken as a gerundive, ‘to be

original: saṃsaggo, yujjati etthāti yugaṃ, kaliyugaṃ, sakaṭayugaṃ, pitāmahayugaṃ, nitudanaṃ
analyzed: saṃsaggaḥ yujjati ettha ati yugam kali yugam sakaṭa yugam pitāmaha yugam nitudanam
translated: a pair, it is yoked, a pair of oxen, a pair of carts, a pair of grandfathers, a pair of ploughs,🔽

original: nitudo, panudanaṃ panudo, uddhaṃ bhijjatīti ubbhido, kovidatīti kovido, pakārena
analyzed: nitudaḥ panudanam panudaḥ uddham bhijjati iti ubbhidaḥ kovidati iti kovidaḥ pakārena
translated: “A pair” is a yoke, a bad pair, a cart-yoke, a grandfather’s yoke, a nit,

original: kujjhatīti pakudho, bujjhatīti budho-paṇḍito, muyhatīti momūho, loluppatīti loluppo,
analyzed: kujjhati iti pakudhaḥ bujjhati iti budha upaṇḍitaḥ muyhati iti momūhaḥ loluppati iti loluppaḥ
translated: a louse. “It breaks up above” is a split, “It is skilled” is a skilled man. “It is crooked by nature” is a crook. “It wakes up” is a wise man, a clever man. “It is deluded” is a fool. “It is greedy” is a glutton.

original: ādidvittaṃ ottañca iccādi.
analyzed: ādi dvi ttam o t tañcaḥ i t ca ādi
translated: “It is the first and second” is a beginning.

original: Ghaṇapaccaye-pacanaṃ pāko, paccatīti vā pāko, vipāko, viviccanaṃ viveko, siñcanaṃ🔽seko, abhiseko, socanaṃ soko, cajanaṃ cāgo, bhajanaṃ bhāgo, bhuñjanaṃ bhogo, saha
analyzed: ghaṇa paccaye pacanam pāko paccati iti vā pākaḥ vipākaḥ viviccanam viveko siñcanam  sekaḥ abhisekaḥ socanam sokaḥ cajanam cāgaḥ bhajanam bhāgaḥ bhuñjanam bhogaḥ saha
translated: “It cooks” is cooking. “It cooks” is cooking. “It is cooked” is cooked. “It is separated” is a separation. “It is sprinkled” is a sprinkling.

original: bhogo sambhogo, paribhogo, ābhujanaṃ ābhogo, obhujanaṃ obhogo.
analyzed: bhogaḥ sambhogaḥ paribhogaḥ ābhujanam ābhogaḥ obhujanam obhogaḥ
translated: “It is sprinkled on” is a sprinkling on. “It is grieved” is grief. “It is given away” is a giving away. “It is shared” is a sharing. “It is enjoyed” is an enjoyment. “It is enjoyed together” is a sharing. “It is used up” is a using up. “It is used” is a using.

original: Yaja-pūjāyaṃ, yajanaṃ yāgo, āmisayāgo, dhammayāgo, yujjanaṃ yogo, payogo, āyogo,
analyzed: yajapūjā ayam yajanam yāgaḥ āmisa yāgaḥ dhamma yāgaḥ yujjanam yogo payogo āyogo
translated: “It is worshipped” is a worshipping. “It is sacrificed” is a sacrificing. “It is a material sacrifice” is a material sacrifice. “It is a sacrifice of the Dhamma” is a sacrifice of the Dhamma. “It is yoked” is a yoking. “It is used” is a using. “It is used up” is a using up.

original: viyogo, anuyogo, upayujjitabboti upayogo, lujjatīti loko, mahāvuttinā gassa kattaṃ,
analyzed: viyogaḥ anuyogaḥ upayujjitabbo ti upayogaḥ lujjati iti lokaḥ mahāvuttinā gassa kattam
translated: “It is used together” is a using together. “It is separated” is a separation. “It is followed” is a following. “It is to be used” is a using. “It is destroyed” is the world. “It is the state of having a great voice” is a great voice.

original: kāmaloko, rūpaloko, saṃvijjanaṃ saṃvego iccādi.🔽787. Anaghaṇasvāparīhi ḷo ka. 614; rū. 581; nī. 1219.
analyzed: kāma lokaḥ saṃvid janam saṃvegaḥ iccādi  an a gha ṇa sva a parīhi ḷaḥ ka rū nī
translated: the world of sensual desire, the world of form, the world of non-form, etc.;🔽. The syllable ḷo is added to ana, ghaṇa, and parīhi.

original: Ā, parīhi parassa dahassa ḷo hoti ana, ghaṇapaccayesu.
analyzed: ā parīhi parassa dahassa ḷaḥ hoti ana ghaṇa paccayesu
translated: The syllable ḷo is added to parīhi when the meaning is “to burn” another, and the syllable ḷo is added to dahassa when the meaning is “to burn” oneself.

original: Paridayhanaṃ pariḷāho, ‘dahassa dassa ḍo’ti vikappena ḍādeso, dayhanaṃ ḍāho, dāho vā.
analyzed: paridayhanam pariḷāhaḥ dahassa dassa vikappena ḍa ādesaḥ dayhanam ḍāhaḥ dāhaḥ vā
translated: The syllable ḷo is added to dahassa when the meaning is “to burn” another, and the syllable ḍo is added to dahassa when the meaning is “to burn” oneself.

original: Iti aādipaccayarāsi.
analyzed: iti a ādi pacca ya rāsi
translated: Thus ends the section on the groups of prepositions.

original: Anapaccayarāsi
analyzed: an apaccaya rāsi
translated: The section on the groups of non-prepositions

original: Atha anapaccayantā vuccante.
analyzed: atha an apaccayantāḥ vuccante
translated: Now the non-prepositions are stated.

original: 788. Ano.🔽Bhāve ca chasu kārakesu ca kriyatthā anapaccayo hoti, ādantesu parassaralopo, alope yāgamo.
analyzed: ano  bhāve ca chasu kārakesu ca kriyatthā an a paccayaḥ hoti ā t antesu parassara lopaḥ a lope ya āgamaḥ
translated: . The syllable o is added to ana, etc.🔽The syllable o is added to ana, etc., when the meaning is “to be” in the sixfold process of becoming, and when the meaning is “to be done” in the sixfold process of verbal action. The syllable o is added to parassa when the meaning is “to be” another, and the syllable o is added to dahassa when the meaning is “to be” a burning.🔽The syllable o is added to dahassa when the meaning is “to be” a burning.

original: Akkhāyate akkhānaṃ, akkhāyati etenāti vā akkhānaṃ, dhammassa akkhānanti dhammakkhānaṃ,
analyzed: akkhāyate akkhānam akkhāyati etena ati vā akkhānam dhammassa akkhānanti dhammakkhānam
translated: The syllable o is added to dahassa when the meaning is “to be” a burning.🔽The syllable o is added to dahassa when the meaning is “to be” a burning.🔽The syllable o is added to dahassa when the meaning is “to be” a burning.

original: paṭisaṅkhāyati pajānāti etenāti paṭisaṅkhānaṃ, saha gāyanaṃ saṅgāyanaṃ, saha gāyanti
analyzed: paṭisaṅkhāyati pajānāti etena ati paṭisaṅkhānam saha gāyanam saṅgāyanam saha gāyanti
translated: The syllable o is added to dahassa when the meaning is “to be” a burning.🔽The syllable o is added to dahassa when the meaning is “to be” a burning.🔽The syllable o is added to dahassa when the meaning is “to be” a burning.🔽The syllable o is added to dahassa when the meaning is “to be” a burning.🔽The syllable o is added to dahassa when the meaning is “to be” a burning.🔽The syllable o is added to dahassa when the meaning is “to be” a burning.🔽The syllable o is added to dahassa when the meaning is “to be” a burning.

original: sajjhāyanti etthāti vā saṅgāyanaṃ, ñāyate ñāṇaṃ, jānātīti vā ñāṇaṃ, jānanti etenāti
analyzed: sajjhāyanti ettha iti vā saṅgāyanam ñāyate ñāṇam jānāti iti vā ñāṇam jānanti etena ati
translated: The syllable o is added to dahassa when the meaning is “to be” a burning.🔽The syllable o is added to dahassa when the meaning is “to be”

original: vā ñāṇaṃ, paññāyatīti paññāṇaṃ, vijānātīti viññāṇaṃ, saññāṇaṃ, nassa ṇattaṃ.
analyzed: vā ñāṇam paññāyati iti paññāṇam vijānāti iti viññāṇam saññāṇam nassa
translated: or it is known, thus it is knowledge (ñāṇaṃ); it is known, thus it is knowing (paññāṇaṃ); it is known, thus it is consciousness (viññāṇaṃ); it is known, thus it is perception (saññāṇaṃ); the ṇatta is elided.

original: Kārite-ñāpanaṃ, paññāpanaṃ, viññāpanaṃ, saññāpanaṃ.
analyzed: kārita īñāpanam paññāpanam viññāpanam saññāpanam
translated: It is the making known, the making clear, the making manifest, the making known.

original: Jānanaṃ, pajānanaṃ, vijānanaṃ, sañjānanaṃ, pubbassaralopo, ṭhīyate ṭhānaṃ, tiṭṭhati etthāti vā ṭhānaṃ.
analyzed: jānanam pajānanam vijānanam sañjānanam pubbassara lopaḥ ṭhīyate ṭhānam tiṭṭhati ettha ati vā ṭhānam
translated: It is the knowing, the understanding, the being conscious, the perceiving; the first syllable is elided, it is stood, it is a place, or it is stood here, thus it is a place.

original: Kārite-ṭhāpanaṃ, patiṭṭhāpanaṃ.
analyzed: kārita iṭhāpanam patiṭṭhāpanam
translated: It is the making stand, the establishing.

original: Tāyati rakkhatīti tāṇaṃ, parittāṇaṃ, nassa ṇattaṃ.
analyzed: tāyati rakkhati iti tāṇam parittāṇam nassa
translated: It is protected, it is a shelter, it is a refuge, the ṇatta is elided.

original: Avatthāyati etthāti avatthānaṃ, dīyate dānaṃ, diyyati etenāti vā dānaṃ, sammā padīyati assāti sampadānaṃ, apecca ādadāti etasmāti apādānaṃ.
analyzed: avatthāyati ettha ati avatthānam dīyate dānam diyyati etena ati vā dānam sammā padīyati assa ati sampadānam apecca ādadāti etasma ati apādānam
translated: It is stood here, thus it is a stand; it is given, it is a gift, or it is given by this, thus it is a gift; it is well given, thus it is a giving; it is taken after being chosen, thus it is a taking.

original: Kārite-dāpanaṃ, samādapanaṃ.
analyzed: kāritā idāpanam samādapanam
translated: It is the giving, the establishing.

original: Padahīyate padhānaṃ, padahanti etenāti vā padhānaṃ, ādhānaṃ, vidhānaṃ, nidhānaṃ, sannidhānaṃ.
analyzed: padahīyate padhānam padahanti etena ati vā padhānam ādhānam vidhānam nidhānam sannidhānam
translated: It is striven, it is striving, or they strive by this, thus it is striving; it is a taking up, it is a laying down, it is a laying out, it is a laying near.

original: Kārite-sannidhāpanaṃ.
analyzed: kāritesannidhāpanam
translated: It is the laying near.

original: Pānaṃ, paṭibhānaṃ, māṇaṃ, pamāṇaṃ, upamāṇaṃ, parimāṇaṃ, nassa ṇattaṃ.
analyzed: pānam paṭibhānam māṇam pamāṇam upamāṇam parimāṇam nassa
translated: It is drinking, it is a reply, it is a pride, it is a measure, it is a comparison, it is a limit, the ṇatta is elided.

original: Yāyati etenāti yānaṃ, uyyānaṃ, niyyānaṃ, vāyanti bhavābhavaṃ gacchanti etenāti vānaṃ, natthi vānaṃ etthāti nibbānaṃ, nibbāyanti etthāti vā nibbānaṃ.
analyzed: yāyati etena ati yānam uyyānam niyyānam vāyanti bhava abhavam gacchanti etena ati vānam natthi vānam ettha ati nibbānam nibbāyanti ettha ati vā nibbānam
translated: Yāyati etenāti yānaṃ, uyyānaṃ, niyyānaṃ, vāyanti bhavābhavaṃ gacchanti etenāti vānaṃ, natthi vānaṃ etthāti nibbānaṃ, nibbāyanti etthāti vā nibbānaṃ.

original: Kārite-nibbāpanaṃ.
analyzed: kāritenibbāpanam
translated: Kārite-nibbāpanaṃ.

original: Avasānaṃ, osānaṃ, pariyosānaṃ, pahānaṃ, parihānaṃ.
analyzed: avasānam osānam pariyosānam pahānam parihānam
translated: Avasānaṃ, osānaṃ, pariyosānaṃ, pahānaṃ, parihānaṃ.

original: Kārite-hāpanaṃ, parihāpanaṃ.
analyzed: kārita īhāpanam parihāpanam
translated: Kārite-hāpanaṃ, parihāpanaṃ.

original: Ivaṇṇesu-ayanaṃ vikkayanaṃ, vikkiṇanaṃ, khayanaṃ, khiyanaṃ, khiyyanaṃ, iya, iyyādeso,
analyzed: vikkayanam vikkiṇanam khayanam khiyanam khiyyanam iyaḥ iyyā desaḥ
translated: Ivaṇṇesu-ayanaṃ vikkayanaṃ, vikkiṇanaṃ, khayanaṃ, khiyanaṃ, khiyyanaṃ, iya, iyyādeso,

original: cayanaṃ, cinanaṃ, ācinanaṃ, vicinanaṃ, jayanaṃ, vijayanaṃ, līyanti etthāti leṇaṃ, nassa ṇattaṃ.
analyzed: cayanam cinanam ācinanam vicinanam jayanam vijayanam līyanti ettha ati leṇam nassa
translated: cayanaṃ, cinanaṃ, ācinanaṃ, vicinanaṃ, jayanaṃ, vijayanaṃ, līyanti etthāti leṇaṃ, nassa ṇattaṃ.

original: Paṭisallīyanti etthāti paṭisallānaṃ, issa āttaṃ. Seti etthāti senaṃ, sayanaṃ.
analyzed: paṭisallīyanti ettha ati paṭisallānam issaḥ āttam seti ettha ati senam sayanam
translated: Paṭisallīyanti etthāti paṭisallānaṃ, issa āttaṃ. Seti etthāti senaṃ, sayanaṃ.

original: Kārite-sayāpanaṃ iccādi.
analyzed: i t ca ādi
translated: Kārite-sayāpanaṃ iccādi.

original: Uvaṇṇesu-cavanaṃ, javanaṃ, abhitthavanaṃ, dhunanaṃ, viddhunanaṃ, niddhunanaṃ, bhavanaṃ, abhibhavanaṃ, lavanaṃ, lunanaṃ, savanaṃ, pasavanaṃ iccādi.
analyzed: javanam abhitthavanam dhunanam viddhunanam niddhunanam bhavanam abhibhavanam lavanam lunanam savanam pasavanam iccādi
translated: Uvaṇṇesu-cavanaṃ, javanaṃ, abhitthavanaṃ, dhunanaṃ, viddhunanaṃ, niddhunanaṃ, bhavanaṃ, abhibhavanaṃ, lavanaṃ, lunanaṃ, savanaṃ, pasavanaṃ iccādi.

original: Edantesu-ajjhenaṃ, ajjhāyanaṃ, apacāyanaṃ, jhāyate jhānaṃ, jhāyati etenāti vā jhānaṃ,🔽paṭhamajjhānaṃ, dutiyajjhānaṃ, ujjhānaṃ, nijjhānaṃ, abhijjhānaṃ, sālilāyanaṃ, cīvaravāyanaṃ,🔽gilāyatīti gilāno iccādi.🔽‘Rā nassa ṇo’ti suttena rakāramhā parassa nassa ṇo, kāraṇaṃ, adhikarīyati etthāti adhikaraṇaṃ, saṅkharaṇaṃ, abhisaṅkharaṇaṃ.🔽Kārite-kārāpanaṃ.🔽Ākiraṇaṃ, vikkiraṇaṃ, caraṇaṃ, jiraṇaṃ, taraṇaṃ, kaṅkhāvitaraṇaṃ, attharaṇaṃ, āgantvā dahanti ettha matasarīranti āḷahanaṃsusānaṃ, dassa ḷo.
analyzed: e t antesu ajjhenam ajjhāyanam apacāyanam jhāyate jhānam jhāyati etena ati vā jhānam  paṭhama jhānam dutiya jhānam ujjhānam nijjhānam abhijjhānam sālilāyanam cīvara vāyanam  gilāyati iti  rā nassa no ti suttena rakāramhā parassa nassa no kāraṇam ettha ati adhikaraṇam saṅkharaṇam abhisaṅkharaṇam  kārite kārāpanam  ākiraṇam vikkiraṇam caraṇam jiraṇam taraṇam kaṅkhā vitaraṇam attharaṇam āgantvā dahanti ettha mata sarīranti āḷahanaṃ susānam dassa ḷaḥ
translated: The state of being a seer is seeing; the state of being a meditator is meditation; the state of being a meditator by this is meditation.

original: Passīyate passanaṃ, dassanaṃ, suṭṭhu passatīti sudassanorājā, suṭṭhu passitabbanti sudassanaṃ-devanagaraṃ, sandassanaṃ, nidassanaṃ, dhāraṇaṃ, uddhāraṇaṃ, niddhāraṇaṃ, ādidīgho.

original: Pūraṇaṃ, paripūraṇaṃ, pharaṇaṃ, vippharaṇaṃ.
analyzed: pūraṇam paripūraṇam pharaṇam vippharaṇam
translated: Filling, filling up, spreading, spreading out.

original: Kārite-māraṇaṃ.🔽Nivāraṇaṃ, saraṇaṃ, nissaraṇaṃ, haraṇaṃ, āharaṇaṃ, nīharaṇaṃ iccādi.
analyzed: kāritemāraṇam  nivāraṇam saraṇam nissaraṇam haraṇam āharaṇam nīharaṇam iccādi
translated: Killing, having killed.🔽Preventing, refuge, escape, carrying away, bringing, taking away, etc.

original: Sāmaññavidhānattā saddattha, kujjhanattha, calanatthadhātūhi ruca, juta, vaḍḍhādidhātūhi
analyzed: saddattha kujjhanattha calanattha dhātūhi ruca juta vaḍḍha ādi dhātūhi
translated: The words ruca, juta, vaḍḍha, etc., have the meaning of “desire,” “anger,” “shaking,” etc., by the addition of the suffix ano to the roots ruj, juj, cal, etc., which have the meaning of “desire,” “anger,” “shaking,” etc., by the addition of the suffix ano to the roots ruj, juj, cal, etc., which have the meaning of “desire,” “anger,” “shaking,” etc.

original: ca tassīlādīsu ano hoti, ghosati sīlenāti ghosano, ghosati dhammenāti ghosano, ghosati
analyzed: ca tassīla ādīsu anaḥ hoti ghosati sīlena ati ghosanaḥ ghosati dhammena ati ghosanaḥ ghosati
translated: He makes a noise with virtue, therefore he is a ghosana; he makes a noise with the Dhamma, therefore he is a ghosana; he makes a noise with

original: sādhukārenāti ghosano, kodhano, dūsano, padūsano, kopano, calano, phandano, kampano,
analyzed: sādhukārena ati ghosanaḥ kodhanaḥ dūsanaḥ padūsanaḥ kopanaḥ calanaḥ phandanaḥ kampanaḥ
translated: praise, therefore he is a ghosana; he is angry, therefore he is a kodhana; he is corrupt, therefore he is a dūsana; he is corrupt, therefore he is a padūsana; he is angry, therefore he is a kopana; he shakes, therefore he is a calana; he is agitated, therefore he is a phandana; he is agitated, therefore he is a kampana;

original: maṇḍano, bhūsano, vibhūsano, rocano, virocano, verocano, jotano, ujjotano, vaḍḍhano,
analyzed: maṇḍanaḥ bhūsanaḥ vibhūsanaḥ rocanaḥ virocanaḥ verocanaḥ jotanaḥ ujjotanaḥ vaḍḍhanaḥ
translated: he is adorned, therefore he is a maṇḍana; he is adorned, therefore he is a bhūsana; he is adorned, therefore he is a vibhūsana; he shines, therefore he is a rocana; he shines, therefore he is a virocana; he shines, therefore he is a verocana; he shines, therefore he is a jotana; he shines, therefore he is an ujjotana; he increases, therefore he is a vaḍḍhana;

original: karoti sīlenāti karaṇo. Rāgo nimittakaraṇo, doso nimittakaraṇo, moho nimittakaraṇo
analyzed: karoti sīlena ati karaṇaḥ rāgaḥ nimitta karaṇaḥ dosaḥ nimitta karaṇaḥ mohaḥ nimitta karaṇaḥ
translated: he makes with virtue, therefore he is a karaṇa; craving is a cause of signs, hatred is a cause of signs, delusion is a cause of signs

original: saṃ. ni. 4.349 iccādi.🔽789. Karā ṇano.
analyzed: sam ni i t ca ādi  karā ṇano
translated: etc.🔽. The word karaṇa has the meaning of “making.”

original: Karamhā kattari ṇānubandho ano hoti.
analyzed: karamhā kattari ṇa anubandhaḥ anaḥ hoti
translated: The suffix ṇano is added to the root kara in the sense of “making.”

original: Karoti attano phalanti kāraṇaṃ.🔽790. Hāto vīhikālesu.
analyzed: karoti attanaḥ phalanti kāraṇam 🔽hā taḥ vīhi kālesu
translated: It makes its own fruit, therefore it is a cause.

original: Vīhismiṃ kāle ca vattabbe hādhātumhā kattari ṇānubandho ano hoti.
analyzed: vīhismim kāle ca vattabbe hā dhātumhā kattari ṇa anubandhaḥ anaḥ hoti
translated: In the case of the word vīhi, and in the case of the word kāla, and in the case of the word vattabba, and in the case of the word hā, the syllable ṇā is not followed by o in the agent noun.

original: Hāpetīti hāyano, vīhiviseso vassañca. “Kuñjaraṃ saṭṭhihāyana”nti ettha vassaṃ hāyananti vuccati.
analyzed: hāpeti iti hāyanaḥ vīhi visesaḥ vassam ca kuñjaram saṭṭhi hāyanam ti ettha vassam hāyanam ti vuccati
translated: He causes loss, thus he is a hāyano ; a kind of rice is also called hāyano. And in the case of the word vassa, in the expression kuñjaraṃ saṭṭhihāyanaṃ , vassa is called hāyano.

original: Iti anapaccayarāsi.
analyzed: iti an a paccaya rāsi
translated: So much for the group of indeclinables.

original: Akapaccayarāsi
analyzed: aka pad ca ya rā si
translated: The group of indeclinables not compounded

original: Atha akapaccayantā vuccante.🔽791. Āsīsāyamako ‘āsiṃsāmako’ (bahūsu).
analyzed: atha aka paccaya ntāḥ vuccante  āsīsāyamakaḥ āsiṃsāmakaḥ bahūsu
translated: Now those not compounded are stated.🔽In the case of the word āsiṃsāmako , the syllable ko is not compounded.

original: Āsīsā vuccati patthanā, āsīsāyaṃ gamyamānāyaṃ ako hoti kattari.
analyzed: āsīsā vuccati patthanā āsīsā ayam gamyamānā ayam akaḥ hoti kattari
translated: Aspiration is called āsiṃsā ; when the state of aspiration is being gone to, the syllable ko is not compounded in the agent noun.

original: Jīvatūti jīvako, nandatūti nandako. “Jinabuddhi, dhanabhūti, bhūto, dhammadinno,🔽vaḍḍhamāno”ti ete saddā aññathā sijjhanti, jino imaṃ bujjhatūti jinabuddhi, dhanaṃ
analyzed: jīvatu uti jīvakaḥ nandatu uti nandakaḥ jina buddhi dhanabhūti bhūtaḥ dhamma dinno  vaḍḍhamānaḥ ti ete saddāḥ aññathā sijjhanti jinaḥ imam bujjhatu iti dhanam
translated: He may live, thus he is a jīvaka ; he may rejoice, thus he is a nandaka . “Jinabuddhi, dhanabhūti, bhūto, dhammadinno,

original: etassa bhavati vaḍḍhatīti dhanabhūti, bhavati vaḍḍhatīti bhūto, dhammena dinno dhammadinno,
analyzed: etassa bhavati vaḍḍhati iti dhana bhūti bhavati vaḍḍhati iti bhūtaḥ dhammena dinnaḥ dhamma dinnaḥ
translated: vaḍḍhamāno” . These words are established otherwise: Jinabuddhi = jino imaṃ bujjhatū ; dhanabhūti = dhanaṃ etassa bhavati vaḍḍhatī ; bhūto = bhavati vaḍḍhatī ; dhammadinno = dhammena dinno ;

original: yathā devadatto, brahmadatto, vaḍḍhatīti vaḍḍhamānoti.
analyzed: yathā devadattaḥ brahmadattaḥ vaḍḍhati iti vaḍḍhamānā uti
translated: vaḍḍhamāno = vaḍḍhatī .

original: ‘Kattari ltuṇakā’ti ṇako, so ca sāmaññavidhānattā arahe sattiyaṃ sīle dhamme sādhukāre🔽ca sijjhati, akkhāyatīti akkhāyako, ‘āssāṇāpimhi yuka’iti yāgamo, akkhātuṃ arahati,
analyzed: kattari so ca sāmañña vidhāna ttā arahe sattiyam sīle dhamme sādhukāre  ca sijjhati akkhāyati iti akkhāyakaḥ āssāṇāpimhi yukaiti yāgamaḥ akkhātum arahati
translated: ‘In the maker, the suffix -aka’ means the suffix -aka. And that, because of the rule of general application, is established in the worthy, in the knife, in virtue, in the Dhamma, in good conduct,🔽and in the word ‘well’. ‘In the speaker, the suffix -aka’ means the suffix -aka. ‘In the word “praise” and so on, the suffix -aka’ means the suffix -aka. He is worthy to speak,

original: sakkoti, akkhānamassa sīlaṃ, dhammo, akkhānaṃ sakkaccaṃ karotīti attho. Kālattayepi🔽sijjhati, pubbepi akkhāsi, ajjapi akkhāti, pacchāpi akkhāyissatīti attho. Evaṃ sesesu🔽sāmaññavidhīsu yathārahaṃ veditabbo.🔽Itthiyaṃ-‘adhātussa ke…’ti suttena akassa assa ittaṃ, akkhāyikā-itthī, akkhāyakaṃ-kulaṃ, saṅgāyako, jānātīti jānako.🔽Vikaraṇapaccayato paraṃ nāgame sati vikaraṇassa rasso, jānanako, ājānanako, vijānanako, sañjānanako.
analyzed: sakkoti akkhānam assa sīlam dhammaḥ akkhānam sakkaccam karoti iti attho kāla ttaye pi  sijjhati pubbe api akkhāsi ajja api akkhāti pacchā api akkhāyissati iti atthaḥ evam sesesu  sāmañña vidhīsu yathāraham veditabbaḥ  itthiyaṃ a dhātussa ka iti suttena akassa assa ittam akkhāyikā aitthī akkhāyakaṃkulam saṅgāyakaḥ jānāti iti jānakaḥ  vikaraṇa paccayataḥ param na āgame sati vikaraṇassa rassaḥ jānanakaḥ ājānanakaḥ vijānanakaḥ sañjānanakaḥ
translated: ‘In the maker, the suffix -aka’: the suffix -aka; and that, because of the rule of commonality, is established in the worthy, in the knife, in virtue, in the Dhamma, in good conduct,

original: Kārite-ñāpetīti ñāpako, viññāpako, saññāpako.
analyzed: kāritā iñāpeti iti ñāpakaḥ viññāpako saññāpako
